notes: [['Multiple Cubes of Meat can be collected in a single run.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The orbital orbits Isaac significantly faster.'], ['{{e|Famine}}, {{e|Pestilence}}, {{e|War}}, and {{e|Death}} will always drop either a {{i|Ball of Bandages}} or Cube of Meat. After the first one drops, further Harbingers will only drop that same one and never the other for the duration of the run.'], ["The ticking rate for Meat Boys' contact damage causes them to often deal damage twice once they touch an enemy, making their first second of DPS up to 1.5x higher than normal."]]
synergies: [["{{i|Book of Revelations}}: Ensures that [[Harbingers]] that haven't already been defeated will replace their respective floor's boss, making it drastically easier to collect multiple Cubes of Meat."], ['{{i|Box of Friends}} / {{i|Monster Manual}}: Additional copies of Cube of Meat combine with the first, increasing its level as normal.'], ['{{i|Potato Peeler}}: Consumes 1 [[Heart Container]] in return for creating 1 Cube of Meat and increasing damage a little.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Duct Tape}}: Familiar will stay in place relative to Isaac at levels 1 and 2. No effect at levels 3 and 4.'], ['[[Pretty Fly]]: Cube of Meat will replace one if Isaac already has 3 Pretty Flies. If the Cube of Meat reaches level 3 or 4, the Pretty Fly will come back until another Cube of Meat orbital is obtained.']]

name: Cupid's Arrow
description: Grants Isaac [[piercing tears]] that travel through enemies (but not obstacles) instead of breaking on impact with them.
effects: [['Grants [[piercing tears]] that travel through enemies (but not obstacles) instead of breaking on impact with them.']]
interactions: [["{{i|8 Inch Nails}}/{{t|Blister}}/{{i|Cricket's Head}}/{{t|Flat Worm}}: Reduces knockback effectiveness of these items."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs travel through enemies. When combined with {{I|Ipecac}}, bombs do not explode upon hitting enemies.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bombs also deal 2.5x Isaac's damage to enemies when passing through them."]], ['{{i|Fire Mind}}: Tears will continue to pierce enemies while retaining the explosion chance.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Pierces through {{E|poop}} and {{E|Fire Place}}s, but not enemies.']]

name: Daddy Longlegs
description: Daddy Long Legs' shadow follows Isaac and occasionally stomps enemies for 40 damage total.
effects: [["Daddy Long Legs' shadow follows Isaac and stomps on enemies for 20 damage per tick, with each stomp capable of hitting a single enemy twice for a total of 40 damage. The delay between stomps is approximately 4 seconds."], ['In a room with multiple enemies, Daddy Long Legs will prioritize on monsters with the most health first.', ['If all monsters are of the same type, the familiar will attack the closest enemy.']], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['The foot stays down for about 1 second, and enemies who wander into it will also take damage.'], ['This item deals enough damage to kill most early enemies in one hit and is especially powerful against enemies with multiple segments like {{E|Larry Jr.}}']]
synergies: [["{{i|BFFS!}} / {{i|Hive Mind}}: Increases the foot's size and doubles its damage. Both items cannot be stacked for an even stronger effect."], ['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Spawns an additional foot for the rest of the room.'], ['{{t|Extension Cord}}: Bolts of electricity will arc between the shadow or the foot and Isaac and his familiars.'], ['{{i|Gnawed Leaf}}: Allows Isaac to stay invincible while Daddy Longlegs clears the [[Rooms|room]], granting Isaac a slow but effective way of completely avoiding damage. This combination is especially useful as {{C|The Lost}}.'], ["{{i|Spin to Win}}: Boosts the foot's damage while spinning."], ['{{t|The Twins}}: Has a chance to spawn an additional foot when entering a new room.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Duct Tape}}: No effect.'], ['{{t|Forgotten Lullaby}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Sacrificial Altar}}: Daddy Longlegs cannot be sacrificed.']]

name: Dead Bird
description: After Isaac takes damage, spawns a flying [[familiar]] that chases enemies for the current [[Rooms|room]], dealing ~5 damage per second.
effects: [['Taking damage summons a [[familiar]] that chases enemies for the remainder of the current [[Rooms|room]], dealing 2 damage per tick (~4.3 damage per second).']]
notes: [['{{C|Eve}} starts with this item by default.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Birthright}} + {{C|Eve}}: Dead Bird will be active at all times, without necessitating damage.']]

name: Dead Cat
description: Sets Isaac's [[Red Heart Container]]s to 1, but grants 9 extra lives. After dying, Isaac respawns with 1 Red Heart Container.
effects: [["Sets Isaac's Red [[Heart container]]s to 1.", ['Does not remove {{E|Soul Heart}}s or {{E|Black Heart}}s unless picked up as {{C|???}}, {{dlc|a+}} {{c|The Soul}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{c|Tainted ???}}, {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}, or {{C|Tainted Bethany}}.', '{{dlc|a+}} Does not remove {{E|Bone Heart|n}}s unless picked up as {{c|The Forgotten}}.']], ['Grants 9 extra lives.'], ['Upon death:', ['Isaac respawns in the previous room with 1 Red [[Heart container]].', "{{dlc|nr}} Any active items in Isaac's possession will lose all its charges."]], ["The head of Guppy begins following Isaac like a familiar upon pickup but doesn't do anything.", ['When Isaac has lost all of the lives provided by this item, the Guppy familiar will disappear.']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{e|Super Pride}}.'], ["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Dead Cat is {{dlc|nr}} 2nd / {{dlc|r}} 4th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, and {{c|Lazarus|r}}' inherent extra life."], ['{{dlc|na}} Picking this item up as {{c|The Lost}} does not show the number of lives remaining, but still functions normally.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} If picked up as {{c|The Forgotten}}, his Bone Hearts are reduced to 1 but {{c|The Soul}}'s Soul Hearts remain unaffected. The reverse is also true."], ['The lives are added after the "picking up an item" animation has ended, so characters that die while the animation is playing will not be revived by this item.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The effects of the {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, {{i|Missing No.}}, or a 1- or 6-pip {{r|Dice Room}} will not remove the lives granted by this item.'], ['Additional Dead Cats can be picked up during a run, increasing lives well past 9. {{dlc|nr}} Only the first dead cat counts toward becoming Guppy.\n<!--'], ['Picking up Dead Cat when the player has 0 Red Heart containers and greater than 11 Soul Hearts can cause the player to go over the normal 12 cap by up to 1 heart temporarily. (cannot reproduce, can anyone provide insight?)-->'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} This item counts as 9 items, so if Isaac is trying for an early portal to {{s|The Void}} after beating {{E|Mom}}, this will significantly boost the progress closer to 20 items.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If {{c|Jacob and Esau}} take the item, only the brother who takes it will be set to one Red Heart Container on pickup. But if they die, both are resurrected with one Red Heart Container.'], ['{{dlc|r}} If {{c|Tainted Jacob}} takes this item after being touched by {{E|Dark Esau|n}}, he will return to his previous Red Heart total upon reaching the next floor.', ['Dying as Tainted Jacob after being touched by Dark Esau and carrying this item will respawn him in the previous room in his lost form. Making it to the next floor will still return him to his previous Red Heart total.']], ['{{dlc|r}} During the {{E|The Beast|n}} sequence, Isaac is respawned on the spot upon death, as opposed to doing so in a previous room.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Diplopia}}: Isaac gains 18 extra lives in total.'], ['{{E|Gold Heart}}s: Gives Isaac many coins when picked up, due to the amount of hearts lost.']]

name: Dead Dove
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['Useless for {{C|The Lost}} and {{C|Azazel}}, who have spectral tears and flight by default.']]

name: Demon Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and automatically fires at enemies in its reach.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and automatically fires at enemies in its range 3 times per second, dealing 3 damage per shot.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|Box of Friends}}: If used without having any familiars, a Demon Baby will be spawned for the remainder of the current [[Rooms|room]].'], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Shoots at enemies while charging up a shot, thus giving Isaac an alternative way to kill enemies while charging a shot.'], ['{{transf|Guppy}}: Spawns flies as if normal tears are hitting enemies.']]

name: Dessert
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Dinner
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Distant Admiration
description: Spawns an attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|circles]] further out than {{i|Halo of Flies}}, but closer than {{i|Forever Alone}}, dealing 75 damage per second.
effects: [['Spawns a red attack fly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|that circles around Isaac]], and deals 5 damage per tick or 75 damage per second on contact.', ['The fly circles farther out than regular orbitals, but closer than {{i|Forever Alone}}.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]

name: Dr. Fetus
description: Tears are replaced by {{e|bomb}}s that benefit from bomb-enhancing effects and slide for a fixed time after being fired.
effects: [['Tears are replaced with {{E|bomb}}s that explode approximately one second after being fired.', ["{{Dlc|na}} Each bomb deals 3 times the character's normal [[Damage|tear damage]].", "{{Dlc|anr}} Each bomb deals 5 times the character's normal tear damage plus a flat 30 damage. The flat 30 is not affected by damage multipliers.", "{{Dlc|r}} Dr. Fetus has two formulas for calculating the damage it does. At first, each bomb deals 10 times the character's normal tear damage. If the previous formula would lead to the bombs doing more than 60 damage, the bombs instead deal 5 times the character's normal tear damage plus a 30 flat damage. The flat 30 is not affected by damage multipliers.", '[[Tears]] down: {{Dlc|nr}} Tear Delay × 2.5 / {{Dlc|r}}Fire Rate ÷ 2.5.', 'The [[range]] and [[shot speed]] stats both affect the velocity at which the bombs are fired out. Delay before the explosion is not affected by either.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bomb velocity formula has not been updated to account for the new [[range]] stat so it uses [[tear height]] for calculation (and not the actual range stat), resulting in range stat effectively not working for Dr. Fetus with exceptions being {{I|Number One}}, {{I|Kidney Stone}}, {{i|Pluto}}, and {{i|Inner Child}}'s revive, which make velocity absurdly low."], '{{Dlc|r}} Bombs grow larger or smaller with tear size modifiers and deal no knockback to each other.', ['{{I|Angelic Prism}} Split bombs still deal knockback to each other.', '{{I|Brimstone Bombs}} The brimstone beams deal knockback to other bombs.']]]]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Dr. Fetus is a [[special item]].'], ['R U A Wizard? Does not affect Dr. Fetus.'], ['Dr. Fetus overrides multiple [[tear effect]] items, but benefit from some (but not all) bomb-enhancing effects like {{I|Mr. Mega}}.', ['{{Dlc|a}} Many more synergies have been added, and all passive bomb modifiers affect Dr. Fetus.']], ['Dr. Fetus bombs deal half a heart of damage to Isaac. Other explosion damage is not affected.', ['Self-damage is increased to a full heart if the bomb would deal 85 damage or more. This includes effects from bomb modifiers, not just raw base damage.']]]
synergies: [['{{I|Apple!}} / {{I|Euthanasia}}: Damage multiplier may be applied to the non-flat damage without a visual difference. Euthanasia bombs do not retain the instant kill ability.'], ['{{I|Bobby-Bomb}}: Bombs home in on enemies.', ['{{Dlc|a}} [[Tear Effects#Homing|Homing Tears]]: Bombs home in on enemies.']], ['{{I|Bomber Boy}}: Bombs explode in a large cross-shaped pattern.', ["Bomber Boy + {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}} / {{I|Polyphemus}} / {{I|Scatter Bombs}}: The subsequent bomb or bombs explode in a cross-shaped pattern."]], ['{{I|Blood Bombs}}: Bombs leave behind a pool of red creep.'], ['{{I|Brimstone Bombs}}: The activation rate of the {{I|Brimstone}} lasers is random and dependent on [[Luck]]. The chance is 11% at 0 Luck, increasing by 3% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 29.67 luck and minimizes at 0% at -3.67 luck.'], ['{{I|Butt Bombs}}: All bombs inherit the Butt Bomb effects.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The activation rate is random and dependent on luck. The chance is 20% at 0 Luck, increasing by 3% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 26.67 luck and minimizes at 0% at -6.67 luck.', 'Unlike normal Butt Bombs, this synergy cannot heal {{E|Brownie}}, {{E|Clog}}, {{E|Colostomia}}, {{E|Dangle}}, or {{E|Dingle}}. Both the explosion and the cloud effect deal full damage.']], ["{{I|Cricket's Body|a}}: The bombs split outwards into 4 tiny bombs, which detonate almost immediately.", ['{{Dlc|r}} The split bombs deal a flat 35 damage.']], ["{{I|C Section}}: C Section has priority. Does not apply Dr. Fetus' tears down. The fetuses drop small bombs when they touch an enemy. The bomb's damage follows Dr. Fetus' damage calculation, based on half of the fetuses damage. A fetus can drop only one bomb.", ["The fetuses' bombs do not benefit from Isaac's bomb effects such as {{I|Hot Bombs}} or {{I|Bobby-Bomb}}.\xa0However, they do benefit from Isaac's tear effects and have appearance of the corresponding bombs. For example, {{I|Hot Bombs}}\xa0from {{I|Fire Mind}}, {{I|Bobby-Bomb}}\xa0from [[Tear Effects|Homing Tears]]. As such, {{I|Cricket's Body}}, {{I|The Parasite}}\xa0and {{I|Polyphemus}}\xa0leave a subsequent bomb or bombs, and {{I|Mysterious Liquid}}\xa0leaves a creep.", 'C Section + {{I|Ipecac}}: The fetuses explode before dropping any bomb.']], ["'''Dr. Fetus''': Additional copies of this item, such as from {{I|Diplopia}} / {{I|Crooked Penny}}, grants a multi-shot effect without tears down."], ['{{I|Explosivo}}: The bombs have a chance of sticking to an enemy. These bombs have the same appearance as {{I|Sticky Bombs}}, but do not spawn spiders.'], ['{{I|Eye Sore}}: When Isaac shoots, he has a chance to fire 1-3 additional bombs in random directions.'], ['{{I|Fire Mind}} / {{I|Hot Bombs|a}}: The bombs leave behind a fire that damages enemies on contact after exploding, and bombs themselves deal {{Dlc|anr}} 1 point of damage/{{Dlc|r}} 16 damage on contact.'], ['{{I|Ghost Bombs}}: The activation rate of the ghosts is dependent on luck. The chance is 34% at 0 Luck, increasing by 8% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 8.25 luck and minimizes at 0% at -4.25 luck.', ["Ghost Bombs + {{i|Almond Milk}}/{{i|Soy Milk}}: While the bombs are mini any created ghosts are smaller too and instantly launch themselves at enemies and explode, similar to {{i|Purgatory}}. They each deal 2x Isaac's damage, up to 4 times."]], ['{{I|Godhead}}: Does not give bombs the damaging aura, but does give them the [[homing]] effect.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Guppy}}: Explosions can spawn flies.'], ["{{I|Haemolacria}}: Haemolacria has priority. Applies +10 Tear Delay after Haemolacria tears down, instead of Dr. Fetus tears down. The main tear is reminiscent of a bomb and scatters into 3-5 bombs that explode simultaneously. The split bombs deal half of Dr. Fetus' damage calculation based on the main tear's damage.", ["Haemolacria + {{I|Sad Bombs}}: Sad bombs from Haemolacria tears shoot 10 Haemolacria tears, which then scatters into bombs without Sad Bombs' property."]], ["{{I|Ipecac}}: The bombs become {{I|Bob's Curse}} bombs. Isaac is immune to his bomb shots (not explosives or placed bombs) and the damage is massively increased, as the +40 damage from Ipecac is run through the damage multiplier of Dr. Fetus. Shots will also explode immediately on impact with enemies, [[rocks]], {{E|poop}}s, angel statues, devil statues, or walls.", ["{{Dlc|r}} The effect on damage becomes a flat +2 bonus instead of +40. Does not apply Ipecac's tears down. Bombs leave behind a cloud of poison gas that will poison enemies in contact with it aside from the main target.", "Ipecac + {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}} / {{I|Polyphemus}} / {{I|Sad Bombs}} / {{I|Scatter Bombs}}: Isaac is immune to the main bomb shot, but not to the explosive shrapnel.", ["{{Dlc|r}} Isaac is immune to the shrapnel bombs left by Cricket's Body, The Parasite, Polyphemus, and Scatter Bombs."], 'Ipecac + {{I|Tech X}}: Isaac is immune to the main bomb shot, but not the explosions created by the laser ring.']], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: The bomb can be controlled before exploding, similar to {{I|Epic Fetus}}. Isaac does not shoot bombs while controlling it.'], ["{{I|Monstro's Lung|a}}: Monstro's Lung has priority. Does not apply Dr. Fetus' tears down. Fires 6 bombs which detonate simultaneously.", ['Multi-shot effects add 1 bomb to the barrage, up to 21 bombs.']], ['{{I|Mr. Mega}}: Adds 25 flat damage to bomb explosions.'], ['{{I|Mysterious Liquid|a}}: Exploding bombs leave behind a large pool of creep.'], ['{{I|The Parasite|a}}: Upon exploding, bombs split into two other bombs, which explode almost immediately.', ['The split bombs deal a flat {{Dlc|anr}} 24 damage/{{Dlc|r}} 40 damage.']], ["{{Dlc|r}} [[Piercing tears]]: Bombs deal 2.5x Isaac's damage to enemies when passing through them."], ["[[Status Effects#Poison|Poison tears]]: This is guaranteed by {{I|Bob's Curse}}, {{I|Ipecac}}, and {{I|Scorpio}}, and also has a chance to trigger from {{I|The Common Cold}}, {{t|Black Tooth}}, {{t|Pinky Eye}} or {{I|Serpent's Kiss}}.", ['{{Dlc|nr}} Poison effects will give bombs a flat +50 damage.', '{{Dlc|r}} Poison bombs leave behind a cloud of toxic gas that will poison enemies in contact with it aside from the main target.']], ['{{I|Polyphemus}}: The bombs increase in size and do increased damage.', ['{{Dlc|a}} The bombs become {{I|Mr. Mega}} bombs. After they detonate, they leave behind a regular-sized bomb that deals a flat {{Dlc|anr}}60 damage/{{Dlc|r}}100 damage, much like a standard bomb.']], ['{{I|Proptosis}}: Distance penalty does not apply.', ["{{Dlc|r}} [[Damage]] for Dr. Fetus' damage calculation is tripled."]], ['{{I|Remote Detonator}}: The bombs can be detonated on command, making it easier to hit moving enemies. Unlike placed bombs, they will eventually detonate on their own.'], ['{{I|Rocket in a Jar}}: Shoots rockets.', ['[[Piercing tears]]: Rockets do not pierce through enemies. However, they deal both piercing damage and explosion damage on impact with an enemy.']], ['{{I|Sad Bombs|a}}: Fires tears as normally placed Sad Bombs would.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The activation rate is random and dependent on luck. The chance is 11% at 0 Luck, increasing by 3% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 29.67 luck and minimizes at 0% at -3.67 luck.']], ['{{I|Scatter Bombs}}: The bombs split into {{Dlc|anr}} 2-4/{{Dlc|r}} 4-5 tiny bombs. The bombs deal half damage of the bomb it came from.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The activation rate is random and dependent on luck. The chance is 34% at 0 Luck, increasing by 8% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 8.25 luck and minimizes at 0% at -4.25 luck.']], ['{{I|Tech X}}: Dr. Fetus has priority. The bombs have a laser ring around them.', ["Tech X + {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}} / {{I|Polyphemus}} / {{I|Scatter Bombs}}: The subsequent bomb or bombs do not have the laser ring."]], ['{{I|Tough Love}}: Damage multiplier may be applied to the non-flat damage without a visual difference.', ['{{Dlc|ana+}} Tears that would have fired a tooth shot instead become a {{I|Mr. Mega}} bomb, adding a flat 25 damage and shaking the screen.', '{{Dlc|r}} Damage multiplier may be applied to the non-flat damage without a visual difference.']], ['{{I|Uranus}}: The bombs freeze enemies upon killing them.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus. Tear delay decrease is still applied.'], ['{{t|Brain Worm}}/{{I|Mucormycosis}}/{{I|Neptunus}}/{{i|Ocular Rift}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus. The beams can still appear from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}}.', ["{{dlc|anr}} Isaac continuously fires bombs while charging the beam. Overrides {{c|Azazel}}'s Brimstone."]], ["{{i|Chocolate Milk|nr}}: The bombs can't be charged, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%."], ["{{i|Cricket's Body|nr}}: The bombs do not split. Range is greatly decreased."], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}: Bombs do not split. Stat changes still apply.'], ['{{i|Cursed Eye}}/{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Dr. Fetus.'], ['{{c|The Forgotten}}: A live bomb will spawn on top of The Forgotten when he starts charging his attack. The Forgotten will toss bombs after releasing the charge; airborne bombs deal 1.5x his damage if they collide with an enemy with enough speed. Max distance is obtained with minimal charge. If the bomb explodes while charging, a normal ranged bone attack happens after releasing it. The melee attack is unaffected.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{transf|Guppy}}: Explosions do not spawn flies.'], ['{{i|Immaculate Heart}}: Orbital tears do not become bombs.'], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}/{{I|Sinus Infection}}/{{i|Trisagion}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus. Can still appear from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}}."], ["{{dlc+|r}} {{i|Kidney Stone}} / {{i|Number One}} / {{i|Pluto}} / {{i|Inner Child}}'s revive: The bombs lose almost all of their range, and cannot be improved by range ups. [[Shot speed]] and [[tear height]] ups can be used to mitigate this downside.{{dlc-}}"], ["{{i|Kidney Stone|nr}}: The range decrease applies, but since the tear falling speed stat doesn't affect Dr. Fetus' bombs, they spawn directly in front of Isaac, making self-damage very likely. The effect can be mitigated with range ups."], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Dr. Fetus bombs are not affected. Lachryphagy tears can still appear from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}}.'], ['{{i|Lead Pencil|nr}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.', ['{{dlc|r}} Every fifteenth shot will cause a barrage of short-ranged tears, which blocks the path of the bomb and can harm Isaac as the result.']], ['{{i|Marked}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus. Tear delay decrease is still applied.', ['{{dlc|r}} Creates a target reticle at which the bombs continuously fire.']], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung|na}}: Same effect as {{i|20/20}}, except retains fire rate.", ["Monstro's Lung + {{I|Ipecac}}: Isaac is no longer immune to his own bombs, and since they explode as soon as they make contact, it makes self-damage very likely."]], ["{{i|Mom's Eye}}: Grants a chance to shoot an extra bomb from the back of Isaac's head.", ["Mom's Eye + {{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Bombs that spawn from Mom's Eye will try to move to where you're shooting making it very difficult to not get hit by your own explosions."]], ["{{dlc|anr}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Isaac continuously fires bombs while charging the knife.", ['{{Dlc|nar}}Overrides Dr. Fetus. Knives can still appear from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}}.', "Mom's Knife + {{i|Incubus}}: The Incubus loses the ability to fire out bombs."]], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: The bombs lose momentum and slide back towards Isaac, making self-damage very likely.'], ['{{T|Ouroboros Worm}}: Does not affect the trajectory of the bombs. Turns some bombs into homing bombs, similar to {{I|Bobby-bomb}}.'], ['{{i|The Parasite|na}}: Overridden by Dr. Fetus.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tear Effects|Piercing tears]]: The bombs pierce through enemies, which makes killing them more difficult.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: The bombs are not affected. Pop! tears can still appear from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}}.'], ['{{I|Soy Milk}}: Shoots rapid-fire mini bombs. Can create a line of bombs which can be difficult to avoid taking damage from. The explosions from bombs do not repel the other bombs, though.', ['Soy Milk + {{i|The Parasite|force=a}}: The split bombs will repel the mini-bombs, making it very difficult to avoid taking damage.']], ['[[Spectral tears]]: The bombs can pierce through the obstacles. If a bomb is fired inside an obstacle, the bomb collides against it, but not against others.'], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}}: Overrides Dr. Fetus.', ["Spirit Sword + {{I|Haemolacria}}: The split bombs can appear from Spirit Sword's projectiles."]], ['{{i|Sticky Bombs}}: The bombs stick to enemies, but enemies killed by the bomb will not spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['{{i|Tear Detonator}}: No effect on bombs.'], ['{{dlc|r}} [[Tear height]] ups such as {{t|Tape Worm}}, {{i|Jupiter}}, {{i|Telepathy for Dummies}}, {{p|I - The Magician}}, and {{p|Huge Growth}}: Improves the effective range of the bombs.'], ['{{i|Technology}}:', ['{{dlc|nar}} Overridden by Dr. Fetus. Lasers can still appear from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}}.', '{{dlc|anr}} Both fire normally.']], ['{{i|Technology 2|r}}: The bombs are seemingly pushed forward by the laser, giving the appearance of much longer range.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Dr. Fetus bombs do not generate electricity. Tears from other sources such as {{I|Sad Bombs}} can still generate electricity.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The bombs fly uncontrollably around the player, making self-damage very likely.'], ["{{i|Tractor Beam}}: After firing a bomb and moving, the bomb will have a homing-style effect towards the beam, but will not stay directly on the beam. '''Not recommended''', as changing directions while firing will cause the bomb to reel back to Isaac at high speed, making self-damage very likely."]]

name: E. Coli
description: Enemies that touch Isaac are transformed into {{E|poop}}.
effects: [['Enemies that touch Isaac are transformed into {{E|poop}}.'], ['{{transf|Oh Crap|item}}']]
notes: [['Bosses cannot be turned into poop.'], ['Poop created by this item is not grid-aligned, and flashes red when hit, similar to damaging [[monster]]s.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Poops produced by E. Coli crumble upon being attacked, identically to regular poops.']], ['If you touch the middle section of a {{E|Grub}} with E. Coli, it will then split and become two heads (rather than destroying and spawning {{E|Maggot}}s).'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{E|Mulliboom}}s can be turned into poop without taking damage.'], ['The poops vanish if the room is left and then returned to.'], ['{{dlc+|anr}} Poops created by E. Coli do not heal Isaac when he has the {{transf|Oh Crap}} transformation.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Poops created by E. Coli heal Isaac when he has the {{transf|Oh Crap}} transformation.{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [["{{i|Death's List}}: Enemies that die by being turned into poop do not disrupt the Death's List chain and clearing a room by turning all its enemies into poop still grants Isaac the Death's List reward."], ['{{i|Holy Mantle}}: On-contact effect still applies to enemies if Holy Mantle negates the contact damage taken.'], ["{{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Isaac can turn enemies into poop without taking damage."], ['{{I|Lodestone}}: If an enemy is hit by a lodestone tear perfectly simultaneously with it being turned into poop, the resulting poop will be tinted black and have a lodestone aura that sucks in enemies. This poop will return to normal after a few seconds.'], ["{{i|Midas' Touch}}: Enemies touched are turned into {{E|Golden Poop}}."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The body will turn enemies into poop on contact.'], ['{{i|Unicorn Stump}}: Provides invincibility during which enemies can be touched.']]
interactions: [["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Bob's Brain}}: Bob's Brain will explode upon hitting an enemy that has been turned into poop.", ["{{dlc|r}} Bob's Brain no longer explodes upon hitting poops made from enemies."]], ['{{T|Brown Cap}}: The generated poops are affected and will explode when destroyed.'], ['{{i|Hallowed Ground}}: The generated poops cannot be white.'], ['{{t|Meconium}}: The generated poops cannot be black.'], ["{{i|Serpent's Kiss}} / {{i|The Virus|anr}}: The poops won't drop Black Hearts, negating the touch effect from these items on non-bosses."], ["{{c|Tainted Keeper|r}} / {{c|Tainted Magdalene}}: Kills from enemies being turned into poop don't generate pickups."]]

name: Forever Alone
description: Spawns an attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] a long distance from Isaac, dealing 30 damage per second.
effects: [['Spawns a blue attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] a long distance from Isaac and deals 2 damage per tick or 30 damage per second on contact.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Super Envy}}.']]

name: Fate
description: Grants [[flight]] and one {{E|Eternal Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants [[flight]] and one {{E|Eternal Heart}}.']]
notes: [['Taking this item as {{c|Keeper}} will grant [[Blue Flies]] instead of the Eternal Heart.']]

name: Epic Fetus
description: Isaac's tears are replaced with guided missiles, like those used by the {{i|Doctor's Remote}}.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced with guided missiles. Pressing the fire buttons spawns a crosshair that can be moved freely, summoning a missile to its position from above 1.5 seconds later.", ["Missiles deal 20 times Isaac's damage."]]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Epic Fetus is a [[special item]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Epic Fetus overrides most items in the game and has the highest priority of all tear modifiers, over {{i|Brimstone}} and {{i|Mom's Knife}}."], ["Isaac's tear delay determines how quickly a new (set of) missile(s) can be fired after the previous one has landed. Barring very high tear delay, this has little effect on damage rate due to the delay of the missiles themselves."], ['Missiles benefit from some bomb modifier items, though at a lesser scale compared to {{i|Dr. Fetus}}.'], ["Stacking multiple copies of the item causes a barrage of missiles in quick succession without resetting the crosshair's position, up to sixteen at a time."], ['Epic Fetus missiles usually deal a full heart of damage to Isaac.', ['Self-damage is only half a heart if the missile would deal less than 85 damage. In practice this is not common, as even a small damage stat increase will cause the missiles to go over the critical damage level.']]]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|a}} {{i|20/20}}/{{transf|Conjoined}}{{dlc-}}/{{transf|Bookworm}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}: Fires a barrage of missiles.'], ["{{i|Bomber Boy|r}}: Missiles explode in a large cross-shaped blast, with each explosion dealing 0.75x times damage. Unlike with regular bombs, getting hit by every separate explosion from Epic Fetus won't decrease the damage for each successive explosion, drastically increasing damage."], ['{{i|Blood Bombs}}: Every missile explosion leaves a large, lasting pool of red creep.'], ['{{i|Blood Clot}}/{{i|Chemical Peel}}: Each missile has a 50% chance to deal 20 or 40 points more damage, respectively.'], ["[[Status Effects#Poison|Poison tears]]: This is guaranteed by {{I|Bob's Curse}}, {{I|Ipecac}}, and {{I|Scorpio}}, and also has a chance to trigger from {{I|The Common Cold}}, {{t|Pinky Eye}} or {{I|Serpent's Kiss}}.", ['{{dlc|r}} Explosions leave behind a cloud of poison gas that will poison enemies in contact with it aside from the main target.']], ['{{i|Brimstone|a}}: Missile explosions shoot ten blood lasers in all directions.'], ["{{i|Brimstone Bombs}}: Missile explosions have a chance to shoot four Brimstone lasers in the cardinal directions. The chance scales with Isaac's luck."], ['{{i|Butt Bombs}}: Missile explosions will cloud up the screen, briefly [[Confusion|confusing]] and dealing 10 damage to all enemies in the room.'], ["{{I|Eye Sore}}: More marks appear orbiting around where you're aiming."], ["{{i|Fire Mind}}/{{i|Hot Bombs}}: Missile explosions leave behind a fire that damage enemies on contact. Fire Mind's [[burn]] effect is overridden."], ["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: The charge attack is replaced by a missile in the Forgotten's hand and a crosshair that may be moved for an indefinite amount of time. The missile is thrown at the crosshair when all attack buttons are released, with an additional melee swing in the same direction. The melee attack is unaffected."], ['{{i|Glitter Bombs}}: Missile explosions have a small chance of spawning pickups.'], ['{{dlc|a}} [[Homing tears]]: The crosshair slowly slides towards enemies.'], ['{{i|Host Hat}}/{{I|Pyromaniac}}: Isaac becomes immune to his own airstrikes.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Ipecac}}: Missiles have a poison effect, have a larger blast radius and deal drastically increased damage, as the +40 damage from Ipecac is run through the damage multiplier of Epic Fetus.', ['{{dlc|r}} Adds flat +2 damage instead of +40. Explosions leave behind a cloud of poison gas that will poison enemies in contact with it aside from the main target.']], ['{{t|Lil Clot}} / {{c|Tainted Eve}}: The clots have their own targeting reticles and fire simultaneously with Isaac.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife|a}}: Missile explosions shoot a ring of ten knives.", ["{{dlc|a}}With a second {{i|Mom's Knife|a}} a second missile will be shot similar to {{dlc+|a}} {{i|20/20}}."]], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung|a}}: 2 to 4 additional crosshairs orbit the main crosshair, and missiles are fired onto each crosshair."], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Every missile explosion leaves a small, lasting pool of creep.'], ['{{i|Nancy Bombs}}: Explosions have a chance to be affected by any of the bomb-modifier effects that synergize with Epic Fetus.'], ["{{i|Polyphemus}}: Increased tear delay, but massively increases the missiles' blast radius and damage, as Polyphemus' damage multiplier is run through the damage multiplier of Epic Fetus."], ["{{i|Sad Bombs}}: Missile explosions fire ten tears in all directions. The shrapnel's damage is not run through the damage multiplier of Epic Fetus.", ["{{dlc|r}} The chance for the effect to proc is dependent of Isaac's luck. Chance goes up to 100% at 30 luck."]], ['{{i|Strange Attractor|a}}: Enemies get drawn towards the crosshair.'], ['{{i|Technology|anr}}: Both fire normally. Missile explosions shoot ten Technology beams in all directions.', ['{{dlc|r}} Missile explosions shoot ten Technology beams in all directions.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Missile explosions shoot ten Technology beams in all directions.']]
interactions: [['{{i|8 Inch Nails}}: Missile explosions retain the knockback boost, so enemies that survive the blast will be knocked back far.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus. Stat effects are still applied.'], ["{{C|Azazel}}/{{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Azazel}}: Azazel's mini-Brimstone/Tainted Azazel's thin Brimstone are overridden by Epic Fetus. There is no Brimstone burst on missile explosions."], ['{{t|Black Tooth}}: Has no effect despite being a poison tear effect.'], ['{{i|Bobby-Bomb}}/{{i|Bomber Boy|anr}}/{{i|Ghost Bombs}}/{{i|Mr. Mega}}/{{i|Scatter Bombs}}/{{i|Sticky Bombs}}: No effect.'], ["{{dlc|na}}{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus."], ['{{i|C Section}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus making Epic Fetus the only item in the game that can override it.'], ["{{i|Chocolate Milk|nr}}: Reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%. Missiles can't be charged.", ['{{dlc|r}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus.']], ['{{i|Cursed Eye}}/{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|The Parasite}}/{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus.'], ['{{dlc+|a}}{{i|Evil Eye}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus.'], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult|r}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus. Stat effects are still applied.'], ['{{dlc|na}}{{i|Godhead}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus.', ['{{dlc|a}} Stat effects apply and the crosshair gains a homing effect, but missiles do not have a damaging aura.']], ['{{dlc|na}} [[Homing tears]]: Overridden by Epic Fetus.'], ['{{dlc+|anr}} {{i|Incubus}}: Incubus fires normal tears while the crosshair is being aimed.{{dlc-}}', ["{{dlc|r}}: Incubus fires a missile alongside Isaac's."]], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}/{{I|Sinus Infection}}/{{i|Technology Zero}}/{{i|Trisagion}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus."], ["{{I|Loki's Horns}}: Adds a chance to spawn four crosshairs in cardinal directions. Isaac controls one and the others will mirror the movement keeping their space."], ['{{i|Mucormycosis}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus.'], ["{{i|Tammy's Head}}/{{i|Varicose Veins}}/{{I|It Hurts}}: Fires only normal tears, not missiles."], ["{{i|Soy Milk}}: '''Not recommended.''' Damage of missiles is drastically reduced, and unlike normal tears, the fire rate will not significantly increase."], ['{{i|Spirit Sword}}: Overrides Epic Fetus making it the only item in the game that takes priority over Epic Fetus.'], ['{{i|Technology|na}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus.'], ["{{dlc|na}} {{i|Technology 2}}: '''Not recommended'''. Technology 2 is overridden by Epic Fetus, but the damage multiplier is still applied, massively reducing the missiles' damage.", ['{{dlc|anr}} Both fire normally.', "{{dlc|r}} Does not reduce missiles' damage, and both fire normally at the cost of a slightly higher delay between each crosshair appearing."]], ["{{i|The Wiz}}: Makes two missiles drop in quick succession, and control of the crosshair is rotated 45 degrees clockwise. '''Not recommended''', as it makes controlling the crosshair harder. However, mouse control is less affected."], ["{{I|Twisted Pair}}: Each familiar will fire a missile from a two additional crosshairs. '''Not Recommended''', as the twisted pair crosshairs are not synced to Isaac's crosshair and move at a much slower rate, making self damage much more likely as the additional crosshairs will struggle to make distance from Isaac."]]

name: Gemini
notes: [['Status effects will equally affect both Contusion and Suture even if it was only applied to one of them. This includes effects granting knockback such as {{i|Knockout Drops}}.', ['This also applies to Green Champion Gemini despite the twins being completely separated entities.']]]

name: Leo
description: Isaac can destroy [[rock]]s by walking into them.
effects: [['Isaac can break [[obstacle]]s by walking into them.'], ["Increases Isaac's size."], ['{{transf|Stompy|item}}']]
notes: [['Walking into [[Bomb Rock]]s will cause them to explode.'], ['[[Mushroom (Obstacle)|Mushrooms]] may hurt Isaac with a poison cloud if walked into.'], ['[[Polyp]]s may hurt Isaac with blood shots or red creep if walked into.'], ['[[Flight]] does not prevent the effect from occurring.'], ['Holes in the ground can be filled if Isaac walks into adjacent rocks from the right direction, similar to bombs.'], ['{{E|TNT}} Barrels will not be destroyed or explode on contact, however {{E|Movable TNT}} Barrels will explode and may deal damage to Isaac if walked into.'], ['Allows Isaac to walk over and destroy {{E|Red Poop}} without taking damage. Isaac will still take damage if he is standing on it when it reforms.'], ['Walking into an Angel Statue in the {{R|Angel Room}} will trigger the boss fight, and Isaac will take damage as the Angel spawns on top of him.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} Nullifies effects of One Makes You Small [[pill]]s, One Makes You Larger pills, and other items which decrease size, such as {{i|Caffeine Pill}} and {{i|Binky|n}}.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} [[Rocks#Spiked Rocks|Spiked Rocks]] can be destroyed, but depending on Isaac's size, angle and velocity they may still hurt him."]]

name: The Ladder
description: Allows Isaac to walk across gaps one square across by automatically placing a ladder between the two walkable sections.
effects: [['Allows Isaac to walk across gaps one square across by automatically placing a ladder between the two walkable sections. Enemies can not walk over the ladder.']]

name: Jesus Juice
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[damage]], +0.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[damage]], +0.375 [[range]].

name: Ipecac
description: Replaces tears with explosive and [[poison]]ing projectiles fired in an arc from the mouth.
effects: [['Replaces tears with explosive and [[poison]]ing projectiles fired in an arc.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Tears down - (Delay'], ['2) + 10'], ['{{dlc|r}} 1/3 Fire Rate'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tear Falling Speed]] is set to 13.'], ['+40 flat damage (See [[Damage#Effective Damage|Effective Damage]])'], ['Tear size multiplier: 0.4x'], ['{{dlc|r}} -0.2 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Minor range down.'], ['{{transf|Bob|item}}']]
notes: [['Enemies within the blast radius of an Ipecac explosion will also be [[poison|poisoned]].'], ['The damage boost mitigates the very small tear size multiplier.'], ["Ipecac's damage bonus does not apply to [[Burn]] or [[Poison]] fully; only {{Dlc|nr}}+4/{{Dlc|r}}+2 is applied to their damage per tick."], ["Character damage multipliers do not apply to Ipecac's flat bonus."], ['Since explosions that deal less than 85 damage hurt Isaac for half a heart, Ipecac shots usually hurt Isaac for half a heart.', ['Self-damage is increased to a full heart with 85 or higher damage stat.']], ['Explosions that deal more than or equal to {{dlc|nr}} 100/{{dlc|r}} 166 damage shake the screen.'], ["{{dlc|r}} The height of the shots scales with range. At base stats, Ipecac shots won't be able to fly over obstacles, but the more range ups Isaac gets, the higher shots will be launched."], ["{{dlc|r}} It is possible that with low shot speed and high range/tear height, Isaac won't be able to hit obstacles up close with Ipecac shots."], ['{{dlc|nr}} The range of the explosion is a circle roughly 3 blocks in diameter, regardless of damage.', ["As Ipecac's explosion range does not scale with tear size, with enough tear size increasing items (e.g. {{I|Death's Touch}}), it can become nearly impossible to hit enemies with Ipecac's explosions."]], ["{{dlc|r}} Ipecac's explosion range increases with tear size."], ['Using Ipecac in a {{R|Crawl Space}} will cause the tear to bounce off the ceiling, bounce off the floor at a low height, and eventually explode. The same applies to using it on a Crawl Space wall.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Ipecac it turns into a larger slow moving green locust that deals x1.5 Isaac’s damage per tick and poisons enemies.'], ["{{T|Brain Worm}}: The Ipecac tears will snap 90 degrees and rain down at nearby enemy should the shot miss, completely eliminating the shortcoming of having too much range and causing Ipecac tears to fly over enemy's head, missing them."], ["{{i|Brimstone}} / {{c|Azazel}}: Blood beam now does poison damage and will explode on connection with an enemy which can damage the character if close enough. The character doesn't gain the Damage Up or Tears Down effects.", ["{{dlc|a+nr}} Isaac shoots Ipecac tears while charging Brimstone. Both Brimstone and Ipecac shots modify Isaac's damage and tear delay stat, meaning that Ipecac fires slower and Brimstone charges slower, but Brimstone does an extra 40"]], ['13 damage.  Take care to pre-charge Brimstone so that the Ipecac shot is on cooldown as Isaac enters a room.', ["{{dlc|r}} The flat damage bonus is reduced to +2, but Isaac's tear rate stat is not modified. The beam explodes on the first enemy or obstacle it hits every other tick, dealing 10 + twice of Isaac's Damage. The explosions do not occur when the beam narrows, meaning that they occur only twice per shot without {{I|Soy Milk}} / {{I|Almond Milk}}. The beam and its explosions poison enemies. {{I|The Ladder}}, when placed, will trigger the Ipecac-Brimstone explosions. (possibly a bug)"]], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: The main tear splits into four explosive splash tears. The splash tears can still damage Isaac."], ["{{I|C Section}}: The fetuses explode once they touch an enemy, poisoning and dealing damage equal to Isaac's Damage."], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs explode on contact, do no damage to Isaac and become {{I|Bob's Curse}} bombs. The flat damage bonus is reduced to +2. With {{C|Jacob and Esau}} only the character with the items is immune to the explosions.", ["'''Dr. Fetus''' + '''Monstro's Lung''': The flat damage bonus is increased back to +40. Renders Isaac no longer immune to his shots.", "'''Dr. Fetus''' + '''Sad Bombs''': Isaac is not immune to the explosive shots created by the Sad Bombs' effect."]], ["{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Missiles turn green and are poisonous. Damage greatly increases as the flat damage bonus stacks with Epic Fetus' explosive multiplier."], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: The Ipecac shots cause full-damage explosions instead of lesser splash damage when they bounce off the floor, though they can also harm Isaac.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Each bounce creates an explosion that deals half Isaac's damage as well as dealing the regular splash damage. The bounce explosion radius is slightly larger than the splash radius."]], ['{{dlc|a+}}{{c|The Forgotten}}: The flat damage bonus is reduced to +4. Melee attacks become poisonous and explosive; he cannot be hurt by the blasts but is pushed back by them. The explosions deal 1.5x Damage. The charged throwing attack is only poisonous. The Soul uses Ipecac as normal.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The flat damage bonus is reduced to +2. The thrown bone club can explode once on enemy contact while being sent out, but not while returning. These explosions deal from 10 + 2.8x to 10 + 6x Damage based on how much the attack is charged and do no self-damage.', '{{Dlc|r}} When the skeleton form has {{i|Technology}}, the thrown bone club constantly explodes and deals damage to The Forgotten.']], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Tear delay is increased by 1/3 compared to either of the items on their own, but Isaac now fires Ipecac shots that releases poisonous, high-damage but\\non-explosive split tears on impact.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear damage is increased by 4, explodes when killing an enemy, and comes back to Isaac.', ['{{dlc|a+nr}}+4 flat damage bonus, no explosion.', '{{dlc|r}} +2 flat damage bonus, no explosion.']], ["{{i|Maw of the Void|force=r}}: The ring becomes poisonous and explodes on the first enemy or obstacle contact it hits every other tick, dealing 10 + twice of Isaac's Damage. The explosions do not occur for the first four ticks."], ['{{i|Mega Blast|force=r}}: The explosions from the beam do not damage Isaac.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Knife turns green, may poison enemies, and removes Ipecac's damage increase.", ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Also adds +4 flat damage bonus.', '{{dlc|r}} Also adds +2 flat damage bonus. The thrown knife can explode once on enemy contact while being sent out, but not while returning. These explosions deal from 10 + 2.1x to 10 + 6x Damage based on how much the attack is charged.']], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Isaac fires a barrage of Ipecac shots, with no increase in charge time compared to Monstro's Lung alone.", ['{{dlc|r}} Charge time increases by 3x.']], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Leaves a massive pool of [[creep]] on the floor on impact.'], ['{{i|The Parasite}}: The Ipecac tear will spawn two smaller explosive tears when it collides with a solid object, but not with an enemy. These tears can spawn tears on their own as well, potentially leading to huge chain reactions.'], ["{{i|Revelation}}: The laser do not benefit from Ipecac's damage bonus, instead it takes +2 flat damage bonus. The laser explodes on the first enemy or obstacle it hits every other tick. The explosions occur 8 times and deal 10 + twice of the laser's damage."], ['{{i|Tech X}}: The flat damage bonus is reduced to +4. The laser ring becomes poisonous.', ["{{Dlc|r}} The flat damage bonus is reduced to +2. The laser ring becomes poisonous and explodes every other tick on contact, deal 10 + twice of the ring's damage. Knockback from the blasts will push enemies along the path of the ring, prolonging damage. The ring will not open {{R|Secret Room}}s."]], ['{{i|Technology}}: Removes the flat damage bonus, poisonous laser.', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} +4 flat damage bonus, poisonous laser.', "{{Dlc+|r}} +2 flat damage bonus, poisonous laser that explodes on enemy or obstacle contact, deal 10 + twice of Isaac's damage. Keeps Ipecac's stats other than damage.", ['Note: This combination is not advised if the player has the {{I|Multidimensional Baby}} familiar. When the ipecac technology laser passes through the {{I|Multidimensional Baby}}, it instantly explodes, damaging the player and likely being fatal for the run.{{dlc-}}']]], ["{{i|Trisagion}}: Trisagion blasts do not explode on hit. The explosion happen once the blast runs out of range or hits a wall and deals damage equal to Isaac's Damage.", ["{{Dlc|r}} Trisagion blasts are poisonous and explode upon impact with an enemy or obstacle, dealing 10 + twice of the blast's damage. When the base of the blast reaches an enemy or obstacle, it explodes and deals damage equal to Isaac's Damage."]]]
interactions: [["{{i|Crown of Light}} / {{i|Polyphemus}} / {{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Proptosis}} / {{i|Sacred Heart}} / {{I|Bloody Lust|force=nr}}: The damage multipliers from these items do not apply to Ipecac's +40 bonus, resulting in much lower damage increase than expected."], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Charged up Ipecac deals expectedly high damage. Rapid-fire can be used against weaker enemies or to clear obstacles when necessary.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Head}} / {{i|Eve's Mascara}} / {{i|Magic Mushroom}}: The damage multipliers from these items apply to Ipecac's +40 bonus, unlike others."], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Death's Touch}}: Although damage is increased, the tears' hitboxes also grow larger which may be detrimental."], ['{{I|Fire Mind}}: Due to the nature of the Ipecac, all shots will have a 100% chance of leaving a fire at the center of the explosion. {{dlc|nr}} It will also no longer leave behind green creep and the explosion will be of normal color instead of green.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Ghost Pepper}}: If a fire is generated at the same time as an Ipecac shot, the Ipecac shot will explode instantly.'], ['{{i|Glass Cannon}}: As the Glass Cannon tears are so large, even a modest damage increase or a single tear size increasing item is likely to render the tear unable to damage enemies.'], ['{{Transformation|Guppy}}: Blue Flies are no longer spawned on hit.', ['{{dlc|a}} Ipecac shots spawn Blue Flies on hit, both direct and indirect.']], ["{{I|Holy light}}: A beam of light will spawn on top of any enemy within the explosion's radius."], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: The sparks spawn only when they hit a wall."], ['{{i|Little Horn|force=nr}}: If an Ipecac shot has the Little Horn effect, after destroying an enemy, it loses its explosive property and effectively is just a normal Little Horn tear.'], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Ipecac shots will explode on contact with enemy shots.'], ["{{i|Mom's Eye}} / {{i|Loki's Horns}}: Occasionally shoots backwards or in all 4 directions, with high risk of self-damage."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Tears will still explode on enemy contact, nullifying piercing.'], ["{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears will bounce off walls and rocks and won't explode until they hit the ground. Not recommended, as self-damage is likely."], ["[[Spectral tears]]: Ipecac shots no longer explode on contact with obstacles or walls, making accidental self-damage less likely but it's more difficult to open secret doors."], ["{{c|Tainted Forgotten}}: Tainted Forgotten's melee attacks will explode. Tainted Soul is immune ''only'' to those explosions, and any further explosions caused by synergies will damage it."], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology 2}}: The +40 damage bonus is not affected by the Technology 2 multiplier making the laser very high powered, but only every other Ipecac shot is fired.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: High fire rate needed for explosive shots to be connected.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Ipecac tears orbit around Isaac for a very long time. They land far enough to not cause self-damage, but that can be relied on only if Isaac is not moving and do not hit enemies.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: The Ipecac tear will travel in an arc along the beam, even if Isaac is moving forward as well. When Isaac changes direction, the tear will snap to the beam, making it very easy to accidentally hit close objects blocking its new path.']]

name: The Inner Eye
description: Grants triple shot but decreases [[tears]].
effects: [['Isaac fires a spread of three tears at once.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears down: (Delay'], ['2.1) + 3', ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears fired per second']], ['0.51.']]
notes: [['The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating {{i|20/20}}, The Inner Eye, {{i|Mutant Spider}} and {{i|The Wiz}} is 16, or 20 with {{C|Keeper}}.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb The Inner Eye it creates three locusts instead of one.'], ['{{i|Cursed Eye|nr}}: At full charge, fires 3 rows of 4 tears, resulting in 12 tears.', ['{{dlc|r}} At full charge, fires 3 rows of 5 tears, resulting in 15 tears.']], ["{{i|Doctor's Remote}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Replaces the single missile strike with a barrage of three consecutive missiles."], ['{{i|The Inner Eye|anr}}: Effects stack, resulting in 6 tears being shot with no further decrease in fire rate.', ['{{dlc|r}} Adds an additional tear with no further decrease in fire rate. This can be stacked up to 16 tears.']], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear gains two orbiting tears.'], ["[[Mom's Knife]] : 3 Knives are fired"], ['{{i|Polyphemus|nr}}: Tear rate is not lowered further. Damage is increased by a flat +5 instead of a normal Polyphemus boost.', ['{{dlc|r}} Damage is increased by a flat +5 instead of a normal Polyphemus boost. Decreases fire rate by a little.']], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: All tears are fired along the beam, but some may be hard to see as they overlap each other.']]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20|na}}: Overridden by The Inner Eye.', ['{{dlc|anr}} Shoots 5 tears with no further decrease in fire rate.', '{{dlc|r}} Removes the fire rate penalty while reducing damage to 75%. Additional copies will add one additional tear with no further change to damage/fire rate.']], ["{{i|Brimstone}}: Fires 3 beams. Affects Azazel's short-ranged version the same way."], ['{{C|The Forgotten|a+}}: Triples bones thrown and swung. Significant increase in tear delay.'], ['{{C|Keeper|anr}}: Fires 6 tears with significantly increased tear delay.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires 4 tears with significantly increased tear delay.']], ['{{c|Tainted Keeper|r}}: Only fires 5 tears in the volley, while still gaining significantly increased tear delay.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Increase number of tears in tear barrage; however, only fires one stone.'], ['{{i|Lead Pencil}}: The barrage will activate as normal but Isaac will sometimes fire red tears.'], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}}: Only occasionally fires one tear in the other three directions."], ["{{i|Mom's Eye}}: Only occasionally fires one tear out of the back of Isaac's head."], ['{{i|Mutant Spider|na}}: Overrides The Inner Eye.', ['{{dlc|anr}} Shoots 7 tears instead of 3. No further decrease in fire rate.', ['{{dlc|r}} Shoots 5 tears instead of 3. Decreases fire rate by a little.']]], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Adds 5 tears to barrage with a significant increase in tear delay."], ['{{i|Sad Bombs}}: Does not affect the number of tears when bombs explode.'], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: The laser is not affected by The Inner Eye.'], ['{{i|Varicose Veins}}: No effect on number of tears when taking damage.']]

name: Infestation
description:
{{dlc|nr}} 1-3 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn every time Isaac gets hit.
{{dlc|r}} 2-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn every time Isaac gets hit.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} 1-3 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn whenever Isaac takes damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} 2-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] randomly spawn whenever Isaac takes damage.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Fish Tail}}: Doubles number of flies spawned.'], ['{{i|Hive Mind}}: Flies are bigger and deal double damage.']]

name: Hot Bombs
description: Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs leave behind fire that damages enemies upon contact.
effects: [['Isaac gains +5 {{e|Bomb}}s on pickup.'], ['Placed bombs deal damage to enemies on contact and will leave behind a fire that damages enemies on contact upon exploding for 10 seconds.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The fire does 22 damage per tick (66 damage per second).', '{{dlc|r}} The fire can block four shots and/or deal four ticks of contact damage before expiring. It deals 23 damage at full durability, 17.25 damage after taking one hit, and 11.5 damage otherwise for a maximum damage of 63.25 damage.', "Fire from a Hot Bomb doesn't damage Isaac.", '{{dlc|nr}} Bombs deal 1 point of contact damage to enemies.', '{{dlc|r}} Bombs deal 16 contact damage to enemies.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac can no longer take damage from fire.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac produces a large circle of light, mitigating {{cu|darkness}}.']]
notes: [['If a {{e|Hopper}} touches a Hot Bomb, it will become a {{e|Flaming Hopper}}.'], ["The contact damage does not scale with Isaac's damage and is completely removed if Isaac acquires another bomb item that overrides the flaming bomb graphic such as {{i|Mr. Mega}} or {{i|Glitter Bombs}}."], ['{{e|Big Horn}} will throw Hot Bombs at Isaac that deal contact damage.'], ['If eaten by a boss such as {{e|Chub}}, a Hot Bomb will continously deal damage to the boss until it explodes.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Negates the damage from the floor of lava in {{e|The Beast|n}}'s chamber, but not from its fire inhalation attack."]]
synergies: [["{{i|BBF}} / {{i|Best Friend}} / {{i|Bob's Brain}} / {{i|Bob's Rotten Head}} / {{i|Mr. Boom}}: These explosions are affected by Hot Bombs."], ['{{i|Bomber Boy}}: Bombs leave behind nine fires in a cross shaped pattern.'], ["{{dlc|a}}{{i|Doctor's Remote}} / {{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Bombs/missiles are affected by Hot Bombs."], ['{{dlc|a+}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: Red locust explosions are affected.'], ['{{I|Remote Detonator}}: Allows for maximization of contact damage, especially if an enemy gets stuck on a bomb.'], ['{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Scatter Bombs|n}}: Each additional explosion creates a fire.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires from extra bombs now start with 1 less durability.']]]
interactions: [["{{dlc|na}}{{i|Doctor's Remote}} / {{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Bombs/missiles are not affected by Hot Bombs."], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Ipecac shots are unaffected.']]

name: Holy Grail
description: Grants [[flight]] and one Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals an additional {{E|Red Heart}}
effects: [['Grants [[flight]] and one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|red heart}}']]

name: Harlequin Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires two tears at once in a V-pattern.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires two tears at once in a V-pattern which deal 4 damage each.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Harlequin Baby shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Harlequin Baby shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]

name: Halo of Flies
description: Spawns two [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]] that block enemy shots and deal contact damage to flies.
effects: [['Spawns two [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]] that block enemy shots.', ['Pretty flies kill some [[fly]] enemies upon contact.', 'The orbital limit of three flies cannot be surpassed with this item, reducing its effectiveness if Isaac has two or more orbitals.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['Orbital flies can also be obtained by other means, such as {{m|Slot Machine}}s and [[pill|Pretty Fly]] pills.'], ['The following types of flies are instantly killed when they come in contact with the orbitals:', ['{{e|Army Fly}}', '{{e|Attack Fly}}', '{{e|Dart Fly}}', '{{e|Fly}}', '{{e|Hush Fly}}', '{{e|Moter}}', '{{e|Pooter}}', '{{e|Ring Fly}}', '{{e|Super Pooter}}', '{{e|Swarm}}']]]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Halo of Flies two gray locusts are created dealing half of Isaac’s damage per tick each.']]

name: The Halo
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.25 [[range]], +0.3 [[speed]], and +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.375 [[range]], and +0.3 [[speed]]. Heals 1 additional {{e|red heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Red Heart container|Heart container]].', ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|red heart}}.']], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]

name: Habit
description: When Isaac is hit, his active item gains 1 room's worth of charge.
effects: [["When Isaac is hit, his active item gains 1 room's worth of charge."]]
synergies: [['{{i|9 Volt}} + {{i|Yum Heart}}: Isaac could potentially become invincible on early floors or with {{i|The Wafer}}, losing only half a heart per three hits taken.'], ['{{i|The Battery}} + {{dlc|r}} {{i|Sharp Plug}}: Isaac gains one charge from Habit for every half-heart of damage that Sharp Plug deals, effectively granting double the charges when using Sharp Plug.'], ['{{i|Dull Razor}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: Using the Dull Razor activates the Habit, but this does not restore its charge, only that of the item in the Schoolbag.'], ['{{I|Larynx}}: Both on-hit charge effects stack, granting Larynx 2 charges per hit.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Glass Cannon}}: Upon taking damage, {{I|Broken Glass Cannon}} will be half-charged. However, taking damage before the last charge will break the cannon again.'], ["{{I|Habit}} Duplicates: Doesn't stack; will still yield one charge per hit."]]

name: Guppy's Tail
description: [[Room Clear Awards]] have a 1/3 chance of being replaced with a {{E|Chest}} and a 2/9 chance being replaced with nothing.
effects: [['Grants a 1/3 chance of replacing [[Room Clear Awards]] with a {{E|Chest}} or a {{E|Locked Chest}}, but also a 2/9 chance to replace it with nothing at all.', ['{{dlc|a}} The effect does not apply to {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} dropped in [[Greed Mode]].']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["The drawback to this item is that Keys become much more scarce, while increasing the amount of Locked Chests. This makes taking Guppy's Tail a potential liability early on."], ["Due to any found Chests containing [[item]]s while in {{s|Chest}} or {{s|Dark Room}}, Guppy's Tail can be a good way to quickly stack up more upgrades before facing the final boss."], ['This item has no effect in [[Greed Mode]] other than counting towards the Guppy Transformation.']]
synergies: [["{{I|Guppy's Eye}}: Makes {{E|key}} management easier by revealing which Locked Chests are worth opening and which are not."], ['{{t|The Left Hand}}: Turns all chests into {{E|Red Chest}}s, allowing Isaac to get Red Chest items much more quickly. Useful when pursuing the {{transf|Guppy}} transformation.'], ["{{i|Mom's Key}}: Increases the number of drops from Chests and counteracts the increased chance to run into Locked Chests."]]

name: Guppy's Hair Ball
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that loosely follows behind Isaac, which blocks shots can be swung like a flail to damage enemies. Grows bigger by killing enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a hairball [[familiar]] that loosely follows behind Isaac, blocks shots, and can be swung like a flail to damage enemies.', ['The ball deals 5 damage per tick, but grows, increasing damage by 2 each time it kills an enemy — up to 5 times for a maximum of 13 damage. The damage it deals per tick (each half-second) is (level × 2) + 3.', 'The hairball level decreases upon entering a new floor: if level 2, it reverts to level 1. If level 3 or 4, it reverts to level 2. If level 5, it reverts to level 3.']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["The hairball's hitbox is the same size regardless of level."], ["{{dlc|na+r}}If Isaac has transformed into {{transf|Guppy}}, Guppy's Hair Ball spawns Blue Flies when it deals damage."], ["If [[Blindfolded]], the ball occasionally spawns a [[Blue Fly]] while it's damaging an enemy.\n== In-game Footage ==\n{{#ev:youtube|sLWq7VX-INU||inline}} {{#ev:youtube|Uw0P9YrkPD8||inline}}"]]

name: Guppy's Collar
description: Grants a permanent 50% chance to respawn with 1/2 of a {{E|Red Heart}} after [[death]].
effects: [['Grants a permanent 50% chance to resurrect on [[death]].', ['Resurrection leaves Isaac at half of a {{E|Red Heart}}, or half a {{E|Soul Heart}} if he had no Red Heart Containers.']], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Guppy's Collar is {{dlc|nr}} 4th / {{dlc|r}} 6th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, {{i|Dead Cat|nr}}, {{c|Lazarus|nr}}' inherent extra life ({{dlc|r}} swap the order of the previous two), and {{i|Inner Child}}."], ['It is possible to obtain two collars by finding one in a {{E|Red Chest}}, without picking it up, and then finding another collar in a different Red Chest. {{dlc|nr}} However, this does not have any additional effects and does not count towards transforming into Guppy.', ["{{dlc|r}} Obtaining multiple copies of Guppy's Collar now grants extra lives, depending on how many copies are obtained (obtaining a second collar displays the lives count as '2?', and so on). The chance for Guppy's Collar to activate is defined with separate rolls, but increases the odds for one of the collars to revive Isaac. Additional collars also count towards the Guppy transformation."]], ['Resurrecting in a {{r|Curse Room}} may trap Isaac if he has no way of recovering health or exiting them without losing health.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} Resurrecting via Guppy's Collar during a [[Daily Challenge]] will count as a death, even if the run is eventually completed."]]

name: Guardian Angel
description: Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots, deals 105 damage per second to enemies, and increases the speed of all orbital familiars.
effects: [['Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second ({{dlc|r}} 53 damage per second) on contact.'], ['Increases the speed of all orbital familiars.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}This item belongs to the [[Seraphim (Transformation)|Seraphim]] set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into an angel.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['The increased orbital speed improves odds of being protected from enemy shots.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Big Fan}}: Guardian Angel counteracts most of the slower orbit speed.']]

name: Growth Hormones
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[damage]], +0.4 [[speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1 [[damage]], +0.2 [[speed]].

name: Ghost Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires [[spectral tears]].
notes: [['This item has a low chance to spawn from [[Rocks#Skulls|skulls]].']]

name: Infestation 2
description: Spawns allied [[Blue Spider]]s from killed enemies.
effects: [['Spawns an allied [[Blue Spider]] from each enemy that is killed.'], ['{{Dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['Enemies do not spawn Blue Spiders when killed by anything not controlled by Isaac (environmental hazards, charmed enemies, death upon clearing room, etc).'], ['Enemies do not spawn Blue Spiders when killed by Blue Spiders.'], ['Blue Flies can also spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['Enemies killed by [[familiar]]s will spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['Destroying dead {{E|shopkeeper}}s will spawn Blue Spiders.'], ['Killing {{E|Pin}} will give one Blue Spider for each of his segments.'], ['Killing {{E|Chub}} will spawn a lot of Blue Spiders.'], ['Killing a {{E|Homunculus}} or a {{E|Begotten}} will sometimes spawn a Blue Spider for each segment in the chains holding them to the wall.'], ['{{E|Dark Ball}}s spawned by {{E|Little Horn}} can also drop Blue Spiders upon death.']]

name: Piggy Bank
description: Gives 3 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} on pick-up. Every time Isaac is damaged, he will drop one additional penny.
effects: [['Adds 3 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} on pickup.'], ['When Isaac takes damage, there is an equal chance for 1 or 2 Pennies to drop.', ['When held by {{C|Keeper}} or {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, it will drop 0-1 pennies instead.']]]
notes: [['If {{C|Keeper}} or {{C|Tainted Keeper}} collects this item with 1 health coin, it will heal a coin and add 2 coins to his inventory.', ['{{Dlc|r}} If {{C|Keeper}} has unlocked a third health coin, collecting this item may heal 2 health coins and only provide a single coin to his inventory, depending on whether he has 1 health coin remaining or 2.']], ["Unlike the coins dropped from being hit by a shot from a {{E|Keeper}}, {{E|Greed}}, or {{E|Super Greed}}, the coins that are dropped from the piggy bank are not subtracted from Isaac's total."], ['Can appear in the shop and the item room on the same floor, but picking up multiple copies of the item does not cause its effect to stack.'], ['The drops from Piggy Bank, unlike {{t|Swallowed Penny}}, are locked to normal pennies, instead of random types of coins.']]

name: Dark Matter
description: +1 [[damage]], adds a chance to shoot [[fear|fear tears]].
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ['Adds a chance to shoot [[fear|fear tears]], causing enemies to run away from Isaac.']]
notes: [['Fear tear effect depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 20 luck.', ["This makes Dark Matter significantly better at inflicting fear than {{i|Abaddon}} or {{i|Mom's Perfume}}."]]]
synergies: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Laser applies fear to enemies more consistently due to its tick rate.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Chance for tears and split tears to cause fear. If the main tear causes fear, the split tears cause fear too."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Tear appearance stays the same; only the main tear can cause fear.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: If a fear tear is fed, all burst tears cause fear. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears cannot cause fear.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear occasionally changes appearance to Dark Matter tears and causes fear.']]

name: The Bible
description: On use, Isaac gains [[flight]] for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Instantly kills {{E|Mom}}, {{E|Mom's Heart}}, and {{E|It Lives}} when activated, but kills Isaac when used on {{E|Satan}}.
effects: [['Gives Isaac [[flight]] for the current room.'], ["Instantly kills {{E|Mom}}, {{E|Mom's Heart}}, {{E|It Lives}}, including their {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} variants, upon use."], ['Using The Bible on {{E|Satan}} will kill Isaac instantly upon use.'], ['{{transf|seraphim|item}}'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['Using The Bible on {{E|Isaac}}, {{E|???}}, {{E|The Lamb}}, {{E|Hush}}, {{E|Mega Satan}}, {{E|Delirium}}, {{E|Dogma}}, {{E|The Beast}} or {{E|Mother}} has no special effect and does not kill Isaac.']]

name: Gimpy
description: Gives chance of spawning a {{E|Soul Heart}} when taking damage. Enemies have a chance to drop a {{E|Half Red Heart}} after being killed.
effects: [['When Isaac takes damage, there is a chance that a {{E|Soul Heart}} may spawn.'], ["[[Monster]]s have a chance to drop a {{E|Half Red Heart}} after being killed. Chance depends on killed monster's base health."]]
notes: [["Gimpy's Soul Heart drop chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 50% at 22 Luck."]]
synergies: [['{{I|Blood Oath}}: For each half heart damaged by Blood Oath, Gimpy has a chance to drop a soul heart. Synergy further improves with luck.'], ['{{i|Dark Bum}}: Dark Bum can collect the Half Red Hearts that enemies drop, which when combined with the chance to drop Soul Hearts when damaged, is a good way to generate Soul and {{E|Black Heart}}s as well as other pickups.']]

name: Placenta
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], and a chance to regenerate a {{E|Half Red Heart}} of health every minute of gameplay.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] when picked up.'], ['Isaac has a chance to regenerate a {{E|Half Red Heart}} every time the in-game timer hits a new minute (00:01:00, 00:02:00, etc).'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}} when picked up.']]
notes: [['The regeneration can happen multiple times in the same room, so there is no need to move between rooms to continue regeneration.', ["{{dlc|nr}} However, regeneration '''does not occur''' when standing in a {{R|Crawl Space}}."]], ["Regeneration will only occur when Isaac has Red Heart containers or '''something equivalent''':", ["{{c|Keeper}}'s and {{c|Tainted Keeper|r}}'s coin hearts will regenerate, one coin at a time.", '{{E|Bone Heart}}s regenerate like red hearts.', 'Consequently, characters with no applicable health -- {{c|???}}, {{c|The Lost}}, {{c|Dark Judas}}, {{c|Tainted Bethany}}, {{c|Tainted Judas}}, and {{c|Tainted Lost}} -- do not benefit from the effect.']]]
synergies: [['{{i|Blood Oath}}: With enough patience, health can be safely restored each floor by waiting in the starting room.'], ['{{i|Gnawed Leaf}}: Regeneration works while turned to stone, allowing Isaac to become invincible and regenerate while in any room.'], ['{{i|Sanguine Bond}}: Can be used indefinitely with placenta’s regen. Also works with normal sacrifice rooms'], ['{{i|Sharp Plug}}: With enough patience, any active item can be reused indefinitely.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Maggy's Bow}}: No effect on regen."]]

name: Pyromaniac
description: +5 [[bomb]]s. Grants immunity to explosion damage and causes explosions to heal Isaac. {{dlc|r}} Also grants immunity to fire.
effects: [['+5 {{e|Bomb}}s.'], ['All explosions heal Isaac instead of damaging him. If Isaac has no [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart containers]] or full health, no damage is taken.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Explosions heal one full Red Heart.', '{{dlc|r}} Explosions heal one half Red Heart.']], ['{{dlc+|r}} Grants immunity to damage from {{e|Fire Place}}s or enemy fires, but does not heal Isaac.', ['It does not protect the player from taking damage from the {{e|White Fire Place}} in {{s|Downpour}} II, making it still possible to acquire {{i|Knife Piece 1}}.', 'Isaac is immune to the lake of fire in the fight against {{e|The Beast}}, but not to her fire inhalation attack.{{dlc-}}']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Pyromaniac is a [[Special Item]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Makes the player immune to {{e|Mom}}'s, {{e|Satan}}'s, and other enemies' stomp attacks, making those fights substantially less difficult.", ["Due to the immunity to Mom's stomping attack, {{t|Mom's Toenail}} has improved usefulness."]], ["{{dlc|nr}} Makes the player immune to {{e|The Cage}}'s, {{e|The Adversary}}'s, {{e|Mega Satan}}'s, and {{e|Ultra Greedier}}'s rock wave attack."], ['The item is unable to produce {{e|Soul Heart}}s, {{e|Black Heart}}s, or {{e|Eternal Heart}}s, making Pyromaniac a little less effective if used with {{C|???}}, {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|The Lost}}, {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}, or {{C|Tainted Bethany}}. However, these characters still gain immunity to explosions, with {{C|Tainted ???}} benefiting the most out of all.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Makes the player immune to fires left behind by enemies and their hot bombs, as well as projectiles from {{e|Red Fire Place}}s and {{e|Purple Fire Place}}s, but '''not''' the fireplaces themselves."], ['{{e|Ultra Greedier}} uses explosive attacks almost exclusively. As a result, Pyromaniac makes characters nearly invulnerable against him.'], ['One of only two items that grant full immunity to explosive damage, the other being {{i|Host Hat}}.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Blood Bombs}}: If the player has run out of bombs, they can spend half a heart to drop a bomb and recover it by getting caught in the explosion (it won't work on characters that can't obtain red health)"], ['{{i|Curse of the Tower}}: Whenever Isaac gets hit, numerous healing troll bombs fill the room, nullifying nearly any red heart damage taken.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}} / {{i|Ipecac}}: Explosions heal Isaac, essentially making him invincible as long as he has more than one red heart container and a decent rate of fire.'], ['{{i|Kamikaze!}}: Provides an unlimited source of explosions which will heal.'], ['{{I|Bomber Boy}}: Heals Isaac multiple times per bomb depending on the number of explosions that hit him.']]

name: Midas' Touch
description: Enemies that touch Isaac are temporarily [[Petrification|petrified]] and turn to gold. Any enemy killed while in this state will drop {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}.
effects: [['Petrifies and turns enemies into gold upon contact with Isaac.', ['Enemies killed while in this state will drop 1-4 {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}.', 'When held by  {{C|Keeper}} or  {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, enemies will drop 0-1 pennies instead.']], ['Enemies that make contact with Isaac take damage equal to the number of [[coin]]s he has.', ['{{dlc|r}} The damage is 3.5+0.2']], ["the number of Isaac's coins. The damage caps at 23.30 with 99 coins.", ['Damage is dealt up to twice per second per enemy.']]]
notes: [["With Midas' Touch, some effects that create {{E|Poop}} may instead create {{E|Golden Poop}} (see Synergies for details)."], ["If an enemy doesn't deal contact damage, Midas' Touch can safely be used on it to create extra Pennies. {{E|Fly|display=Flies}}, {{E|Bulb}}, {{E|Mulligan}}, and {{E|Host}} are the most common enemies this can be applied to.", ["If Isaac has 13 coins or more when using Midas' Touch on {{E|Mulligan|display=Mulligans}}, they will die and release flies, hurting Isaac.", 'With {{i|Skatole}}, {{E|Hive}}s and {{E|Swarmer}}s will constantly spawn black flies, meaning they can create endless amounts of coins.', "{{dlc|nr}} As {{E|Mom}}'s foot and {{E|Satan}}'s feet don't deal contact damage, Midas' Touch can be used against them to great effect."]], ['{{dlc|a}} When used against {{E|Ultra Greed}}, his [[Damage scaling|armor]] will be partially impaired to a 25% efficiency.'], ["Spawning Multiplayer [[Babies]] while the player has Midas' Touch will give the Midas' Touch effects (freeze on touch + damage) to the baby itself. This can be abused, considering the baby's invincibility frames upon spawning:", ['Spawn the baby using the Enter key. It is invincible for a short period.', 'During this period, stay in contact with enemies to freeze them and damage them.']], ["This can be used to gather 99 [[coin]]s very quickly, and in turn, deal massive damage with Midas' Touch damage component."], ['{{dlc|r}} Petrified enemies that are [[Freeze|frozen]] will not drop any coins on death.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Midas' Touch can be a great item with {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, as you can run into enemies and get even more coins. Just be careful to not kill yourself."], ["{{dlc|r}} Both Midas' Touch and {{i|E. Coli}} affect {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}'s body, causing enemies that touch the body to freeze and turn into poop respectively."]]
synergies: [['{{p|A Card Against Humanity}}: Spawned Poops have a great chance to turn into Golden Poops. 10% at 0 [[luck]] and 100% at 18 [[luck]], this also applies to poop spawned by the [[Pills#Re-Lax|Re-Lax]].'], ['{{I|Deep Pockets|force=r}}: Increases maximum contact damage. The damage caps at 203.3 damage with 999 coins.'], ['{{I|E. Coli}}: Enemies touched are turned into {{E|Golden Poop}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Epic Fetus}} + {{i|E.
