Coli}}: Launching a rocket at Isaac will turn the rocket into a golden poop, causing the explosion to break it automatically and spawning coins, which allows health to be exchanged for money.'], ['{{i|The Poop}}: Using The Poop has a high chance to spawn Golden Poop. 50% at 0 [[luck]] and 100% at 7 [[luck]].'], ["Any item or card that grants Isaac temporary invincibility lets Isaac use Midas' Touch on any enemy without taking damage. This includes, but is not limited to:", ['{{p|VII - The Chariot}}', '{{P|VII - The Chariot?}}', '{{i|A Pony}}', '{{i|Blanket}}', '{{i|Book of Shadows}}', '{{i|Breath of Life}}', '{{t|Cartridge}}', '{{i|Celtic Cross}}', '{{i|Dull Razor}}', '{{i|Empty Vessel}}', '{{i|Gnawed Leaf}}', '{{p|Holy Card}}', '{{i|Holy Mantle}}', '{{i|My Little Unicorn}}', "[https://bindingofisaacrebirth.fandom.com/wiki/Pills#:~:text=Feels%20like%20I'm%20walking%20on%20sunshine!| Feels like I'm walking on Sunshine!]", '[https://bindingofisaacrebirth.fandom.com/wiki/Pills#:~:text=Power%20Pill!| Power Pill!]', '{{p|Rune of Algiz}}', '{{P|Soul of the Lost}} (with enough care)', '{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Aries}} if the character walking speed is superior to 0.8', '{{i|Taurus}}', '{{i|The Gamekid}}', '{{i|The Polaroid}}', '{{i|Unicorn Stump}}', '{{i|Ventricle Razor}} (briefly after exiting a portal)', '{{i|Virgo}}', '{{i|White Pony}}', '{{t|Wooden Cross}}']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Mine Crafter}}: Instantly detonates the TNT block when placed, damaging Isaac in the process.']]

name: Mom's Underwear
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]]. Spawns 3-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] on pickup.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns 3-6 [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] when picked up.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Caffeine Pill
description: Grants +0.3 [[speed]], reduces character size, and gives a random [[pill]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ["Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit."], ['Upon pickup, gives Isaac a random [[pill]]. If he is already holding a consumable, it is forcibly dropped to the ground.']]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} It will still drop a pill even if the player has {{I|Starter Deck}}.']]

name: Screw
description: +0.5 [[tears]], +0.2 [[shot speed]].

name: Soy Milk
description: [[Tears]] are smaller and do much less [[damage]], but fire in very rapid succession.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Reduces [[tear delay]] by the formula: (delay / 4) - 2'], ['{{dlc|r}} Multiplies [[fire rate]] by 5.5x'], ['0.2x [[damage]] multiplier.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} 0.5x tear size multiplier.', ['{{Dlc|r}} -0.3 tear size.']], ["{{dlc|r}} Drastically reduces [[knockback]] from Isaac's tears."], ["{{dlc|r}} Automatically charges and fires charged attacks, such as {{i|Brimstone}}, {{i|Monstro's Lung}}, and {{i|Chocolate Milk}}, providing a different effect per item. Also removes the charge bar on them. See [[#Synergies|Synergies]]."]]
notes: [["At base tear rate, Soy Milk sets the player's tear delay to the game's minimum value of 1, for 15 tears per second. This is much lower than the normal minimum tear delay; see [[tear delay|the tear delay explanation page]]."], ['{{dlc|nr}} At base damage, Soy Milk is a very small DPS up. With a tear delay of 8 or lower, Soy Milk becomes a DPS down. The more tears per second before obtaining Soy Milk, the greater the decrease in DPS.'], ["Soy Milk's damage down stat also significantly decreases tear size."], ['The endless stream of tears effectively increases directional knockback.'], ['Due to the high fire rate, items that cause tears to inflict [[status effect]]s activate more frequently.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Soy Milk is a [[special item]].'], ['Charged items which do not affect tears such as {{dlc|r}} {{i|Maw of the Void}}, {{i|Sumptorium}}, and {{i|Revelation}} are not affected.']]
synergies: [['{{i|20/20}}: The shot pattern may help in controlling enemy knockback, in addition to dealing up to {{Dlc|nr}} double damage {{dlc|r}} 50% more damage.'], ['{{i|Blood Clot}}: +1 damage bonus on the left eye. Blood Clot tears are unaffected by the damage penalty.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Brimstone}}/{{c|Azazel}}: Beam can be fired continuously after charging.'], ['{{i|Chemical Peel}}: +2 damage bonus on the left eye. Chemical Peel tears are unaffected by the damage penalty.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Shots cannot be charged, but Isaac gains a flat +1 damage up after the Soy Milk penalty.', ['{{dlc|r}} Shoots moderately charged shots at a quick pace. No longer gives +1 damage.']], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Cursed Eye}}: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. This may be riskier than Cursed Eye alone because Soy Milk prevents Isaac from holding a fully charged shot.'], ['{{i|Explosivo}}: Despite the tiny appearance of the bomb tears, the explosions will do normal explosion damage. Due to the massive fire rate, many bombs can be applied in extremely quick succession, decimating anything after a short delay.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Allows for incredibly fast firing medium damage bombs.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires tiny bombs, like the kinds created by {{I|Scatter Bombs|n}}. Damage downgrade applies as normal.']], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: The very fast rate of fire fills the screen with low damage explosions.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Libra}}: Decreases fire rate slightly, but massively increases damage, range, and speed. Tear height is also massively increased, meaning tears can hit enemies through obstacles without spectral effect.', ['{{dlc|r}} Resets stats to slightly higher than base level.', "{{dlc|r}} '''Libra''' + {{i|Brimstone}}: Constant Brimstone beam at normal/higher damage."]], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Extremely effective at blocking shots.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Significantly increases tear damage as they get further away.  Even with only this synergy, individual tear damage appears to approach starting tear damage when firing over longer distances.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Monstro's Lung}}:  Automatically charges and fires tear barrages."], ['{{I|The Mulligan}}: Will generate an enormous wave of blue flies given that each tear has a 1/6 chance of spawning one.'], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Each shot creates creep that deals reasonable damage but stacks with every shot, causing hefty damage.'], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Causes tears to affect enemy movement less for better accuracy, though also removes the advantage of rapidly knocking back enemies.'], ['{{i|Pisces}}: Greatly increases knockback, allowing tears to pin enemies against walls.'], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: If Soy Milk is picked up at an opportune time (after Rock Bottom and preferably near the end of the run), it will result in a huge gain in fire rate without the damage penalty.'], ['{{i|Tech X|r}}: Automatically charges and fires fully charged Tech X rings. Non-fully charged rings can still be fired by releasing the fire key during charging, but much harder due to the high fire rate and removal of charge bar.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: The near-constant stream of tears will have electricity chained between them, providing an electrical net of damage making it almost impossible to not hit an enemy.  This can greatly help offset the lowered damage by increasing the number of hits.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Almond Milk}}: Overrides Soy Milk (no additional effect on tears or damage).'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Damage of missiles will be decreased accordingly, but unlike normal tears, there is still a fixed timed delay between firing missiles.'], ["{{i|Kidney Stone}}'s charge time is not affected."], ["{{dlc|r}} {{i|Mom's Knife}} No special synergy. Charge bar still disappears, but knife will not be automatically released upon full charge."], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Proptosis}}: The low-damage, lowered size tears disappear extremely quickly, greatly reducing range.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Tears no longer dissappear instantly. Range is slightly shorter.']], ['{{I|Lead Pencil}}: Will fire very often burst of tears that are much weaker.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology 2}}: Half of the Soy Milk tears are replaced by a constant laser, but damage down compounds.', ['{{dlc|r}} Half of the Soy Milk tears are replaced by a constant laser and there is no further damage down on it.']]]

name: Lunch
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.

name: Butter Bean
description: Upon use, Isaac farts and [[knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies {{dlc|a}} and projectiles. {{dlc|r}} Enemies pushed into walls or [[obstacles]] take 12 damage.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac farts and [[knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies.', ['{{dlc|a}} Projectiles are also deflected.', ['{{dlc|r}} Enemies pushed into walls or [[obstacles]] take 10 + 2']]], ['(floor - 1) damage. Projectiles that are reflected also deal damage to enemies']]
notes: [['{{dlc|a+nr}} If Isaac swaps Butter Bean for a different active item, then picks up Butter Bean again, it has a 10% chance to transform into {{i|Wait What?|n}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When a run is started, the game may replace Butter Bean with {{i|Wait What?|n}} in item pools. Both items are generally not available in the same run.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Ghost Pepper}}: Shoots a flame behind Isaac upon each use of Butter Bean. Two flames will be shot if Isaac also has {{I|Car Battery|n}}.'], ['{{t|Panic Button}}: Activates Butter Bean upon taking damage. If the damage was from a projectile that Butter Bean can knock away, it will be negated.']]

name: Best Bud
description: When hit, spawns a quickly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbiting]] attack fly similar to {{i|Forever Alone}} for the current [[Rooms|room]] that deals high damage.
effects: [['Upon taking damage, spawns a white attack fly for the duration of the current [[Rooms|room]]. The fly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] Isaac at medium range, similar to {{i|Forever Alone}}, but with much higher speed.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The fly deals 5 damage per tick (75 contact damage per second).', '{{dlc|r}} The fly deals 10 damage per tick (150 contact damage per second).']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]

name: Mom's Wig
description: Adds a chance to spawn [[Familiar#Blue Spiders|Blue Spiders]] when firing tears. Restores 1 {{E|red heart}}.
effects: [['Isaac now spawns friendly [[Familiar#Blue Spiders|Blue Spiders]] when firing tears at an enemy.'], ['Heals Isaac for 1 {{E|red heart}} upon pickup.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The spiders are spawned when Isaac is shooting, and up to 5 spiders can be spawned at the same time. More spiders can be spawned if the previous ones died.'], ['The spider spawning chance depends on the [[luck]] stat and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} This item does not work for Lilith since {{i|Incubus}} tears do not count as her tears.'], ['Spiders can still be spawned in rooms without enemies.']]
synergies: [["{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Brimstone}} / {{i|Chocolate Milk}} / {{i|Cursed Eye}} / {{i|Mom's Knife}} / {{i|Monstro's Lung}} / {{i|Tech X}}: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}} / {{i|The Ludovico Technique}} / {{i|Marked}}: Moving the tear/crosshair around will spawn spiders rapidly.'], ['{{t|Fish Tail}}: Doubles the total amount of spiders that can be spawned at the same time, up to a total of 10.'], ["{{i|Hive Mind}}: Doubles the limit to 10 spiders, in addition to boosting the damage of spiders per the item's base effect."]]

name: SMB Super Fan
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.2 [[speed]], +0.5 [[range]], +1 [[tear falling speed]]. Fully restores all red hearts.
{{dlc|r}} +1 [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.2 [[tears]], +0.2 [[speed]], +1.5 [[range]]. Fully restores all red hearts.
effects: [['+1 [[health]].'], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[tears]].'], ['+0.2 [[speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['Fills all Red Heart containers.']]
interactions: [['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: Grants 12 blood charges.']]

name: Aquarius
description: A trail of [[blue creep]] is left behind Isaac, which damages enemies. {{dlc|r}} The creep inherits most of Isaac's tear effects, like [[homing]], etc.
notes: [["{{dlc|r}} The creep copies Isaac's [[tear effects]] and changes colors based on Isaac's tears.", ['Chance for triggering the effects works like it does for tears.', "The creep's color changes even if the items don't have an applicable tear effect."]]]
synergies: [['{{I|Apple!|r}} / {{I|Tough Love|r}}: Creep does not appear visually different but has a chance to deal bonus damage.'], ['{{I|Ipecac|r}}: Creep becomes green and poisons enemies but does not explode.'], ['{{I|Knockout Drops}}: Creep knocks back any enemies that touch it.'], ['{{I|A Lump of Coal}}: Creep does more damage the farther Isaac is from the enemy.'], ["{{i|Proptosis|r}}: Creep deals 2x Isaac's damage instead of 66%."], ['{{dlc|r}} [[Tear Effects|Homing tears]]: Creep turns purple and moves towards nearby enemies.'], ['{{t|Lost Cork}}: The creep is 50% larger.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Turns the creep purple.'], ['{{I|Godhead|r}}: Creep becomes homing as expected but does not have a larger radius.'], ["{{I|Sulfuric Acid|r}}: Occasionally turns the creep yellow but doesn't destroy obstacles."], ["{{I|Montezuma's Revenge}}: Turns the creep brown."], ['{{I|Fire Mind|force=r}}: Turns the creep orange.'], ['{{I|Number One|force=r}}: Turns the creep yellow.']]

name: Polyphemus
description: Isaac fires huge tears that deal massive [[damage]], but [[Tears|fire rate]] is greatly decreased. If a tear kills an enemy, it travels on with any leftover damage.
effects: [['Greatly increased [[damage]]: <math display="inline">{(Damage + 4) \\times 2}</math>'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tears]] down: <math display="inline">{(Delay \\times 2.1) + 3}</math>'], ['{{dlc|r}} Tears fired per second'], ['0.42.'], ['If a tear kills an enemy and has left over damage, the tear travels on with the remaining damage.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Polyphemus is a [[special item]].']]
synergies: [["{{i|Abyss}}: When Polyphemus is picked up instead of being converted into a locust, it grants all of Abyss's locusts the high damage up without suffering the tears down allowing Isaac to increase his damage rate substantially the more items he uses Abyss on."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Increases tear delay, and after the first bomb explodes, a second bomb appears where the first one exploded, doing roughly half the damage of the first.'], ['{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: The tear rate is not lowered further, but the effect on damage becomes a flat +5 bonus instead.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: The Forgotten's bone club becomes massive. It deals very high damage but has a very low swing rate."], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: Allows Isaac to keep his previous fire rate in addition to the massive damage boost.'], ['{{i|Shard of Glass|r}}: The rapidly spawning red tears do full damage.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Haemolacria}}: The main tear retains the semi-piercing ability and may not burst when hitting a weaker enemy. Split tears do not semi-pierce.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Greatly increases how big the fed tear can grow.'], ["{{i|Lost Contact}}: Isaac's tears will block enemy shots and continue, but lose 10 damage. If the tear had less than 10 damage left, it disappears."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Semi-piercing is replaced by proper piercing, with no loss of damage on any enemy contact.'], ['{{i|Polyphemus}}: No further effect when multiple copies are acquired.']]

name: Pageant Boy
description: Spawns seven random [[coins]] around Isaac.
effects: [['Spawns seven [[coin]]s around Isaac.', ['These coins may be any normal type with their respective usual chances: {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}, {{E|Nickel}}s, {{E|Dime}}s, {{E|Lucky Penny|display=Lucky Pennies}}, {{E|Sticky Nickel}}s or {{E|Golden Penny|display=Golden Pennies}}.', 'Denomination of coins that spawn is not affected by [[luck]].']]]
synergies: [["{{T|Nuh Uh!}}: On the low chance this item spawns in {{s|Womb}} or {{s|Corpse}}, coins dropped will instead be replaced by drops from Nuh Uh!'s drop table."]]

name: Infamy
description: Chance to block projectiles coming from any direction.
effects: [['Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a 50% chance to be blocked.', ['After effectively blocking a projectile, Isaac will briefly flash blue. Isaac in this state can still take damage from another projectile.', 'Can block:', ['Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), but their lines of fire harm Isaac.', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', 'Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.'], 'Does not block:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}).', 'Lasers or beams.', 'Lines of fire from fireballs.', 'Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.']]]]
notes: [["Although the mask is seen only on Isaac's face, projectiles still have a 50% chance to be blocked from any direction."]]
interactions: [['{{I|Cone Head}}: Blocking effect from either item can occur.', ['This leaves Isaac 60% chance to negate tears.']], ["{{P|Holy Card}} / {{I|Holy Mantle}}: Infamy's chance of blocking projectiles is applied before the shield, allowing the shield to be saved."], ["{{I|Host Hat}}: Infamy's blocking effect is applied first. Host Hat does not fire tears when a tear is blocked by Infamy.", ['This leaves Isaac 60% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["'''Infamy''': Additional copies of this item, such as from {{I|Diplopia}} / {{I|Crooked Penny}}, have no effect."], ["{{I|Metal Plate}}: Infamy's blocking effect is applied first. Tears blocked by Infamy are not reflected by Metal Plate.", ['This leaves Isaac 62.5% chance to negate tears in any way.']]]

name: Dark Bum
quote: He wants to take your life
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and collects {{E|Red Heart}}s. For every 1½ Red Hearts collected, Dark Bum will give a reward.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and collects {{E|Red Heart}}s. (He does not fill up a familiar "slot".) For every one-and-a-half Red Hearts collected, Dark Bum will generate one of the following:', ['{{dlc|nr}} A single {{E|Soul Heart}}.', 'A hostile {{E|Spider}}.', 'A friendly [[Blue Spider]].', 'A single {{E|Black Heart}}.', '{{dlc|r}} A random [[pill]], [[Cards and Runes|card, or rune]].']]]
notes: [['If Dark Bum enters one of a set of {{r|Super Secret Room}}s which allow only certain types of Hearts to generate in them, he will drop that type of heart instead of what he would normally instead.', ["The one which only allows Red Hearts will cause Dark Bum to consume the Red Hearts on the floor only to generate yet more Red Hearts. Leading Dark Bum around the room to consume the Red Hearts and then leaving the room before he's able to generate anything will avoid this."]], ['Dark Bum will not pick up {{e|Gold Heart}}s, {{E|Blended Heart}}s, {{E|Bone Heart}}s, or {{E|Rotten Heart}}s.'], ["Very beneficial for characters that can't have heart containers ({{c|???}}, {{c|Tainted ???}}, {{c|Dark Judas}}, {{c|Tainted Judas}}, {{c|Tainted Forgotten}})  since they have no use for Red Hearts."], ['{{E|Scared Heart}}s will run away from Dark Bum. Try to pinch them between Dark Bum and Isaac so he can collect them.'], ['From a scoring perspective, Hearts that Dark Bum picks up count towards your Schwag bonus on daily runs. (only applies to Afterbirth and Afterbirth ✞ dailies)']]
synergies: [['{{i|Little C.H.A.D.}}: Each Half Red Heart dropped by Little C.H.A.D. can be collected by Dark Bum, increasing the amount of pickups dropped.'], ["{{i|Gimpy}}: Enemy kills have the chance to drop Half Red Hearts that can be collected by Dark Bum, which when combined with Gimpy's chance to drop Soul Hearts when Isaac is damaged is a good way to generate Black Hearts as well as other pickups."], ['{{i|Humbling Bundle}}: Most Red Heart drops will become Double Red Heart drops. This counts as two full Red Hearts for Dark Bum, essentially doubling the value of it.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect, but familiar is bigger.']]

name: Cancer
description: Adds 3 {{E|Soul Heart}}s. Grants {{i|The Wafer}} effect for the current room after taking damage.
effects: [['Grants three {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['After taking damage, grants {{i|The Wafer}} effect of damage reduction for the current room.']]

name: Gnawed Leaf
description: After standing still and not shooting for a short time, Isaac turns invincible until he moves or shoots.
effects: [['Upon pickup, Isaac gets a small brown ringtail.'], ['After standing still and not pressing the move or attack buttons for one second, Isaac will turn into an [[invulnerability|invulnerable]] statue.', ['Using bombs and active items will remove the invincibility state.', 'Bombs can be placed while stationary and safely be stood on until they blow up if no other inputs are done after placing the bomb. (Unless Isaac is carrying the {{T|Short Fuse}} trinket, in which case the bomb will explode before the invincibility state returns)']]]
notes: [['While invulnerable, {{E|Little Horn}}’s pitfall still affects Isaac and will teleport him throughout the room; however, the damage is not dealt.'], ['With items like {{i|Cube of Meat}}, Isaac can easily, but slowly, kill most enemies and bosses without taking any damage.']]
synergies: [['{{I|7 Seals}}: One of the more versatile familiars that works with Gnawed Leaf.  The varied forms and attacks of this familiar make it capable of clearing pretty much any room given time.  The locusts it produces often fly to Isaac which takes care of chasing enemies, but its damaging creep and chasing attacks can reach even the farthest enemies.'], ["{{I|120 Volt}}: With enough damage, 120 Volt's zaps becomes far more efficient at killing than orbitals.", ['At 15 damage minimum, it surpasses most orbitals.', 'At 30 damage or more, it surpasses {{I|Sacrificial Dagger}}.']], ["{{I|Angry Fly}}: Aggressively attacks enemies even if they're far away, but can end up harmlessly orbiting slow or stationary enemies indefinitely, or trying to attack invulnerable enemies.  It does better with slow or stationary bosses than regular enemies, diving in to attack periodically instead of harmlessly orbiting."], ["{{i|Daddy Longlegs}}: Allows Isaac to easily clear most rooms or bosses while in statue form. Daddy Longlegs cannot damage bosses like {{E|The Shell}} and won't target enemies that are a long distance from Isaac. In a pinch, {{T|mom's toenail}} works the same, albeit much slower."], ['{{I|Damocles}}: If Isaac is in statue form when the sword falls, he will survive.'], ['{{I|Dark Arts}}: While Isaac is surrounded by enemies, he will not take damage and will safely go into the shadow state. (Even if enemies are in pointblank range.)'], ['{{I|Decap Attack}}: The head can be used on stationary bosses to wither them down.'], ["{{i|E. Coli}} /{{i|Midas' Touch}} /{{I|serpent's kiss}} / {{i|The Virus}}: Monsters touching the statue will be affected without Isaac taking collision damage."], ["{{I|empty vessel}}: if Empty Vessel's requirement is fulfilled, Isaac can safely wait for the shield to activate, allowing to deal damage without leaving invulnerability."], ['{{I|IBS}}: Orbitals and other things(such as 120 Volt) can trigger IBS while in statue form, however, Isaac will still be invincible. This can be really good if a Stinky Poop is held above his head.'], ['{{i|Kamikaze!}}: Statue form will break, but the initial explosion will not damage Isaac, therefore granting Isaac quasi-unlimited bombs.'], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The hovering tear will still deal damage and the statue form won't break as long as the attack buttons aren't being pressed.", ["'''The Ludovico Technique''' + {{i|Strange Attractor}}: Can pull enemies in while remaining a statue, clearing out rooms easily."]], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife can damage enemies while Isaac is a statue."], ["{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Mom's Heels}}: While invincible, Isaac can still deal contact damage."], ['{{I|Monstrance}}: The aura makes quick work of chasing enemies.'], ["{{i|The Pinking Shears}}: Isaac's body will attack enemies while his head is invincible."], ['{{i|Placenta}}: Isaac can safely regenerate Red Hearts in any room, making it easy to have enough health from any mistake at the cost of time.'], ['{{i|Robo-Baby 2.0}}: Since it fires automatically, this familiar is one of the more effective synergies, since it will even shoot off screen as it’s knocked around.'], ['{{I|Salvation}}: The aura can trigger from nearby enemies while Isaac is safely a statue, and the damaging beams when this happens can reach farther enemies.  This powerful attack can make quick work of bosses that chase Isaac.'], ['{{I|Spin to Win}}: Gnawed Leaf will activate while using Spin to Win, as long as Isaac is stationary. This allows for a brief moment of high damage against enemies that chase Isaac.'], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: Can be placed upon entering a room, and will continue to fire when Isaac is invincible, meaning any room can be cleared without the risk of Isaac taking damage. This theoretically allows end-game bosses to be beaten without having to move.'], ['{{t|Super Magnet}}: Pulls enemies into Isaac, can be extremely powerful if combined with orbitals that allow contact damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Magdalene}}: Tainted Magdalene\'s "Hug" attack still triggers when in the statue state without taking damage, making short work of aggressive enemies as well as providing lots of healing.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The Soul is invincible as long as the bone club is not used and The Forgotten is not thrown, even if The Soul is holding The Forgotten and moving around.  Combined with orbitals that deal contact damage like {{I|Cube of Meat}} or items that can trigger damage only by movement such as {{I|Purgatory}}, can make for a trivial method to beat any boss.'], ['{{Transformation|Yes Mother?}}: When worst comes to worst and Isaac has no orbitals or familiars, the knife can be used to deal damage, due to how common the transformation is.'], ['{{i|Tooth and Nail}}: Allows one second to act and/or reposition without taking damage. Useful in situations such as ranged combat when enemies bombard from a distance, or to attack and move to a safe distance where Isaac can safely regain statue form.']]
interactions: [['{{I|2spooky}}: Counterintuitive and should be avoided, as most enemies will never approach orbital range.'], ["{{i|Blood Oath}}: Standing still at the start of a level will block Blood Oath's damage, preventing it from activating."], ['{{i|Blood Rights}} / {{i|IV Bag}} / {{i|Razor Blade}}: Statue invulnerability will not prevent damage from these items when activated.'], ['{{I|Book of Virtues}} / {{I|Lemegeton}}: Wisps are invincible while invulnerable.'], ['{{c|Jacob and Esau}}: If Esau picks up the item, he can remain invulnerable even when Jacob is moving but not when firing.'], ['{{i|The Gamekid}} / {{i|My Little Unicorn}} / {{i|Unicorn Stump}}: Statue form can activate while invulnerable.'], ['{{T|Short Fuse}}: Bombs explode before invincibility kicks in.']]

name: Torn Photo
description: +0.7 [[tears]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].

name: The Boomerang
description: Throws a boomerang which retrieves [[pickup]]s, as well as damages and [[Status Effects#Effects|petrifies]] enemies hit for 2 seconds.
effects: [['On use, Isaac readies the Boomerang. Pressing a fire key will throw it in the chosen direction, and it will return shortly afterward.'], ['Any [[pickup]]s hit will return to Isaac with the Boomerang.'], ["Enemies hit by it will take double Isaac's current damage and are [[Status Effects#Effects|petrified]] for about 2 seconds."], ['{{Dlc|r}} Boomerang [[Tear Effects#Effects|pierces]] enemies it hits.']]
notes: [['The Boomerang starts to recharge only after it has returned to Isaac.'], ['The Boomerang can grab [[pickup]]s from afar, even over [[obstacle]]s.'], ['The Boomerang can be used to destroy any {{E|Shopkeeper}}s.', ['If Isaac has low damage, the shopkeeper won’t get destroyed and will instead flash red as if taking damage.']], ['The Boomerang can damage {{E|Host}} and {{E|Mobile Host}} enemies even while under their shells.'], ["The Boomerang's range scales with Isaac's range."], ["The Boomerang can hit and stun {{E|The Haunt}} or {{E|Lil' Haunt}}s even when they are invincible."], ['The Boomerang is unable to pick up {{E|Sticky Nickel}}s, or {{E|chest}}s.'], ['With enough speed, it is possible to have two Boomerangs in the air at the same time.'], ['The Boomerang can grab troll bombs.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone|r}} / {{i|Mini Mush}} / {{i|Number One}} / {{i|Pluto}}: The Boomerang loses almost all of its range, and cannot be improved by range ups or any other method.']]

name: Goat Head
description: A {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding the first floor and floors after Chapter 4.
effects: [['A {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} Door will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding first floor and floors after [[Chapter 4]].', ['The spawned door will not disappear when leaving and re-entering the boss room.']]]
notes: [['The precise effect involves setting the [[Devil Room#Conditions to make Devil Rooms appear|Devil Room chance]] to 100%, regardless of other effects.', ['Even if taken after a boss is killed, Goat Head will force a Devil / Angel Room door to spawn on that floor.']], ['Accepting a deal with the Devil will prevent any Angel Rooms from appearing, meaning that Isaac needs to acquire the Goat Head in a {{R|Curse Room}}, {{Dlc|nr}} {{E|Locked Chest}}, {{Dlc|na}} {{E|Red Chest}}, from {{E|The Fallen}} or with {{p|Credit Card}}, which would allow {{R|Angel Room}}s to open.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Goat Head and {{i|The Book of Belial}} are the only items that will ensure Angel/Devil Rooms on every floor between The {{S|Basement}} I and {{S|Utero}} II.'], ['{{dlc|anr}} Goat Head will not force a Devil / Angel Room door to open if the boss fight was in a narrow room.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Goat Head has no effect in [[Greed mode]] and is not normally available.', ["It can still be a starting item for {{c|Eden}}, a bonus item from {{i|Eden's Blessing}} and is obtainable with {{i|Pandora's Box}} and {{i|Sacrificial Altar}}."]]]
synergies: [['{{T|Black Feather}}: Grants a damage boost'], ['{{i|Duality}}: Both Angel and Devil Room doors spawn after every boss, and the selected door will never disappear.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Eucharist}}: Overrides Goat Head.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Lazarus}}: Fighting the boss as the Lazarus with Goat Head will spawn the door immediately. Fighting the boss as the other Lazarus will spawn the door when you leave the room and re-enter.']]

name: Taurus
description: -0.3 [[Speed]]. Isaac builds speed while in a room with enemies. At max speed, he gains the {{i|My Little Unicorn}} effect for 5 seconds.
effects: [['-0.3 [[speed]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.3 maximum speed.']], ['When in a room with enemies, Isaac gradually gains speed at a rate of +0.065 per tick.', ['{{dlc|nr}} This speed boost will be able to go past the lowered maximum.']], ["Once Isaac's speed reaches 2.0, he gains the {{i|My Little Unicorn}} effect for 5 seconds, becoming [[invulnerability|invulnerable]], and loses the speed bonus from Taurus afterward."]]
notes: [['Isaac slowly gains a red tint that becomes more intense as he gains speed.'], ['The speed boost and invulnerability effect activate only once per room.'], ["The higher Isaac's base speed, the quicker the effect activates. It can activate immediately upon entering a room if his base speed is already 2.0 ."], ["The item doesn't trigger in rooms that don't have enemies when first entered. This includes {{R|Challenge Room}}s, {{R|Sacrifice Room}}s when spawning {{E|Uriel}} or {{E|Gabriel}}, and the {{R|Boss Rush}} room."], ["The item doesn't trigger in trap rooms which only contain {{E|Poky}} enemies."], ["If Isaac gets teleported out of the room by any source, the {{i|My Little Unicorn}} effect won't trigger if the room is re-entered."], ['Bombs can be placed during the charge.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When playing as {{c|Jacob and Esau}}, the speed changes apply for both, but only the character that is holding Taurus gains invincibility.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Blood Rights}}: While Isaac is invincible, Blood Rights can be freely used without taking damage. This trivializes many rooms, and since Taurus can activate every room, this combination can be game-changing, especially if Isaac has high base speed.', ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac will still take damage from Blood Rights during the invincibility.']], ["{{I|Gnawed Leaf}}: Isaac's speed will still increase while he is invincible from Gnawed Leaf, allowing Taurus to activate with only a very small period of vulnerability when first entering a room."], ['{{I|Rock Bottom}}: Isaac keeps the maximum speed boost after reaching it once.'], ["{{I|Serpent's Kiss}}/{{I|The Virus}}: Isaac will poison enemies in addition to dealing damage to them on contact."]]
interactions: [["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Libra}}: Isaac's [[damage]] and [[range]] increases as speed increases. However, if Isaac's base speed is not high enough, the invincibility never activates.", ['{{dlc|r}} Damage, Range, and Tear delay increase as speed increases. Speed increases much slower than normal.']], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Isaac cannot control the tear while invincible, but any enemies touching it will still take damage from it.']]

name: Number One
description: Grants +1.5 [[tears]], but severely reduces [[range]].
effects: [['+1.5 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -17.62 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} -1.5 [[range]] and -20% [[range]] multiplier.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.76 [[tear falling speed]].'], ["Tears turn yellow and are fired from Isaac's lower body rather than his head."]]
notes: [["Number One doesn't increase the tear rate cap, meaning picking it up with tears capped (normally 5.0) this item will just decrease range with no benefit."]]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Number One it turns into a yellow locust that is faster, deals damage quicker, but has a limited range.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}} / {{c|Tainted Azazel|r}}: The laser turns yellow and charges at a much faster rate with no decrease to the range.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Increases fire-rate with no decrease in range. Explosive clouds are now yellow.'], ['{{i|Incubus}}: The Incubus fires at a much faster rate with no decrease to the range.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Increase fire rate moderately and decreases range only slightly.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Turns tear yellow and allows it to be moved much faster.'], ['{{i|Number One}}: Gives an additional fire rate bonus without further reducing range.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Eyeball tears are yellow, can be fired much quicker, and does not affect their airtime.'], ["{{i|Technology}}: The laser turns yellow and Technology's firing rate is greatly increased with no decrease to the range."], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Laser turns yellow, charge time is greatly decreased, and no decrease to the range.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears travel roughly the same distance but can be fired much quicker.']]
interactions: [['{{C|Azazel}}: Lowers range, reduces charge time.'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Tears often disappear before being able to split. Split tears also only travel a very short distance.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: Tears disappear '''very''' quickly after being fired and split tears barely travel at all."], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: '''Not recommended.''' Makes bombs travel distance very short. The extremely reduced range can turn simple rooms into a challenge and self-damage a constant concern."], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Does not affect the main tear; however, burst tears travel significantly less far.'], ["{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Number One's range penalty overrides Kidney Stone's. The stone is not affected by short range, otherwise the combo behaves as expected."], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Tears still increase in size and damage as they travel; however, the short-ranged distance limits tear size and damage.'], ["{{i|Marked}}: Tears become orange. The firing rate is increased, Marked's effect is unaffected but the range is reduced."], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife turns yellow and the maximum range is significantly reduced."], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Monstro's Lung}} / {{i|Lead Pencil}}: '''Not recommended.''' Tear barrage disappears very close to Isaac.", ['{{dlc|r}} Range is more forgiving.']], ["{{i|Proptosis|nr}}: '''Not recommended.''' Tears disappear after traveling a very short distance.", ['{{dlc|r}} This is now fixed and works as expected.']], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears often disappear before being able to bounce off walls.'], ['{{i|Toothpicks}}: Tears become orange.']]

name: Proptosis
description: Tears start out massive with high [[damage]], and then shrink down and become weaker over a short range.
effects: [["{{dlc|nr}} Doubles Isaac's [[damage]] stat."], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 damage.'], ['Tear size multiplier: 2x.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The tears shrink and lose damage the farther they travel.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The tears shrink and lose damage the more time they stay airborne, starting at 3x damage at point blank range. After 0.8 seconds, they deal no damage at all.']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Effective range of Isaac's tears now also depends on the damage, as they can shrink out of existence before their air time runs out."], ["{{dlc|r}} Since tears run out of damage after 0.8 seconds (48 frames), shot speed is the only stat that determines the effective range of Isaac's tears. Damage and range don't affect the travel distance at all."], ["{{dlc|r}} Approximately 2.08% damage is lost per frame. This means at approximately 0.53 seconds (32 frames) Isaac's tears will deal the normal amount of damage."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Tear size increasing items also increase the maximum distance before its disappearance, but the damage dealt can go below original at the extreme.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Does not affect {{C|Azazel}} short-ranged {{i|Brimstone}} unless the range stat is ''extremely'' high."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: The tears will not decrease in size or damage until they start moving, making this excellent against enemies that chase Isaac.', ["'''Anti-Gravity''' + {{i|Eye of the Occult}}: Lets Isaac maintain the full 3× damage multiplier while controlling his tears."]], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: Retains the double damage effect without losing damage over range.', ['{{dlc|a}} Damage is doubled again for a total of 4x next to Isaac, but quickly drops further along the beam, at about 0.8x per tile of distance.', '{{dlc|r}} The beam does 6x damage at point blank range.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Doubles damage with no penalty for distance.', ['{{dlc|r}} Triples/quadruples damage respectively.']], ['{{i|Godhead}}: The damaging halo shrinks with the tears.'], ["{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Proptosis scales with Isaac's damage while the Lump of Coal does not. At base damage, the Lump of Coal will approximately negate the damage lost over distance, but with increased damage, tears still do more damage up close.", ["'''A Lump of Coal''' + {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The controlled tear has full Proptosis damage buff, {{dlc|nr}} no matter how far it is from Isaac. {{dlc|r}} Very slightly decreases damage from far away."]], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The Knife damage is {{dlc|nr}} doubled ({{dlc|r}} tripled), regardless of range."], ['{{i|Polyphemus}}: Tears do massive damage and carry with leftover damage while still shrinking.'], ['{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Technology 2}}: Doubles damage.', ['{{dlc|a}} The beam decreases in damage and width the farther it travels. Tears become virtually powerless across large rooms like the Boss Rush and the Hush fight.', '{{dlc|r}} The beams do 6x damage at point blank range.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Ring size and damage is substantially increased, but decreases as the ring travels further from Isaac.'], ['{{i|Trisagion|a+nr}}: Base damage is doubled and beam damage is boosted to about 65%. Blasts lose no power as they travel further, though the tips of the blasts deal very slightly less damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Damage slightly increased, beam damage is doubled. Blasts lose no power with distance.']], ["{{I|Bird's Eye}}: Size and damage of fires is increased, but does not decrease with range."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Athame}}/{{i|Maw of the Void}}: The ring is much larger and deals 1.5× damage.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The ring deals normal damage.', '{{dlc|r}} The ring is now normal size.']], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears will often disappear before they can burst. Tears created from bursts will also shrink, but due to their already low range, the difference may not be noticeable."], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: At base range and tear size, tears will bounce twice against the floor and then disappear.'], ['{{I|immaculate heart}}: Tears that appear around Isaac disappear quickly.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Tears almost disappear completely but are still able to do massive damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tears no longer deal massive damage at the end of the arch. Damage decreases rapidly with range.']], ["[[Isaac's Heart]] is a very good item to have, as you can run up to most enemies to deal maximum damage to them with little downside"], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears disappear too quickly to be fed.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The closer the tear floats to Isaac, the larger it is. The farther away, the smaller it becomes.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}/{{i|Lead Pencil}}: Tears will disappear at different distances depending on how big they were when fired."], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Tears disappear before they can return to Isaac.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears will disappear extremely quickly after being fired.'], ['{{i|Saturnus}} The ring tears from Saturnus disappear nearly instantly upon entering a room.'], ["{{i|Soy Milk}}: '''Very poor combination.''' Tears disappear nearly instantly in front of Isaac, decreasing his range and damage to nearly nothing.", ['{{dlc|r}} Tears no longer disappear instantly. Range is only minimally shorter.']]]

name: D10
description: Re-rolls all [[monsters]] in the [[room]]. {{dlc|r}} Will attempt to re-roll monsters into ones with a similar amount of HP.
effects: [['Upon use, re-rolls all [[monsters]] in the [[room]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Will attempt to re-roll monsters into ones with a similar amount of HP.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Re-rolling a monster will replace it with an entirely new one from any floor, making it dangerous to use early on in the game (as Isaac could get monsters from {{s|Depths}} or later).'], ['{{dlc|r}} D10 attempts to reroll monsters into those with similar max HP, making it somewhat safer to use.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The D10 generally will not reroll [[Boss]]es but can reroll monsters spawned by bosses.'], ['Using this item can cause some rooms to become impossible to clear. Jumping or flying monsters may become trapped behind rocks after being rerolled, and therefore become unbeatable.', ['Sealed doors open after 2 minutes, though there are situations that can prevent this failsafe from triggering.']], ['{{dlc|a}} Flying monsters will only be rerolled into other flying monsters, {{dlc|nr}} and ground monsters can only be rerolled into ground monsters. ({{e|Horf}}s are classified as ground monsters by the D10).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Some invincible enemies will be rerolled, while others (including most Grimace variants) are completely unaffected.'], ["Using this item in a room with {{e|Mom's Hand}} can be very dangerous, as unless they have already landed, they will be directly on top of Isaac, resulting in the new monsters spawning directly on top of Isaac, instantly dealing contact damage."], ["Using this item, then exiting the room, such as by teleporting or a bombed door, will cause the enemies to be in their original forms upon Isaac's return."]]
interactions: [['{{t|Broken Remote|nr}}: Using D10 while holding this will first teleport Isaac, and then reroll the enemies in the new room.']]

name: Tammy's Head
description: Shoots 10 tears in a circle around Isaac, which retain the [[Damage]], [[Shot Speed]], and special [[effects]] (such as [[poison]]) of Isaac's tears.
effects: [['Shoots 10 tears in a circle around Isaac.'], ["The tears retain the [[Shot Speed]] and special [[effects]] (such as [[Effects#Poison|poison]]) of Isaac's tears."], ["Each tear will do Isaac's current damage and a flat +25 damage bonus on top."]]
synergies: [['{{c|Azazel}} / {{i|Brimstone}}: Isaac will fire Brimstone lasers in all directions. {{dlc|nr}} Each laser is given bonus damage.', ['This will deal a substantial amount of damage near the center of the effect due to how lasers overlap the closer you get to Isaac.']], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Shoots 20 tears in a circle around Isaac.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: The size and damage of tears shot depends on how far Chocolate Milk is charged.'], ["{{c|Tainted Azazel}}: Although Tainted Azazel's Brimstone beams do not have a damage bonus, they also do not have the normal damage penalty and still deal double damage to enemies that have been sneezed on."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Ipecac}}: Tears are replaced by bombs or exploding shots, which may result in self-damage.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Fires only normal tears.'], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: The tears quickly lose their outward momentum and can now be controlled all at once, making it easy to make the tears hit enemies.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The tears are replaced with knives that deal double Isaac's damage, but move very quickly, have a small hitbox, and don't return to Isaac."], ['{{i|Trisagion|r}}: Trisagion blasts, like Brimstone beams, do not get a damage bonus.']]

name: Anti-Gravity
description: Tears float in position until firing ceases, after which they will fly off in the direction they were shot in. {{dlc|nr}} -2 Tear Delay. {{dlc|r}} +1 Fire Rate.
effects: [['Holding the fire buttons causes tears to hover in midair. When released, the tears will all shoot in the direction they were originally fired.', ['If the fire buttons are not released, the tears will fire on their own after 3 seconds.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|2|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.0 [[fire rate]].']]
notes: [["Gravitational effects, such as {{E|Mega Fatty}}'s inhalation or a {{E|Gaping Maw}} will pull floating tears toward them."], ['The [[range]] attribute only affects the lifespan of the tears after they have been released.'], ["Hovering tears can damage monsters like {{E|Knight}}s or {{E|Mask of Infamy}} from the front, even if they don't have the [[piercing tears|piercing effect]]."]]
synergies: [['{{I|C Section}}: Fetuses stand in place while the fire button is held. They will still home on enemies in this state. Fetuses attacking this way deal more damage.']]
interactions: [["{{c|Azazel}} / {{i|Brimstone}}: A red mist expands and then contracts, doing contact damage to any enemy that touches it. It then fires the original Brimstone shot before disappearing. It allows a new shot to be charged up immediately after firing without interrupting the first shot. It does not increase the range of Azazel's Brimstone beam.", ["{{dlc|nr}} '''Brimstone''' + {{Transformation|Conjoined}}: Fires a single laser instead of a triple laser.", "'''Brimstone''' + {{i|Soy Milk}}: Brimstone continues firing from the position it was fired."]], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: Continues to hover in the air while the fire button is pressed after launching it."], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Overrides Anti-Gravity.', ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}} + {{i|Soy Milk}}: Tears are released immediately, despite not charging.']], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|Haemolacria}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Burst tears will not hover even if a fire button is held."], ["{{i|Cursed Eye}} / {{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}} / {{i|Eye of the Occult}} / {{i|The Ludovico Technique}} / {{i|Marked}} / {{i|Mom's Knife}} / {{i|Monstro's Lung}} / {{i|Tech X}}: Only tear delay down applies."], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: No effect; -2 tears delay does not stack.'], ['{{i|Euthanasia}}: If a needle tear destroys an enemy and the fire button is held, the burst needles will hover until the button is released.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: When the Kidney Stone effect is activated, the tear barrage will hover until released. The stone will not hover and will travel regardless.', ["{{dlc|r}}: ('''Not recommended''') The anti-gravity effect stays in place for the whole duration of the tear barrage even if the fire button isn't held resulting in a complete loss of control of fire for as long as the barrage is active."]], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Despite the visual increase in size, damage still only increases based on the distance traveled.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Tears no longer increase in size while hovering.']], ['{{i|Multidimensional Baby}}: Multidimensional Baby will travel the same path as the Anti-Gravity tears, easily doubling any stationary shots. Any moving tears that hit it will produce a normal moving copy, however stationary tears will spawn a copy that will eventually fall to the ground even after the direction is released.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Stationary duplicated tears will release normally.']], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Combines both effects. Tears no longer hover in place; instead, they will weakly home in on Isaac like he is a pivot point, following as he moves. Releasing the attack buttons will launch the tears from their position as usual.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Notched Axe}}: Melee attacks will generate a hovering tear in the shape of the swing of the pickaxe.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology}}: Only tear delay down applies.', ['{{dlc|r}} Creates floating laser balls that will all fire simultaneously when the fire button is released.']]]

name: Latch Key
description: Grants 1 {{E|Soul Heart}} and +1 [[luck]]. Spawns 2 {{E|Key}}s.
effects: [['Grants 1 {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['+1 [[luck]].'], ['Spawns 2 {{E|Key}}s.']]
notes: [['There is a chance a {{E|Golden Key}} gets spawned instead of regular Keys.']]

name: Fire Mind
description: Grants flaming tears that deal [[burn]]ing damage over time. Tears have a chance to explode on impact with an enemy, which creates a fire at the location of the explosion.
notes: [['The explosion effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 13 luck.'], ['An exploding tear does not set either the hit enemy or anything in the blast range on fire.'], ["Explosive and burning damage is equal to Isaac's current damage stat."], ['The flame will transform {{E|Hopper}}s into {{E|Flaming Hopper}}s.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Fire Mind it turns into a burning locust that sets enemies on fire but does not explode.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{I|Haemolacria}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Each fractal tear has its own chance to explode. However, if the main tear explodes, all fractal tears explode."], ["{{dlc|na}} {{i|Death's Touch}}: Adds burn damage to the scythes, but will not cause explosions."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: All Dr. Fetus bombs will leave a flame behind after exploding, similar to the effect of {{I|Hot Bombs}}.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The missile will leave behind a fire.'], ["{{i|Finger!}}: Finger familiar can set enemies on fire but won't cause explosions."], ['{{i|Godhead}}: The damaging aura can cause explosions.'], ['{{i|Host Hat}}/{{i|Pyromaniac}}: Makes Isaac immune to explosions caused by flaming tears.'], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: Sparks can set enemies on fire but won't explode."], ["{{i|Lost Contact}}: Tears can explode when they destroy an enemy's tear."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Tears will pierce enemies and retain the chance to self-destruct each time it hits an enemy.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears will pierce enemies without exploding, then self-destruct when they hit a wall or fall to the ground.']], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Soy Milk}}: Explosions are smaller (similar to those of {{I|Scatter Bombs|n}}) and do not reach Isaac as easily.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Adds burn damage to the beam, but will not cause explosions.'], ["{{C|The Forgotten}}: Club turns orange and burns enemies, but doesn't cause explosions."], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tears retain the ability to ignite enemies and explode. Tears will respawn at Isaac's location after the explosion."], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides the explosion chance, but the knife can still set enemies on fire."], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Overrides the explosion chance, but tears can still set enemies on fire.', ['{{dlc|a}} When the Fire Mind tear explodes, a much larger pool of creep is left behind.']], ['{{i|Sinus Infection}}: Tears will still stick to enemies, but lose the booger appearance. The booger tears will not constantly burn the enemy they are stuck to.'], ['{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Technology 2}}/{{i|Tech.5}}/{{i|Tech X}}/{{i|Technology Zero}}: Adds burn damage to the beam, but will not cause explosions.'], ["{{dlc+|a+nr}} {{i|Trisagion}}: Beams can burn enemies, but won't cause explosions.{{dlc-}}"]]

name: Iron Bar
description: Increases [[damage]] by 0.3 and adds a chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Confusion|concussive tears]], causing enemies to walk around randomly.
effects: [['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['Adds a chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Confusion|concussive tears]], causing enemies to walk around randomly.']]
notes: [['Concussive tear effect depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 100% at 27 Luck.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the confusion effect.'], ["{{dlc|r}}{{I|notched axe}}: Picking up Iron Bar will refill Notched Axe's charge bar."]]

name: A Snack
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.

name: Lost Contact
description: Isaac's tears can hit and destroy enemy projectiles. -0.16 [[shot speed]].
effects: [["Gives Isaac's tears a shield surrounding them, allowing the player to block enemy shots.", ["Isaac's shots are destroyed upon contact with an enemy's shot.", "{{dlc|ana+}} Affects familiar's tears."]], ['-0.16 [[shot speed]].']]
synergies: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Placing many tears around Isaac creates a safe zone, especially with larger tears.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Technology 2}}: Beam/laser destroys projectiles, although only during its damage tick interval. The projectiles are not instantly destroyed when they touch the beam/laser.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears will be shielded. The Parasite's split tears will not appear to have shields."], ["{{i|Eye of Belial}}: Piercing through a projectile will trigger Eye of Belial's double damage and homing effect. Belial tears will still block shots."], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{C|The Forgotten}}: Enemy shots may be reflected with melee attacks. The damage of the reflected shots depends on their size and properties, with standard enemy shots dealing 6 damage, champion and homing shots dealing 7 and explosive ones dealing 50.'], ["{{I|Jacob's Ladder|force=r}}: Destroyed tears via shot-blocking will trigger the electric arc effect."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Can block an infinite amount of enemy shots if the tear is placed on top of a monster. The projectiles that they attempt to shoot will be immediately destroyed.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife will destroy projectiles in its path without being affected."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: The tears can pass through multiple enemy projectiles. This means that one tear can hurt the enemy and block its projectiles.'], ['{{i|Polyphemus}}: Enemy shots are treated like enemies with 10 health, which are deducted from the Polyphemus tear. If it has strength remaining afterward, it will continue.'], ['{{i|Sinus Infection}}/{{I|Mucormycosis}}: Tears that stick to enemies will block shots, and will not be destroyed in the process.'], ['{{i|Soy Milk}}: The constant stream of tears will cut through any complex attack patterns with ease.\n:'], ['{{i|Almond Milk}}: The random tear effects can allow more shots to be blocked, as effects such as {{t|Ouroboros Worm}}, {{i|My Reflection}}, and {{i|Tiny Planet}} can cause tears to wander outside of the main stream of tears. However, this, in combination with the lower fire rate of Almond Milk compared to Soy Milk, makes Almond Milk slightly less effective than Soy Milk at blocking shots in the direction Isaac is shooting.'], ['{{i|Tech X|force=anr}}: The rings block enemy shots.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Beams will block shots and continue on.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs will not destroy or block shots. Stat effects apply.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Missiles will not destroy or block shots. Stat effects apply.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Fire Mind}}: Lost Contact will remove the chance to explode on impact effect.'], ["{{i|God's Flesh}}: Tears with the shrink effect do not appear to be shielded, but will still block enemy shots."], ['{{i|Godhead}}: Auras will not block shots but tears will.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Main tears will block shots but burst tears cannot.'], ["{{i|Ipecac}}: Ipecac shot will explode upon contact with an enemy's shot."], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears often block shots before they can burst; however, burst tears can also block shots.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Stone will not block shots.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Overridden by Lost Contact.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears will bounce off of enemy tears and destroy them.'], ['{{i|Tough Love}}: Teeth will not appear to be shielded but will still block enemy shots.']]

name: Dead Onion
description: Grants [[piercing tears|piercing]] and [[spectral tears|spectral]] tears. Increases tear size (without increasing [[damage]]) while greatly reducing [[range]] and [[shot speed]].
effects: [['Grants [[piercing tears|piercing]] and [[spectral tears|spectral]] tears.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} -1.5 [[range]].'], ['-0.4 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 1.5x.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.22 tear size.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Incubus}}: Does not affect shot speed or tear size, but still gives the piercing effect.', ['{{dlc|r}}: Shot speed, range, and tear size will be affected.']], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Tears will destroy enemy projectiles without being destroyed in the process.']]
interactions: [['{{C|Azazel}}: Not recommended. Range penalty is the only effect.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Not recommended. Bombs are slow to fire and will pass through enemies, making it far more difficult to hit them with explosions.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bombs also deal 2.5x Isaac's damage to enemies when passing through them."]], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Dead Onion, although stat effects apply.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Dead Onion, although stat effects apply.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Not recommended. Tear moves very slowly making it hard to kill mobile enemies.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Dead Onion."], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Fires a barrage of large tears that disappear at close range. Spectral and piercing effects make it very effective at close range."], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Not recommended. Tears will travel a very short distance before they return to Isaac and eventually disappear.'], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: Not recommended. While tears do massive damage at short range, it makes it a lot easier to be damaged by explosive enemies or enemies that do contact damage.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Edges of tears retain both piercing and spectral effects; however, the center of the tear will lose them and bounce.'], ['{{i|Sulfuric Acid}}: Not recommended. Acid Tears no longer impact objects and can no longer open Secret Rooms.', ["{{dlc|r}} Acid Tears can break objects (but still can't open doors or Secret Rooms)."]], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Technology}}: Laser size is increased.']]

name: Holy Mantle
description: Grants a shield that negates the first instance of damage taken, once per room. Does not apply to or negate self-damage ({{m|Blood Donation Machine}}s, etc).
effects: [['Grants a shield that negates the first instance of damage taken, once per room.'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} When the shield is broken, Isaac gets invincibility frames like he does when he would normally take damage, based on the damage it negated; 1 second for half a heart of damage, 2 seconds for a full heart, and 4 seconds for 2 full hearts.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Holy Mantle breaking only grants one second of invincibility frames, regardless of the damage source.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Holy Mantle won't be active when initially appearing in the starting room of a floor if it was lost in the room where Isaac left the previous floor."], ['As the shield gets restored whenever another room is entered, Holy Mantle allows {{r|Curse Room}}s to be entered and left without taking damage.'], ['Unlike every other protective effect, Holy Mantle (and similar effects) does not prevent damage from {{m|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{m|Devil Beggar}}s, and {{i|Blood Rights}}.', ['{{dlc|nr}} However, Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars can be played practically for free during the invincibility frames granted when losing the shield, by taking damage from touching a {{e|Fire Place}}, etc.']], ['Damage from {{r|Sacrifice Room}} spikes can be blocked by Holy Mantle, but no payout is rewarded.'], ['The blocked hit does not count as damage taken for related achievements and will not trigger items that activate upon taking damage, like {{i|Dead Bird}}.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{c|The Lost}} starts with this item after donating 879 coins to the {{m|Greed Donation Machine|d}}.'], ["{{dlc|r}} When Holy Mantle's shield is broken, a white cross symbol will briefly appear overlaid on top of Isaac and a smashing sound will play."], ["{{dlc|r}} While Holy Mantle is in effect, a blue cross [[File:lost hp.png|10px]] icon appears in the HUD, next to Isaac's life."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Belly Jelly}} / {{i|Host Hat}} / {{i|Infamy}} / {{i|Metal Plate}}: The chance of blocking projectiles is applied before the Holy Mantle, allowing the Holy Mantle shield to be saved.'], ['{{i|Blanket}} / {{i|Dogma}} / {{p|Holy Card}} / {{t|Wooden Cross}}: All stack with Holy Mantle, and with each other simultaneously. Holy Mantle applies last.'], ['{{t|Blind Rage}}: Doubles the invincibility frames given when damage is negated.'], ['{{i|Damocles}}: The nullified first hit does not trigger the chance of the sword falling. It will not, however, protect Isaac from the falling sword.'], ["{{i|E. Coli}} / {{i|Midas' Touch}}: On-contact effect still applies to enemies if Holy Mantle negates the contact damage taken."], ["{{i|Isaac's Heart}}: The shield effect transfers to the heart."], ['{{i|Stop Watch|anr}}: If damage is blocked with Holy Mantle, Stop Watch will trigger the slow effect.']]
interactions: [['[[Bad Trip]]: Damage is blocked by Holy Mantle.'], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: An extra effect is added in the room it was found in, but only a single effect will be given in future rooms.'], ["{{i|Dull Razor|r}}: Ignores Holy Mantle's shield and works normally."], ["{{i|Glass Cannon|nr}}: Holy Mantle's effect will apply after Glass Cannon reduces Isaac's health to half a heart."], ['{{i|Holy Mantle}} / {{c|The Lost}}: An extra shield is given in the room it was found in, but the shield is removed when leaving that room and does not reapply.'], ['{{i|Sharp Plug|nr}}: Holy Mantle blocks the damage from Sharp Plug, but also prevents it from adding charges.']]

name: Headless Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac, leaving [[Creep#Red Creep|blood]] [[creep]] on the ground.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around, leaving a trail of [[red creep]] that damages enemies.', ['The creep deals 2 damage per tick or 6 damage per second to non-flying enemies.', '{{Dlc|r}} The creep deals damage much more rapidly at 20 damage per second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
synergies: [['{{t|Lost Cork}}: Creep trail size is bigger.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Familiar is bigger; however, no effect on creep damage.']]

name: Contract From Below
description: Doubles the number of most room clear awards, but reduces the overall chance of getting one by 1/3.
effects: [['Doubles any [[pickup]]s and {{E|chest}}s earned for clearing a room, but has a 1/3 chance of removing the reward completely.', ['Neither effect applies to [[trinkets]].', '{{dlc|a}} Neither effect applies to {{E|Penny|display=Pennies}} dropped in [[Greed Mode]].']]]
synergies: [['{{i|Diplopia}}: Each additional Contract increases the number of room drops by one and lowers the chance of getting nothing.'], ["{{i|Guppy's Tail}}: Higher chance of double chests upon clearing a room."], ['{{i|Deep Pockets|r}}: If Contract removes the reward, spawns 1-3 random coins.']]

name: The Pact
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants two {{E|Soul Heart}}s, +0.5 [[damage]], and +0.7 [[tears]].
{{dlc+|r}} Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s, +0.5 [[damage]], and +0.7 [[tears]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Grants two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s.'], ['+0.5 [[damage]].'], ['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]

name: Breath of Life
description: Grants a brief moment of invincibility when the charge bar hits zero. If the spacebar is held for an additional second after hitting zero, Isaac will take damage.
effects: [['Holding the active item button will gradually deplete the charge bar. As the charge gets closer to zero, Isaac turns bluer over time.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Once the invincibility takes effect, Isaac starts flashing rapidly.']], ['Gives a brief moment of invincibility when the charge bar hits zero. If the spacebar is held for an additional second after hitting zero, Isaac will take damage.', ['{{Dlc|r}} While Isaac is invincible, he deals 3.5 contact damage to enemies and beams of light will strike down enemies touching Isaac, similar to {{I|Holy Light}}, dealing 15 damage.', ['While not time based, invincibility from Breath of Life is otherwise identical to damage immunity granted by the [[Temporary Buffs|shield]] effect.']]], ["The item will recharge on its own but cannot be used again until it is fully charged (even if you didn't fully deplete the charge bar)."]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{i|Isaac's Heart|nr}}: When held down too long, Breath of Life no longer damages Isaac, resulting in infinite invincibility."], ['{{i|Void}}: Using Void with Breath of Life will immediately grant invincibility frames.']]
interactions: [['{{P|? Card}}/{{I|The Battery}}/{{I|Car Battery}}/{{I|Habit}}: No effect.']]

name: Virgo
description: Adds a chance to give a [[shield]] that nullifies all incoming damage for 10 seconds upon taking damage. Also converts bad [[pills]] into good pills.
effects: [['Grants a chance to trigger the {{i|Book of Shadows}} effect upon taking damage, creating a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 10 seconds.', ['The activation chance depends on the [[luck]] stat and goes up to 100% with 10 Luck.']], ['Converts all negative [[pill]]s into positive ones, but does not identify them.']]
notes: [['The shield negates health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.'], ['Does not prevent [[Red Heart container]] loss from {{R|Devil Room}} deals.'], ['Bad pills already obtained/dropped will be converted to their "good" counterpart.'], ['As bad pills will turn into good pills, it is possible for two different colored pills to have the same effect.']]
synergies: [['{{Dlc|r}}{{i|Celtic Cross}}, {{i|The Polaroid}}: Can trigger at the same time as Celtic Cross or The Polaroid, cumulating to up to 22 seconds of shield.']]
interactions: [['{{i|False PHD}}: Pills can be both good and bad again. Taking bad pills still applies the benefits from False PHD.']]

name: Mom's Knife
description: Isaac's tears are replaced by a knife that pierces enemies, can travel through obstacles, and can hurt enemies while Isaac is holding it. Holding down the fire button before firing increases its range and power.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced by a knife that pierces enemies and can travel through obstacles. Holding down the fire button increases its range and power."], ['The knife deals damage 20 times per second upon contact with enemies while Isaac is holding it.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} The knife deals 2x Isaac's damage while held and 6x damage at the furthest possible point of its throw distance, regardless of the actual maximum range stat."], ["{{dlc|r}} Damage dealt by the knife depends on its charge state. The knife deals 2x Isaac's damage when held and 6x damage at about 1/3 of full charge. The knife damage quickly drops to 2x Isaac's damage when returning regardless of charge state. Further charging only increases its maximum range."], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Mom's Knife is a [[special item]]."], ["{{dlc|nr}} The knife can be held and fired diagonally with frame perfect input. This can be done easily with a controller's analog stick or with {{i|Analog Stick}}."], ['{{dlc+|r}} The knife can be held and fired diagonally as if Isaac was holding {{i|Analog Stick}}.{{dlc-}}', ['The knife can be fired in any direction if using mouse controls (enabled in options.ini).']], ['The knife will not work in challenges with the [[blindfolded]] effect.']]
synergies: [['{{i|20/20}} / {{transf|Conjoined}} / {{i|The Inner Eye}} / {{i|Mutant Spider}}: Isaac holds only one, but shoots multiple knives at their typical spread.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{i|Apple!}}/{{i|Tough Love}}: The knife deals increased damage sometimes based on luck.{{dlc-}}'], ["{{i|Brimstone}} / {{i|Sulfur}}: Shooting the knife also shoots a barrage of knives that goes across the screen, with each knife doing 80% ({{dlc|r}}2x) of Isaac's damage; the extra knives do not return. The longer the charge, the more knives are added. This effect does not work with {{c|Azazel}}'s default mini brimstone. The brimstone-knives do not benefit from {{i|A Lump of Coal}}."], ['{{i|Compound Fracture|r}}: The knife creates bone shards while in contact with an enemy.'], ['{{i|C Section}}: Fetuses hold small knives that spin around them slowly, causing extra damage.'], ["{{i|Diplopia}}/{{i|Crooked Penny}}: Each additional copy of the item will grant an extra knife that fires slightly diagonally from the original one, up to a maximum of 16. Picking up more than 16 knives won't fire more knives but will still modify the angle at which they're shot."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus|a}}: Each explosion shoots 10 knives in a circle from the point of impact.'], ['{{i|Euthanasia|r}}: The knife sometimes deals higher damage, but instant kill ability is overridden.'], ['{{i|Explosivo|r}}: Regular explosive tears may stick to enemies in contact with the knife.'], ["{{i|Eye Sore}}: Will occasionally release 1-3 extra knives when shooting Mom's knife."], ['{{i|Fire Mind}}: Still applies burning but no longer explodes.'], ["{{i|Flat Stone}}: Knife bounces as it flies away from Isaac, each bounce splash causing Isaac's tear damage."], ["{{i|Fruit Cake}}: The benefits of fruit cake still occur but are short lived due to the high damage of Mom's knife."], ["{{dlc|a+}} {{c|The Forgotten}}: +4 damage. The knife will attach to The Forgotten's bone club, forming a scythe. Increases the size of both the melee swing and the bone throw, and allows a single melee swing to deal damage to an enemy twice instead of just once."], ['{{i|Ghost Pepper|a+nr}}: The flames can shoot from Isaac while holding the fire button.', ['{{dlc|r}} The flames only shoot when fire button is released.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{transf|Guppy}}: Knife hits will rarely spawn a blue fly.', ['{{dlc|r}} Knife hits will frequently\xa0spawn a blue fly.']], ['{{i|Holy Light|a+}}: Holy Light can trigger on both held and thrown knives.'], ["{{i|Ipecac|na+r}}: Knife turns green and poison monsters that hit it. Removes Ipecac's damage increase.", ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Also adds +4 damage.', '{{dlc|r}} Adds +2 damage and the knife explodes on contact, once per throw. Will not explode while held without throwing and while coming back to the Player after being thrown.']], ['[[Invulnerability]]: Even though the knife cannot be fired, the knife will deal damage while Isaac is invincible.'], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder|r}}: The knife will sometimes generate sparks when hitting an enemy."], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: The knife will block bullets, even when held (similar to {{i|Trinity Shield}} but has a smaller blocking area).'], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Isaac controls a floating knife that does 2x Isaac's damage. Tears stat is ignored and damage is dealt at a rate equivalent of 5 tear delay.", ["'''The Ludovico Technique''' + '''any multi-shot item''': Isaac controls a floating knife surrounded by additional rotating knives.", "'''The Ludovico Technique''' + '''Lost Contact''': Floating knife loses almost all ability to block bullets, with a tiny area around the hilt that can stop shots.", "'''The Ludovico Technique''' + {{i|Loki's Horns}}: Loses Loki's Horns effect; Isaac controls only one floating knife.", "'''The Ludovico Technique''' + {{i|Brimstone}}: Mom's Knife overrides Brimstone leaving only the floating knife."]], ['{{i|Marked|r}}: The knife fires in the direction of the crosshair, charging automatically, with charging time proportionate to the distance of the crosshair from Isaac.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung|a}}: Firing a knife causes several other knives to shoot out in random directions."], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid|a+}}: The knife leaves creep trails while fired.'], ['{{i|The Parasite|r}}: The knife fires two knives in perpendicular directions from the first point of contact with an enemy. Additional knives can also fire more knives themselves.'], ['{{i|Proptosis|nr}}: The Knife deals double damage regardless of range.', ['{{dlc|r}} The Knife deals triple damage regardless of range.']], ['{{i|Strange Attractor}}: Enemies are pulled towards the knife. The effect is minor while not firing and much stronger while the knife is launched.'], ["{{i|Tammy's Head}}: Fires 10 knives in a circle around Isaac, dealing massive damage."], ['{{c|Tainted Lilith|r}}: Her familiar will carry the knife. When firing once, Gello will not return back to Lilith, instead hanging around stationary. She can drag him around the room and the knife will still deal damage. Pressing any fire button again will whip out Gello, just as normal.'], ['{{i|Technology|a+nr}} Both the knife and the laser fire normally.', ["{{dlc|r}} There is a connecting laser between Isaac and the knife, similar to {{c|The Forgotten}}'s club throw."]], ['{{i|Tech X|naa+nr}}: Both fire normally.', ["{{dlc|r}} The knife is fired with a Tech X ring around it, similarly to {{c|The Forgotten}}'s club throw."]]]
interactions: [["{{c|Azazel}}'s default attack"], ['{{i|Cursed Eye}}'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus|nar}}', ['{{dlc|anr}} Both the knife and the bombs fire normally.']], ['{{i|Euthanasia|a+nr}}'], ['{{i|Explosivo|anr}}'], ['{{i|Eye of Belial}}'], ['{{i|Haemolacria|r}}'], ['{{i|Holy Light|ana+}}'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}, only changes knife color'], ['{{i|Pop!}}'], ['{{i|Pupula Duplex}}'], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder|a+nr}}"], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung|na}}"], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid|na+}}'], ['{{i|The Parasite|nr}}, only changes knife color'], ['{{i|Parasitoid}}'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}'], ['{{i|Sinus Infection|a+}}'], ["{{c|Tainted Azazel|r}}'s default attack"], ['{{i|Technology|na+}}'], ['{{i|Tech X|ana+}}'], ['{{i|Tough Love|a+nr}}'], ["{{i|Trisagion}}\nOnly stat effects are applied; otherwise overridden by Mom's Knife:"], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}'], ['{{i|Apple!|a+nr}}'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture|a+nr}}'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}"], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}'], ['{{i|Marked|anr}}'], ['{{i|My Reflection}}'], ['{{i|Sulfuric Acid|a+nr}} \nOther interactions:']]

name: Thunder Thighs
quote: HP up + speed down + you feel stompy
description: Destroys [[rocks]] upon contact with Isaac. Adds one [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]] and lowers [[Speed]].
effects: [['+1 [[Red Heart container]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}'], ['-0.4 [[speed]] down.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed.']], ['Isaac gains the ability to destroy [[obstacle]]s by walking into them.']]
notes: [['Holes in the ground can be filled if Isaac walks into adjacent [[rocks]] from the right direction, similar to bombs.'], ['Avoid walking over [[Mushroom (Obstacle)|Mushrooms]] and [[Bomb Rock]]s, as they can damage Isaac upon destruction.'], ['With this item, Isaac can walk over and destroy {{E|Red Poop}} without taking damage.'], ['Walking over an [[Angel]] Statue in the {{R|Angel Room}} will trigger the boss fight, and Isaac will take damage as the Angel spawns on top of him.']]

name: Sacred Heart
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Adds a Red [[Heart Container]]. Grants [[homing tears]], a x2.3 [[Damage]] multiplier, +1 flat Damage, -0.4 [[Tears]], -0.25 [[Shot Speed]], and +4.125 [[Range]].
{{dlc+|r}} Adds a Red [[Heart Container]]. Grants [[homing tears]], a x2.3 [[Damage]] multiplier, +1 flat Damage, -0.4 [[Tears]], and -0.25 [[Shot Speed]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['Grants one [[Red Heart Container]] and replenishes all health.'], ['x2.3 damage multiplier.'], ['+1 flat [[Damage]].'], ['-0.4 [[tears]].'], ['-0.25 [[Shot Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.75 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +4.125 [[range]].'], ['Grants [[homing tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Grants homing bombs (the effect of {{i|Bobby-Bomb}}).'], ['{{dlc|+r}}{{transf|Seraphim|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Sacred Heart is a [[special item]].'], ['Sacred Heart has the highest damage multiplier of all passive items.'], ['The flat damage gained by Sacred Heart is not affected by its damage multiplier. However, other flat damage upgrades (such as those gained by {{t|Curved Horn}} or {{i|Void}}) will be affected normally.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Although Sacred Heart increases range, the reduction of shot speed results in a slight decrease in effective range, not accounting for homing.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Sacred Heart}}: Picking up multiple copies of the item will only result in acquiring additional heart containers, while decreasing fire rate and shot speed.'], ['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: On pickup, grants 12 blood charges.']]

name: Safety Pin
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}, +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}, +1.5 [[range]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].
effects: [['Grants 1 {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['+0.16 [[shot speed]].']]
synergies: [['{{T|Black Feather}}: Grants a damage boost.']]

name: My Little Unicorn
description: Gives [[invulnerability]] and +0.28 [[speed]] for six seconds, removing the ability to shoot tears and replacing it with the ability to deal 40 contact damage to enemies.
