effects: [['Gives [[invulnerability]] and +0.28 [[speed]] for six seconds, removing the ability to shoot tears and replacing it with the ability to deal contact damage to enemies.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Isaac deals 40 contact damage to enemies, once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Isaac deals 20 contact damage to enemies, twice per second.', ['If an enemy is at 40 HP or less, the contact damage is increased to 40 for that enemy.']]]]
notes: [['The invulnerability effect negates all forms of damage, including health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.'], ['Does not prevent [[Heart Container]] loss from [[Health Down]] [[pills]] or [[Devil Room|Devil Deals]].'], ['Ending the current run via opening the end chest while My Little Unicorn is active will cause the credits and main menu music to be sped up. The effect ends upon restarting the game or starting a new run.'], ['{{P|VII - The Chariot}} card provides the same effect of this item when used.']]
synergies: [['{{i|4.5 Volt}}: With some damage source while this item is active, it can be permanently invulnerable inside the room while you have enemies.', ['If combined with {{I|9 Volt}}, it will be easier to achieve invincibility.']], ["{{i|???'s Only Friend}}: The fly can still be controlled while invincible."], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Doubles the duration of invulnerability.'], ["{{I|Mom's Knife}} does contact damage in the same direction it was being held at the time of using it, giving a massive amount of free damage by ramming into an enemy.", ['If you have the [[Yes Mother?]] Transformation, you can basically do the same thing using this item.']], ['On contact items ({{i|Aries}}, {{i|The Virus}}, etc.): Freely usable in basically every 4 rooms.', ['[[Orbital Familiar]]s ({{i|Cube of Meat}}, {{i|Sacrificial Dagger}}, etc.): The orbital can be used freely in basically every 4 rooms, making it a great alternative source of damage.']]]

name: Mom's Perfume
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[Fear|fear tears]]. {{dlc|nr}} Decreases [[tear delay]] by 1. {{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].
effects: [['Adds a chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Effects|fear tears]], causing enemies to run away from the player.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|1|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The fear effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, starting at 15% at 0 luck, reaching 100% with 85 luck.', ["{{i|Dark Matter}} is significantly better at inflicting fear than Mom's Perfume."]]]
synergies: [["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|Haemolacria}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: If the main tear causes fear, the split tears cause fear too."], ['{{I|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the fear effect.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: If a fear tear is fed, all burst tears cause fear. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears cannot cause fear.'], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear flickers yellow, capable of inflicting fear when it does.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Abaddon}}: The chance to inflict fear does not stack.'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} '''Mom's Perfume''': Tear delay down does not stack."]]

name: The Nail
description:
{{dlc+|nr}} Gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}. For the current room; +0.7 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]], Isaac breaks [[rock]]s and deals contact damage.{{dlc-}}
{{dlc+|r}} Gives half a {{e|Black Heart}}. For the current room; +2 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]], Isaac breaks [[rock]]s and deals contact damage.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}, +0.7 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]], and the ability to destroy most [[obstacle]]s by walking into them. Cannot be stacked in one room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Gives half a {{e|Black Heart}}, +2 [[damage]], -0.18 [[speed]] and the ability to destroy obstacles for the current room.', ['If used multiple times in one room, the speed penalty only applies once, but the damage buff can stack. Each subsequent damage buff becomes less effective for each use']], ['Allows Isaac to deal 40 contact damage to enemies for the current room. Does not prevent Isaac from taking contact damage. It can be applied only once per second per enemy.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Isaac's tears become red for the current room."], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [["Isaac makes a demon sound when taking damage while this item is in use. This is quieter than Isaac's standard damage sound and is easy to miss."]]

name: There's Options
description: Two items appear after defeating a [[Boss]]. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.
effects: [['Two items appear after defeating a [[Boss]]. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.']]
notes: [['If the boss has a fixed item drop such as [[The Harbingers]], the other item will be selected from the normal [[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss item pool]].'], ['Two items appear after clearing {{r|Boss Rush}}.'], ['Both items that appear after defeating a Boss in {{s|The Void}} are from random item pools. Likewise, both items that appear after defeating {{E|The Fallen}} are [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room items]].'], ['There is no effect on items dropped by [[All Mini-Bosses (Bosses)|Mini-Bosses]].'], ['There is no effect on what appears after defeating {{E|Mom}}, even if {{i|The Polaroid}} / {{i|The Negative}} have not unlocked (in which case only 1 [[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss item]] will appear).'], ['Does not retroactively effect {{r|Boss Room}}s that had already been cleared prior to picking it up.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|r}} {{i|Crooked Penny}} / {{i|Diplopia}}: Both items are copied, allowing Isaac to take both copied items without the other disappearing. The original pedestals will function as normal, removing the other if one is collected.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Jacob and Esau}}: Both brothers can take one item each if they are lined up properly.'], ['{{i|Satanic Bible|r}}: Both items will be [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room items]]; only one can be bought.'], ['{{i|Vanishing Twin}}: The item which appears after defeating the copied boss is also affected.']]

name: Butt Bombs
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Bombs now cloud up the screen, briefly damaging and [[confusion|confusing]] all enemies.
effects: [['Gives the player 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ['Bombs now cloud up the screen on detonation, briefly [[confusion|confusing]] and dealing 10 damage to all enemies in the room.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Oh Crap|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|a}} Butt Bombs heal {{E|Turdlings}}, {{E|Dingle}}, {{E|Dangle}}, {{E|Brownie}} and {{E|Clog}} by 25% of their maximum HP.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The Butt Bomb effect on {{i|Dr. Fetus}} or {{i|Epic Fetus}} does not cause healing, but normal bombs still do.']]]

name: Tiny Planet
description: Massively increases [[Range]] and grants [[spectral tears]]. Tears orbit around Isaac at a fixed distance until they hit the ground.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +7 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +6.5 [[range]].'], ['Grants [[spectral tears]].'], ['Tears now revolve around Isaac at a fixed distance until they hit the ground.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The tears orbit close to Isaac, offset slightly in the direction fired. Changing the firing direction will redirect all previously fired tears.']]
notes: [['Tears will not hit directly in front of Isaac; aiming directly away from enemies is often effective.'], ['{{dlc|r}} It is possible to control the direction of Tiny Planet with the mouse. On Windows, go to {{code|C:/Users/[username]/Documents/My Games/The Binding Of Isaac [Rebirth/Afterbirth/Afterbirth+]/}} and in the options.ini file, change the line that says {{code|MouseControl{{=}}0}} to {{code|MouseControl{{=}}1}}. Unlike normal controls, the mouse allows diagonal direction.']]
synergies: [['{{i|20/20}}: Each shot fires two tears in opposing orbital directions.'], ["{{C|Azazel}}: Increases Azazel's range with Brimstone, and wraps the beam around the character."], ['{{t|Brain Worm}}: Tears will home directly towards nearby enemies in a line from the center of the orbit.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: The beam will wrap around the character and shoot straight forward.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: Tears will split into 2 close groups of 2 tears that follow the orbit. One group travels clockwise and the other travels counterclockwise."], ["{{i|Euthanasia}}: Euthanasia's tear bursts will follow the orbit in 2 close groups of 5 tears. One group travels clockwise and the other travels counterclockwise."], ['{{I|Eye of Belial|r}}: After piercing an enemy, instead of homing in on enemies, tears will continue to orbit, but each tear can pierce multiple enemies to gain more size and damage multipliers.'], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Tears will bounce and orbit around the character.'], ['{{i|Godhead}}: Tears with damaging auras orbit the character, creating a damaging barrier.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Explosive tears orbit around Isaac. {{i|Host Hat}} or {{i|Pyromaniac}} is highly recommended.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: The stone and barrage of tears that follow orbit the character.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears will orbit until they are behind the character. Tears will burst into 8 tears that follow the orbit in 2 close groups of 4. One group travels clockwise and the other travels counterclockwise.'], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}}: Effectively grants a great tear multiplier, as the extra tears from Loki's Horns will follow the trajectory given by the Tiny Planet."], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Shielded tears will orbit Isaac, granting a partially successful 360-degree projectile protection around him. Works better with a faster fire rate.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: This item drastically increases the screen time of tears because it makes them orbit around Isaac for a few seconds. A Lump Of Coal adds a lot of damage to tears in "outer orbit".', ['the tears do not fall during the beast fight allowing tears to grow bigger and bigger']], ["{{i|Marked}}: Isaac will continuously fire orbiting tears, which allows him to not touch the attack keys and focus just on moving (with giant tears it makes it hard to see as he can't stop firing)."], ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Increases range. Causes Mom's knife to orbit around Isaac at very high speeds until it reaching it's maximum range, where it will circle back to Isaac at the same speed."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|My Reflection}}: After reaching their maximum range, the tears will circle back around to Isaac.'], ['{{i|Revelation}}: The beam of light wraps around Isaac and shoots forward at a slight angle, similar to Brimstone.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears bounce off enemies then keep orbiting Isaac. Very powerful as the tears are not destroyed upon damaging an enemy. When near walls, the orbiting tears tend to get stuck against the walls until Isaac moves away.'], ["{{i|Spirit Sword|r}}: The sword's melee attack becomes disjointed from Isaac, hitting in an increased range in front of him but creating a blind spot where the strike used to be. Spin attacks also occur in front of Isaac instead of around him. Sword projectiles orbit around Isaac as normal."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Lilith}}: Tears orbit around the {{I|Gello}} instead of the character.'], ["{{i|Technology}}: A laser creates a circle around Isaac's body before being fired forward normally. The laser becomes spectral.", ["{{dlc|a}} '''Technology''' + {{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The extra distance covered by the laser more than doubles damage right in front of Isaac, and it increases as normal further away."]], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Creates moving laser fields that orbit the character.'], ['{{i|Varicose Veins}}: The ten tears that are fired when the character is hit orbit them closely.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: The thrown bomb orbits around Isaac, making it hard to predict where it will land."], ['{{i|C Section}}: Fetuses will rotate around Isaac, but still home in on enemies.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: The bombs orbit Isaac, exploding just barely far enough to cause no damage assuming he stays motionless.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Tiny Planet.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Fired tears orbit around Isaac, but burst tears do not.'], ['{{t|Hook Worm}}: Has no effect.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear orbits around Isaac, however, the orbit can be grown or shrunken, sped up or slowed down by using the firing keys.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: This item removes the extra tear falling speed bonus, causing the burst of tears to circle and land behind the player after only being airborne for a short time.", ["{{dlc|r}} Range isn't as significantly reduced."]], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Tears will move to maintain their orbital positions around Isaac as he moves, making aiming much easier.'], ['{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears only split when hitting objects and enemies.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears tend to clump together behind the character and then disappear after a few seconds.'], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: At base damage, tears disappear after half an orbit.'], ["{{t|Ring Worm}}: Every single tear spins uncontrollably fast, making aiming incredibly difficult. However, with large shots (Death's Touch with high damage, for instance) this combo can fill the entire screen with projectiles almost immediately."], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: Tears made by Sprinkler will follow Isaac'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Tiny Planet.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Overrides Tiny Planet but keeps the large range increase.', ["'''Tractor Beam''' + {{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears will travel along the beam until they hit a wall and then orbit Isaac.", "'''Tractor Beam''' + {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Tractor Beam is ignored and plain Dr. Fetus interaction applies."]], ['{{t|Wiggle Worm}}: The tear forcefully orbits while spiraling. The orbit amplifies the wiggle.']]

name: Yum Heart
description: Restores one full {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Restores one full {{e|Red Heart}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When playing in co-op, all other players will be healed for a {{e|Half Red Heart}}.']]
notes: [['{{c|Magdalene}} / {{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Magdalene}} starts with this item by default.'], ['This item can drop from {{E|Super Lust}}.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Doubles the amount Yum Heart heals.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Jacob and Esau}}: Regardless of who holds this item, each heal half a Red Heart.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{c|Keeper}} / {{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Keeper}}: Heals one [[Health#Coin_Hearts|Coin Hearts]]; no [[blue fly]] is generated.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Sharp Plug}} + {{i|The Wafer}} / {{i|Cancer}}: Allows infinite Red Heart regeneration.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Magdalene}}: Heals two Red Hearts upon each usage.', ['{{c|Tainted Magdalene}} + {{i|Sharp Plug}}: Allows infinite usage and infinite invincibility frames.']]]
interactions: [["{{i|Maggy's Bow}}: No effect; will still only replenish one full Red Heart."]]

name: Lemon Mishap
description: Creates a tiny pool of [[Creep#Yellow Creep|yellow creep]], damaging enemies that cross it.
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{T|Lost Cork}}: Doubles puddle size.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Pisces
description:
{{dlc|nr}} -1 Tear Delay, adds [[knock-back]] shots and increases tear size.
{{dlc|r}} +0.5 Fire Rate, adds [[knock-back]] shots and increases tear size.
effects: [['Increases [[Knock-back|tear knockback]].', ['If the player has [[piercing tears]], the knockback effect is reduced.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 1.25x.', ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.12 tear size.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|1|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].']]
interactions: [['{{t|Blister}}: Overrides Pisces.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: The beam gains knockback.'], ["{{I|Cupid's Arrow}}/{{i|Death's Touch}}/{{i|Dead Onion}}/{{i|Sagittarius}}: Tears gain knockback."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|Ipecac}}: Explosions also gain increased knockback.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife gains knockback."], ['{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Technology 2}}/{{i|Tech X}}: The lasers gain knockback.', ["Technology 2's constant laser has such strong knockback, it can pin enemies to walls."]], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Adds knockback to blasts, which can not only significantly repel enemies when used correctly, it can deal a high amount of damage to enemies unable to escape the knockback.']]

name: My Reflection
description: Gives Isaac's tears a boomerang effect. {{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[range]], +1 [[tear falling speed]], x1.6 [[shot speed]] multiplier. {{dlc|r}} 1.6x+1.5 [[range]] and a 1.6x [[shot speed]] multiplier.
effects: [["Isaac's tears travel a short distance, then reverse direction and return to Isaac.", ['The tears are constantly pulled towards Isaac; if Isaac moves after shooting, the tears will always return to him.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} 1.6x+1.5 [[range]].'], ['1.6x [[shot speed]] multiplier.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[tear falling speed]].']]
interactions: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: The tears will slowly move towards Isaac instead of remaining stationary. Releasing the fire button will launch the tears as usual.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides My Reflection.', ["{{dlc|a}} Makes the beam curve when moving. It has the same effect on Azazel's mini-brimstone and doubles the range.", '{{dlc|r}} The laser makes a thin loop in front of Isaac, and fires the normal laser backwards.']], ['{{i|Continuum}}: If tears cross the border of the room, they will move towards Isaac from their new position rather than crossing back across the border.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|The Parasite}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}: Split tears will move towards Isaac."], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: '''Not recommended.''' The bombs will slide back towards Isaac after having reached a certain distance.", ['When combined with {{i|Rocket In A Jar}}, the rockets will not explode unless they hit an obstacle or enemy, making this much safer.']], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides My Reflection.'], ['{{i|Euthanasia}}: Needles from Euthanasia bursts will move towards Isaac.'], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Tears bounce away from and then back towards Isaac. However, unless you have range ups, this generally results in tears slowing down then dissipating rather than actually returning.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Range becomes extremely high, making Haemolacria tears follow Isaac for a long time before hitting the ground. Burst tears do not have a boomerang effect.'], ["{{i|Ipecac}}: '''Not recommended.''' The explosive tears will begin flying back towards Isaac after having reached a certain distance."], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears will move towards Isaac and can still be fed and burst. The bursted tears will also move towards Isaac.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The tears increase in damage as they are pulled towards Isaac.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear will slowly move towards Isaac, and the shot speed increase allows the tear to be moved much faster.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: No effect, as the knife already has this effect."], ["{{i|Montezuma's Revenge}}: Causes the beam range behind Isaac to become significantly increased as well as having a short range similar to Azazel's beam in front of him. This greatly eases the use of this item allowing for high DPS."], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: No further stat changes.'], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Despite the piercing effect, tears cannot damage the same enemy multiple times.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears can still bounce off of each other but will try to return to Isaac.'], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: At base tear size, tears disappear before they can return to Isaac.'], ['{{i|Pupula Duplex|r}}: Tears will spin like boomerangs, the effect is purely cosmetic.'], ['{{i|Revelation}}: The laser makes a thin loop in front of Isaac, and fires the normal laser backwards.'], ["{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Isaac's tears will continually be pulled towards him, effectively reducing the chances that tears will bounce."], ['{{i|Spoon Bender}}: If tears are close enough to an enemy, it will home in and damage them. If not, they will return to Isaac.'], ["{{i|Strange Attractor}}: '''Not recommended.''' While it may make it easier to hit enemies, it also makes it much easier for them to be attracted to Isaac, surrounding him."], ['{{i|Technology}}: Overrides My Reflection.', ['{{dlc|nr}}Makes the beam curve when moving.', '{{dlc|r}} The laser makes a thin loop in front of Isaac, and fires the normal laser backwards.']], ['{{i|Technology 2}} / {{i|Tech.5}}', ['{{dlc|nr}}Tears return to character and the beams curve when moving.', '{{dlc|r}} The laser makes a thin loop in front of Isaac, and fires the normal laser backwards.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Stat effects of My Reflection remain but the boomerang effect does not.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The orbital tears will move faster to stay in orbit around Isaac, making aiming easier.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Makes the beams much longer as they move away from and then back towards Isaac.'], ["{{t|Whip Worm}}: Further increases shot speed, making Isaac's tears travel much farther forward before returning to Isaac."]]

name: Technology
description: Replaces tears with a [[Piercing tears|piercing]] laser with unlimited range.
effects: [["Replaces tears with a laser beam with unlimited range and [[Piercing tears|piercing]]. The laser is fired from Isaac's left eye."]]
notes: [['Laser rate of fire is determined by the [[tears]] stat. This differentiates the item from {{i|Technology 2}} which fires a continuous beam, and {{i|Tech.5}} which has a random fire rate.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Laser size scales with tear size.', ['{{dlc|r}} The sound emitted by the laser will also change depending on its size. This is purely aesthetic.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Lasers are affected by momentum, allowing them to be shot diagonally if fired while Isaac is moving.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When directly adjacent to a wall or [[Obstacles|obstacle]] and firing in the wrong direction the obstacle may block the laser, preventing it from damaging enemies. This can happen on all sides of a given [[Rooms|room]] with the exception of the bottom wall.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Fires arcing Haemolacria tears that release Technology lasers in all directions upon impact.'], ['{{i|Apple!}} / {{i|Tough Love}}: The lasers can gain the damage multiplier from each of the items, although there is no visual difference.'], ['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Technology.', ["{{dlc|a}} The Technology laser coils around the Brimstone beam, granting a 1.5x damage multiplier, which can stack with other multipliers such as {{I|Magic Mushroom}}[[Magic Mushroom|'s]] 1.5x damage multiplier.", ["{{Dlc|r}} Technology's damage multiplier will be overridden if Isaac has the powered up version (from picking up Brimstone twice or using {{I|Sulfur}} with Brimstone)."]]], ['{{dlc|a}} {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Fires lasers in all directions upon impact of a missile.'], ['{{i|Fire Mind}}: Laser lights enemies on fire but loses the ability to explode enemies.'], ['{{i|The Inner Eye}} / {{i|Mutant Spider}}: Isaac shoots multiple lasers with a decreased rate of fire.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Lachryphagy}}: Isaac shoots a short-range laser that will form a Lachryphagy tear, which has piercing.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The laser becomes a large ring that is controllable and looks like a {{i|Tech X}} shot. Enemies inside the ring without touching it are not hurt. The shot speed is ignored. The Tears stat is ignored and the damage is dealt very rapidly at a rate equivalent to a 2 tear delay.'], ["{{i|Mom's Eye}}: Fires a laser from the back of Isaac's head as well as the front."], ["{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Several additional lasers fire in random directions. (One beam will always fire straight forward as normal.)", ['{{dlc|r}} Fires a barrage of small lasers.']], ['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Proptosis}}: Doubles damage.', ['{{dlc|a}} Doubles damage but it rapidly decreases with distance, down to 0.1 from about 6 tiles away.']], ['{{i|Soy Milk}}: Expected high damage down and very high tears up.  Because Technology has no knockback like standard tears, this will generally be a good DPS increase.'], ['{{i|Tech X|force=anr}}: Both fire at the same time.'], ['{{i|Technology|r}}: Adds an additional laser for every extra copy of the item up to a maximum of 16, with no downgrade to damage or tears.'], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: Both fire at the same time. Tear rate down from Technology 2 applies.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Laser circles around Isaac and then continues its path forward in a straight line. The laser is also spectral.', ['{{dlc|a}} {{i|Tiny Planet}} + {{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The extra distance covered by the laser more than doubles damage right in front of Isaac, and it increases as normal further away.']]]
interactions: [['{{dlc|na}} {{i|20/20}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|a}} Shoot 2 lasers.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Tears up, but no Anti-Gravity effect.', ['{{dlc|r}} Create laser balls that fire technology lasers when released.']], ["{{dlc|na}} {{C|Azazel}}: Overrides Azazel's Brimstone.", ['{{dlc|a}} Technology laser wraps around the Brimstone beam, dealing extra damage, but not increasing Brimstone range.']], ['{{i|Blood Clot}} / {{I|Chemical Peel}} / {{I|The Peeper}}: 50% chance to apply the flat damage up/damage increase with each shot.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Lasers can't be charged, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%.", ['{{dlc|r}} The laser can be charged, increasing its size and damage.']], ['{{i|Continuum|force=anr}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|r}} Technology lasers wrap around the screen with the Continuum effect with momentum retained.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Cursed Eye}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|r}} Charges a barrage of 5 lasers.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Cricket's Body}}: Tear delay down as expected, but no benefit from the splash effect.", ['{{dlc|r}} Releases a 4-way spread of tears whenever the laser hits a wall or an enemy.']], ['{{i|Dead Eye}}: Prior to picking up Technology, the damage multiplier is preserved to where its at, and missing shots will not remove it.  Saving and quitting the game will remove the multiplier. Picking Dead Eye after Technology has no effect.'], ["{{i|Death's Touch}}: Overridden by Technology, but still gain damage."], ['{{dlc|nar}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Technology.', ['{{dlc|anr}} Fires lasers in addition to bombs.']], ['{{i|Euthanasia}}: The lasers can gain the damage multiplier from Euthanasia although there is no visual difference. {{dlc|nr}} Euthanasia loses its instant kill ability, however.'], ['{{I|Flat Stone}}: Overridden by Technology.'], ['{{t|Flat Worm}} / {{t|Pulse Worm}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Godhead}}: [[Homing tears|Homing]] laser, but the halo is lost.'], ['{{dlc+|anr}} {{i|Head of the Keeper}}: Overridden by Technology.{{dlc-}}', ['{{dlc|r}} The laser is recolored to a bright yellow-orange and keeps the chance to drop coins when hitting enemies.']], ['{{dlc+|anr}} {{i|Holy Light}}: Holy Light shots will not activate.{{dlc-}}', ['{{dlc|r}} Holy Light shots have a chance to activate on hit as expected.']], ['{{t|Hook Worm}}: Laser follows a square wave, which increases its hitbox.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Laser poisons targets.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Additionally, gives a flat +4 damage.', '{{dlc|r}} Laser explodes on contact.']], ["{{dlc+|a+nr}} {{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: Overridden by Technology.{{dlc-}}", ['{{dlc|r}} Fires electricity normally.']], ['{{dlc|na}} {{i|A Lump of Coal}}: No effect.', ['{{dlc|a}} Damage increases the further away the enemy is, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance. This allows for a huge damage increase from longer distances.']], ["{{dlc|na}} {{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Technology.", ['{{dlc|anr}} Both fire normally.', ["When playing as {{C|Lilith}}, Mom's Knife overrides Technology."], "{{Dlc|r}}The tip of Mom's Knife connects to isaac's body with a laser when launched. This effect is similar to that of {{I|Technology Zero}}", "'''Mom's Knife''' + {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The laser ring becomes centered on Isaac and cannot be controlled, and the knife can not be fired. This makes some rooms impossible to do without a [[familiar]]."]], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|a}} Makes the beam curve the opposite direction while Isaac is moving sideways.']], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|a}} The laser spawns pools of liquid always when it hits obstacles and occasionally on enemies.']], ['{{i|Neptunus}}: Overridden by Technology.'], ["{{i|Number One}}: Expected tears up and the laser's color turns yellow."], ['{{t|Ouroboros Worm}}: No effect on laser.', ['{{dlc|r}} Works as intended.']], ['{{i|Pupula Duplex}}: Laser becomes spectral.', ['{{dlc|r}} Laser beams are thicker in terms of width.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|The Parasite}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|r}} Laser splits into two perpendicular beams upon hitting an obstacle.']], ['{{i|Parasitoid}}: Overridden by Technology.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{T|Ring Worm}}: No effect.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Laser wraps around itself multiple times, effectively increasing hitbox.']], ['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Rubber Cement}}: Overridden by Technology.', ['{{dlc|a}} Lasers bounce off of walls.']], ['{{i|Tractor Beam|force=anr}}: No effect.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Lasers are no longer affected by Isaac's momentum."]], ['{{t|Wiggle Worm}}: Laser follows a sine wave, which increases its hitbox.']]

name: Technology 2
description: Replaces the tears fired from Isaac's right eye with a rapid-firing low damage [[piercing tears|piercing]] laser. {{dlc|nr}} [[Damage]] down.
effects: [["Replaces Isaac's right eye tears with an unlimited range [[piercing tears|piercing]] laser which fires continuously, dealing damage 15 times per second."], ['{{dlc|nr}} x0.65 Damage multiplier.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} The laser deals 20% of Isaac's damage per tick.", ["This compounds with the damage down for a total of 13% of Isaac's damage per tick."]], ["{{dlc|r}} Only the laser deals 13% of Isaac's damage per tick."], ['{{dlc|r}} Tears fired per second'], ['(2/3).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Laser is able to knock back enemies.']]
notes: [['Tear delay is effectively doubled, as Isaac will do a bit of the animation to fire a right eye tear, but no tear will come out.', ["{{dlc|r}} This applies to items that replace Isaac's tears, such as {{I|Mom's Knife}} and {{I|Brimstone}}."]], ["Charged shots are not affected by the effective tear delay down, as they don't use the alternative left eye/right eye fire scheme."], ['{{Dlc|nr}} As {{C|Cain}} can only fire tears from his right eye, Technology 2 will replace his tears altogether unless he has {{i|Technology}} or a charged attack.', ['{{dlc+|r}} When used by Cain, or a character that is forced to fire from one eye due to the effects of {{I|Stapler}} or {{I|Lead Pencil}}, they will fire {{i|Technology}} lasers out of their right eye instead of their normal tears, as long as they have no other items that replace their tears ({{I|neptunus}} lets them fire tears normally). These lasers cannot be angled with momentum.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Because {{C|Lilith}} is blindfolded and relies on her {{i|Incubus}}, the only effect gained from Technology 2 is the damage down.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Incubus can fire laser as normal; stat effects apply.', 'Unlike regular Lilith, {{c|Tainted Lilith}} gains the standard laser from her baby as well as the tears from the demonic baby.']], ['The laser can apply [[status effect]]s very efficiently due to its high tick rate.']]
synergies: [['{{i|8 Inch Nails}} / {{t|Blister}} / {{i|Pisces}}: The laser will consistently push back enemies.'], ["{{i|Blood Clot}} / {{i|Chemical Peel}}: Since Isaac's right eye is replaced by Technology 2, he can only fire tears from his left eye, which gives all his tears higher damage and range."], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: The laser fires while Chocolate Milk charges at normal rate.'], ["{{dlc|r}} {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}}: The laser will rapidly split into small low damage tears upon impact with an enemy or obstacle."], ['{{i|Cursed Eye}}: The laser fires while Cursed Eye charges at normal rate, retaining the teleporting effect.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tears are replaced with lasers, fired from the same eye of Technology 2.']], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The laser fires while the missiles are being aimed.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Euthanasia}} / {{i|Explosivo}} / {{i|Holy Light}} / {{t|Nose Goblin}} / / {{I|Sinus Infection}}: Every damage tick from the laser can also apply these tear effects and does so rapidly.', ['{{i|Explosivo}}’s 60 point explosion damage bonus is unaffected by the laser’s reduced damage making the combination incredibly effective.']], ['{{i|Fire Mind}}: Laser will set enemies on fire but will not explode.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Laser damage increases dramatically while also gaining the poison effect.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy|r}}: The laser has its range shortened but rapidly creates and feeds Lachryphagy tears.'], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: The laser destroys all hostile projectiles that come into contact with it.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Isaac simultaneously controls a tear and fires the laser; however, Isaac will only fire the Technology 2 laser in the direction that the tear is currently facing.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal|a}}: Damage increases the further away the enemy is, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Isaac simultaneously controls a big red target on the ground and fires the laser in the cardinal directions.', ['{{dlc|r}} The laser now continuously fires towards the crosshair along with tears.']], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The laser fires while the Knife charges at normal rate."], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: The laser fires while Monstro's Lung charges at normal rate. No reduction in tear burst size."], ['{{i|Rubber Cement|a}}: Laser bounces off of walls.'], ['{{i|Technology|nr}}: Equips two lasers that can be fired at the same time. As Technology is always fired from the right eye, it is not affected by the halved normal attack rate.', ['{{dlc+|r}} Technology is affected by the fire rate multiplier. Holding {{I|Stapler}}, {{I|Lead Pencil}} or playing as {{C|Cain}} will allow Isaac to angle shots with momentum again.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The laser spirals around Isaac once and then goes straight again.'], ['{{i|The Wiz}}: Tears are fired diagonally while the laser is fired straight forward.']]
interactions: [['{{C|Azazel}}: The Technology 2 continuously fires its lesser damage laser as Azazel charges his Brimstone.'], ['{{i|Brimstone|force=na}}: Overrides Technology 2, but retains the reduced damage.', ['{{dlc|a}} Laser fires continuously while Brimstone charges at normal rate.']], ['{{dlc|ab+}}{{i|Eye of Belial}} / {{i|Parasitoid}}: The laser is unaffected.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}}{{i|Euthanasia}} / {{i|Little Horn}} / {{t|Nose Goblin}} / {{i|Sinus Infection}} / {{i|Sulfuric Acid}}: The laser is unaffected.'], ['{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Explosivo}} / {{i|Holy Light}}: The laser is unaffected.'], ['{{i|Fire Mind}}: Tears still ignite enemies, but no longer have a chance to explode.'], ["{{i|Incubus|nr}}: Decreases damage of Incubus' tears; Incubus does not fire a continuous laser."], ["{{i|Lead Pencil|nr}}: Isaac loses the ability to fire tears from the remaining eye, identical to Cain's downside.", ['{{dlc|r}} Replaces tears with lasers similar to {{i|Technology}}. These are shot from the eye that shoots Technology 2, doing damage alongside the Technology 2 beam.']], ['{{i|My Reflection|anr}}: Laser is bent in the opposite direction as Isaac moves sideways, then gradually becomes straight as he stands still.', ['{{dlc|r}} The laser makes a thin loop in front of Isaac, and fires the normal laser backwards.']], ['{{i|Pop!|r}}: The laser has drastically reduced range, and eyeball tears are rapidly created at the end of the laser.'], ["{{i|Soy Milk|nr}}: Both damage reductions are applied, along with removing one eye's worth of tears."], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: Multiple copies of the item provide no benefit.']]

name: Spoon Bender
description: Grants Isaac [[homing tears]].
effects: [['Grants [[homing tears]].']]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Spoon Bender it turns into a purple locust that homes in on enemies while it is charging forward.'], ['{{i|Aquarius|r}}: Trail of creep is purple and homes in on enemies.'], ['{{c|Azazel}} / {{i|Brimstone}} / {{c|Tainted Azazel|r}}  / {{i|Technology}} / {{i|Technology 2}} / {{i|Tech X}}: Beams curve toward enemies.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Tears and split tears are homing."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: The bombs slide towards enemies.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Tears will travel in the direction of the cross-hairs until close enough to home in on an enemy.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife curves towards enemies."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Epic Fetus|a}}: Cursor slides towards enemies.'], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: Tears home in on enemies when not being maneuvered.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear will attempt to home towards a single target, even if it hits a different enemy on its way there, making it difficult to control.', ["{{dlc|r}} The changes to homing tears make it nearly impossible to maintain control of the shot while it's near an enemy."]], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: The electricity is unaffected.']]

name: Transcendence
description: Grants [[flight]].
effects: [['Grants [[flight]].']]
interactions: [['{{I|The Intruder}}: When the effect is activated Isaac becomes invisible.']]

name: Guppy's Head
description: Spawns 2-4 friendly [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] that damage enemies.
effects: [['Spawns 2-4 friendly [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]].'], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [["Each Blue Fly deals 2x Isaac's damage."]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{T|Fish Tail}}: Doubles flies spawned.'], ["[[File:Collectible_9_Volt_icon.png|25x25px]][[9 Volt]]: Guppy's Head slowly gains charge while in a hostile room."]]

name: Magic Fingers
description: Uses 1 {{E|Penny}} to deal a large amount of [[damage]] to all enemies in the [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Uses 1 {{E|Penny}} to deal damage to all enemies in the [[Rooms|room]].', ["{{dlc|nr}} Damage dealt is equal to twice Isaac's [[damage]].", ["{{dlc|r}} Damage dealt is twice Isaac's [[damage]] +10."]]]]
notes: [['This item becomes more valuable once {{R|Shop}}s stop appearing.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{dlc+|nr}}{{i|Isaac's Heart}} + {{I|schoolbag}} + {{i|IV Bag}}: Allows for effectively infinite uses by switching to IV Bag when low on money, with Isaac's Heart preventing it from lowering the player's [[health]]. {{dlc-}}"]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|ipecac|r}}: Damage boost is mostly ignored.']]

name: Pyro
description: Grants 99 {{E|Bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants Isaac 99 {{E|Bomb}}s.']]
notes: [['Rerolling this item with the {{i|D4}}, etc., will not remove 99 Bombs.'], ['This item can appear when using the {{P|0 - The Fool?}} with 99 bombs in inventory.']]

name: Ball of Bandages
description: Creates an [[orbital familiar]]. Collecting additional copies gives it the ability to shoot [[Charm]] tears, then chase enemies to deal contact damage, then deal even more contact damage.
effects: [['Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that deals contact damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} It deals 105 damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 53 damage per second.']], ['{{dlc|na}} Unlike the {{i|Cube of Meat}}, it does not block enemy shots.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Ball of Bandages blocks enemy shots.'], ["Each subsequent Ball of Bandages obtained are combined with the first one (increasing its 'level'), changing its characteristics:", ['Level 2: Gives the orbital the ability to shoot [[Charm]] tears that deal 3.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} It shoots once every second.', '{{dlc|r}} It shoots once every 0.73 seconds.'], 'Level 3: Changes it from an orbital to a Bandage Girl that that chases nearby enemies dealing contact damage and fires Charm tears in the direction Isaac shoots. The tears it fires are the same as the ones fired by the Level 2 form.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} It deals 7 contact damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 12.5 contact damage per second.'], "Level 4: Increases the size of the Bandage Girl and increases its contact damage. Enemies killed by a level 4 Bandage Girl's tears have a chance to drop full {{e|Red Heart}}s.", ['{{Dlc|nr}} It deals 11 contact damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} It deals 25 contact damage per second.'], 'The fifth Ball of Bandages will create a new Level 1 ball, and start the cycle again.']]]
notes: [['Multiple Balls of Bandages can be collected in a single run.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The orbital orbits Isaac significantly faster, making it more effective at blocking shots but less effective for dealing damage.'], ['{{e|Famine}}, {{e|Pestilence}}, {{e|War}}, and {{e|Death}} will always drop either a Ball of Bandages or {{i|Cube of Meat}}. After the first one drops, further Harbingers will only drop that same one and never the other for the duration of the run.'], ["The ticking rate for Bandage Girls' contact damage causes them to often deal damage twice once they touch an enemy, making their first second of DPS up to 1.5x higher than normal."], ["Level 3 and 4 Bandage Girls' tears inherit Isaac's momentum."]]
synergies: [["{{i|Book of Revelations}}: Ensures that [[Harbingers]] that haven't already been defeated will replace their respective floor's boss, making it drastically easier to collect multiple Balls of Bandages."], ['{{i|Box of Friends}} / {{i|Monster Manual}}: Additional copies of Ball of Bandages combine with the first, increasing its level as normal.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Duct Tape}}: Familiar will stay in place relative to Isaac at levels 1 and 2. No effect at levels 3 and 4.'], ['[[Pretty Fly]]: Ball of Bandages will replace one if Isaac already has 3 Pretty Flies. If the Ball of Bandages reaches level 3 or 4, the Pretty Fly will come back until another Ball of Bandages orbital is obtained.']]

name: The Wafer
description: All sources of damage that would cause more than one-half heart of damage are reduced to one-half heart instead.
effects: [['All damage taken is reduced to half a heart.']]
notes: [['The damage reduction includes most sources in the game that would cause more than half a heart of damage:', ['{{E|Bomb}}s.', '[[Champion]]s.', ['Except for the skull champions, they will deal a full heart damage even with The Wafer as opposed to only one half.'], '{{R|Sacrifice Room}}s.', 'Environmental hazards such as [[Spikes]].', 'Most self-inflicting damage items (exceptions are noted).', 'Every source of damage in {{Stage|Womb}}/{{Stage|Utero}}/{{Stage|Scarred Womb}} and beyond, including all enemies, {{R|Curse Room}}s, {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.', 'The "HARD HARD" special [[Seeds|seed]].']], ['The Wafer does not prevent instant death effects such as {{P|Suicide King}} or using {{I|The Bible}} on the {{E|Satan}} boss fight.'], ['Does not prevent health loss from {{R|Devil Room}} deals or Health Down [[pills]].'], ['Despite The Wafer reducing damage to 1/2 a heart, this does not change the amount of invincibility frames granted from full/two heart damage sources.'], ['{{dlc|a}} No effect with {{c|Keeper}} or {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, as Coin Hearts cannot be half hearts.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Does not reduce the damage taken when opening the door to {{Stage|Mausoleum}}/{{Stage|Gehenna}}.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Blood Oath}}: Does not reduce the damage taken.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{i|Glass Cannon}}: The extra damage taken when the cannon breaks is not reduced.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{I|Sharp Plug}}: Damage taken is reduced to half a heart.', ['{{dlc|r}} Does not reduce the damage taken.']]]

name: Anemic
description: After Isaac is damaged, a trail of [[red creep]] will be left behind him until he leaves the current room. {{dlc+|nr}} +5 [[range]].{{dlc-}} {{dlc+|r}} +1.5 [[range]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['Upon taking damage, Isaac leaves a trail of [[red creep]] that damages enemies until he leaves the room.', ['The creep deals 2 damage per tick (6 damage per second) to enemies that walk over it.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].']]
notes: [['The effects of this item do not stack if multiple copies of the item or its effects are acquired; Isaac only gets the range bonus once.'], ["{{C|Lazarus}}, or anyone holding {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}, is resurrected with this item upon his first death.", ['After {{chal|Backasswards}} is beaten, Lazarus will start with Anemic, and Lazarus Risen will have its increased range and creep trail effect permanently active, regardless of whether he possesses the item.']]]

name: Bob's Brain
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that charges forward when shooting tears and explodes upon contact with an enemy, damaging and [[poison]]ing them. The familiar respawns after a few seconds.
effects: [['Spawns a floating brain [[familiar]] that can be fired towards enemies as a projectile.', ["{{dlc|na}}Bob's Brain is fired directly from where Isaac is standing.", "{{dlc|a}}Bob's Brain is fired directly from where it is located in the chain of familiars behind Isaac, making aiming it slightly more difficult."]], ['If it hits an enemy, it deals 3.5 damage and explodes, further damaging and [[Poison|poisoning]] monsters.', ["{{dlc|nr}} The explosion deals 60 damage. The poison deals double Isaac's [[Damage]] over time.", "{{dlc|r}} The explosion deals 100 damage. The poison damage is dealt 4 times, inflicting Isaac's Damage per tick.", '{{dlc|r}} The explosion ignores armor.']], ['The explosion can hurt Isaac, dealing a full heart of damage.', ["This can make picking up the item a risky choice, as Bob's Brain will always fire, regardless of whether or not Isaac will be caught in the explosion."]], ['Once it explodes, it takes a few seconds to re-appear.'], ['{{transf|Bob|item}}']]
notes: [["Bob's Brain is affected by most bomb modifiers."], ["Bob's Brain only explodes when hitting an enemy, and does not explode upon hitting a fire, poop, or wall. It can destroy poops and fires like normal shots, however."], ["Bob's Brain never launches immediately upon entering a room unless a tear-firing key is released and pressed again, or until several seconds have passed."], ["It is possible to get multiple Bob's Brains to spawn on the same floor by finding one in a {{E|Locked Chest}} and not taking it", ['Only one copy of the brains will be active at a given time, with another one firing immediately after the first has exploded or starts to return from a miss.', "{{dlc|na}} Multiple copies of Bob's Brain will float in the same spot in the familiar line.", '{{dlc|a}} Each copy takes up their spot on the familiar line, but only the first one launches out. Respawning brains may end up stacking on top of each other.']]]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The impact damage is increased to 7 and the explosion deals an additional 25 damage.'], ['{{i|Mr. Mega}}: The explosion deals an additional {{Dlc|nr}}85/{{Dlc|r}}50 damage.']]
interactions: [['Effects applied as normal:', ['{{I|Blood Bombs}}', '{{I|Brimstone Bombs}}', '{{I|Butt Bombs}}', '{{I|Glitter Bombs}}', '{{I|Hot Bombs}}', '{{I|Nancy Bombs}}', '{{I|Sad Bombs}}']], ['No effect:', ['{{I|Bobby-Bomb}}', "{{I|Bob's Curse|force=nr}}", ["{{Dlc|r}} The [[poison]] effect of Bob's curse is applied which deals only 2 ticks of damage, resulting in inflicting halved damage."], '{{I|Fast Bombs}}', '{{I|Ghost Bombs}}', '{{I|Rocket in a Jar}}', '{{I|Scatter Bombs}}', '{{I|Sticky Bombs}}']], ['{{i|Bomber Boy|nr}}: No cross explosions. Damage from the explosion is halved against the initial target, but others caught in the blast take full damage.', ["{{dlc|r}} Explodes in a cross-shaped pattern. Damage from the main explosion deals a flat 37.5 damage, and any additional explosion deals flat 75 damage to which Bomber boy's damage reduction is not applied.", ['Bomber Boy + {{I|BFFS!}}: Explosion damages are increased to 1.25x, which are 46.875/93.75 each.', 'Bomber Boy + {{I|Mr. Mega}}: Explosion damages are increased to 1.5x, which are 56.25/112.5 each.', 'Bomber Boy + {{I|BFFS!}} + {{I|Mr. Mega}}: Explosion damages are increased to 1.75x, which are 65.625/131.25 each.']]], ["{{t|Duct Tape}}: Bob's Brain stays in place relative to Isaac until it is fired."], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|E. Coli}} / {{i|Flush!}}: Bob's Brain will explode upon hitting an enemy that has been turned into poop.", ["{{dlc|r}} Bob's Brain no longer explodes upon hitting poops made from enemies."]]]

name: Spirit of the Night
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]] and [[flight]].'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [["The changed texture of the player's body is the same as {{c|The Lost}}'s, but recolored."]]

name: Aries
description: +0.25 [[Speed]]. Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal damage. {{dlc|r}} Prevents Isaac from taking contact damage while moving at high speed.
effects: [['+0.25 [[Speed]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal 18 damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Running into enemies while at a high speed will deal 25 damage.', ['At least 0.85 Speed is required to be able to move quickly enough.', '{{dlc|r}} Moving at this speed also prevents contact damage.']]]
synergies: [["{{i|Serpent's Kiss|r}}: Allows Isaac to poison enemies without needing to take a hit, allowing for an impressive amount of {{E|Black Heart}}s to be collected."], ['{{c|Tainted Forgotten|r}}: Throwing the skeleton will deal 80 damage on contact.'], ["{{c|Tainted Magdalene|r}}'s hugs stack with Aries, dealing insane combined contact damage to enemies. This also makes T. Magdalene invulnerable at high speeds, whilst still generating a decent amount of red hearts."]]
interactions: [["{{i|Isaac's Heart|r}}: The invulnerability does not extend to the heart."]]

name: Blue Cap
quote: HP + tears up + shot speed down
description: Gives one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.7 [[tears]], and -0.16 [[shot speed]]. {{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].', ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals Isaac for 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.']], ['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['-0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]

name: Black Candle
description: Prevents [[curse]]s. Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}. Increases the chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} or {{R|Angel Room}} to appear.
effects: [['Grants immunity to floor [[curse]]s.', ['Will immediately remove any curses on the current floor except {{curse|labyrinth}}.']], ['Grants a {{E|Black Heart}} upon pickup.'], ['Increases chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} door to open when a floor boss is killed by 15%.']]
notes: [['Picking up this item during {{chal|Cursed!}} will not remove the {{curse|cursed}}.'], ['Picking up this item during {{chal|Pitch Black}} will not remove the {{curse|darkness}} or {{curse|unknown}}.'], ["Picking up this item during {{chal|Ultra Hard}} will not remove '''any''' of the curses."], ['Picking up this item while under the effect of an Amnesia [[Pills|pill]] or ??? pill will remove the effect of the pill. However, the item does not negate the effects of Amnesia or ??? pills used after picking up this item.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Picking up this item does not make the second item in alt floor treasure rooms visible.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Doesn't remove {{curse|darkness}} afflicted by {{p|XIX - The Sun?|n}}, no matter if Black Candle was picked up before or after using the card."]]
synergies: [['{{t|Black Feather}}: Grants a damage boost.'], ['{{dlc|a}}{{i|Cursed Eye}}: Removes teleportation effect of Cursed Eye.'], ['{{T|Cursed Penny}}: Removes teleportation effect upon picking up a coin.']]

name: Missing Page 2
quote: Evil up. Your enemies will pay!
description:
Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}. Upon taking damage that reduces Isaac's [[health]] to one heart or less, deals damage to all enemies in the room.
{{dlc|r}} Increases the damage of {{E|Black Heart}}s and {{i|The Necronomicon}}-like effects by 40.
effects: [['Grants one {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Activates {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect upon taking damage if Isaac's total [[health]] ({{E|Red Heart}}s, {{E|Soul Heart}}s, and Black Hearts) is at one heart afterward."], ["{{dlc|r}} Deals 80 damage to everything in the room upon taking damage if Isaac's total [[health]] (Red Hearts, Soul Hearts, and Black Hearts) is at one heart afterward."], ['{{dlc|r}} Adds +40 damage to {{i|The Necronomicon}} and similar effects, such as {{E|Black Heart}}s.']]
notes: [['Works the same for {{C|Keeper}} and {{c|Tainted Keeper}} and his [[Hearts|Coin Hearts]].']]
synergies: [["{{t|Black Feather}}: Counts as an 'evil' item, granting a damage up."], ["{{dlc+|r}} {{I|Blood Rights}} / {{I|Dry Baby}} / {{i|The Negative}} / {{p|XIII - Death}}: Since these items essentially activate {{i|The Necronomicon}}'s effect, the damage boost is applied to these items as well.{{dlc-}}"], ['{{t|A Missing Page|r}}: The damage increase stacks, resulting in The Necronomicon and similar items dealing 120 damage.']]

name: Capricorn
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Adds 1 Red [[Heart Container]], gives +0.5 [[Damage]], +0.1 [[Speed]], +1.5 [[Range]], and -1.0 [[Tear Delay]], and gives 1 {{E|Bomb}}, {{E|Penny}}, and {{E|Key}}.
{{dlc|r}} Adds 1 Red [[Heart Container]], gives +0.5 [[Damage]], +0.1 [[Speed]], +0.75 [[Range]], and +0.5 [[Fire Rate]], and gives 1 {{E|Bomb}}, {{E|Penny}}, and {{E|Key}}.
effects: [['Adds 1 Red [[Heart Container]].'], ['+0.5 [[Damage]].'], ['+0.1 [[Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[Range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.75 [[Range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -1 [[Tear Delay]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[Fire Rate]].'], ['+1 {{E|Bomb}}, {{E|Penny}}, and {{E|Key}}.']]

name: Scorpio
description: Grants [[Poison|poison tears]], which deal damage over time when inflicted.
effects: [['Grants [[poison]] tears, dealing damage over time when inflicted.'], ['{{dlc|na}} The poison randomly hits either 2 or 3 times, dealing a total of 4 or 6 damage.'], ["{{dlc|a}} The poison hits twice, dealing a total of double Isaac's damage."]]
notes: [['This item has the same effect as {{i|The Common Cold}} on every shot. As such, all synergies with that item also apply to Scorpio at a 100% chance.', ['This includes the same effect when absorbed by {{i|Abyss}}.']]]

name: Head of Krampus
description: {{dlc|naa+}} Fires a powerful {{i|Brimstone}} beam in four cardinal directions, much like {{e|Krampus}} shoots.
effects: [['Fires a powerful {{i|Brimstone}} beam in the four cardinal directions, much like {{e|The Fallen}} and {{e|Krampus}} shoot.', ["{{dlc|ana+}} Has a 50% chance to rotate all beams around the player 90 degrees, similar to Krampus' second Brimstone attack."]]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Each beam deals 22 damage per tick, and they tick a total of 20 times, dealing a total of 440 damage per use.', ['{{dlc|r}} Each beam deals 10 damage over 20 ticks, dealing a total of 200 damage per use.']], ['Damaging enemies with the effect of this item as {{transf|Guppy}} will spawn multiple [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]].'], ["By standing really close to large enemies such as bosses, it's possible to hit them with multiple beams at once, dealing significantly more damage than a single beam."]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{i|Car Battery}}: Doubles the damage the brimstone beams deal (for a total of {{dlc|nr}} 880 damage/{{dlc|r}} 400 damage per use). Doesn't double the brimstone beams' duration."]]

name: IV Bag
description: Upon use, Isaac loses half a heart of [[health]] (or a full heart in [[Chapter 4]] onward) for a random amount of [[coins]], similar to a {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}.
effects: [['Upon use, causes Isaac to lose half a heart of [[health]] (or a full heart in [[Chapter 4]] onward) while spawning [[coin]]s.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Each use pays out with 1-3 coins.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Each use pays out with 1-2 coins on Normal mode or 1 coin on [[Hard mode]].'], '{{dlc|a}} Spawns 0-1 coins instead when used by {{C|Keeper}}.']]]
notes: [['This item can be found when causing a {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}} to explode by donating Hearts to it.'], ["If Isaac doesn't have the required {{E|Red Heart}}s or filled {{E|Bone Heart}}s, then {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, and empty Bone Hearts are taken instead."], ['This effect is counted as inflicted damage for items that spawn [[pickup]]s upon said inflicted damage, such as {{i|Gimpy}} or {{i|Fanny Pack}}, but does not decrease the chance of encountering the {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}}.'], ['[[Invulnerability]] will not prevent Isaac from losing hearts.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Can be used before taking damage (getting hit, walking over spikes, donating to a {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}}, donating to a {{machine|Devil Beggar}}, going through a {{r|Curse Room}}, etc.) to grant coins without inflicting extra damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Does not allow Isaac to avoid damage taken by using a {{machine|Blood Donation Machine}} or {{machine|Devil Beggar}}.'], ['Using this item as {{C|The Lost}} will kill him.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Using this item in [[Mirrored World]] kills Isaac.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{i|Old Bandage}} + {{i|Humbling Bundle}}/{{i|Maggy's Bow}}: The damage from IV Bag has a chance to spawn 2 hearts, which can be picked up to create further coins and possibly even heal hearts with enough [[Luck]].", ['{{dlc|r}}Humbling Bundle only has a 50% chance to double the hearts dropped, but Old Bandage may still drop 1 heart.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Can be used without taking damage, resulting in an infinite amount of coins.", ['{{dlc|a}} Isaac still takes damage from this during {{chal|The Guardian}}.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|PHD}}: Increases each payout by 0-2 coins.', ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|PHD}}: IV Bag always pays out with 2 coins.']], ['{{i|Portable Slot}}: Can be alternated between to gain ridiculous amounts of [[pickups]] from only a few initial coins or hearts.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Scapular}}: Allows for infinite coins once Isaac is at half a red heart (or full red heart in [[Chapter 4]] onward) by moving between rooms to reset Scapular's effect."]]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{dlc|a}} {{i|Holy Mantle}} and similar items: IV Bag ignores the shield's protection, resulting in Isaac taking damage regardless."]]

name: Guppy's Paw
description: Upon use, converts one Red [[Heart Container]] into three {{e|Soul Heart}}s.
effects: [['Upon use, converts one Red [[Heart Container]] into three {{e|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{transf|Guppy|item}}']]
notes: [['{{e|Bone Heart}}s cannot be converted.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{t|Broken Remote|na}}: The teleport will activate whenever Guppy's Paw is used, even if Isaac has no Red Heart Containers to trade.  This can give any characters with no Red Hearts the ability to teleport any number of times for free."], ['{{i|Converter|nr}}: Allows Isaac to attain up to 10 Red Heart Containers and 1 Soul Heart.', ['{{dlc|r}} Allows Isaac to attain up to 12 Red Heart Containers or any combination of Red Heart Containers and Soul Hearts.']], ["{{dlc|r}}{{c|Tainted Eden}}: Soul hearts granted by Guppy's Paw are not rerolled when Tainted Eden takes damage."]]
interactions: [["{{dlc|r}} {{c|Bethany}}: Guppy's Paw will remove one Heart Container in exchange for Soul Heart charges. This will kill Bethany if she has no health left afterward."], ['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{dlc|a}} {{c|Keeper}}: Guppy's Paw will take away one Coin Heart, but will only grant [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] in return."], ['{{p|XI - Strength}}: Converts the temporary Red Heart Container into three Soul Hearts (however, Isaac will still lose one Red Heart Container upon leaving the room if he has any left).']]

name: Flush!
description: Turns all non-boss [[monsters]] in the [[room]] into {{E|poop}}. Instantly kills poop-themed bosses.
effects: [['Turns all non-boss [[monsters]] in the [[room]] into {{E|poop}}.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Floods the whole room with water (same effect as seen in {{s|Flooded Caves}}).', ['Floods the room with blood if used in {{Stage|Womb}} and its alts.']], ['{{dlc|a}} Instantly kills most poop-themed bosses ({{E|Dingle}}, {{E|Dangle|n}}, {{E|Brownie|n}}, {{E|Clog}}).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Extinguishes all Normal and Red {{E|fire place}}s in the room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Turns lava-filled pits in the {{Stage|Mines}} into solid rock, allowing them to be walked over.'], ['{{transf|Oh Crap|item}}']]
notes: [['Poops produced by this item act similarly to regular enemies, which causes them to flash red when hit. Certain items will also behave like the poop was a normal enemy, such as {{i|BBF}}.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Enemies that are turned into poop act more similarly to regular poop by crumbling upon being attacked.']], ['If the Fear effect is applied, the poop will stay a dark red.'], ["Does not work against {{E|Lil' Haunt}}s when fighting {{E|The Haunt}}.", ['{{dlc|na}} The first little haunt when fighting the Haunt can be flushed, but this softlocks the game.']], ["Does not work against {{E|Mom's Hand}} or {{E|Wizoob}} enemies."], ['Does not work against {{E|Turdlings}}, {{E|Colostomia}} or {{E|Turdlet}} despite them being poop-based enemies.'], ['Does not work against mini-bosses.'], ['May not work against enemies currently jumping.'], ["The drops from the poops that come from enemies aren't affected by {{T|petrified poop}}."], ["Using it against the [[Champion]] version of a monster will forfeit the chance to get the champion's drop."], ['{{dlc|a}} Poop created by use of this item does not heal Isaac when he has the {{transf|Oh Crap|n}} transformation.'], ['{{dlc|a}} When used inside a crawl space the ladders will be covered in water but the walls will not.']]
synergies: [["{{I|120 Volt|r}} / {{I|Jacob's Ladder|r}}: Since Flush floods the room with water, it is now considered a wet environment, which significantly increases the arcing distance of the electricity created by these items.{{dlc-}}"], ['{{bov}}'], ["{{i|Death's List}}: Enemies that die by being turned into poop do not disrupt the Death's List chain and clearing a room by turning all its enemies into poop still grants Isaac the Death's List reward."]]
interactions: [["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Bob's Brain}}: Bob's Brain will explode upon hitting an enemy that has been turned into poop.", ["{{dlc|r}} Bob's Brain no longer explodes upon hitting poops made from enemies."]], ['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{c|Tainted Keeper|r}} / {{c|Tainted Magdalene}}: '''Not recommended''' as kills from enemies being turned into poop don't generate pickups."]]

name: Magic Scab
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +1 [[luck]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['+1 [[luck]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}']]

name: Mitre
description: Grants a chance of converting any {{E|Red Heart}} pickups into {{E|Soul Heart}}s instead.
effects: [['Grants a chance of converting any {{E|Red Heart}} pickups into {{E|Soul Heart}}s instead.', ['{{dlc|nr}} 50% chance to convert Red Hearts into Soul Hearts.', '{{dlc|r}} 33% chance to convert Red Hearts into Soul Hearts.']], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
synergies: [["{{C|???}}, {{C|Tainted ???}}, {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, and {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: Decreases the chances of useless red heart drops, which these characters can't pick up."], ['{{C|Bethany}}: Sacrifices potential healing for more charges. Usefulness depends on active item.'], ["{{C|Eve}}/{{I|Whore of Babylon}}: Decreases the chance of useless red heart drops when trying to maintain the half a heart (full heart on Eve) of health required to keep Whore of Babylon's ability active."], ['{{C|Keeper}}/{{C|Tainted Keeper}}: Nearly useless, since all hearts are converted into blue flies anyway. Only use is contributing to the Seraphim transformation.'], ['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: Sacrifices potential blood charges for more health. Overall, still a beneficial pickup.'], ['{{C|Tainted Magdalene}}: Due to the "in your face" gameplay of Tainted Maggy, soul hearts will not be as useful up until the later floors.']]

name: Magneto
description: Pulls [[pickup]]s towards Isaac.
effects: [['Pickups (e.g. hearts, coins, keys, bombs, etc.) are attracted to Isaac.', ['The attraction enables the item to pass/fly over pits or rocks, but not through Key Blocks.', '{{E|red heart|display=Hearts}} are only attracted if Isaac could pick them up with his existing Red Heart containers.', "{{E|Lil' Battery|display=Batteries}} act similarly to hearts in that they will only be attracted to Isaac if his active item isn't fully charged.", '{{E|Chest|r}}s roughly 2 or fewer tiles away from Isaac open automatically. {{E|Spiked chest|n}}s are opened without damaging Isaac. {{E|Locked chest}}s and {{E|bomb chest}}s are not opened and still require a key/bomb.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} A few enemies (like the [[Horf]]) are drawn toward Isaac as well.']]
notes: [['Magneto can attract {{E|Scared Heart}}s, but they still run away from Isaac.'], ['{{E|Grab Bag|r}}s are not attracted nor opened by Magneto.'], ["{{dlc|r}} If Magneto opens the chests in {{r|Challenge Room}}s, the waves won't start spawning, nor the way out will be closed."]]
interactions: [['{{I|Hypercoagulation}}: Magneto cuts the momentum of the hearts, allowing for easy pickup and, in turn, making Isaac very tough to kill.'], ["{{i|Options?}}: If a chest is presented as a choice and opened by Magneto, the other reward won't disappear unless the empty chest is then touched. Chests with items disappear or make the other reward disappear, though."], ['{{C|Tainted Magdalene}}/{{C|Tainted Keeper}}: Attracts hearts and coins dropped by enemies, allowing for an easier survival and/or coin mongering respectively.'], ['{{T|Paper Clip}}: Allows locked chests to be opened from a short distance.'], ['{{T|Broken Magnet}}: Does not increase the pull speed of coins.']]

name: BFFS!
description: Increases the size and effectiveness of most [[familiar]]s.
effects: [['Visually increases the size of all [[familiar]]s by 25%, and improves the effectiveness of most of them.', ['Doubles the damage of Familiars that deal damage through tears and contact damage.', ['Has no effect on [[Creep]] generated by familiars.'], 'For pickup-generating familiars, increases the frequency that they drop pickups.', ['Familiars that require clearing a certain number of rooms will require one less room.', 'Familiars that have a random chance to drop items have a higher chance.', 'Familiars that pick up consumables require less, except {{i|Dark Bum}} which is unaffected.'], 'Some familiars have unique synergies.']]]
notes: [["The size change is only cosmetic: familiars' hitbox for blocking damage or attacking is not affected."], ['Familiars summoned by a [[trinket]] or by {{i|Monster Manual}} are also affected by BFFS!.'], ['The Blue Flies and Blue Spiders benefit from {{i|Hive Mind}} instead.'], ['Does not increase the frequency or effectiveness of [[Status Effects]] applied by familiars.']]
synergies: [["{{i|BBF}}/{{i|Bob's Brain}}: Doubles impact damage and increases explosive damage by 25."], ['{{I|Bird Cage}}: Spawns 4 rock waves in an x pattern. Doubles the damage when the bird lands and doubles contact damage. Damage of waves unaffected.'], ['{{i|Blood Oath}}: Adds 2 extra full hearts worth of bonuses if any health is drained.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Holy Water}}: Double water damage, spawn a blue flame at point of impact.'], ["{{i|Incubus}}: Shoots tears that do {{Dlc|nr}} 2x Isaac's damage {{Dlc|r}} 1.5x Isaac's damage. Still deals 2x as {{C|Lilith}}."], ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Fires additional shots in random directions and leaves a larger puddle of creep. Does not change the heart's size."], ['{{i|Juicy Sack}}: Spawns an extra Blue Spider.'], ["{{i|Lil Spewer}}: Increases the creep pool's size, but not its damage."], ['{{I|Lost Soul}}: Gives the Lost Soul a {{I|Holy Mantle}} effect.'], ["{{i|Mystery Egg}}: Spawns a champion variant of an enemy, even if the enemy normally can't be a champion."], ["{{i|Stitches}}: On use, fires eight tears from Isaac's original location. The tears synergize with Isaac's tear effects."]]
interactions: [["{{i|Blood Puppy}}: Only increases the damage and size while it isn't hostile."], ['{{i|Evil Eye}}: The eyes are not treated as familiars and therefore will not synergize with BFFS!'], ["{{i|Guillotine}}/{{i|Scissors}}: Doesn't change the head's size, but still improves its damage."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Hive Mind}}: Does not stack.'], ['{{i|Shade}}: Retains the increased damage even after being absorbed.']]

name: Prayer Card
description: Gives an {{E|Eternal Heart}} per use.
effects: [['Gives an {{E|Eternal Heart}} upon activation.']]
notes: [['If used after clearing a [[floor]], before proceeding to the next one, it guarantees a new [[Heart Container]] every floor.'], ['Since it adds the eternal heart directly to the health bar instead of spawning it on the floor, the item is useless for {{C|Keeper}}.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}', ['The wisps have two possible sizes. The bigger ones seem to spawn if using Prayer Card gives Isaac another Heart Container.']], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Grants one full Heart Container upon use.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{c|Tainted Eden}}: Health ups granted by eternal hearts are not rerolled when Tainted Eden takes damage.']]
interactions: [["{{c|Tainted Magdalene}}: Doesn't benefit from her passive ability, giving only 1 Eternal Heart as usual."]]

name: Broken Watch
description: Every 4th newly discovered room entered will [[Status Effects#Slow|slow down]] or speed up every enemy and their attacks. The chance to slow enemies is quite higher than the chance to speed them up.
effects: [['Every 4th newly discovered room, the Broken Watch [[slow]]s all enemies and their attacks down, but has a ~13% chance of speeding them up by 40% instead.', ['The effect is lost upon leaving the room, and not gained again if re-entering it.', 'The effect is also lost upon exiting and continuing the run.\n== Notes ==']]]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Because of the slow effect, champion versions of enemies will be tinted the same color as all other enemies. This makes it much harder to distinguish certain champion types, such as those that explode upon death.'], ["The player can abuse the Broken Watch to have the Boss Rush be slowed every time by making sure that it's the 4th room since the last time the effect activated. This necessitates skipping the {{R|Devil Room}}s or {{R|Angel Room}}s , however."], ['If the slow effect triggers when entering {{E|The Beast}} boss area, it will be active for all four horsemen and the Beast. This is also true of the speed effect.', ['To trigger the effects of Broken Watch during the fight and do not have either the {{I|Red Key}} or a {{P|Cracked Key}}, you have to clear 1 room after the effect has activated, then explore every room in {{Stage|Home}}. Otherwise, after the effect has activated in a room, immediately go to {{Stage|Home}} and explore every room.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Glowing Hour Glass}}: The Glowing Hour Glass does not reset the entered room counter: using it in a room where the Broken Watch is active and immediately returning without visiting other new rooms will not trigger the effect again.'], ['{{T|Lil Clot}} / {{I|Sumptorium}} / {{C|Tainted Eve}}: Clots are moving and firing at normal speeds when a room is sped up. This can be extra hurtful as Tainted Eve, since the clots will not move in sync with her.'], ['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Stop Watch}}: Overrides Broken Watch; the speed-up effect will not occur.', ['{{dlc|a}} Both the slow effect and the rarer speed up can trigger at the start of a room.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} This results in enemies being slowed to around 71.8% of their original speed.', '{{dlc|r}} This results in enemies being sped up by 12%.']]]]

name: Converter
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Converts two {{e|Soul Heart}}s or {{e|Black Heart}}s into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.
{{dlc|r}} Converts one {{e|Soul Heart}} or {{e|Black Heart}} into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Converts two {{e|Soul Heart}}s or {{e|Black Heart}}s into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Converts one {{e|Soul Heart}} or {{e|Black Heart}} into one filled {{e|Red Heart}} Container.']]
notes: [["Using this item on Black Hearts will activate the Black Heart's damaging effect."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Must use with two full Soul Hearts to work. One and a half will not work.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{i|Guppy's Paw|nr}}: Allows Isaac to have 10 Heart Containers and 1 Soul Heart. ({{dlc|r}}12 Heart containers).", ['{{i|Potato Peeler|nr}}: Allows Isaac to generate basically infinite damage upgrades and {{i|cube of meat|}}. ({{dlc|r}}Needs the {{i|sharp plug|}} to make this loop work perfectly.)']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery|nr}}: No effect.', ['{{dlc|r}}: Consumes 2 Soul Hearts and produces 2 Red Heart Containers.']], ['{{dlc+|a+}} {{c|The Soul}}: Consumes Soul Hearts and produces {{e|Bone Heart}}s for {{c|The Forgotten}}. Does nothing when used by The Forgotten.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{c|Tainted Bethany|r}}: When used while fully charged, adds 2 Blood Charges to her pool at no cost to her Heart total. When used with no charges, consumes 3 Blood Charges and produces 2, resulting in a net loss.', ['With {{i|Car Battery|n}}: Consumes 3 Blood Charges and produces 4, still at no cost to Heart total, resulting in infinite Blood Charges.']]]

name: Blank Card
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] or [[rune]] currently held by Isaac.
{{dlc|r}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] currently held by Isaac. The charge time is based on the power of the card.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] or [[rune]] currently held by Isaac.', ['{{dlc+|anr}} Also mimics {{p|Dice Shard}} and {{p|Emergency Contact}}.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{dlc|r}} Copies the effect of the [[card]] currently held by Isaac.']]
notes: [['Using the Blank Card does not expend the consumable.'], ['[[Pill]]s can be mimicked only by {{i|Placebo}}.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Runes and soul stones can be mimicked only by {{i|Clear Rune}}.{{dlc-}}'], ['Using the Blank Card with a consumable that is not compatible, or no consumable at all, will spend the charge with no effect.'], ["If the player is holding more than one consumable (e.g. {{I|Starter Deck}}, Tainted Characters...) and one of them isn't a card, they must ensure the card is the one selected when activating Blank Card, otherwise the effect won't be triggered."]]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|r}}{{t|Butter!}}: Because Blank Card is dropped upon usage, the recharge time for it is reset to 4, allowing to use more expensive cards much more frequently.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery|a}}/{{i|Tarot Cloth|a+nr}}: Essentially uses the card twice. If used with the Two of Hearts/Diamonds/etc. cards it will quadruple whatever amount Isaac has.', ["'''Car Battery''' + '''Tarot Cloth''': The card is used 4 times at once.", '{{dlc|r}} Only certain cards can be amplified by Tarot Cloth and/or Car Battery.']], ["{{dlc+|anr}} {{p|2 of Diamonds}} + {{i|Restock}} or in [[Greed mode]]: [[Coins]] can be infinitely generated by buying {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}. As Lil' Batteries only cost 5 coins, as long as Isaac starts with at least 11, the maximum of 99 coins can be quickly reached.{{dlc-}}", ["{{dlc+|r}} This cannot be repeated infinitely, as '''Restock''' now increases the price of a shop slot every time something is purchased from it. Having 12 coins will very slowly allow Isaac to obtain 99 coins, however.", ['This does not apply in greed mode.', 'Having {{i|Deep Pockets}} allows this to once again be repeated infinitely, as the price will cap at 999 coins.{{dlc-}}']]], ['{{p|? Card}}: Teleports Isaac to the {{r|I AM ERROR}} room. This will consume both the Blank Card and the ? Card.', ['An exception is when they are used on {{s|Chest}}, {{s|Dark Room}}, or {{E|Ultra Greed|force=x}} floors. Using them here consumes both the Blank Card and the ? Card and spawns an I AM ERROR {{E|Shopkeeper}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Likewise occurs on {{s|Home}} floors.']]], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{p|Rune of Jera}}: Allows Isaac to copy pickups with every use. This combination can double {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}, which can allow for game-breaking combos, due to repeated use of the synergy.", ['Spawning too many items will cause objects to despawn. This can even despawn the [[Endings|End]] Chest after finishing a final boss fight.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Little Baggy}}: All cards are replaced by pills, rendering Blank Card useless, unless Isaac also has {{i|Starter Deck}}.'], ['{{p|Wild Card}}: Does nothing if used through Blank Card. Wild Card can, however, copy the last card that was used through Blank Card.']]

name: Sharp Plug
description: Damages Isaac in exchange for fully recharging Isaac's current activated item.
effects: [["Damages Isaac in exchange for fully recharging Isaac's current activated item.", ['{{dlc|nr}} Sharp Plug costs two hearts of health to use.', ["{{dlc|r}} Sharp Plug's heart cost is one half-heart per charge slot filled. The health cost is not increased in later stages where half-heart damage is upgraded to full heart."], '{{dlc|nr}} If the item has any charges, the Sharp Plug will not work.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac has less than two Black or Soul Hearts, it will remove them but will not remove any Red Hearts.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Sharp Plug attempts to draw from Red Hearts first.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Sharp Plug cannot deal fatal damage. If used at half a heart, it will not work.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} [[:Category:Damage-triggered items|Damage-triggered items]]: Each half heart used up by activating Sharp Plug triggers damage effects separately, allowing multiple payouts.'], ['{{i|Glowing Hour Glass}}: As long as Isaac has more than {{dlc|nr}} 2 full hearts or {{dlc|r}} 1.5 hearts, time can be rewinded indefinitely since the health used to recharge the item is refunded upon use.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{C|Keeper}}: The Keeper takes only one heart of damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Expends health for charges at the rate of 2 charges per 1 [[Coin Heart]]. If an item is 1-charge, removes 1 Coin Heart.']], ['{{i|Schoolbag}}: The active item in the main slot is fully charged as normal and the secondary slot gains as many charges as the main one did.'], ["{{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Magdalene}}: Tainted Magdalene's {{i|Yum Heart}} can be used infinitely, allowing for infinite invincibility frames from taking damage. Paired with Tainted Magdalene's melee attack, this can easily win a run."], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|The Wafer}}: Reduces the health cost to half a heart (except for Keeper).']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|9 Volt}}: Renders the Sharp Plug unusable.
