Sharp Plug can only be used if the item is at 0 charges, but 9 Volt instantly gives 1 charge to the item upon activation.', ['{{dlc|r}} As Sharp Plug can now be used with charges and the cost is based on charges filled, 9 Volt now synergizes with Sharp Plug, lowering the cost of using it by half a heart on 2+ charge items.']], ['{{i|Alabaster Box}}: Expends up to 6 full hearts if possible with no charges given.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{c|Bethany}} / {{c|Tainted Bethany}}: Soul/blood charges are used before Sharp Plug when available.'], ['{{i|Eraser}}: Attempting to recharge the Eraser with the Sharp Plug fails and only hurts Isaac for half a heart.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Holy Mantle}}: Holy Mantle blocks the damage from Sharp Plug if the shield is active, but also keeps Isaac's active item from charging.", ['{{dlc|r}} Bypasses the Holy Mantle and gives charges as usual.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Renders the Sharp Plug unusable."], ["{{C|The Lost}}: No benefit from this item unless he has a respawn item because his active item's charge will not refill if the {{i|Holy Mantle}} effect activates. Sharp Plug only activates upon receiving actual damage.", ["{{dlc|r}} No effect, as The Lost doesn't have health.", "{{dlc|r}} When turned into The Lost via the white fire, activating Sharp Plug will take the health cost from the original character's health. {{I|Holy Mantle}} will not block the health cost."]], ['{{i|Mega Blast|anr}}: Sharp Plug will not work with Mega Blast.', ['{{dlc|r}} Works as intended, giving 1 charge per half a heart.']]]

name: Black Lotus
description: Grants one Red [[Heart Container]], one {{E|Soul Heart}}, and one {{E|Black Heart}}.

name: The D6
description: Re-rolls all items in the current [[Rooms|room]] into other items, depending on the current room's [[Item Pool]].
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} The D6 is a [[special item]].'], ['{{c|Isaac}} starts with this item once it is unlocked.'], ['Since it re-rolls every item in the room, it can be more efficient to use it in rooms where multiple items are in the same room. For instance:', ['In the {{r|Shop}}, when multiple items are available for purchase.', 'In the {{r|Devil Room}}, when there are multiple deals offered.', 'In the {{r|Boss Room}} after the {{E|Mom}} fight, where both {{i|The Polaroid}} and {{i|The Negative}} can be rerolled, at the cost of the opportunity to go to the {{s|Chest}}/{{s|Dark Room}}. Once one item is picked up the other will disappear.', 'In the {{r|Boss Rush}} Room, where all 4 items can be rerolled at once.', "When {{i|There's Options}} or {{i|More Options}} spawn two items."]], ['Items from {{E|chest}}s can be rerolled.'], ['When an item pool is exhausted, every item will be rerolled to {{i|Breakfast}}.'], ['If Isaac runs out of red hearts in the {{r|Devil Room}}, then rerolls, the prices of the items switch over to soul hearts.'], ['Using the D6 on an active item yields different rerolls depending on whether you picked up the active item first.'], ['Using the D6 to reroll items duplicated with {{i|Diplopia}} will reroll all the items into different items. The copied item will not be rerolled into the same one as the original item.'], ['With {{i|Sharp Plug}} and any combination of items that can infinitely regenerate health, the D6 can be used to reroll items indefinitely.'], ["Be careful when rerolling, as it will replace the item with another item from the '''current''' room's item pool. This can be used as an advantage in various ways; for example, after defeating {{E|The Fallen}}, the item will be drawn from the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool]], so Isaac can safely roll the item into another from that pool. This behavior can also be an advantage in {{r|Angel Room}}s since {{I|Key Piece 1}} and {{I|Key Piece 2}} can be rerolled to get a free Angel Room item."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: Re-rolls twice instantly without any benefits.'], ['{{p|Soul of Isaac}}: Using the D6 re-rolls the current item and cancels alternation.']]

name: Box of Spiders
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns 1-4 [[Blue Spider]]s that deal 2.5x damage to enemies.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns 4-8 [[Blue Spider]]s that deal 2x damage to enemies.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns 1-4 [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns 4-8 [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Blue Spiders deal 2.5x Isaac's damage."], ["{{dlc|r}} Blue Spiders deal 2x Isaac's damage."]]

name: How to Jump
description: Upon use, Isaac jumps in the direction he is currently moving, allowing travel over [[obstacles]] and [[Monsters|enemies]].
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac jumps in the direction he is currently moving. The distance of the jump depends on how fast Isaac was moving and for how long he was holding the button when the item was activated. Jumping allows Isaac to travel over [[obstacles]] such as rocks and pits.'], ['While mid-jump, [[Monsters|enemies]], projectiles, {{E|bomb}}s, and [[spikes]] cannot damage Isaac. Isaac cannot interact with [[pickups]] or {{E|chest}}s mid-jump.', ["If Isaac has a Stompy trait (from items such as {{I|Leo}} and {{I|Thunder Thighs}}), rocks won't be destroyed mid-jump"]], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['How to Jump can be used to easily dodge fast moving projectiles, as jumping in any direction should mean that the projectile is gone before you land.', ['Standing still while jumping only grants invincibility for the first jump. Isaac has to move to regain invincibility while jumping']], ['If Isaac has [[flight]], Isaac dashes instead of jumping. This is functionally the same as jumping, but without the animation playing. Isaac will have invincibility during the dash, and the dash will only stop on terrain that can be walked on.', ['While flying above a pit, the dash distance will be very short.']], ['This item can also be used to pass through otherwise impassible {{r|Crawl Space}} walls.'], ["Isaac can't jump through doors, which means damage from {{r|Curse Room}} doors cannot be avoided."], ['If this item is activated by {{i|Void}}, it is possible to get stuck in an impassable area with no ability to escape. Exiting and resuming the run will place Isaac at whichever door he entered the room through.'], ['{{dlc|r}} How to Jump can be used to jump over pillars and spiked rocks safely.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{T|Broken Remote}}: No more jumping, infinite teleportation.'], ['{{T|Panic Button}}: Makes Isaac immune to contact and projectile damage while moving.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Book of Revelations
description: Increases the chance of a {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}} appearing while held. On use, gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}, and replaces the boss of the current floor with a [[Harbinger]] if possible.
effects: [['On use, gives one {{e|Soul Heart}}.'], ['Increases chance for a {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} door to open by 17.5% ({{dlc|na}}35%) if held while killing the final [[boss]] of the [[floor]].'], ["If the Book of Revelations is used at least once on a floor, a [[Harbinger]] will {{dlc|anr}} sometimes/{{dlc|r}} always replace the current floor's boss if possible."], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['Set bosses ({{e|Mom}}, {{e|Isaac}}, {{e|The Lamb}}, etc.) are unaffected by Book of Revelations.'], ['Only the first boss of a floor affected by {{cu|Labyrinth}} is affected.'], ["Book of Revelations won't replace the boss on double-sized {{r|Boss Room}}s, like [[Double Trouble]] rooms or if the boss is {{e|Mr. Fred}}.", ['Furthermore, if the Book of Revelations is used on the first floor of a Chapter with a Double Trouble room no Harbinger will spawn on the second floor, even if Book of Revelations is used again. If finding a Harbinger is desired, Isaac should wait until seeing the shape of the Boss Room before using it.']], ['Keeping Book of Revelations until [[Chapter 4]] is one of the methods to unlock achievements related to Super Meat Boy and Super Bandage Girl, [[Super Meat Boy#Book of Revelations|explained in detail here]].'], ['This item can replace the Boss even after Isaac initiates a battle with a normal boss and then teleports out before the fight is completed.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} This item can ({{dlc|r}} will) replace {{e|The Bloat}} with a Harbinger in {{chal|Aprils Fool|n}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Bosses in {{s|Downpour}} / {{s|Mines}} / {{s|Mausoleum}} and their variants cannot be replaced with Harbingers.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} This item will replace {{e|Mother}} with Death or Conquest during {{chal|Red Redemption}}.{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Gives Isaac two soul hearts.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Satanic Bible}}: The spawned {{i|Ball of Bandages}} or {{i|Cube of Meat}} will cost hearts like a normal devil deal.']]

name: Sagittarius
description: Increases [[speed]] by +0.2 and grants [[piercing tears]].
effects: [['+0.2 [[speed]]', ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.2 maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).']], ['Grants [[piercing tears]].']]
synergies: [['{{I|Lost Contact}}: Tears will pierce right through enemy projectiles, deleting them. A very strong offensive/defensive combo.']]
interactions: [['{{i|8 Inch Nails}}: Knockback overridden by Sagittarius.'], ['{{t|Blister}}: Overridden by Sagittarius.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs travel through enemies. When combined with {{I|Ipecac}}, bombs do not explode upon hitting enemies.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bombs also deal 2.5x Isaac's damage to enemies when passing through them."]], ['{{i|Pisces}}: Knockback overridden by Sagittarius.']]

name: Scapular
description: Once per room, when Isaac is reduced to his last half heart, he is granted one {{E|Soul Heart}}.
effects: [['Once per room, when Isaac is reduced to his last half [[heart]] (either red, soul, or black), the aura around his head temporarily vanishes and he is granted one {{E|Soul Heart}}.', ['After re-entering a room, the ability can be triggered again.', 'With {{E|Bone Heart}}s, the effect triggers on both half-filled and empty ones.']]]
notes: [["If the Scapular is active and Isaac is already at his last half heart, the effect won't trigger even on fatal damage.", ["{{C|Tainted Samson}} / {{I|Berserk!}}: If fatal damage activates Tainted Samson's Berserk, or if it occurs during it or during Berserk!'s effect, it will trigger and grant the soul heart."]], ['{{dlc|a}} Scapular does not charge between waves in [[Greed mode]], though it can still be recharged by moving between rooms.'], ['Does not work with {{C|The Lost}} or {{C|Keeper}}, as they cannot reach the required heart value.'], ['Reaching only half a heart remaining may be more difficult in [[Chapter 4]] onwards, since all half-heart hits are upgraded to a full heart.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Damage sources that count as "health donation" no longer activate Scapular. This includes {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}, {{M|Devil Beggar}},  {{M|Hell Game}}, {{M|Confessional}}, {{i|IV Bag}}, {{i|Razor Blade}}, {{i|Blood Rights}}, {{i|Dull Razor}}, {{i|Sharp Plug}}, {{i|Shard of Glass}}, {{i|Blood Bombs}}, and {{i|Blood Oath}}. Sacrifice Rooms and Curse Rooms spikes still activate Scapular.{{dlc-}}']]
interactions: [['{{T|Cursed Skull}}: Provided Scapular can always trigger, grants effective immortality, as the soul heart is always given before the teleport takes place.', ['+{{I|The Wafer}}: Grants true immortality, plus one hit on the soul heart, allowing the player to get hit once before teleporting.']]]

name: Bob's Rotten Head
description: Upon use, Isaac holds a [[Status Effects#Poison|poison]] {{E|bomb}} which can be thrown in the cardinal directions and explodes on impact.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac holds a [[Status Effects#Poison|poison]] {{E|bomb}} which can be thrown in the cardinal directions and explodes on impact.', ["The bomb can fly across the room for a range before falling to the ground and explode, a distance equal to that of Isaac's tears' if the player's current [[range]] is 9.50.", "{{dlc|nr}} The explosion deals a flat 50 + Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] and poisons affected enemies.", "{{dlc|r}} The explosion deals a flat 185 + Isaac's tear damage and leaves behind a gas cloud that poisons affected enemies. The poison cloud deals 5 damage.", '{{dlc|na}} The poison deals 6 or 8 points of damage over time.', "{{dlc|a}} The poison deals 3 times Isaac's tear damage over time.", '{{Dlc|r}} It will bounce off walls slightly before exploding on the floor.']], ['This item belongs to the {{Transformation|Bob}} set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into Bob.']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Sloth}}.'], ["Bob's Rotten Head is affected by many tear modifiers and some bomb modifiers. Notable exceptions and precautions are listed below."], ["Bob's Rotten Head cannot directly impact {{Machine|Beggar}}s, {{Machine|Slot Machine}}s, or {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s, just passing through, but can destroy them with the blast damage if it impacts anything nearby and open {{R|Secret Room}}s, {{R|Super Secret Room}}s, or destroy [[rocks]] like any other bomb."], ['Certain interactions require Flat Stone to be effective or work.']]
interactions: [["{{t|Bob's Bladder}} / {{i|Bob's Curse}} / {{i|Bobby-Bomb}} / {{i|Bomber Boy}} / {{i|Fast Bombs}} / {{i|Rocket in a Jar}} / {{i|Scatter Bombs}} / {{i|Mr. Mega}}: No effect."], ["{{I|Blood Bombs}}: Bob's Rotten Head leaves a pool of [[Creep#Red%20Creep|red creep]] on the ground after each explosion."], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{i|Continuum|anr}}: Bob's Rotten Head can now travel through walls and appear out of the opposite wall, similar to a portal-type mechanic.", ['{{dlc|r}} No longer travels through the wall; instead he bounces off it, like with {{i|Rubber Cement}}, and then travels for the rest of its duration and then explodes.']], ['{{I|Holy Light}}: Has a chance to throw a Holy Light head that spawns a damaging beam of light dealing ({{Dlc|nr}}4x) {{dlc|r}}3x the explosion damage when it hits an enemy.'], ['{{i|The Parasite}}: Causes two smaller tears to appear that explodes for half the damage of the head. Tears do not look like the normal head.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: Spawns four smaller heads that explodes for half the damage of the bigger one."], ["{{i|Explosivo|anr}} / {{i|Sticky Bombs|anr}}: If Bob's Rotten Head sticks to an enemy (sometimes with Explosivo, always with Sticky Bombs), the explosion is delayed but will deal 110 damage.", ['{{dlc|r}} No longer sticks to enemies.']], ["{{i|Flat Stone|r}}: Will cause Bob's Rotten Head to bounce once, exploding twice and leaving two gas clouds."], ['{{I|Fire Mind}}: Creates fire when the head lands.'], ['{{I|Godhead}}: Creates a Godhead aura around the head and applies homing effect when thrown.'], ['{{I|Haemolacria}}: When the head lands, tears are fired.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Causes the head to bounce off of [[rocks]] and walls.'], ['{{i|Sacred Heart}}: Homing effect is applied.'], ["{{i|Tiny Planet}}: When used, Bob's Rotten Head will orbit the player similar to a tear."], ['{{i|Trisagion|anr}}: Explodes multiple times before reaching its target, dealing explosive damage and knockback to Isaac.', ["{{dlc|r}}Shoots a white blast of light instead of the head that pierces through enemies, and causing explosions when it contacts an enemy (if not killing it at the first tick), an obstacle, or when it runs out of range. One tick of the beam deals 33% of Bob's Rotten Head's damage to enemies, but the resulting explosion every tick deals full damage."]], ["{{I|Uranus}}: Enemies are frozen when dying to Bob's Rotten Head."], ["[[:category:worms|Worm Trinkets]]: Bob's Rotten Head is affected by [[trinkets]] like {{t|Hook Worm}} and {{t|Wiggle Worm}} the same way tears are."]]

name: Trinity Shield
description: Isaac gains a shield that protects him from enemy shots. It aims in the direction Isaac fires from.
effects: [['Isaac uses a shield to block shots.'], ['The shield stays in the same direction until Isaac fires in another direction.']]
notes: [['The shield can block diagonally by holding down 2 arrow keys at once.', ['Tears will be fired vertically while the shield is at an angle.']], ["The shield can't block beams or explosions."], ["The shield can be held in any direction if you're using a joystick."], ["Many items that change the color of Isaac's tears will also change the color of the shield; this effect is purely cosmetic."], ['When using Tainted Forgotten, the shield goes on the bone pile and not the soul.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Marked|r}}: The shield will now face the crosshair instead of facing just four cardinal directions.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Maw of the Void}}: Trinity shield briefly stays fixed in place during the start of the effect.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Notched Axe}}: While using this item, the shield stays in place. It returns when the effect ends.']]

name: Magic Mushroom
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Makes Isaac bigger. Adds one Red [[Heart Container]], +0.3 [[Damage]], x1.5 damage multiplier, +5.25 [[Range]], and +0.3 [[Speed]], and restores all Health.
{{dlc|r}} Makes Isaac bigger. Adds one Red [[Heart Container]], +0.3 [[Damage]], x1.5 damage multiplier, +1.5 [[Range]], and +0.3 [[Speed]], and restores all Health.
interactions: [["{{i|Blood of the Martyr}} + {{i|The Book of Belial}} / {{i|Cricket's Head}} / '''Magic Mushroom''': Damage multipliers do not stack. Only the highest one is counted."], ['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: On pickup, grants 12 blood charges.']]

name: The Virus
description: Isaac [[poison]]s enemies on contact. {{dlc|nr}} -0.1 [[speed]]. {{dlc|r}} +0.2 [[speed]]. {{dlc|anr}} Poisoned enemies have a chance to drop a black heart when killed.
effects: [['Inflicts [[poison]] on enemies who make contact with Isaac.', ['{{dlc|na}} The poison deals 2 damage per tick (3 damage per second) and lasts for 2-3 ticks.', "{{dlc|ana+}} The poison deals Isaac's damage per tick (1.5x Isaac's damage per second) and lasts for 2-3 ticks.", "{{dlc|a+nr}} The poison deals Isaac's damage per tick (1.5x Isaac's damage per second) and lasts for 6 ticks for [[Monsters|normal enemies]] and 3 ticks for [[bosses]].", '{{dlc|r}} The poison lasts for 6-7 ticks and deals damage equal to (0.2']], ['HeartContainers^2) + 2, where HeartContainers is the total number of [[Health#Red_Heart_Containers|heart containers]] and {{E|bone heart}}s Isaac has.', ['The poison can be continuously applied to bosses, which normally are immune to status effects for a brief time after being inflicted with one.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Lets Isaac deal 24 contact damage per tick on top of applying poison (48 damage per second).'], ['{{dlc|anr}} Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop [[Black Heart]]s.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.1 [[speed]] down.', ["{{dlc|na}} This is not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated."]], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.2 [[speed]] up.'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|anr}} The black heart is only dropped if the poison was caused by The Virus. The item's effect doesn't extend to poison tears."], ["{{dlc|anr}} If an enemy doesn't do contact damage, The Virus can safely be applied to it for more chances at black hearts. {{E|Fly|display=Flies}}, {{E|Mulligan}}s, and {{E|Host}}s are the most common enemies this can be applied to.", ['{{dlc|anr}} With {{i|Skatole}}, {{E|Hive}}s and {{E|Swarmer}}s will constantly spawn normal Flies, meaning they can be endless sources of Black Hearts.', "{{dlc|na+}} Although {{E|Stoney|display=Stonies}} and {{E|Shopkeeper}}s can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched."]], ["Enemies won't start taking poison damage if they are pushing up against Isaac; The Virus will be constantly trying to apply poison and refreshing the ticks where poison damage would occur.", ['{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Gnawed Leaf}} and The Virus can still work if Isaac has a short-range orbital such as {{i|Cube of Meat}} or {{i|Ball of Bandages}}, as it will kill enemies pushing against Isaac that are not taking poison damage while still dropping Black Hearts.']]]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb The Virus it turns into a green locust that poisons enemies.'], ['[[Invulnerability]]: Contact while invincible poisons enemies.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Odd Mushroom (Large)}}: The speed down from the Virus does not stack with the Odd Mushroom; if both are collected, only a total of -0.1 applies.']]

name: Roid Rage
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +0.6 [[speed]], +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc+|r}} +0.3 [[speed]], +1.50 [[range]]{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +0.6 [[speed]]'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]]'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.3 [[speed]]'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.50 [[range]]'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]]'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]

name: Raw Liver
description: Grants 2 [[Red Heart container]]s and completely restores [[health]].
interactions: [['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: Grants 12 blood charges.']]

name: Wooden Spoon
description: Increases [[speed]] by 0.3.

name: Mom's Heels
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]], enemies that touch Isaac take 12 damage.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Makes Isaac deal 12 contact damage per tick (24 damage per second).'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: The Bean
description: Isaac farts, [[poison]]ing any enemy in close range.
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Ghost Pepper}}: Poison farts shoot a fire behind Isaac. Two flames will be shot if Isaac also has {{I|Car Battery}}.'], ['{{t|Gigante Bean}}: The fart deals 10 additional damage.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Second Hand}}: The poison duration is not affected.']]

name: Teleport!
description: Teleports Isaac to a random [[Rooms|room]] on the current [[Chapters|floor]].
effects: [['Teleports Isaac to a random [[Rooms|room]] on the current [[Chapters|floor]].']]
notes: [['It is possible to teleport to the {{R|Secret Room}} or {{R|Super Secret Room}}.'], ['It is not possible to teleport to the {{R|I AM ERROR}} room.'], ['It is not possible to teleport to the {{R|Crawl Space}} for the floor or the {{R|Black Market}}.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{mode|greed}} It is possible to teleport to a {{R|Super Secret Room}} with no doors, resulting in the player being stuck.']]

name: Lucky Foot
description:
+1 [[luck]]. Increases chance of winning {{M|Shell Game}}s and {{M|Fortune Telling Machine}}s (independent from the luck stat).
{{dlc|r}} Converts all bad [[pill]]s into good pills, without identifying them.
effects: [['+1 [[luck]].'], ['Increases chances of winning at {{M|Shell Game}}, {{Machine|Hell Game}},  {{M|Slot Machine}}, {{M|Fortune Telling Machine}}, and {{M|Confessional}}.'], ['Increases chances of getting a room-clearing drop (independent from the luck stat).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Converts all "bad" [[pill]]s into their "good" counterparts but doesn\'t affect neutral ones, like {{i|PHD}}. Pills remain unidentified.']]
notes: [['{{C|Cain}} starts with this item by default.']]
interactions: [['{{i|False PHD}}: Pills can both be good or bad again. Taking a bad pill still applies the benefits from False PHD.'], ['{{t|Lucky Toe}}: The extra luck-independent chance of room clearing drops from Lucky Toe applies only in a diminished form, unless at zero or negative luck. This bonus from Lucky Foot is still retained.']]

name: Pentagram
description: +1 [[damage]], increases {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} chance by 10%.
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ['Increases chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} door to open by 10%.', ['Chance is increased by 15% with two Pentagrams.']], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [['If the Devil Room item pool is depleted, {{i|Sacrificial Altar}} will spawn one or two Pentagrams.']]

name: Lord of the Pit
description: Grants [[flight]] and +0.3 [[speed]].
effects: [['Grants [[Flight]].'], ["+0.3 [[speed]] ({{dlc|na}} not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated).\n== Notes =="], ['{{i|Spirit of the Night}} costs the same amount of Red Hearts as Lord of the Pit, while granting [[spectral tears]] instead of increased speed. It´s strongly recommended to take Spirit of the Night if the player has the choice.']]
notes: [['{{i|Spirit of the Night}} costs the same amount of Red Hearts as Lord of the Pit, while granting [[spectral tears]] instead of increased speed. It´s strongly recommended to take Spirit of the Night if the player has the choice.']]

name: The Mark
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one {{e|Soul Heart}}, +1 [[damage]], and +0.2 [[speed]].
{{dlc+|r}} Grants one {{e|Black Heart}}, +1 [[damage]], and +0.2 [[speed]].{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Grants one {{e|soul heart}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Grants one {{e|black heart}}.'], ['+1 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[speed]].'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]

name: We Need to Go Deeper!
description: Creates a trapdoor to go to the next [[Chapters|floor]]. {{dlc|r}} Once per floor, using it on tiles with special graphics will instead create a {{r|Crawl Space}}.
effects: [['Spawns a trapdoor that leads to the next [[Chapters|floor]] upon activation.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} There is a 10% chance the trapdoor will instead lead into a {{R|Crawl Space}}.', '{{Dlc|r}} Some tiles will appear with a special graphic (for example grass or a piece of garbage in {{s|Basement}}). Using this item on these tiles will guarantee a {{R|Crawl Space}}. Only one trapdoor to the Crawl Space can be made per floor, as all subsequent uses will guarantee a trapdoor to the next floor.', 'If used in {{s|Womb}} II/{{s|Utero}} II/{{s|Scarred Womb}} II, the trapdoor will always lead to {{s|Sheol}}.']]]
notes: [['If more than one {{R|Crawl Space}} trapdoor exists, they will all lead to the same {{R|Crawl Space}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Has no effect in the {{S|Cathedral}}, {{S|Chest}}, {{Stage|Sheol}}, {{Stage|Dark Room}}, {{dlc|a}}{{S|???}} and {{Dlc|a+}}{{Stage|The Void}} (no trapdoors of any type will be generated).', ['{{Dlc|r}} Can only create crawl space trapdoors in the aforementioned stages and in {{S|Corpse}} II, {{S|Home}} and during the [[Ascent]].']], ['A trapdoor cannot be placed in front of a {{R|Secret Room}} entrance position, making this item an indirect aid to locating Secret Rooms.'], ['This item can be used to destroy [[rocks]] if used while Isaac is [[flight|flying]] over a rock.'], ['This item can be used to create a trapdoor to {{s|Sheol}} on {{Stage|Womb}}, even before Sheol has been unlocked.'], ['When used on the last floor of a [[Challenges|challenge]], a trapdoor to the next floor can spawn. If it is entered, Isaac must beat the boss of that floor to spawn the ending trophy.', ['{{Dlc|r}} While trapdoors will no longer spawn on challenges on floors at the final destination, certain challenges like [[Red Redemption]] may still spawn a trapdoor leading to the next floor.']], ['{{dlc|a+}} The item may be used on the [[dirt patch]]es in the {{s|Dark Room}} to dig up a random type of [[Chests|chest]].']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{I|Car Battery}}: In most cases, no extra effect. When used near the entrances to a room, the item can occasionally open 2 trapdoors at once, {{Dlc|nr}} increasing the chance of opening a {{r|Crawl Space}}. {{dlc|r}} When using We Need To Go Deeper! on a special tile, the {{r|Crawl Space}} will not spawn because the normal trapdoor will spawn on top of the {{r|Crawl Space}} trapdoor (unless the player is in a floor where they’re unable to skip).']]

name: Spider Bite
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[slow|slowing tears]], reducing speed of enemy movement and any projectile fired by them.
effects: [['Adds a 25% chance to shoot [[slow|slowing tears]], reducing the speed of enemy movement and any projectile fired by them.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [['The slow duration is 2.5 seconds.'], ['The slow effect chance depends on the [[luck]] stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(4 - (Luck / 5)). At base luck (0), the chance is 25%, maxing out at 100% at 15 luck.', ["Due to how this formula works, increases in activation rate are only seen with every 5 points of luck, as this formula rounds down after dividing Isaac's luck by 5."]]]
synergies: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: The beam turns light pink and can slow enemies.'], ['{{i|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the slow effect.'], ['{{I|Technology}}/{{I|Technology 2}}/{{I|Tech.5}}/{{I|Tech X}}: The laser turns light pink and can slow enemies.']]

name: Spelunker Hat
description: Reveals type of adjacent rooms, including location for {{R|Secret Room}}s and {{R|Super Secret Room}}s.

name: Remote Detonator
description: {{E|Bomb}}s placed by Isaac only explode when Remote Detonator is used. Gives 5 bombs.
effects: [['Activating the Remote Detonator will cause all {{E|bomb}}s placed by Isaac to explode.'], ['Bombs will no longer explode without the usage of the detonator.'], ['Gives 5 bombs when picked up. If the item is picked up a second time in the same run, this effect will not be applied.']]
notes: [['Remote Detonator gives Isaac five bombs for the price of three (using the bombs on the {{M|Donation Machine}} to trade for coins) when bought at a {{R|Shop}}, making its purchase a good value if the player is low on bombs.', ['{{dlc|r}} The Donation Machine explodes once bombed and while it drops many coins, it is destroyed for the rest of the run']], ['Remote Detonator does not control the explosions of {{E|Troll Bomb}}s and {{E|Mega troll bomb}}s.'], ['It does control throwable bombs spat out by {{E|Bomb Grimace}}s, once picked up. The bombs can be carried throughout rooms without ever exploding until Remote Detonator is used, making a Bomb Grimace essentially equivalent to a Golden Bomb with this item.'], ['If {{E|Chub}} or {{E|Carrion Queen}} swallow a remote bomb, the bomb will be released from them after the animation unless it is detonated manually.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Best Friend}}/{{i|Mr. Boom}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: The active item bombs are affected by remote detonator.'], ["{{T|Bob's Bladder}}: Undetonated bombs can be used to maximize creep damage."], ['{{i|Bobby-Bomb}}: Bombs placed will chase after the enemy, making it easier to do massive amounts of damage to enemies.'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Curse of the Tower}}: The Troll Bombs generated upon taking damage will not explode until the Remote Detonator is used, unlike normal Troll Bombs.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Remote Detonator can be used to detonate the fired bombs early, which can be useful against moving enemies.'], ['{{I|Eye of Belial}}: Bombs can be shot to gain the full effect of the eye. Especially useful on bosses that do not spawn enemies.'], ['{{i|Number Two}}: The bombs automatically dropped by No. 2 will not detonate on their own, greatly reducing the risk of accidental explosive self-damage.'], ['{{I|Rocket in a Jar}}: Rockets do not explode on impact with surfaces, requiring manual detonation.', ["'''Rocket in a Jar + Dr. Fetus:''' Rockets fired with Dr. Fetus will still explode on impact, but can be manually detonated."]]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Scatter Bombs}}: Remote Detonator can be used on the original bomb, but not on the small bombs that are spawned.']]

name: Portable Slot
description: Upon use, consumes 1 {{E|penny}} and has a chance to drop a random [[pickup]], like a {{M|Slot Machine}}.
effects: [['Upon use, consumes 1 {{E|Penny}} and has a chance to drop a random [[pickup]], like a {{M|Slot Machine}}.', ['Unlike a {{M|Slot Machine}}, the default reaction to using a bad [[Pill]] will occur if the Portable Slot grants nothing.']]]
notes: [["Unlike normal Slot Machines, the Portable Slot can't explode, nor can it drop {{i|A Dollar}}, although it can still grant [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]]."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Crystal Ball
description: Upon use, reveals the map (except the {{R|Super Secret Room}}) and drops a {{e|Soul Heart}} or random [[tarot card|card/rune]].
effects: [['Reveals the [[Chapters|floor]] layout and all special rooms except the {{R|Super Secret Room}}.'], ['Drops either a {{e|Soul Heart}} or a random [[Cards and Runes|card or rune]]. (50% chance of either)'], ['{{dlc|r}} While held, increases the chance of finding a {{R|Planetarium}} by 15%, or 100% if a treasure room has been skipped.']]
notes: [['The map revealing effect will not work if the {{cu|Lost}} is active.'], ["It's possible to get more than one Crystal Ball from {{M|Fortune Telling Machine}}s on a single run."], ["{{dlc|r}} The Planetarium bonus guarantees the level generation to ''attempt'' placing one, but the level layout may not have enough room. Read the article on {{r|Planetarium}}s for further details."]]
interactions: [["{{t|Daemon's Tail}}: The chance to drop cards or runes will change to 90%/10% in favor of cards."]]

name: The Pinking Shears
description: Separates Isaac's head from his body for the current [[Rooms|room]], granting [[flight]] and turning the body into a [[familiar]] that chases enemies.
effects: [["Separates Isaac's head and body for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Isaac's head, which now has [[flight]], will be under the player's control, while his body will seek out enemies to attack by contact damage.", ["The body's movement speed is dependent on Isaac's [[speed]].", '{{dlc|nr}} The body deals 5.5 damage per tick, or up to 82.5 damage per second.', '{{dlc|r}} The body deals 5.5 damage per tick. <!--Tick rate was lowered. The current DPS needs to be added.-->']]]
notes: [["The damage of the body [[familiar]] is independent of Isaac's stats. Its damage per second is the highest of all chasing familiars."], ["{{dlc|r}} If Isaac's body is not visible (for example, through the effects of {{i|Transcendence}} or previous uses of the Pinking Shears), the familiar will take upon a ghost-like body, similar to the Lost's body type."], ['If used multiple times in the same room (via battery pickups, for example), more instances of the body familiar can be spawned.'], ['Compared to the original game, where the {{e|Gusher}} sometimes walked aimlessly around the room, this version actively chases enemies.'], ['If Isaac switches active items while The Pinking Shears is in effect, the body will immediately despawn for the rest of the room.'], ['The body familiar will avoid [[creep]], and will consequently rarely damage enemies like {{e|Brain}}s and {{e|Blighted Ovum}} that leave creep trails as they walk, instead opting to stand right next to them.'], ['Using The Pinking Shears just above an obstacle results in the body becoming stuck in the terrain, making it useless until the obstacle is destroyed.']]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Damage dealt by the body is doubled.'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Two bodies are spawned at once.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}: Only the head needs to be moved by the {{c|Tainted Soul}}.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Scissors}}: If Scissors and Pinking Shears are used together, control is given back to an invisible head with only a shadow visible as both the head and body are mobilized to attack.'], ["{{I|Guillotine}}: Using The Pinking Shears after picking up Guillotine results in the head revolving around a shadow, making Isaac's hitbox difficult to determine."], ['{{I|The Intruder}}: If the familiar is released after Pinking Shears are used, control is given back to an invisible head with only a shadow visible. This is due to both the head (the spider) and the body being mobilized to attack.']]

name: Anarchist Cookbook
description: Spawns six {{e|Troll Bomb}}s around the [[room]].
notes: [['This item can drop from {{e|Pride}}.'], ['Although visually unchanged, all passive {{E|bomb}} effect items affect the spawned Troll Bombs unless otherwise noted.'], ['The Troll Bombs created by Anarchist Cookbook spawn in one at a time; if Isaac leaves the [[room]] soon after using it, not all 6 Troll Bombs will spawn.'], ['Using this item without any blast protection is not always recommended as it is very easy to be caught in the blast.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{I|Glitter Bombs}}: Each troll bomb has a chance to spawn a [[pickup]] or a [[trinket]] including batteries for repeated use.'], ['{{I|Remote Detonator}}: The Troll Bombs generated will not explode until Remote Detonator is activated, unlike regular Troll Bombs.'], ['{{T|Safety Scissors}}: Spawned troll bombs become bomb pickups.'], ['{{I|Pyromaniac}}: Spawned bombs can be used for mass healing.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Bomber Boy}}: Not recommended. The cross pattern explosion makes it very hard to avoid taking damage.'], ['{{i|Mr. Mega}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Scatter Bombs|a+}}: Not recommended. Each Troll Bomb will spawn several smaller bombs upon exploding, making it very hard to avoid taking damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} No visual change can be seen with the Troll Bombs, but the smaller bombs have the sprite of the smaller normal bombs.']]]

name: Best Friend
description: Spawns a decoy Isaac that explodes after 5 seconds. Enemies will always target the decoy and ignore Isaac.
notes: [['All {{E|bomb}} modifier items will affect Best Friend, with the exception of {{i|Bobby-Bomb}}, {{i|Bomber Boy|force=nr}}, {{i|Fast Bombs}}, {{i|Mr. Mega}}, and {{i|Rocket in a Jar}}.', ['{{i|Scatter Bombs}} will create mini decoys.']], ['Bosses such as {{E|Chub}} or {{E|Carrion Queen}} can swallow the decoy bomb just like a regular bomb.'], ['Isaac can push the decoy bomb by walking into it or shooting it with his tears just like regular bombs.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Spawns two decoys on top of each other.'], ['{{i|Remote Detonator}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: The decoy bomb is affected by remote detonator.']]

name: A Lump of Coal
description: The more distance tears travel, the more damage they will do.
notes: [["A Lump of Coal can be found as a drop from {{E|Krampus}}, a possible payout of {{I|Mystery Gift}}, or using {{I|Spindown Dice}} on {{I|Guppy's Paw}}."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Godhead}}: Tears and more importantly their auras will increase in size and damage the farther they travel.'], ["{{t|Hook Worm}}: The movement pattern increases Coal's damage at the same effective distance."], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Increases the tear's damage and size the farther the tear is from Isaac. Even at close range, it will still do about +3.5 damage."], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Hitting enemies with tears that initially missed will grant possibly considerable extra damage.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears will increase their damage and size as they travel, and they are not limited by range.'], ["{{i|Soy Milk}}: Coal's flat damage increase is not affected by Soy Milk's multiplier, so tears gain the full benefit from Coal."], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The movement pattern allows much longer airtime and reasonably easy way to hit enemies with the powered-up tears.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Despite the tears visually growing while they hover, they will still only deal bonus damage based strictly on how far they travel. If the enemy hits the tears by running into them, Coal will add no damage.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Tears no longer grow while hovering.']], ['{{i|Athame}}: Damage of the Athame ring is halved.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The ring deals normal damage.']], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: {{dlc|na}} +2 flat damage.', ['{{dlc|a}} Beam will gradually increase in size and damage the farther it travels, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance.', "'''Brimstone''' + {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Makes the Brimstone circle widen and deal damage based on how far away it is from your character.  At very close ranges, the damage is ''reduced'' to about 73% (unlike normal Coal effects)."]], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: No benefit though the bombs appear darker.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: No benefit.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears will grow until they burst, though their actual damage bonus is only based on distance traveled. Burst tears will also grow as they travel.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: No benefit from an additional Lump.'], ['{{i|Maw of the Void}}: Damage of the Maw ring is halved.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The ring deals normal damage.']], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: No benefit. The Knife becomes a very dark brown."], ['{{t|Ouroboros Worm}}/{{t|Ring Worm}}: The peculiar movement patterns result in overall less damage from the same effective distance.'], ["{{i|Proptosis}}: Proptosis scales with Isaac's damage while the Coal does not. At base damage, tears will have approximately the same damage at any range; with increased damage, tears do more damage up close."], ['{{i|Technology}} / {{i|Technology 2}}: No benefit.', ['{{dlc|a}} Damage increases the further away the enemy is, on a multiplier that is roughly +20% per tile of distance.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: The laser ring will grow as the ring distances itself from the player, but will shrink as the player approaches it. Damage increases the further away the enemy is.', ['{{dlc|r}} The damage increase per tile is significantly lower.']], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: The damage of the blasts is increased by a negligible amount.']]

name: Mom's Coin Purse
description: Spawns 4 random [[pill]]s near Isaac.
effects: [['Spawns 4 random [[pill]]s near Isaac.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Starter Deck}}: Drops four cards/runes rather than pills.']]

name: Book of Shadows
description: Creates a protective [[shield]], nullifying all types of damage in the current room for 10 seconds.
notes: [['The Book of Shadows effect negates [[health]] loss from {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{Machine|Devil Beggar}}s, {{Machine|Hell Game}} and {{Machine|Confessional}}.', ['Does not prevent damage from {{i|IV Bag}}.']]]
synergies: [['{{I|4.5 Volt}}: With sufficient damage (18+ damage per second), the Book of Shadows can be kept active indefinitely.', ['If combined with {{I|9 Volt}}, Isaac only needs 12 DPS to achieve invulnerability.']], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Doubles the duration of invulnerability.'], ['{{I|Cube of Meat}} and most other orbitals: Highly effective with Book of Shadows, as Isaac can run into enemies with an active shield to deal massive amounts of damage.'], ['{{i|Razor Blade|nr}}: Can be used at no cost while the Book of Shadows shield is present, allowing damage to be significantly increased for the room.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Blood Oath}}: If the book is used just before the knife stabs Isaac, he will not lose any health, nor gain any stat upgrades associated with the item. An incredibly useful item to find in {{chal|Bloody Mary|n}}.']]

name: Dry Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and blocks enemy projectiles. Upon blocking a shot, it has a chance of triggering {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and blocks enemy projectiles. Upon blocking a shot, it has a 10% chance of triggering {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect, dealing 40 damage to all enemies in the room.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{i|The Necronomicon}} effect can occur multiple times in the same room.'], ['It can be used to block multiple shots if positioned correctly.'], ["It sometimes layers itself above {{i|Isaac's Heart}}, protecting it from nearly all projectile damage."], ['This item can rarely drop from [[Rocks|skulls]].']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Missing Page 2}}/{{T|A Missing Page}}: Doubles damage of Dry Baby, from 40 to 80.', ['If both are held at the same time, triples damage of Dry Baby, from 40 to 120.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect on damage or blocking radius; only the visual size is changed.']]

name: Rotten Meat
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.

name: Stigmata
description: +0.3 [[damage]], grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Odd Mushroom (Thin)
description: +1.7 [[tears]], +0.3 [[speed]], slightly reduces [[damage]].
effects: [['+1.7 [[tears]].'], ['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ["Makes Isaac's head smaller, which on its own is only a visual effect.", ['If combined with other size downs, the Mushroom also affects his hitbox.']], ['Reduces [[damage]] using the following formula: (Damage Ups from other items'], ['0.9) - 0.4.'], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [['There are two collectible items in the game named [[Odd Mushroom]]; you can tell them apart from the sprites.'], ["This item affects damage differently than other items in the game. Instead of multiplying your damage stat, it directly alters the total added damage from other items. In practice, this means this item reduces your damage significantly if you have no items that grant extra damage (x0.72), but won't have as strong of an impact as you collect more 'damage up' items."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Odd Mushroom (Thin)}}: Multiple copies of the item will grant a speed and fire rate boost with no additional decrease in damage.']]

name: Tough Love
description: Adds a chance to shoot a tooth instead of a tear, which deals x3.2 Isaac's [[damage]].
effects: [["Adds a chance to shoot a tooth instead of a tear, which deals x3.2 Isaac's [[damage]]."]]
notes: [['The chance for this to occur increases with [[Luck]]. The activation rate is equal to 1/(10 - Luck). At base Luck (0), the chance is 10%, maxing out at 100% at 9 Luck<ref>[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing|The Binding of Isaac Item Trigger Testing]</ref>.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Apple!}}: With 14 [[Luck]], overrides Tough Love. With 13 Luck, Apple and Tough Love each have about an equal chance to trigger.'], ['{{i|Brimstone|na}}: Overridden by Brimstone.', ['{{dlc|a}} Occasionally fires Brimstone beam with damage multiplier of Tough Love.']], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|Compound Fracture}}: Teeth will split into smaller teeth."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus|nr}}: Bombs explode with the increased blast damage and radius of {{i|Mr. Mega}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Adds a chance for the bombs to deal increased damage. See the page for the specific damage formula.']], ['{{i|Fire Mind}}: Adds a [[Tears (weapon)#Flaming Tears|flaming]] effect to the teeth, {{dlc|nr}} but without the chance of exploding.'], ['{{i|ipecac}}: Teeth explode with the increased blast damage of {{i|Mr. Mega}}.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife|nr}}: Overridden by Mom's Knife.", ['{{dlc|r}}: Both damage multipliers apply, combined damage multiplier is x6.4.']], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Tears will not appear as teeth but may still gain the damage multiplier.'], ['{{t|Jawbreaker}}: Activation rates are individually applied to each tear, effectively allowing for higher amounts of teeth. At 9 Luck, the trinket is no longer needed, as Tough Love will already guarantee that every shot is a tooth.'], ["{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear occasionally flicks to being a tooth, which deals 3.2x Isaac's tear damage, before immediately returning to being a normal tear. The frequency at which the tear very briefly transforms into a tooth increases with [[Luck]], permanently becoming a tooth at 9 Luck."], ['{{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears will not turn into teeth.'], ['{{i|Spirit Sword}}: Both the sword and projectiles can deal increased damage.']]

name: Mutant Spider
description: Grants quadruple shot but decreases [[Tears]].
effects: [['Isaac fires 4 tears at the same time.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears down: (Delay'], ['2.1) + 3.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears fired per second'], ['0.42.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Mutant Spider is a [[special item]].'], ['The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating {{i|20/20}}, {{i|The Inner Eye}}, Mutant Spider and {{i|The Wiz}} is 16, or 20 with the {{C|Keeper}}.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Mutant Spider it creates four locusts instead of one.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Cursed Eye}}: Shoots 4 shots out of each eye, for a total of 16 tears when fully charged.'], ["{{i|Doctor's Remote}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Replaces the single missile strike with a barrage of four consecutive missiles."], ['{{dlc|anr}}{{i|The Inner Eye}}: Shoots 7 tears with no further decrease in fire rate.', ['{{dlc|r}} Shoots 5 tears with no further decrease in fire rate.']], ['{{i|Mutant Spider}}: Fires 8 tears with no further decrease in tear delay.', ['{{dlc|r}} Each copy of the item adds +2 tears up to the maximum of 16.']], ['{{i|Polyphemus}}: Tear rate is not lowered further. Damage is increased by a flat +5 instead of normal Polyphemus boost.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: All tears are fired along the beam.']]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|na+}} {{i|20/20}}: Overridden by Mutant Spider.', ['{{dlc|anr}} Shoots 6 tears.', '{{dlc|r}} Removes the fire rate penalty while reducing damage to 75%. Additional copies will add one additional tear with no further change to damage/fire rate.']], ['{{dlc|anr}} {{C|Keeper}}: Fires 7 tears with significantly increased tear delay.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires 5 tears with significantly increased tear delay.']], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Keeper}}: Fires 6 tears with significantly increased tear delay.'], ['{{I|the ludovico technique}}: The tear gains 3 orbiting tears.'], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}}: Only occasionally fires one tear in the other three directions."], ["{{Dlc|na+}} {{i|Mom's Eye}}: No effect.", ['{{dlc|a+}} Fires three shots out of each eye.']], ["{{I|Monstro's Lung}}: Adds 7 tears to the barrage with a significant increase in tear delay."], ['{{i|Pupula Duplex|a+}} + {{i|Lachryphagy|n}}: The four shots instantly fuse and burst.'], ['{{i|Sad Bombs}} / {{I|varicose veins}} / {{I|it hurts}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|The Wiz}}: Four shots are fired in each direction.']]

name: Toothpicks
description: +0.7 [[tears]], +0.16 [[shot speed]].
effects: [['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['+0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['Tear color becomes red.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Spindown Dice}}: Turns into {{I|Sacred Heart}} when rerolled by Spindown Dice.']]

name: Squeezy
description: Increases [[tears]] by 0.4, spawns 2 {{E|Soul Heart}}s.
effects: [['+0.4 [[tears]].'], ['Spawns two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.']]

name: Speed Ball
description: +0.3 [[speed]], +0.2 [[shot speed]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ['+0.2 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]

name: Sister Maggy
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around shooting tears that deal 3.5 damage.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around shooting tears that deal 6 damage.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and shoots normal tears.', ['These tears appear red, but have no special effects.', '{{dlc|nr}} Tears deal 3.5 damage, and are fired once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Tears deal 6 damage, and are fired once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Sister Maggy is functionally identical to {{i|Brother Bobby}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Sister Maggy deals more damage than {{i|Brother Bobby}}, while Brother Bobby has a higher tear rate.']]

name: PHD
description: Converts all bad [[pills]] into good pills, spawns one pill pickup, and identifies all pills. Restores two {{E|Red Heart}}s and increases the payout of {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s.
effects: [['Identifies all [[pills]] upon pickup.'], ['Spawns a pill.'], ['Replenishes 2 {{E|red heart}}s.'], ['Adds 0-2 coins to the payout every time you use a {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} or {{i|IV Bag}}.', ['In [[hard mode]], adds exactly 1 coin to the payout.']], ['Converts some "bad" pills into their "good" counterparts or removes their bad effects:']]
notes: [['Bad pills already obtained/dropped will be converted to their "good" counterparts.'], ['If PHD is lost in any way, such as rerolling by the {{i|D4}} or a {{R|Dice Room}}, or dropping it as {{dlc|r}}{{c|Tainted Isaac}}, pills will remain fully identified, but negative pills will not be converted.'], ['{{dlc|a+}} Performing a [[RERUN]] with a character that held PHD will still prevent negative pills from spawning, but will no longer identify pills until used.'], ['As bad pills will turn into good pills, it is possible for two different colored pills to have the same effect.']]
interactions: [['{{i|False PHD}}: Pills can both be good or bad again. Taking a bad pill still applies the benefits from False PHD.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{C|Keeper}} / {{C|Tainted Keeper}}: {{m|Blood Donation Machine}}s will not produce more coins and they will still have a chance to fail.']]

name: Blood Rights
quote: Mass enemy damage at a cost
description: Upon use, takes a full heart of [[health]] and deals 40 damage to all enemies in the [[room]].
notes: [["If Isaac doesn't have the required {{E|Red Heart}}s or filled {{E|Bone Heart}}s, then {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, and empty Bone Hearts are taken instead."], ['Using this item does not affect {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} chances.'], ['Using this item as {{C|The Lost}} will kill The Lost, even if the protective effect from {{i|Holy Mantle}} is still active.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{T|A Missing Page}}/{{I|Missing Page 2}}: Doubles damage, from 40 to 80.', ['If both are held, triples damage, from 40 to 120.']], ['{{bov}}'], ["{{dlc+|a+}} {{i|Habit}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: Taking damage from Blood Rights grants a point of charge to Isaac's other held active item.{{dlc-}}"], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Blood Rights doesn't deal damage to Isaac, allowing it to be used repeatedly with no penalty."], ["{{dlc|nr}} [[Shield]]/[[Invulnerability]]: Blood Rights can be used without taking damage for the duration of the shield or invulnerability. Temporary invincibility frames from recently taking damage will not protect against this item's damage."], ['{{i|The Wafer}}: Reduces the damage dealt to Isaac to half a heart.'], ["{{i|Birthright}} &{{c|Judas}}: Actives the effect of {{i|Razor Blade}} alongside it's normal effect."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{dlc|r}}[[Shield|Shields]]/[[Invulnerability]]: Will not protect against this item's damage."]]

name: The Book of Belial
description:
{{dlc+|na}} +2 [[damage]] for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Passively guarantees a {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} will appear while held.{{dlc-}}
{{dlc+|a}} +2 [[damage]] for the current [[Rooms|room]]. Passively increases the chance of finding a {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} while held.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['Gives +2 [[damage]] for the current [[Rooms|room]].'], ['{{dlc|na}} Guarantees the {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} to spawn after killing a [[boss]] while holding it.'], ['{{dlc|a}} Increases the chance to open the {{r|Devil Room}} or {{r|Angel Room}} after killing a [[boss]] by 12.5% while holding it.'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['{{C|Judas}} starts with this item by default.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The damage bonus does not stack with multiple uses in the same room or with {{p|XV - The Devil}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Additional uses in the same room or combined with {{p|XV - The Devil}} give +1 damage per use.']], ['While activated, switching items will end the bonus damage effect.'], ['If the {{I|Schoolbag}} and a second activated item are held, the book must be equipped in the primary slot to receive the {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}} bonus.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Only guarantees Devil/Angel Rooms on floors that they can normally appear on, and, unlike {{i|Goat Head}}, picking up The Book of Belial after killing the boss will not open the Devil/Angel Room door.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Blood of the Martyr}}: Causes The Book of Belial to apply a 1.5x damage multiplier on top of its normal effect. This multiplier cannot stack with multipliers from {{i|Cricket's Head}} or {{i|Magic Mushroom}}."], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery|r}}: Gives +3 damage for the current room.']]

name: The Book of Sin
description: Generates a random [[pickup]], [[pill]], [[card]], or [[rune]].

name: The Candle
description: Throws out a flame that damages everything in its path, diminishing in size as it travels.
effects: [['On use, Isaac raises the candle above his head. On pressing a fire button, a blue flame, similar to a {{E|blue fire place}}, will fire in the chosen direction, extinguishing itself after a fixed time of approximately two seconds.'], ['The flame deals 23 damage per damage tick.', ['The maximum damage dealt by a single flame is around 276, dealing damage roughly 6 times per second.']], ['The flame also destroys enemy shots it comes into contact with.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} While Isaac holds the candle above his head, his movement speed is reduced.'], ["Will block Isaac's tears, unlike {{I|Red Candle}} and won't burn him."], ['Flames do not drop any collectibles when doused.'], ['The flame can destroy {{E|shopkeeper}}s.'], ['The flame projectile can pass over Pits, but can not travel through Rocks or Poop.'], ['The flames from this item can put out {{E|fire place}}s.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: D20
description: Rerolls all [[pickup]]s in the current [[room]].
effects: [['Randomizes all [[pickup]]s, [[chest]]s, and [[trinket]]s within a [[Rooms|room]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} The empty chest object that is left behind after opening any kind of chest can be re-rolled.'], ["Cannot re-roll pickups into {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}, but can re-roll pickups into {{E|Grab Bag}}s which can contain Lil' Batteries.", ["{{dlc|r}} Can re-roll pickups into Lil' Batteries and other battery pickups."]], ['It can re-roll pickups into chests or trinkets and vice versa.', ['On {{s|Chest}} and {{s|Dark Room}}, the re-rolled chests will always contain items unless they are a {{E|Red Chest}}.', 'Re-rolls create trinkets far less often than pickups and chests.']], ['It can re-roll pickups in the {{r|Shop}}.'], ['Re-rolling pickups duplicated by {{p|Rune of Jera}}, {{i|Diplopia}} and {{i|Crooked Penny}} will result on both the original item and the duplicate being the exact same pickup.', ['{{Dlc+|r}} Can re-roll both items created by {{I|Options?}}, but only one can still be taken.{{dlc-}}']], ['{{A|Golden Trinket}}s rerolled by D20 will cause the resulting pickup to have the golden effect applied to it. If this is a trinket, the affected trinket will act as a normal golden trinket would, otherwise the gold effect will do nothing and will disappear upon leaving and reentering the room.', ['Additionally, items spawned by chests with the gold effect applied will be golden as well, however other pickups dropped by chests will not be.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Can reroll coins dropped by {{c|Tainted Keeper}} into other pickups, but they will still disappear if not picked up quickly.']]
interactions: [["{{dlc|r}} When used to reroll pickups in {{c|Tainted Keeper}}'s special shops, pickups may be rerolled into items instead."]]

name: Dad's Key
description: Upon activation, opens all doors in the current [[room]] in almost all circumstances, including doors which require a {{e|Key}} to open, entrances to {{r|Secret Room}}s, and the door to {{e|Mega Satan}}.

name: Dead Sea Scrolls
description: Triggers the effect of a random [[activated item]] from a list of possible options (not every activated item is included).
notes: [["When Bob's Rotten Head or Shoop Da Whoop! is chosen, Dead Sea Scrolls will not lose its charge until said item is thrown or released.", ['This allows Isaac to press Spacebar again if need be to skip over said items in the rotation while keeping full charge, allowing it to be used again for a different effect.', ["This doesn't work if Bethany has Soul Charges and Book of Virtues."]]], ["It may be helpful to use Dead Sea Scrolls upon entering an enemy room, as many of its effects such as The Gamekid and Tammy's Head are helpful in combat."], ['As many of Dead Sea Scrolls effects involve explosions, using it near [[Rocks|Tinted Rocks]] or potential {{R|Secret Room}} entrances can potentially be helpful when low on bombs.', ['While {{I|Anarchist Cookbook}} and {{I|Kamikaze!|nr}} can hurt the player, effects such as {{I|Book of Revelations}}, {{I|Satanic Bible|nr}}, {{I|The Nail}}, {{I|Crystal Ball|r}} and {{I|Prayer Card|r}} will pay out with more health than is lost long-term.']]]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: Two effects are activated, with only one being named on screen.']]

name: Deck of Cards
description: Gives Isaac a random [[card]].
notes: [['{{p|Dice Shard|anr}} is technically a card, but cannot be generated by the Deck of Cards.', ['{{p|Dice Shard|r}} and {{p|Cracked Key}} can be found in the Deck, albeit extremely rarely.']]]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Little Baggy}}: Gives [[pills]] instead. Picking up {{i|Starter Deck}} will nullify this effect but pills are only transformed into cards when they are dropped on the ground.', ['{{dlc|r}} Having both allows both pills and cards to start spawning again, letting this item to produce cards as normal.']]]

name: Doctor's Remote
description: Creates a crosshair on the ground that can be aimed with tear controls. A missile strikes the spot after 2 seconds, creating a heavy damage explosion.
notes: [['This item shares many of the synergies and interactions with Epic Fetus.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Azazel}}: Shoots thin {{I|brimstone}} beams when rocket explodes. This behavior is not shared with {{I|epic fetus}} which produces no brimstone lasers.']]

name: Forget Me Now
description: On use, [[Level Generation|re-generates]] the current [[floor]] with a new layout. Isaac loses Forget Me Now, but keeps other [[items]] and [[Pickups|consumables]] picked up on the original floor.
effects: [["On use, the current [[floor]] will be [[Level Generation|completely re-generated]] and Forget Me Now will be removed from Isaac's inventory.", ['Isaac will restart the level as if he had entered a new floor.']]]
notes: [['The re-generated floor will count as the same floor number as the one Isaac used Forget Me Now in.', ['If a {{R|Devil Room}} / {{R|Angel Room}} is not encountered after defeating the boss of the re-generated floor, the multiplier tied to the number of floors since the last Devil/Angel Room affecting the spawn chance will not change.', ['{{dlc|r}} If the first possible {{R|Devil Room}} is encountered, the 100% chance for the next deal to be an angel chance is preserved upon regenerating the floor.'], 'If a Devil/Angel Room is encountered before regenerating the floor, the multiplier will become x0.25 upon regenerating the floor.']], ["Any [[items]] earned before using the re-generation effect will remain in Isaac's inventory."], ['If used on the {{s|Depths}} / {{s|Necropolis}} / {{s|Dank Depths}} II after beating {{E|Mom}}, both {{i|The Negative}} and {{i|The Polaroid}} can be obtained in one run. Additionally, two {{R|Boss Rush}}es can be entered as long as the total playtime of the run stays under 20 minutes.', ['{{dlc|r}} This also allows opening the door to {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} II in the starting room.']], ["{{Dlc+|r}} If used on {{Stage|Downpour}} / {{Stage|Dross}} II after collecting {{I|Knife Piece 1}}, a second {{I|Knife Piece 1}} will spawn in the mirrored world's {{R|Treasure Room}}, which can be rerolled into a random item from the [[Treasure Room (Item Pool)]].{{dlc-}}"], ['If used on {{Stage|Chest}} or {{Stage|Dark Room}} when the door to {{E|Mega Satan}} has been opened, the golden key will not re-open the door and you will be unable to fight him.'], ['If used on an XL floor, the merged chapter can be re-generated as two separate floors instead.'], ["If used on [[Womb]] II/[[Utero]] II/[[Scarred Womb]] II after defeating [[Mom's Heart]], and Mom's Heart is again defeated on the regenerated floor, it will count as having defeated Mom's Heart 2 separate times, therefore unlocking 2 consequent [[endings]]."], ['{{R|Challenge Room}}s and {{R|Boss Challenge Room}}s will have the same rewards and enemy waves as the Challenge Room in the previous iteration of the floor.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If left in a Treasure or Boss Room and then returned to during the [[Ascent]], the Forget Me Now item will return to the room it was left each time it is used, allowing the floor to be repeated indefinitely.', ['This can be useful in conjunction with {{I|The Stairway}}, as it allows for unlimited Angel Shops to be visited.', 'Upon reentry, items, pickups, and trinkets left in treasure and boss room after using Forget Me Now will be removed and not converted into cracked keys.']], ['If used in Floor 1, the chance of Devil/Angel room is still 0%.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} If used on Mausoleum or Gehenna II after the special version of {{E|Mom's Heart}} is defeated, the newly generated floor will be dimly lit as though Mom's Heart was already defeated. Additionally, no items will naturally generate in rooms where they would have. After the player defeats {{E|Mom}} again, there will be no flesh door, and the trapdoor to {{Stage|Corpse}} will appear."]]

name: The Gamekid
description: Turns Isaac into a into a [[wikipedia:Pac-Man (character)|Pac-Man]]-like creature for 6.5 seconds, granting [[invulnerability]], inflicting [[Status Effects#Fear|fear]] on all enemies, and has a chance of replenishing a {{e|Half Red Heart}} every time an enemy is killed.
effects: [['Gives [[Effects#Invulnerability|invulnerability]].'], ['Inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies.'], ['Removes the ability to shoot tears.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Allows Isaac to deal 40 contact damage to enemies, at the rate of 1 hit per second per enemy.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Allows Isaac to deal 20 contact damage to enemies, at the rate of 2 hits per second per enemy.', ['If an enemy is at 40 HP or less, the contact damage is increased to 40 for that enemy.']], ['Has a chance to replenish a {{e|Half Red Heart}} every time an enemy is killed.']]
notes: [['The invulnerability effect negates all forms of damage, including health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.', ['This also negates damage from entering or exiting a {{r|Curse Room}}, but the effect is immediately removed upon walking through the door.']], ['Does not prevent [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart container]] loss from [[Health Down]] pills or [[Devil deal]]s.'], ['This item is very similar to {{i|My Little Unicorn}}, trading the extra speed for the ability to gain health from killing enemies.'], ['[[Pills|Power Pill!]] has the same effect as The Gamekid, same goes with {{T|Cartridge}} on getting hit.']]
synergies: [['{{i|4.5 Volt}}: With some damage source while this item is active, it can be permanently invulnerable inside the room while you have enemies.', ['If combined with {{I|9 Volt}}, it will be easier to achieve invincibility.']], ["{{i|???'s Only Friend}}: The fly can still be controlled while invincible."], ['{{bov}}']]

name: The Hourglass
description: All enemies in the [[room]] are [[Status Effects#Slow|slowed]] for 8 seconds.
effects: [['All enemies in the [[room]] are [[Status Effects#Slow|slowed]] for approximately 8 seconds.']]

name: The Jar
description: When at full [[health]], up to 4 extra {{E|Red Heart}}s can be stored in The Jar. Activating drops the stored hearts on the ground.
effects: [['Isaac can store up to 4 extra {{E|Red Heart}}s in The Jar if there are no remaining empty [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Heart Containers]].'], ['When used, all Red Hearts in the jar are dropped on the floor, rather than directly consuming them.']]
notes: [['Red hearts are the only type of heart that can be stored. Blended Hearts do not count.'], ["If used in the two {{R|Super Secret Room}}s that contain nothing but a {{E|Black Heart}} or {{E|Eternal Heart}} (Room ID's 1 and 6), it will spawn those types of hearts instead."], ['If a whole red heart is picked up and Isaac only heals half a heart container, the other half is placed in the jar, indicated by the jar number increasing by one. Despite the jar indicating that it picked up a whole red heart in this fashion, it will only drop half a red heart on use. When picking up a double red heart, the jar will also store the remainder not healed in the same way.'], ['[[Co-op]] babies, except Magnet Baby, cannot add hearts to the jar, as they are unable to interact with pickups.'], ['The short-lived half red hearts dropped by {{C|Tainted Magdalene}} can be picked up and stored.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Humbling Bundle}} / {{I|Maggy's Bow}}: Spawn double the hearts put into the jar, allowing for infinite health to be spawned."]]
interactions: [['{{t|Broken Remote}}: Allows for teleportation with no recharge; however, it drops the contained red hearts in the room it was used.'], ["{{i|Car Battery}}: The Jar acts as usual, and doesn't double the hearts dropped upon activation."], ['{{i|Schoolbag}}: The player cannot pick up extra hearts while The Jar is in the inactive slot.'], ['{{i|Shard of Glass|force=r}}: Storing a heart in the jar does not stop the bleeding effect, despite playing the "heart collected" sound effect.']]

name: Kamikaze!
description: Creates an explosion around Isaac, damaging him and nearby enemies as well as destroying [[obstacles]].
notes: [["Despite the explosion usually damaging Isaac, Kamikaze! is not ''stricto sensu'' considered a self-damaging item because it is not the item's use which causes the damage, but rather the resulting explosion. This has a few consequences:", ['Kamikaze! does not bypass invincibility, which means items such as {{i|Holy Mantle}} or {{i|Tooth and Nail}} work normally.', 'Using Kamikaze! will cause the sword summoned by {{I|Damocles}} to start having a chance to fall at any point.']], ["Kamikaze!'s cooldown length is as long as the invincibility frames Isaac normally gets from being hit. This means that Isaac cannot activate Kamikaze!, and then activate Kamikaze! again before the invincibility frames end."], ["Synergizes with many bomb-enhancing items such as {{i|Bob's Curse}}, with exceptions listed in Interactions."]]
synergies: [['{{t|Blind Rage}}: With longer invincibility, Isaac can use Kamikaze! a second time without taking damage.'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Dark Arts}}: Kamikaze can be used for free while Dark Arts is active.'], ['{{i|Glitter Bombs}}: Has a chance to drop a [[pickup]] or [[trinket]] each time it is used.'], ['{{i|Gnawed Leaf}}: Activating Kamikaze will cancel out of the statue state, but Isaac will not be damaged by the resulting explosion.'], ['{{i|Host Hat}} / {{I|Pyromaniac}}: Allows unlimited uses without consequences.', ['{{I|Pyromaniac}}: Each use will heal Isaac for {{dlc|nr}} one full / {{dlc|r}} half a red heart.']]]
interactions: [['The following items have no effect:', ["{{t|Bob's Bladder}}", '{{I|Car Battery}}', '{{I|Mr. Mega}}', '{{I|Rocket in a Jar}}', '{{I|Scatter Bombs}}', '{{I|Sticky Bombs}}']], ['{{C|Jacob and Esau}}: Only the brother using it will take damage, regardless how close the other is to the blast.'], ["{{P|Soul of the Forgotten}}/{{I|Strawman}}: The Forgotten or Keeper ''will'' take damage if they are caught within the blast radius."]]

name: Mom's Bottle of Pills
description: On use, gives Isaac a random [[pill]].
effects: [['On use, gives Isaac a random [[pill]].'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Starter Deck}}: Gives [[card]]s instead.']]

name: Mom's Bra
description: [[Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies in the current [[room]] for around 4 seconds.
effects: [['[[Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies in the current [[room]] for around 4 seconds.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['Isaac keeps wearing the bra until he leaves the room, even after the petrifying effect has worn off.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Mom's Pad
description: Inflicts [[fear]] to all enemies in the [[room]] for 5 seconds.
effects: [['Inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies in the [[room]] for 5 seconds.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Monster Manual
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] from a specific selection for the current [[room]].
{{dlc|r}} Spawns a [[familiar]] from a specific selection for the current [[floor]].
effects: [["{{i|???'s Only Friend}}"], ['{{i|Angry Fly}}'], ['{{i|Ball of Bandages}}'], ['{{i|BBF|r}}'], ['{{i|Big Chubby|r}}'], ['{{i|Big Fan}}'], ['{{i|Bloodshot Eye|r}}'], ["{{i|Bob's Brain}}"], ['{{i|Boiled Baby}}'], ['{{i|Bot Fly}}'], ['{{i|Brother Bobby}}'], ['{{i|Cube of Meat}}'], ['{{i|Demon Baby}}'], ['{{i|Distant Admiration}}'], ['{{i|Dry Baby}}'], ['{{i|Farting Baby|r}}'], ["{{i|Fate's Reward|r}}"], ['{{i|Forever Alone}}'], ['{{i|Freezer Baby}}'], ['{{i|Friend Zone|r}}'], ['{{i|Fruity Plum}}'], ['{{i|Gemini}}'], ['{{i|Guardian Angel}}'], ['{{i|Halo of Flies}}'], ['{{i|Headless Baby}}'], ['{{i|Hushy|r}}'], ['{{I|Incubus|r}}'], ['{{i|Juicy Sack}}'], ['{{i|Leech}}'], ['{{I|Lil Abaddon}}'], ['{{i|Lil Brimstone}}'], ['{{i|Lil Delirium|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Gurdy|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Haunt}}'], ['{{i|Lil Loki|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Monstro|r}}'], ['{{i|Lil Spewer|r}}'], ['{{i|Little Chubby}}'], ['{{i|Little Gish}}'], ['{{i|Little Steven}}'], ['{{i|Lost Fly|r}}'], ['{{i|The Peeper|r}}'], ['{{i|Psy Fly}}'], ['{{i|Robo-Baby}}'], ['{{i|Robo-Baby 2.0}}'], ['{{i|Rotten Baby}}'], ['{{i|Seraphim|r}}'], ['{{i|Shade|r}}'], ['{{i|Sissy Longlegs}}'], ['{{i|Sister Maggy}}'], ['{{i|Smart Fly}}'], ['{{i|Succubus|r}}'], ['{{i|Sworn Protector|r}}'], ['{{i|Tinytoma|r}}'], ['{{i|Twisted Pair}}\n'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Familiars spawned by Monster Manual last for the current room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Familiars spawned by Monster Manual last for the rest of the [[floor]].'], ['Familiars generated by Monster Manual do not contribute toward transformations.'], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['It can spawn familiars not yet unlocked.'], ['If {{i|Cube of Meat}} or {{i|Ball of Bandages}} are spawned and Isaac already has either of those items, the level of these items will increase while the effect is active.'], ['Using Monster Manual is a good method to unlock achievements related to Super Meat Boy and Super Bandage Girl.', ["Using Monster Manual and enough {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}, Super Meat Boy and Super Bandage Girl can both be achieved in the same run.", 'If Isaac does not already have the Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages, Monster Manual can spawn a level 2 Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages in one use.']], ['{{i|Mongo Baby}} will not copy familiars spawned by Monster Manual.'], ['Familiars spawned by Monster Manual cannot be rerolled into other items by {{I|d4}} or {{I|d100}}.'], ['{{I|Box of Friends}} will not duplicate familiars spawned by Monster Manual.'], ['{{i|Tinytoma}} orbitals will persist between floors until they are all destroyed. They will not respawn outside of the floor they were generated in.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The familiars summoned by Monster Manual are items with a [[Item Tags monstermanual|monstermanual]] [[Item Tags|item tag]].'], ['{{C|Tainted Lazarus|r}}: If dead Tainted Lazarus has used Monster Manual, but living Tainted Lazarus progresses to the next floor (or vice versa), familiars from the previous floor are not removed. Upon exiting the game, or moving to the next floor as either character, any familiars retained this way are lost, meaning familiars cant be kept at most 1 extra floor.']]
interactions: [["{{I|Sacrificial Altar|force=r}}: Summoned familiars can be sacrificed since they persist for the entire floor, even if Monster Manual isn't currently being held."]]

name: Monstro's Tooth
description: A friendly {{E|Monstro}} jumps on a random enemy, dealing 120 area damage. Lands on Isaac if used in a [[room]] without enemies.
notes: [['This item will target Isaac if it is used in a [[room]] without monsters and will cause damage.'], ['Monstro will target {{E|shopkeeper}}s.'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} Like {{E|Mom}} and {{E|Satan}}'s stomp attacks, this attack is treated as an explosion, so {{i|Pyromaniac}} and {{i|Host Hat}} will be activated if Monstro falls on Isaac.", ['Due to this, if Monstro falls near the entrance to a {{R|Secret Room}}, it will be opened. This can be used to open {{R|Secret Room}}s for free.']], ['{{dlc|na}} This item does not affect the boss, {{E|Monstro}}.']]

name: Mr. Boom
description: Places a {{I|Mr. Mega}} {{E|bomb}} that deals 110 damage.
effects: [['Places a large {{E|bomb}} similar to ones produced by {{i|Mr. Mega}}.', ['Despite slightly different appearance, the bomb is functionally identical to a Mr. Mega bomb, being compatible with all [[:Category:Bomb_items|bomb modifiers]].']]]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{e|Wrath}}.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Remote Detonator}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: The Mr. Boom bomb is affected by remote detonator.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Mr. Mega}}: No further improvement in damage or blast radius.']]

name: The Necronomicon
description: Deals 40 damage to every enemy in the [[Rooms|room]].
notes: [['Many collectibles will produce effects similar to the Necronomicon, such as depleting a {{E|Black Heart}} or blocking projectiles with {{i|Dry Baby}}.'], ['The Necronomicon deals a considerable amount of damage to bosses that have multiple damageable parts, e.g. {{E|Larry Jr.}} and {{E|The Hollow}}.'], ['This item also does high enough damage to instantly kill most non-boss enemies.']]
synergies: [['{{T|A Missing Page|r}} / {{I|Missing Page 2|r}}: Increases the damage from 40 to 80.', ["'''A Missing Page''' + '''Missing Page 2''': The damage increase stacks for a total of 120 damage."]], ['{{bov}}']]

name: Notched Axe
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Isaac destroys [[obstacles]] and opens {{R|Secret Room}}s by walking into them, but cannot shoot or pick up items until it's cancelled.
{{dlc+|r}} Toggles between tears and the pickaxe, which can be swung to attack and break [[obstacles]]. Using it depletes the charge, and it can't be used until next [[floor]] once the charge runs out.{{dlc-}}
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac takes damage while using the Notched Axe, his current use of the Axe will end.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Isaac cannot attack or pick up other items while using the Notched Axe.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Activating the item while it is already being used will end the effect. This does not require any charge.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The Notched Axe may be used to get access to the {{s|Mines}}. The door will break open with one swing.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe shares its synergies with {{c|The Forgotten}}'s bone club. See that page for details."], ["{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe, like {{c|The Forgotten}}'s bone club, may be used to pick up items that are just out of reach over a pit or spikes. This does not require any charge."], ['{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe can open secret rooms, and so it can be used on walls to test for secret rooms without using charge.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe cannot free {{E|Sticky Nickel|n}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Notched Axe can provoke an Angel Statue in {{R|Angel Room}}s, triggering the boss fight.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Obstacles destroyed by the Notched Axe will never fill pits.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Notched Axe can be used to destroy the {{E|Tuff Twins}} and {{E|The Shell}} bosses instead of using bombs.{{Dlc-}}']]
