synergies: [['{{I|Anti-Gravity|r}}: Melee attacks will generate a hovering tear in the shape of the swing of the pickaxe.'], ['{{i|The Battery|r}}: Causes remaining charge from the previous floor to carry over to the next one.'], ['{{c|Bethany|r}}: Breaking Notched Axe and using a Soul Charge to activate it again will allow for a single use before immediately breaking.'], ['{{bob}}'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{t|Broken Padlock}}: Allows the Notched Axe to open locked chests and doors; does not use durability.'], ["{{i|Ipecac|r}}: Melee attacks will trigger an explosion when they makes contact with an enemy; unlike with the Forgotten's bone club, Isaac ''will'' take damage from these Ipecac explosions."], ['{{i|Iron Bar|r}}: Fully recharges the axe when picked up.'], ['{{i|Technology|r}}: Melee attacks will cause a technology laser ring to appear around Isaac, damaging enemies.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Glowing Hour Glass|n}} & {{i|Schoolbag|n}}: Notched Axe will be fully recharged after going back in time to the previous floor.']]

name: A Pony
description: Passively grants [[flight]] and increases [[speed]] to 1.5. Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving [[invulnerability]] during the charge and dealing damage to enemies hit.
effects: [['Passively gives [[flight]] whether it has charges or not.'], ["If Isaac's [[speed]] is less than 1.5, passively increases his speed to 1.5."], ['Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving invincibility during the charge and dealing contact damage to enemies.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The dash deals 40 flat contact damage to enemies.', "{{dlc|r}} The dash deals 4 times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 28 damage.", '{{dlc|r}} Isaac can dash through doors, which means damage from {{r|Curse Room}} doors can be avoided.', 'Invincibility granted by dashing will not prevent Isaac from being damaged by {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, {{M|Devil Beggar}}s, and similar self-damage active items (when holding {{I|Schoolbag}}).']]]
notes: [['This item is normally only obtainable by defeating {{E|The Headless Horseman}}.'], ['The [[flight]] and potential [[speed]] added by A Pony will be removed if a new activated [[item]] is collected.'], ['{{dlc+|a+}} If {{i|Void}} is used, Isaac will not be granted permanent flight.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} If Isaac dashes into an open door, he will continue to dash in that direction for a distance of 2 normal [[rooms]] unless he collides with a closed door/wall.', ['This allows Isaac to enter and exit curse rooms for free, provided A Pony is activated to give invincibility before charging through the exit.', 'Caution should be taken when dashing into rooms that has not been explored, as some of room layouts has {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} or {{M|Devil Beggar}}, which Isaac may dash into and get damaged.', ['This is more important to {{C|The Lost}} and {{C|Tainted Lost}} , as {{i|Holy mantle}} or {{P|Holy Card}} can not prevent damage from them.']]]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{I|Mars}}: Lowers the dash cooldown to approximately 1 second.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: The Poop
description: Spawns a pile of {{E|poop}} where Isaac is standing and [[Knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies. May yield [[pickups]] like regular poop.
effects: [['Spawns a pile of {{E|poop}} where Isaac is standing and [[Knock-back|knocks back]] nearby enemies. This pile of poop may yield [[pickups]] like regular poop.', ['{{dlc|a}} Also knocks back pickups and enemy shots upon use.']], ['{{transf|Oh Crap|item}}']]
notes: [['{{C|???}} starts with this item by default.'], ['Can bridge gaps when bombed from the opposite side (as if it was a [[Rocks|rock]]).'], ['Poops spawned by The Poop may give {{t|Petrified Poop}}, which gives better odds at future poop drops.'], ['If used on top of an obstacle while flying, it will only produce its sound effect, but no poop will be spawned.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The also applies to destroyed obstacles.']], ['If you have {{i|Thunder Thighs}} or {{i|Leo}}, the poop will be destroyed beneath you as soon as it is placed.'], ['After defeating {{E|Ultra Greedier}}, all remaining piles of poop in the room will be converted into golden poops.', ['{{dlc|r}} This effect is purely visual, the "golden" poop acts as regular poop despite the recolor.']], ["{{dlc|r}} The Poop can be used to destroy retractable spikes when they're retracted."], ['If used on top of a destroyed red poop, this will effectively remove it from the room permanently.']]
synergies: [["{{I|Bird's Eye}} / {{I|Ghost Pepper}}: Fire will appear behind Isaac when The Poop is used."], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{T|Brown Cap}}: The Poop may be used as a discounted {{I|Mine Crafter}}, both for utility, as well as combat.'], ['{{I|Dirty Mind}}: Allows the creation of extra [[friendly]] {{E|Dip|n}}s.'], ['{{t|Gigante Bean}}: Deals 10 flat damage to nearby enemies.'], ['{{i|Hallowed Ground}}: Using The Poop will always spawn a {{E|white poop|n}}.'], ['{{t|Meconium}}: Using The Poop has chance to spawn a {{E|black poop|n}}.'], ["{{i|Midas' Touch}}: Using The Poop has a chance to spawn {{E|golden poop}}. The chance of this effect is 100% at 4 [[Luck]]."], ['{{t|Petrified Poop}}: Significantly increases the chance that poop may drop a pickup.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: Only spawns one poop.']]

name: Razor Blade
description: On use, takes one {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}} of [[health]] and grants +1.2 [[damage]] for the current [[room]].
effects: [['On use, takes a full {{E|red heart}} of [[health]] and grants +1.2 [[damage]] for the current [[room]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc+|a}}{{C|Eve}} starts with this item after unlocking it and donating 439 [[coins]] to the {{m|Greed Donation Machine}}.{{dlc-}}', ["{{dlc|nr}} Both conditions must be met for Eve to hold it; donating 439 coins before defeating {{E|Satan}} with Eve will wrongly state on Eve's profile on the Character Selection Screen that she has it equipped.", ['{{dlc|r}} Eve now starts with the Razor Blade if unlocked from the Greed Machine, even if Satan has not been defeated with Eve.']]], ["If Isaac doesn't have a full {{E|Red Heart}} or a filled {{E|Bone Heart}}, then {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, and empty Bone Hearts are taken instead."], ['The effect stacks with itself and {{t|Red Patch}}, which provides a similar benefit.'], ['Using this item does not affect {{R|Devil Room}}/{{R|Angel Room}} chances.'], ['Using this item as {{C|The Lost}} will result in death.'], ["When picked up, Isaac's tears turn red, though this change is purely cosmetic."], ['The Razor Blade prioritizes Red Hearts first.', ['Using the Razor blade grants Isaac the regular immunity frames upon usage; this allows Isaac to enter cursed rooms without using soul hearts should he have them.']], ['Using this item in the {{E|Ultra Greed}} boss room will result in Isaac losing 2-4 coins and dropping 1-3 pennies on the floor similar to being hit by any of the greed enemies.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Isaac cannot take damage from the Razor Blade, allowing for infinite uses of the item."], ['{{i|Old Bandage}} / {{i|Shard of Glass}}: Isaac has a chance to drop a red heart while using the item.'], ['{{T|Panic Button}}: Self-damage occurs before enemy damage, making it almost impossible to lose Angel or Devil chance.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|The Polaroid}}: Isaac takes no damage while invincible, allowing for repeated free uses of the item.'], ['{{i|The Wafer}}: Isaac loses half a heart instead of a full heart.'], ["{{i|Whore of Babylon}}: The Razor Blade can be used to activate this item's effect by doing enough damage to get Isaac down to half a red heart (or one red heart as Eve), providing a big damage boost for the current room at the cost of health."], ['{{i|Birthright}} &{{c|Judas}}: Actives the effect of {{i|The Necronomicon}} alongside its normal effect.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{dlc|r}} [[Shield]]/[[Invulnerability]]: Will not protect against this item's damage."], ["{{C|Tainted Samson|r}}/{{I|berserk!}}: The Razor Blade can be used in order to gain a massive damage boost in a room as long as there's a source of HP within reach."]]

name: Shoop Da Whoop!
description: Fires a laser from Isaac's mouth.
effects: [["When used, the next shot will fire a large, {{i|Brimstone}}-like laser in the direction Isaac shoots that deals double Isaac's tear damage. If Isaac is already shooting, the item immediately activates in that direction.", ['The laser hits up to 13 times.', '{{dlc|a+}} [[Status effect]]s can be applied by the laser.']]]
notes: [["Despite the laser looking very similar to Brimstone, it doesn't share most of the Brimstone-specific interactions."], ['This item can drop from {{E|Envy}}.'], ['Can still be used while [[blindfolded]].'], ['This item synergizes extremely well with items that significantly increase damage such as {{i|Polyphemus}} and {{i|Ipecac}}.']]
synergies: [['{{i|4.5 Volt}}: Allows the item to be charged and used multiple times in a room, which can help with dealing extra damage in enduring fights like most endgame bosses.'], ['{{i|9 Volt}}: Can be used once every room, and more frequently in {{R|Challenge Room}}s.'], ['{{bov}}'], ["{{t|Broken Remote}}: Since item charges aren't expended until Isaac chooses a direction to shoot, the player can teleport across the floor indefinitely."], ['{{i|Hemoptysis}}: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the laser deals to 4x and +3 flat damage (instead of just 2x). Enemies who die to the laser under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Spider Butt
description: Deals 10 damage to all enemies in the room and [[Status Effects#Slow|slows]] them for 4 seconds. {{dlc|r}} Enemies killed by Spider Butt spawn [[Blue Spider]]s.
effects: [['Deals 10 damage to all enemies in the room and [[Status Effects#Slow|slows]] them for 4 seconds.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Enemies killed by Spider Butt spawn 1-3 [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: Deals 10 damage to enemies twice but does not increase slow effect.']]

name: White Pony
description: Passively grants [[flight]] and increases [[speed]] to 1.5. Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving [[invulnerability]] during the charge while also creating damaging beams of light.
effects: [['Passively grants [[flight]].'], ["If Isaac's [[speed]] is less than 1.5, passively increases his speed to 1.5."], ['Upon use, Isaac charges in the direction the pony is facing, giving [[invulnerability|invincibility]] during the charge and damaging enemies while also creating beams of light.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The beams of light are spaced randomly around the room and deal the same damage as those created by {{i|Crack the Sky}}.', "{{dlc|r}} The beams of light deal 4 times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 10 damage and trail behind Isaac as he charges.", '{{dlc|nr}} The dash deals 40 flat contact damage to enemies.', "{{dlc|r}} The dash deals 4 times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 28 damage.", '{{dlc|r}} Isaac can dash through doors, which means damage from {{r|Curse Room}} doors can be avoided.', ['Although the dash can persist between rooms, the beams of light only occur in the room it is used in.']]], ['While not time-based, invincibility from White Pony is otherwise identical to damage immunity granted by the [[invulnerability]] effect.']]
notes: [['White Pony is only obtainable as a boss drop from {{E|Conquest}}, or from using {{I|Spindown Dice}} on {{I|Sacred Heart}}.', ['White Pony cannot be crafted with the {{I|Bag of crafting}}.']], ['If White Pony is replaced by another activated [[item]], Isaac will lose any passive benefits that it had granted.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{I|Mars}}: Lowers the dash cooldown to approximately 1 second.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Big Fan
description: Spawns a large [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 30 damage per second to enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a large [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 2 damage per tick (~8.57 damage per second) on contact.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [["The Big Fan is the largest of the orbital familiars, but also deals the least damage. {{dlc|a+}} Its contact damage is tied with {{i|Bloodshot Eye}} and its position of the lowest contact damage has been usurped by {{i|Mom's Razor}} while Isaac's damage stat is low."], ['The Big Fan has lower rotational speed than other familiars (similar to [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]]).'], ['The Big Fan orbits independently rather than occupying one of the three defense orbital slots.'], ['Affects the speed of all other orbitals, slowing them down a lot (NOTE: This effect does not happen until you get a new orbital after Big Fan).'], ["Horse pill versions of the Pretty Fly [[Pills|pill]] spawn a Big Fan without granting it as an item. Big Fans acquired this way spin at normal pace and don't affect rotation speed of other orbitals."]]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}} / {{i|Hive Mind|force=r}}: Big Fan becomes visually larger and deals more damage. Collision radius is not increased, however.']]
interactions: [['[[Orbital familiar]]s: If Big Fan is the first orbital obtained, subsequent familiars will match its low speed. {{dlc|na+}} This excludes Pretty Flies.']]

name: Bogo Bombs
description: All normal {{e|Bomb}}s become {{e|Double Bomb}}s.
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Humbling Bundle}}: No effect.', ["{{dlc|r}} Due to Humbling Bundle no longer guaranteeing double pickups, Bogo Bombs will ''always'' double bombs."]]]

name: Cursed Eye
description: Grants charged tears that can be fired in a tight burst. Getting hit while charging will teleport Isaac to another room.
effects: [['Grants charged tears which fires a tight burst of shots, {{dlc|r}} shooting up to five shots when fully charged. Firing mid-charge will shoot fewer tears depending on the charge time.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The full burst size is four shots.', '{{dlc|nr}} Quickly tapping the fire key will result in no tears being fired.', 'Charging while a burst is currently firing will prevent the rest of the shots from being fired.']], ['Taking damage while charging (not fully charged) will teleport Isaac into another room.']]
notes: [['This item can be counterproductive, especially while fighting bosses, as getting hit while charging a shot will reset the fight.'], ['The teleport effect only occurs when taking damage while in the middle of charging, before the shot is fully charged. Having a high tears stat for faster charging will decrease the window where Isaac is vulnerable to teleporting.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} The teleporting and charge-up effects do not apply to {{C|Lilith}}. Her Incubus will fire three projectiles with each shot without needing to charge, tripling her damage output with no downside.'], ['Isaac is unable to fire tears if he hits 30+ TPS with this item.'], ["The color of Isaac's cursed eye will indicate what state it currently is in:", ['White: Inactive', 'Black: Charging up', 'Flashing black and white: Fully charged']]]
synergies: [['{{dlc|a}}{{i|Black Candle}}: Teleport effect is removed.'], ['{{dlc|a}}{{i|Holy Mantle}}: Losing Holy Mantle while charging Cursed Eye will not teleport Isaac.'], ['{{i|Incubus}}:', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Incubus fires 3 tears for each one that normally would be fired, with no change in delay.', '{{dlc|r}} Incubus has the same charge shots as most characters would. Getting hit while charging will have the chance to teleport, as usual.']], ['{{i|Marked}}: Tears are charged and automatically fired to varying levels depending on the distance between Isaac and the reticule. The firing rate is greatly increased without affecting the tears stat, even beyond normal maximum fire rate. The teleport effect is removed.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Technology}}: Becomes a quick charging laser that shoots multiple lasers on release.'], ["{{I|Epiphora|force=r}}: Epiphora's tear rate multiplier affects the number of tears in a burst for a total of ten shots with a full Epiphora charge."], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: Laser fires while charging Cursed Eye. Tear delay for the charge is unaffected by Tech 2. Allows {{C|Cain}} to fire normal tears.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tears are replaced with lasers, fired from the same eye of Tech 2.']], ['{{i|Mutant Spider}}: Fires 4 tears out of each eye, for a total of 16 tears when fully charged.'], ['{{c|The Lost}}/{{c|Tainted Lost}}: Since The Lost dies in one hit, it is effectively immune to its teleportation effects, making this item much safer to use.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Almond Milk}}/{{I|Soy Milk}}: Cursed Eye is automatically charged and fired when the fire key is held. The charge bar of Cursed Eye becomes invisible. The teleport effect remains.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Anti-Gravity effect cannot be used, as releasing a tear fire button also releases the Anti-Gravity Effect.'], ["{{C|Azazel}}/{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Overrides Cursed Eye."], ['{{I|C Section}}/{{I|Neptunus}}/{{I|Spirit Sword}}/{{C|Tainted Azazel}}: Overrides Cursed Eye.'], ["{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Charged tear is followed by up to 3 minimum-power tears, depending on Cursed Eye's charge.", ["'''{{Dlc|r}}''' Cursed Eye takes longer to charge, but low damage shots can be fired rapidly. If fully charged, Isaac fires five Chocolate Milk shots'''.'''"]], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: The tears stack on top of each other, and only move forward when holding a direction afterwards.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: The skeleton form's charge attack becomes a rapid barrage of hits; the amount depends on how full the charge is, up to 4."], ['{{i|Neptunus}}: Overrides Cursed Eye.'], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: Overrides Cursed Eye.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Lilith}}: The fetus gains the effect of Cursed Eye and the teleportation effect does not happen.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology}}: Overrides Cursed Eye.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Cursed Eye.']]

name: Fanny Pack
description: Has a chance to drop a random [[pickup]] when Isaac takes damage.
synergies: [['{{i|Blood Oath}}: Each half-heart lost has a chance of spawning a pickup from the fanny pack.'], ['{{i|Sharp Plug}}: Each half a heart lost from the use of sharp plug has a chance of spawning a picking from the fanny pack.']]

name: Hive Mind
description: Increases the size of [[Blue Spider]]s and [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] and doubles the amount of damage they deal. {{dlc|r}} Also increases the effectiveness of fly and spider [[familiar]]s.
effects: [['Increases the size and doubles the damage of [[Blue Spider]]s, [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] and {{dlc|a+}} [[Locust]]s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Fly and spider familiars become stronger, exactly like {{i|BFFS!}}.', ['Having both Hive Mind and BFFS! gives no further benefit.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This item does not affect Fly familiars or orbitals.'], ['No effect on flies made passive by {{I|Skatole}}.']]
synergies: [['{{transf|Guppy}}: Doubles the damage of all Blue Flies spawned greatly increasing damage output.'], ['{{I|Brown Nugget}}: Turret does 7 damage instead of 3.5'], ["{{I|Mom's Wig}}: Doubles spider limit of the wig to 10 spiders."], ["{{I|Plum Flute}}: Doubles {{E|Baby Plum}}'s contact damage, but not projectile damage. Plum is also larger."], ['{{dlc|a+}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: Contact damage is doubled as normal and explosions will deal an additional 25 flat damage.'], ["{{I|Sissy Longlegs}}: Increases familiar's size. Spiders spawned by Sissy are affected by Hive Mind."]]

name: Holy Water
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a bottle [[familiar]] that breaks when Isaac takes damage, leaving a puddle of [[blue creep]].
{{dlc|r}} A bottle [[familiar]] that flies forward when Isaac shoots. It breaks upon hitting an enemy, leaving a puddle of [[blue creep]] that [[petrification|petrifies]] enemies.
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Familiar is bigger but no effect on damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Doubles the initial damage and causes it to also spawn a blue flame on point of impact that blocks shots and deals 6 contact damage per tick to enemies (36 damage per second). The fire can hit flying enemies, persists for the same amount of time as the creep, and cannot be destroyed.']], ['{{i|Vasculitis}}: Upon killing an enemy while they are inside the puddle of holy water,  The enemy bursts into a cluster of petrifying tears.']]

name: Juicy Sack
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and drips a trail of [[Status Effects#Effects|slow]] [[creep]], spawning 1-2 [[Blue Spider]]s after each [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac, leaving a trail of white [[creep]] that [[Status Effects#Effects|slows]] enemies.'], ['Spawns 1-2 [[Blue Spider]]s after every [[Rooms|room]].'], ['{{Dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Juicy Sack spawns an extra Blue Spider.']]

name: Lil Brimstone
description: Grants a [[familiar]] that charges a thin {{i|Brimstone}} laser while Isaac is shooting.
notes: [['{{dlc|na}} Lil Brimstone is a [[Special Item]].'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Lil Brimstone takes priority over all other following familiars aside from {{i|Incubus}}, and will always appear first in line directly behind Isaac or second behind Incubus.{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{t|Baby-Bender}}: Brimstone beams will home in on enemies.'], ['{{i|BFFS!}}: The beam deals double damage.'], ['{{i|Hemoptysis}}: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the Brimstone beam deals to 8 damage per tick. Enemies who die to the Brimstone beam under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.', ["Hemoptysis + {{i|BFFS!}}: The curse causes the beam's damage to be increased to 13 damage per tick."]], ['{{Dlc+|r}} {{I|King Baby}} / {{I|Marked}}: While firing, Brimstone will be charged automatically and fired immediately upon full charge, the beam will now target the nearest enemy/crosshair.{{dlc-}}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: When used with a laser attack (such as {{i|Brimstone}}), Lil Brimstone will not automatically fire as it would with {{i|Marked}}.']]

name: Little C.H.A.D.
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] who drops a {{E|Half Red Heart}} every 3 rooms.
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The familiar drops hearts in a repeating pattern of 2, 2 then 3 rooms.']]
interactions: [["{{C|???}}, {{C|Tainted ???}}, {{C|Dark Judas|force=r}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: Useless, unless {{t|Apple of Sodom}} or {{i|Dark Bum}} have been collected, since these characters can't pick up red hearts."], ['{{C|Keeper}}/{{C|Tainted Keeper}}: Will give [[Familiar#Blue Flies|Blue Flies]] instead of hearts, acting as a weaker {{i|Rotten Baby}}.']]

name: Little Chubby
description: Spawns a {{E|charger}} [[familiar]] that charges forward and deals contact damage to any enemies in its path.
notes: [['For Little Chubby to recharge, it must first get back to Isaac. Therefore, running away from Little Chubby after firing it will extend the time required to recharge it.'], ['The enemy {{E|Chubber}} can attack like this item, but they have limited range.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Duct Tape}}: Familiar will stay in place relative to Isaac, however, it will still charge across the room but will always return to the spot it first returned to after charging across a room.'], ['{{I|Marked|r}}: Little Chubby will charge at the direction that is marked on the floor.']]

name: Little Gish
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires [[Slow|slowing tears]], impeding enemies' speed.

name: Loki's Horns
description: Gives a random chance for projectiles to fire in all 4 cardinal directions.
effects: [['Adds a chance to shoot tears in four cardinal directions, similar to {{E|Loki}}.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} The chance is 25% at 0 [[Luck]], increasing by 12% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 7 luck and minimizes at 0% at -3 luck.', '{{Dlc|r}} The chance is 25% at 0 [[Luck]], increasing by 5% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 15 luck and minimizes at 0% at -5 luck.']]]
synergies: [["{{i|Mom's Eye}}: Each time Mom's Eye would activate, Loki's Horns activates instead."], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: Extra tears will fire in the same direction.'], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: The sprinkler eye turns into four eyes and alternates shots between the cardinal and ordinal directions.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Effectively grants a great tear multiplier, as on item activation the extra tears will follow the trajectory given by the Tiny Planet.']]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: No effect on the tears fired in the other 3 directions. The chance to activate is checked per shot, not for each tear fired.'], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: '''Not recommended without immunity.''' Adds a chance to fire four bombs in cardinal directions."], ['{{I|Epic Fetus}}: Adds a chance to spawn four crosshairs in cardinal directions. Isaac controls one and the others will mirror the movement keeping their space.'], ["{{i|incubus|anr}}: Not affected by Loki's Horns."], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Adds a chance to fire four explosive shots in cardinal directions. Caution is advised, though it is easier to avoid damage than Dr. Fetus.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Adds a chance for 4 tears to be fired in cardinal directions from the main tear.'], ["Mom's Knife: Adds four knifes on the cardinal directions around Isaac that can be rotated but all of them will be thrown when four tears would shoot with only Loki's Horns."], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung|nr}}: Only one red tear will be fired in the other directions.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Fires 14 tears in each of the four directions.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ["{{dlc|r}} When Isaac shoots a laser ring it'll actually be 2 on top of each other, there's also a chance that Isaac will shoot 2 more laser rings backwards which will also be one on top of the other."]], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Extra tears are not affected by Tractor Beam.']]

name: Magic 8 Ball
description: +0.16 [[shot speed]], spawns a random [[tarot card]]. {{dlc|r}} Increases the chance of finding a {{R|Planetarium}}.
effects: [['+0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['Upon pickup, drops a random [[tarot card]] near Isaac.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Adds an additional 15% chance for the first {{R|Planetarium}} to appear.']]

name: Match Book
description: Grants Isaac one {{E|Black Heart}}, spawns two or three {{E|Bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants Isaac one {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ['Spawns two or three {{E|Bomb}}s near Isaac.', ["{{dlc|r}} Drops the {{t|Match Stick}} if it hasn't yet been encountered."]]]
notes: [["It's advised to pay attention when picking up this item. The bombs that it spawns, like every other bomb pickup, has a chance to be replaced by a {{E|Troll Bomb}}."]]
synergies: [['{{T|Black Feather}}: Black Feather grants a damage boost for Match Book.']]

name: MEAT!
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}
effects: [['Grants Isaac one full Red [[Red Heart container|Heart container]].'], ['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Mini Mush
description: Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit. {{dlc|nr}}+0.3 [[speed]], +1.5 [[tear falling speed]], -4.25 [[range]] (effective range is increased). {{dlc|r}} +0.3 [[speed]], +1.50 [[range]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -4.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.50 [[range]].'], ["Decreases Isaac's size, making him less likely to be hit."], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Even though the range stat is decreased, the ''effective'' range is slightly increased due to the changes to the hidden tear falling speed attribute."]]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Effective range is decreased since tear falling speed does not affect Dr. Fetus.']]

name: Mom's Contacts
description: Adds a chance to shoot [[Petrification|petrifying tears]], which stop enemies in place and prevent them from moving or attacking. {{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]]. {{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].
effects: [['Adds a 20% chance to shoot [[Petrification|petrifying tears]], which stop enemies in place and prevent them from moving or attacking.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]]. ({{dlc|na}} not applied until the next time Isaac's range stat is updated)."], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]]. ({{dlc|na}} not applied until the next time Isaac's tear falling speed is updated)."], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The activation chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to around 50% with approximately 20 luck.'], ['Petrifying the Heart of a {{E|Mask + Heart}} also freezes the Mask bound to it.'], ['Petrifying an enemy with a weak zone ({{E|Scolex}} or {{E|Carrion Queen}}) will make the enemy take damage anywhere while it is petrified, making combat significantly easier.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|Haemolacria}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: If the main tear causes petrification, split tears will too."], ['{{I|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the petrification effect.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: If freezing tears are fed first when they burst, the split tears can also freeze enemies.'], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear flickers red, capable of petrifying enemies when it does.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: The beam can occasionally freeze enemies with no visual difference.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Occasionally fires missiles that can freeze enemies. No visual difference.'], ['{{i|Technology}}: Lasers can occasionally freeze enemies with no visual difference.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: The electricity that is connecting tears has a chance to freeze enemies.']]

name: Mom's Eye
quote: Eye in the back of your head
description: Gives Isaac a chance to fire tears from the back of his head.
synergies: [['{{I|Continuum}}: Tears shot out of the back reappear on the opposite side of the screen.'], ["{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Mom's Eye tears follow the direction in which Isaac is shooting."], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}}: Any time Mom's Eye would activate, Loki's Horns activates instead."], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears bounce around, making the backward tear more likely to hit enemies.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Another knife is permanently behind Isaac, able to deal contact damage. The fire chance is still affected by luck as usual."]]
interactions: [["{{i|20/20}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: No effect on the tears fired out of the back of Isaac's head. The chance to activate is checked per shot, not for each tear fired."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Occasionally shoots a bomb backward. Not recommended, as self-damage is likely.'], ["{{i|Doctor's Remote}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Chance for two airstrikes on opposite sides of Isaac."], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Occasionally shoots an explosive shot backward. Not recommended, as self-damage is likely.'], ['{{i|Incubus|anr}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Adds a chance for tear barrage to fire from the front and back of Isaac. The kidney stone will only fire from the front of Isaac.'], ['{{i|Lead Pencil}}: Adds a chance for tear barrage to be fired behind Isaac.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Adds a chance for tears to be fired in random directions from the main tear.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Occasionally fires one red tear out the back of Isaac's head."], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: The backward tear is not affected by Tractor Beam.'], ['{{i|The Wiz}}: The backward tear is not affected by The Wiz.']]

name: Mom's Eyeshadow
description: Tears have a chance to [[charm]] enemies.
effects: [["Gives a chance to shoot [[charm|charming tears]], causing enemies to temporarily fight on Isaac's side."], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['The chance for a tear to be charming depends on the [[Luck]] stat. The activation rate is equal to <math>1/(10 - (Luck / 3))</math>. With 0 Luck, the chance is 10%, maxing out at 100% at {{dlc|nr}} 27/{{dlc|r}} 26.95 Luck.', ["{{dlc|nr}} Due to how this formula works, increases in activation rate are only seen with every 3 points of Luck, as this formula rounds down after dividing Isaac's Luck by 3."]]]
synergies: [['{{I|Brimstone}}: Beam will be colored pink and applies the charming effect.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|Haemolacria}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears will retain the charm effect if main tear had the charm effect."], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{I|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the charm effect.'], ['{{I|Immaculate Heart}}: Tears produced by this item can charm.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: If a charm tear is fed, all burst tears can charm. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears cannot charm.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear flickers pink, capable of charming enemies when it does.']]

name: Mom's Key
description: Adds 2 keys. {{E|Chest}}s will drop additional [[pickup]]s.
effects: [['Gives Isaac two {{e|Key}}s.'], ['If a non-{{e|Red Chest}} spawns [[hearts]], [[coins]], {{E|bomb}}s and/or {{E|key}}s, causes the chest to spawn a second group of said pickups, effectively doubling the average pickup yield.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [["Mom's Key cannot change the contents of a chest; it will only cause it to spawn extra pickups."], ['All other chest rewards (such as [[pill]]s, [[card]]s, [[item]]s, etc.) will not cause the chest to spawn additional pickups.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Does not affect {{e|Old Chest|n}}s.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Mom's Key}}: Does not further increase the amount of pickups spawned when multiple copies of the item are acquired."]]

name: Mom's Lipstick
description:
{{dlc|nr}}+5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +2.25 [[range]]. Spawns a {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}} on pickup.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +2.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns one random {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Mom's Purse
description: Allows Isaac to hold one additional [[trinket]]. {{dlc|r}} Drops a random trinket.
effects: [['Allows two different [[trinket]]s to be carried at once.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns one random trinket. Two copies of the same trinket can be held.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
synergies: [['{{t|Tick}}: Lets you gain the benefits of the item without losing your only trinket slot.', ['{{dlc|a}} You cannot replace the {{t|Tick}} with The {{t|Match Stick}} once it is picked up, as it will only occupy the second trinket slot.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Belly Button}}: No effect; Isaac can still only hold two trinkets.']]

name: Money = Power
description: Increases [[damage]] by 0.04 for every {{e|penny|display=coin}} Isaac has, up to +3.96 damage at 99 coins.
effects: [['Adds 0.04 [[damage]] for every {{e|penny|display=coin}} Isaac has.', ['The more coins Isaac has, the less effective damage this item gives for picking up new coins.', 'The damage caps at +3.96 Damage at 99 coins.', 'Though Isaac can still collect coins if he already has 99, he will not gain any damage bonus from them.', 'Picking up multiple copies of this item will not increase the damage bonus.']]]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|r}}{{i|Deep Pockets}}: Increases maximum damage bonus from Money = Power. The damage caps at +39.96 Damage at 999 coins.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{i|A Dollar}}: Immediately maxes out damage bonus.'], ['{{i|A Quarter}}: Increases damage by 1 per 25 coins.'], ["{{I|Greed's Gullet}}: Isaac will gain health and damage."]]
interactions: [["{{i|Diplopia}}: Damage bonus doesn't stack."]]

name: Monstro's Lung
description: Replaces normal tears with a charged shot that fires 14 tears in the same fashion as {{E|Monstro}}.
effects: [['Grants a charged shot that fires 14 tears in the same fashion as {{E|Monstro}}.', ['The attack can be released only when fully charged.', "Each tear deals 100% Isaac's [[Damage]].", 'Each tear has a random size multiplier between 0.9x to 1.33x, but there is no effect on damage.']], ['[[Tears]] down: {{Dlc|nr}}Tear Delay × 4.3 / {{Dlc|r}} Fire Rate ÷ 4.3 (roughly 0.23x).']]
notes: [['Charge time can be found with the following equation:'], ['<math>\\text{(time)} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay)}) \\approx \\frac{1}{\\text{Fire Rate}}</math>'], ['Each tear has independant chance to have [[Tear Effects]].'], ["[[Tear falling speed]] ups will slightly reduce the effective range of Monstro's Lung.", ['{{dlc|r}} Since range ups always add to tear falling speed, every range up reduces effective range.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Multi-shot effects such as {{I|20/20}} or {{C|Keeper}} adds 2.4 tears to the barrage per tear they normally grant. The resulting amount is rounded, and is capped at 50.']]
synergies: [['{{I|20/20}} / {{I|The Inner Eye}} / {{I|Mutant Spider}}:', ['{{Dlc|nr}} Adds 2, 5 or 7 tears to the barrage respectively. For the latter two, greatly slows down the charge.', ["20/20 + The Inner Eye '''+ The Inner Eye:''' 10 extra tears.", '20/20 + Mutant Spider: 14 extra tears.', 'The Inner Eye + Mutant Spider: 14 extra tears.', 'All three: 19 extra tears.'], '{{Dlc|r}} Adds multi-shot effect they normally grant (see Notes section).', ['Without any other multi-shot effect, the barrage size becomes 16/19/21 respectively.']]], ['{{I|Almond Milk}} / {{I|Soy Milk|force=r}}: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge.'], ['{{I|Anti-Gravity}}: Hover effect is overidden, but tear delay down still applies, which greatly reduces the charge time.'], ['{{I|Blood Clot}}: All tears are larger, with increased damage (as opposed to every 2nd tear like Blood Clot alone).', ['{{Dlc|a+}} Tears have a 50% chance to be Blood Clot tears.']], ["{{I|Brimstone|force=a}}: Brimstone has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Fires 3-5 additional beams in random directions around Isaac. This effect also applies to {{C|Azazel}} and {{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Azazel}}'s versions of Brimstone.", ['Brimstone + {{I|Eye Sore}}: Overrides this synergy with a chance to shoot 1-3 additional beams in random directions.']], ["{{I|Chocolate Milk|nr}}: Reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%, and each tear from Monstro's Lung is a charged Chocolate Milk shot, massively increasing fire rate and damage.", ["This does not apply to {{C|Lilith}}'s Incubus; picking up Chocolate Milk will significantly reduce damage and increase charge time.", '{{Dlc|r}} The tear damage and the barrage size scale with charge amount. At 50% charge, the tear damage is 100%, the barrage size reaches 100% and is capped there. At 100% charge, the tear damage is 200%.', ['<math>\\text{Charge Time (s)} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay} \\times \\frac{5}{2} + 1)) \\approx \\frac{5}{2 \\times \\text{Fire Rate}}</math>', ['This makes damage per second drop to 80%.']]]], ['{{I|Eye Sore}}: Adds a chance to fire 1-3 additional barrages in random directions.'], ["{{I|Dr. Fetus|force=a}}: Monstro's Lung has priority. Does not apply Dr. Fetus' tears down. Fires 6 bombs which detonate simultaneously.", ['Multi-shot effects add 1 bomb to the barrage, up to 21 bombs.']], ["{{I|Epic Fetus|force=a}}: Epic Fetus has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. 2-4 extra cursors rotate around the main cursor before the missiles land."], ['{{I|Flat Stone}}: All tears bounce simultaneously; the effective range is greatly increased.'], ["{{I|Haemolacria}}: Monstro's Lung has priority. Applies +43 Tear Delay after Haemolacria tears down, instead of Monstro's Lung tears down. The barrage size is reduced to 4/7 (roughly 0.57), tears of which all burst.", ['The barrage size is 8 without any multi-shot effect. The resulting amount is rounded, and is capped at 29.']], ['{{I|Ipecac}}: Fires Ipecac tears, with no increase in charge time.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Applies Ipecac's tears down."]], ["{{I|Technology|force=r}}: Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Grants a charged shot, fires 12 lasers in 30° spead that arc 3-4 times. A laser can hit an enemy multiple times between their arcings.", ['<math>\\text{Charge Time (s)} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\frac{43}{10} (\\text{Tear Delay} + 1))) \\approx \\frac{43}{10 \\times \\text{Fire Rate}}</math>', ["This is equivalent of applying Monstro's Lung's tears down and its charge time, without actually altering tear delay."], 'Multi-shot effects add 12 lasers to the barrage, up to 128 lasers total.', 'Technology + {{I|Mysterious Liquid}}: The lasers leave creep each time they arc, resulting in a massive amount of creep.', 'Technology + {{I|Proptosis}}: The 6x damage is recovered each time they arc, nearly nullifying the distance penalty.']], ['{{I|Tech X}}: Fires 3-5 extra rings in 30° spead. Extra rings deal from 50% to 100% damage of the main ring.', ["Additional copy of Monstro's Lung adds 3-5 more rings.", '{{Dlc|nr}} Increases Tear Delay.', '{{Dlc|r}} Fire Rate is divided by 3.1.']], ["{{I|The Ludovico Technique|force=a}}: The Ludovico Technique has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. A cluster of variably sized tears orbit the main tear."], ["{{I|Mom's Knife|force=a}}: Mom's Knife has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Fires additional knives depending on charge amount, each dealing 2x tear damage. Fires 3-5 knives at maximum charge."], ["{{I|Mom's Wig|nr}}: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Spawns spiders upon firing, not charging. The amount of spiders spawned is dependent on luck.']], ["'''Monstro's Lung''': Additional copies of this item, such as from {{I|Diplopia}} / {{I|Crooked Penny}}, add {{Dlc|nr}} 10/{{Dlc|r}} 12 tears to the barrage.", ["This effects is equivalent of adding {{Dlc|nr}} 4/{{Dlc|r}} 5 multi-shot effects. The items which have priority over Monstro's Lung or override it (e.g. {{I|Brimstone}}/{{I|C Section}}) benefit from this multi-shot effect."]], ['{{I|My Reflection}}: Tears stay in the air much longer and consistently, allowing better reach and more focused blasts before the tears returning to Isaac.'], ['{{I|Tractor Beam}}: All the tears follow the beam at different heights without spreading out, making it much easier for multiple tears to hit a target.']]
interactions: [["{{I|Chemical Peel|na}}: Overridden by Monstro's Lung.", ['{{Dlc|a+}} Tears have a 50% chance to be Chemical Peel tears.']], ["{{i|C Section}}: Overrides Monstro's Lung."], ["{{I|Cursed Eye}}: Overridden by Monstro's Lung."], ["{{I|Epic Fetus|force=na}}: Overrides Monstro's Lung."], ['{{I|Epiphora}}: Tears stat is increased properly but firing cancels the effect.'], ["{{C|The Forgotten}}: The Forgotten's bone club will shoot bones as it performs a melee swing."], ["{{I|Isaac's Tears}} / {{I|Sad Bombs}} / {{I|Tammy's Head}}: Fires 8 normal tears."], ["{{I|Kidney Stone|na+}}: If Monstro's Lung is picked up while Kidney Stone is ready to fire, charge time for Monstro's Lung will be significantly decreased.", ['{{Dlc|a+}} Only stat effects from Kidney Stone apply.']], ['{{I|Lachryphagy}}: The tears merge into one giant tears a while after being fired, and instantly burst. Without [[Piercing]], most of the damage is often wasted. Without [[Spectral]], the tears often collide against obstables due to their size.'], ["{{I|Loki's Horns|nr}} / {{I|Mom's Eye}}: Adds a chance to fire single tears in the other direction(s).", ['{{Dlc|r}} Adds a chance to fire barrages in the other direction(s).']], ["{{I|The Ludovico Technique|na}}: Overrides Monstro's Lung"], ['{{I|Marked}}: Only stat effects from Marked apply.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Works as expected. Fires automatically upon reaching full charge.']], ["{{I|Neptunus}}: Overridden by Monstro's Lung."], ['{{I|Pop!}}: The tears still fall after being fired.'], ["{{I|Spirit Sword}}: Overrides Monstro's Lung."], ['{{I|Strange Attractor}}: Due to the high concentration of tears enemies will be pulled into Isaac at great force, in certain cases enough force to pull enemies through rocks.'], ['{{I|Tech.5}}: Occasionally fires a linear laser while charging.'], ["{{I|Technology|na}}: If picked up after Technology, Monstro's Lung has no effect. Technology will override Monstro's Lung with a very low firerate.", ["{{Dlc|anr}} Technology has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Fires extra lasers in random directions."]], ['{{I|Technology 2}}: Fires a linear laser while charging.'], ['[[Ipecac]] + [[Dr. Fetus|Dr]]. [[Dr. Fetus|Fetus]]: Removes Explosion Immunity'], ['{{I|The Wiz|nr}}: 7-8 tears are fired at each diagonal direction instead of a full burst.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Adds a multi-shot effect (see Notes section). Full-sized barrage on each diagonal direction.']]]

name: Mr. Mega
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Increases the size, blast radius, and damage of Isaac's bombs.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["Gives all of Isaac's bombs increased damage and blast radius.", ['{{dlc|nr}} Mr. Mega bombs deal 110 damage instead of 60.', '{{dlc|r}} Mr. Mega bombs deal 185 damage instead of 100.']], ['When bombs explode, the screen will shake.']]
notes: [["It is possible to acquire this item more than once by killing multiple {{E|Super Wrath}}s on later floors; however, the bomb damage increase doesn't stack."]]

name: The Mulligan
description: Tears have a 1/6 chance of spawning allied [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] when they hit an enemy.
effects: [['Tears have a 1/6 chance of spawning allied [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] when they hit an enemy.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Because the {{transf|Guppy}} transformation includes the guaranteed ability to spawn flies on hit, the Mulligan's effect is nullified. This means individual tears cannot spawn more than one fly per hit.", ['{{dlc|r}} Guppy has been lowered to have a 50% chance of spawning a fly, allowing the 2 items to work together.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} This item does not work for {{C|Lilith}} since the {{i|Incubus}} tears do not count for her tears.'], ['Items and trinkets that increase tear firing rate synergize well with the Mulligan.'], ['This item is not affected by [[luck]].']]
synergies: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Constantly spawns blue flies when attacking.'], ["{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: The Mulligan's ability isn't affected by the charge time, meaning rapidly firing uncharged shots will generate a ton of blue flies."], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Has a 1/6 chance to spawn a fly on every hit by a split shot, which boosts the spawning of flies immensely."], ['{{i|Finger!}}: Rapidly spawns blue flies when pointed at an enemy.']]
interactions: [["{{C|Azazel}}: Azazel's default brimstone spawns flies like regular tears."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides The Mulligan.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Flies only have a chance to spawn if the knife is stationary."]]

name: Odd Mushroom (Large)
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants one empty [[Heart container]], +0.3 [[damage]], +0.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], and -0.1 [[speed]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants one full [[Heart container]], +1 [[damage]], +0.375 [[range]], and -0.2 [[speed]]
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Gives Isaac one empty [[Heart container]].', ['{{dlc|r}} Gives Isaac one full [[Heart container]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.3 [[damage]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1 [[damage]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.25 [[range]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.1 [[speed]].', ['{{dlc|r}} -0.2 [[speed]].']], ["Makes Isaac's head larger, which on its own is only a visual effect.", ['If taken when Isaac is smaller than the default, this Mushroom also increases his hitbox slightly.']], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [['There are two collectible items in the game named [[Odd Mushroom]]; you can tell them apart from the sprites.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|The Virus}}: The speed down from the Virus does not stack with the Odd Mushroom; if both are collected, only a total of -0.1 applies.']]

name: Old Bandage
description: Grants an empty Red [[Heart container]]. Adds a chance of dropping a {{E|Red Heart}} after taking damage.
effects: [['Grants an empty Red [[Heart container]].', ['If the character cannot hold red heart containers they will simply be given a normal HP up.']], ['Adds a chance of dropping a {{E|Red Heart}} after taking damage.']]
notes: [["Old Bandage's Red Heart drop chance depends on the [[luck]] stat, and goes up to 50% at 29 luck."]]
synergies: [['{{I|Blood Oath}}: For each half heart damaged by Blood Oath, Old Bandage has a chance to drop a heart. Synergy further improves with luck.']]

name: Ouija Board
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] that travel through obstacles (but not enemies) instead of breaking on impact with them.
synergies: [['{{i|The Parasite}}: When tears pass through solid objects, like rocks, they will split, resulting in many tears shooting out from every rock the original tear passed through.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Aesthetic only, no effect.', ['{{C|Azazel}}: Only cosmetic effect.']], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs will become transparent and pass through objects, just like [[spectral tears]] do.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: No effect.'], ['{{C|The Forgotten}}: Useless on both characters, as the bone club can hit through obstacles and {{C|The Soul}} has spectral tears passively.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{C|The Lost}}: Useless, as The Lost starts with spectral tears by default.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife becomes transparent but otherwise, Ouija Board has no effect."], ['{{C|Tainted Lilith}}: Hardly useful, as most damage is done through Gello whips.'], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: Allows the laser to go through objects, allowing piercing and spectral "tears".']]

name: The Parasite
description: Isaac's tears split in two when they hit something.
effects: [['Tears that deal more than 1.0 damage split into two tears with half damage and half remaining range on impact with obstacles or enemies.', ['Damage less than 1.0 causes the tears to simply disappear.', 'The splitting can keep up as long as the tears have range remaining and the damage of the split tears stays above 0.5.', 'Split tears are scaled down by 0.5x from the parent one, ignoring damage based size reduction.']]]
synergies: [['{{i|Angelic Prism}}: All tears split by the prism will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles.'], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: Two further explosions appear perpendicular to the head's direction of travel when it blows up."], ['{{i|C Section}}: Fetuses fire short-ranged tears constantly while in contact with an enemy.'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}: Both tear split effects happen simultaneously.'], ['{{i|Continuum}} / [[Spectral tears]]: When tears pass through solid objects, like rocks, they will split, resulting in many tears shooting out from every rock the original tear passed through.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: Two groups of this item's four tears, creating eight additional miniature tears on every point of impact instead."], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Every time tears bounce, burst tears spawn.'], ['{{I|holy light}}: As the holy effect is applied before the split, both tears will be holy if a holy tear is split'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Fed tears split into 12 tears. When tears are minimally fed and hit an obstacle, they will split into 5 Lachryphagy burst tears and Parasite burst tears.'], ["{{i|Lead Pencil}} / {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: All tears in tear barrage will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles or enemies."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Repeatedly spawns miniature tears when on top of an enemy, greatly increasing damage.'], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Split tears form for each hit as the tears pass through the enemies.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The split tears will continue to orbit Isaac, increasing damage potential.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: The split tears will be forced directly forward, impacting whatever caused the first tear to split. This increases damage immensely.', ['If all shots connect, effective damage will be multiplied by 2 + log<sub>2</sub>(damage).']], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: When beams hit obstacles, the beam will split; the split beams can split again when hitting other obstacles.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Aquarius}}: No effect.', ["{{dlc|r}} Creep trail turns dark orange but doesn't affect the creep itself."]]]

name: The Peeper
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that slowly floats around the room in a zig-zag pattern, damaging enemies it passes through.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that slowly floats diagonally around the room and bounces off walls. The eye blocks enemy shots and deals 8 damage per tick or about 17.1 damage per second to enemies it passes through.'], ['Gives tears shot from Isaac’s left eye a red appearance. {{dlc|r}} All tears shot from the left eye will deal 35% more damage.']]
notes: [["The empty eye leaves behind a small blood trail. This doesn't affect anything and is a purely cosmetic effect."], ['The Peeper is distinguishable from the eyes emitted from {{E|Peep}} by the size of the pupil, it being noticeably bigger on The Peeper.'], ['A slightly better Peeper familiar can be spawned by {{I|The Scooper}}.']]

name: Punching Bag
description: Spawns a {{E|Mulligan}} [[familiar]] that wanders randomly. Enemies will attack the Mulligan if it's closer.
effects: [['Spawns a {{E|Mulligan}} [[familiar]] that walks around the [[room]] and acts as a decoy for [[monsters]].'], ['If the monsters are closer to the decoy than Isaac, they will attack the decoy.'], ['Punching Bag will also block enemy shots.'], ['{{dlc|ana+}} Punching Bag will die after taking too much damage and eventually respawn after a long time. Exiting and continuing the run will cause it to reappear right away.', ['{{dlc|ana+}} Punching Bag will reappear instantly each time a familiar or orbital item is picked up.']]]
notes: [['The Punching Bag will be targeted by enemies if it is closer to them than Isaac, for up to 6 seconds. Then they will target Isaac for 6 seconds regardless of distance, before acknowledging the Punching Bag again.'], ["{{dlc|ana+}} The Punching Bag will die instantly by enemies' beam-type attacks, such as {{i|Brimstone}} or by {{E|Uriel}}'s and {{E|Gabriel}}'s beam. This also includes enemies' {{i|Technology}} lasers such as {{E|Eye}} and {{E|Camillo Jr.}}"]]
interactions: [['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Adds another Punching Bag. This may cause enemies to become unpredictable, so use with caution.', ['If the Punching Bag has died, it can be forced to respawn with a double upon using the Box of Friends.']]]

name: A Quarter
description: Gives Isaac 25 {{E|Penny|display=coin}}s.
notes: [['It has a chance to spawn when [[Urn]]s are destroyed or by killing {{E|Super Greed}}.', ['Multiple Quarters can be dropped in the same run by Super Greed, but will not spawn from Urns once picked up.']], ['Rerolling this item with the \xa0{{I|D4}}, \xa0{{I|D100}} ,\xa0{{I|Missing No.}}, or a 1 or 6 pip {{R|Dice Room}} will not remove 25 coins.']]

name: Rainbow Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and fires tears with random effects.
notes: [['The type of tear is randomized with each familiar shot.']]

name: The Relic
description: Spawns a cross [[familiar]] that drops a {{e|Soul Heart}} after clearing enough [[room]]s.
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The familiar requires one less room clear to drop a soul heart.']]

name: Robo-Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that shoots {{i|Technology}} lasers.

name: Rosary
description: Grants 3 {{E|Soul Heart}}s. Causes {{i|The Bible}} to appear in any [[item pool]]. {{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[tears]].
effects: [['Grants 3 {{e|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{i|The Bible}} is added to all [[item pool]]s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[tears]].'], ['{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['If The Bible has been picked up before collecting the Rosary, it will not be re-added to item pools.'], ['The Bible can be encountered multiple times even in the same pool if it is not picked up; however, once picked up, it cannot appear again anywhere.'], ['This item stacks with {{t|Rosary Bead}}, further increasing the chance to find The Bible in the {{R|Library}} and {{R|Shop}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The approximate chances of finding {{i|The Bible}} in each item pool are:', ['[[Treasure Room (Item Pool)|Treasure Room]]: 2.26%', '[[Shop (Item Pool)|Shop]]: 12.82%', '[[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss]]: 11.36%', '[[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room]]: 12.82%', '[[Angel Room (Item Pool)|Angel Room]]: 20.83%', '[[Secret Room (Item Pool)|Secret Room]]: 20.83%', '[[Library (Item Pool)|Library]]: 45.45%', '[[Golden Chest (Item Pool)|Golden Chest]]: 55.56%', '[[Red Chest (Item Pool)|Red Chest]]: 71.43%', '[[Beggar (Item Pool)|Beggar]]: 27.78%', '[[Devil Beggar (Item Pool)|Devil Beggar]]: 45.45%', '[[Curse Room (Item Pool)|Curse Room]]: 38.46%', '[[Key Master (Item Pool)|Key Master]]: 71.43%']]]

name: Rotten Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that spawns a [[Blue Fly]] when Isaac shoots. It can only have one Fly at a time.
notes: [['Spawns one Fly at a time.'], ["Blue Flies deal 2x Isaac's damage."], ["Flies will be generated regardless Isaac's ability to fire tears normally."]]
synergies: [['{{T|Fish Tail}}: Rotten Baby will spawn two flies at a time.'], ['{{i|Mongo Baby}}: Mongo Baby will also spawn flies.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Rotten Baby becomes larger, but this is only a cosmetic change.'], ['{{I|Hive Mind}}: Fly damage is doubled.'], ['{{T|The Twins}}: Unlimited flies can be slowly generated by walking back and forth between rooms while firing.  A new fly will generate each time Rotten Baby is duplicated.']]

name: Rubber Cement
description: Tears bounce off walls, [[enemy|enemies]], and [[obstacle|environmental objects]].
effects: [['Makes tears bounce off walls, [[enemy|enemies]] and [[obstacle|environmental objects]].', ['Tears that bounce off of enemies bounce in random directions, whereas tears that bounce off of walls and other objects bounce directly back.', 'When tears bounce from enemies, they become able to hit the same enemy again should they bounce off of another enemy or obstacle.', '{{dlc|a+}} Tears bounce off bombs.']]]
synergies: [['{{dlc|a}} {{i|Brimstone}}: The blood laser bounces off of walls, creating a second beam that deals half damage.', ["{{dlc|a}} {{C|Azazel}}'s Brimstone laser becomes a full length laser after bouncing, but will deal half of the damage.", ["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|Azazel}}'s Brimstone no longer becomes a full length laser after bouncing, and instead bounce as a regular mini-Brimstone."]]], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Both effects stack, with tears that bounce off of enemies being able to hit others for more damage.'], ['{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears will bounce off of walls without splitting, but split and bounce when hitting enemies. The split tears and the original one will bounce off everything.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Significantly increases the uptime of tears, since they are not limited by range and each tear will bounce off of each other. Continuously firing tears will eventually create a positive feedback loop, as the tears will keep bouncing faster and faster while not dropping to the floor.', ["'''Pop!''' + {{i|A Lump Of Coal}}: Extremely powerful combination; Lump of Coal's tear size increase will make it much easier for tears to bounce off of each other, while they increase in damage very rapidly. Given some time and enough tears, this can kill even final bosses such as {{E|Hush}} and {{E|Delirium}} quickly."]], ['{{dlc|a}} {{i|Technology}} / {{i|Technology 2}} / {{I|Tech.5}}: Laser bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage.'], ['{{i|Tech X|r}}: The laser rings bounce off walls once.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Rubber Cement.'], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: The bomb bounces back upon hitting an obstacle, and will not explode until it runs out of air time. '''Not recommended''', as it can make self-damage more likely in small rooms."], ['{{i|Continuum}}: Overridden by Rubber Cement; tears will still bounce off of walls and obstacles.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Rubber Cement.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Rubber Cement.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: No effect on the skeleton form's attacks."], ['[[Homing tears]]: Tears will bounce off enemies and home back in, but to deal damage to that enemy again they must bounce off a different object.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Tears will bounce off of obstacles, but not enemies.'], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: Tears don't generate arcs when hitting obstacles."], ["{{i|Lost Contact}}: Tears will bounce off of enemy tears. '''Not recommended''' unless the player's fire rate is high, as it can prove detrimental when trying to hit a shooting enemy."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Overrides Rubber Cement.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Rubber Cement."], ["[[Piercing tears]]: Tears that don't destroy enemies will bounce off of them instead of going straight through them. Tears can still damage enemies such as {{E|Knight}}s that are normally invulnerable from the front."], ['{{i|Sinus Infection}}: Boogers stick to enemies, but otherwise they bounce normally.'], ['[[Spectral tears]]: Overridden by Rubber Cement.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Tears pass through obstacles but bounce off walls.']], ['{{i|Sulfuric Acid}}: Overridden by Rubber Cement.'], ['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Technology}} / {{i|Technology 2}}: Overrides Rubber Cement.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears no longer fly over obstacles but instead bounce very quickly along with them, appearing to "vibrate".', ['{{dlc|a+}} Tears pass through obstacles but coast along walls, trying to maintain the circular trajectory.']]]

name: Sack of Pennies
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{e|penny|display=coin}} every 2 [[rooms]].
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The familiar drops coins in a repeating pattern of 1, 2, 2 then 2 rooms.']]

name: The Sad Onion
description: Increases tears by 0.7.
interactions: [['{{i|Spindown Dice}}: The Sad Onion disappears upon being rerolled, as its internal ID number is 1.']]

name: Skatole
description: [[Fly|Flies]] become harmless or less dangerous depending on the type.
effects: [['This item causes many [[Fly]] enemies to alter their behavior toward Isaac.', ['The following flies transform into a neutral normal {{e|Fly}}: {{e|Attack Fly}}, {{e|Dart Fly}}, {{e|Eternal Fly}}, {{e|Ring Fly}}, {{e|Army Fly}} and {{e|Swarm}}.', '{{dlc|nr}} The following flies move slower but will still deal contact damage: {{e|Boom Fly}}, {{e|Red Boom Fly}}, and {{e|Drowned Boom Fly|n}}.', 'The following flies move slower and deal no contact damage: {{e|Moter}}, {{e|Level 2 Fly}}, {{e|Pooter}}, {{e|Super Pooter}}, {{e|Bulb}}, {{e|Mama Fly}}, {{e|Bloodfly}}, {{e|Ultra Famine Fly}} and {{e|Ultra Pestilence Fly}}.', ['Pooters will not fire at Isaac, Moters will not split into Attack Flies, and Bulbs will not drain active item charges if touched.'], 'The following flies move slower and deal no contact damage, but can still damage Isaac through other means: {{e|Full Fly}}, {{e|Boom Fly}}, {{e|Red Boom Fly}}, {{e|Drowned Boom Fly}}, {{e|Sucker}}, {{e|Soul Sucker}}, {{e|Spit}}, {{e|Ink}}, {{e|Willo}}, {{e|Level 2 Willo}}, {{e|Dragon Fly}}, {{e|Dragon Fly X}}, {{e|Bone Fly}}, {{e|Sick Boom Fly}}, {{e|Tainted Boom Fly}} and {{e|Tainted Sucker}}.', ['Bone Flies will still throw bones at Isaac, and Willos and Level 2 Willos will still shoot.'], '{{dlc|nr}} The following flies are completely unaffected, retaining their normal attacks and speed: {{e|Swarm}}, {{e|Hush Fly}}, {{e|Sucker}}, {{e|Soul Sucker}}, and {{e|Spit}}.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Oh Crap|item}} {{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['This item can only be naturally obtained from the {{m|Shell Game}}.', ['{{dlc|r}} Skatole exists in an otherwise unused shellGame item pool. This means it can also be acquired with {{i|Chaos|n}} and bosses in {{s|The Void}} can drop it.']], ["{{transf|Beelzebub}}'s effect overrides Skatole."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Flies spawned by {{e|The Husk}} will not become passive.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Due to being quality 0, Skatole cannot be obtained from {{m|Shell Game}}s after {{i|Sacred Orb|n}} has been picked up.'], ['This item makes {{e|The Duke of Flies}} a lot easier, as most of his attacks, which spawn flies, will instantly be converted. Staying out of his way while having Skatole can even make it so he ends up killing himself.']]

name: Skeleton Key
description: Gives Isaac 99 {{E|Key}}s.
effects: [['Gives Isaac 99 {{E|Key}}s.']]
notes: [['Rerolling this item with the {{i|D4}}, etc., will not remove the 99 keys.'], ['This item can appear when using the {{P|0 - The Fool?}} with 99 keys in inventory.']]

name: The Small Rock
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ["-0.2 [[speed]] ({{dlc|na+}} not applied until the next time Isaac's speed stat is updated).", ['{{dlc|nr}} -0.2 maximum speed.']], ["+0.2 [[tears]] ({{dlc|na+}} not applied until the next time Isaac's tears stat is updated)."]]
notes: [['Has a small chance to be dropped from a destroyed [[tinted rock]].', ["{{dlc|r}} The first encountered Super Special Rock is guaranteed to spawn The Small Rock if it wasn't seen before."]], ["Normally only appears once per run, but can appear again if Isaac's items are re-rolled with {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, or a {{R|Dice Room}}."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Always has a chance to spawn as long as Isaac does not currently have it. This includes the possibility of spawning and obtaining multiple copies of The Small Rock on the same floor if not picked up the first time.'], ['Taking the rock in the {{R|Boss Rush}} from a tinted rock in the room will count as taking an item and consequently trigger Boss Rush. The other items do not disappear and will stay until one is picked up.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Diplopia}}/{{I|Crooked Penny}}: Additional copies grant an additional tears up and speed down with no further increase in damage.']]

name: Spiderbaby
description:
{{dlc|nr}} When hit, spawns 1-2 [[Blue Spider]]s.
{{dlc|r}} When hit, spawns 3-5 [[Blue Spider]]s.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns 1-2 friendly [[Blue Spider|Blue Spider(s)]] upon taking damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns 3-5 friendly [[Blue Spider]]s upon taking damage.'], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [["Essentially {{i|Infestation}}'s spider equivalent."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Hive Mind}}: Increases spider size and doubles damage.']]

name: Starter Deck
description: Isaac can hold 2 [[Cards and Runes#Cards|cards]] at once and all [[pills]] are replaced by cards.
effects: [['Allows Isaac to carry two [[Cards and Runes|cards or runes]] at once. Cycle through cards by pressing the Control key (PC), R2 (PlayStation), RT (Xbox), or ZR (Switch, 3DS).'], ['Replaces all [[pills]] with cards. Pills already on the ground will be converted to cards or runes upon picking up Starter Deck.'], ['Spawns a random [[card]].', ['{{dlc|r}} [[Rune]]s, [[soul stone]]s, and other card-like consumables are also possible.']]]
notes: [['When picking up Starter Deck in a shop that has a pill for purchase, the pill can still be purchased and used. If the pill is dropped, it will be turned into a card.'], ["Picking up 2 Starter Decks won't allow you to carry 3 cards at once."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Acid Baby}}: Spawns cards or runes instead of pills. Using cards or runes will not trigger the room-wide poisoning effect.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Caffeine Pill}}: A pill drops normally, but if it is picked up and dropped, or left on the ground while visiting other rooms, it becomes a card.'], ['{{i|Little Baggy}}: Overrides the effect of Little Baggy (switch from receiving only pills to only cards).', ['{{dlc|r}} Having both items allow both cards and pills to appear again.', 'Picking up Little Baggy while already holding Starter Deck will turn any held cards or runes into pills for one time.']], ["{{i|Mom's Bottle of Pills}}: Gives a card instead of a pill, essentially becoming equivalent to a {{i|Deck of Cards}}."], ['{{p|XIV - Temperance?}}: Forces Isaac to eat pills even with Starter Deck.']]

name: Steam Sale
description: Reduces all Shop prices by 50%, rounded down to 7 coins for an item, rounded up to 2-3 coins for a pickup.
effects: [['Halves shop prices.']]
notes: [['This item can drop from {{E|Greed}}, as well as a rare drop from {{E|shopkeeper}}s.']]
synergies: [['{{T|Adoption Papers}}: Both of the discounts stack, selling familiars for 5 cents.'], ['{{dlc+|anr}} {{i|Diplopia}}: Can be used to create two Steam Sales, reducing the price of all items in the shop to 0.', ["'''Diplopia''' + {{i|Restock}} or [[Greed mode]]: Restock will allow shop items to replenish indefinitely, so by having multiple Steam Sales by the methods above, infinite items may be purchased. Be careful not to pick up {{i|Missing No.}}, which will remove the Steam Sales and will likely replace many items with {{i|Breakfast}}.{{dlc-}}"]], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{i|Diplopia}}: Each additional Steam Sale will further reduce the price of all items in the shop, down to a minimum of 1 cent.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Stem Cells
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] and +0.16 [[shot speed]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['+0.16 [[shot speed]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional heart of [[health]].']]

name: Steven
notes: [['{{Dlc|r}} Steven is much less common than his counterpart, spawning only 1/4th as often.'], ["Steven's arena will always look the same as {{e|Gemini}}'s."]]

name: Super Bandage
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] and 2 {{E|Soul Heart}}s.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]] as well as two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['Heals 1 additional heart of [[health]].']]

name: Treasure Map
description: Reveals the map of each [[floor]]. It does not identify special rooms and does not reveal the locations of {{r|Secret Room}}s / {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.
effects: [['Reveals the map of each [[floor]]. It does not identify special rooms and does not reveal the locations of {{r|Secret Room}}s / {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.']]
notes: [['When combined with {{i|Blue Map}} and {{i|The Compass}}, the entire floor is revealed, identical to the effect of {{i|The Mind}}.'], ["Although not explicitly revealing it, the {{R|Boss Room}} can ''usually'' be found by locating the room farthest away from the starting room."]]
synergies: [['{{t|Liberty Cap|nr}}: If Liberty Cap triggers the effect of {{i|The Compass}}, it will last for the remainder of the floor.']]

name: Whore of Babylon
description: Grants +1.5 [[Damage]] and +0.3 [[Speed]] whenever Isaac has a {{E|Half Red Heart}} or less.
effects: [['Grants +1.5 [[Damage]] and +0.3 [[Speed]] whenever Isaac has a {{E|Half Red Heart}} or less.']]
notes: [['{{c|Eve}} starts with this item by default, and has the following extra effects:', ['The item is activated at one full {{E|Red Heart}} or less.', 'Her damage multiplier increases from 0.75 to 1.0 when active.']], ['The effect is removed after leaving a room with more than half a heart (more than one full heart for {{c|Eve}}).'], ['The effect may not be immediately applied if Isaac has lost red hearts without taking damage; the effect will activate upon entering a new room.'], ["The effect is always active for characters without {{E|Red Heart}} containers, such as {{c|???}} and {{c|The Lost}}, though other characters can also lose their heart containers through Devil deals or items like {{i|Guppy's Paw}} or {{i|Abaddon}}.", ['{{dlc|r}} This also includes {{C|Tainted Jacob}} after being hit by {{E|Dark Esau|n}}.']], ['{{p|III - The Empress}} grants a similar effect to Whore of Babylon for the current room which does stack with Whore of Babylon.', ["Stacking ''The Empress'' on Whore of Babylon either via multiple cards or multiple activations of {{i|Blank Card}} increases damage by the number of uses ''squared'', e.g. +1.5"]], ['2'], ['2 total damage bonus for using the card on top of activated Whore of Babylon.']]
interactions: [['{{c|Keeper|a}}: As Keeper cannot have half of a Coin Heart, this item has no effect on him.'], ['{{e|Rotten Heart}}s: Counts as a full Red Heart for the purposes of this item, rendering it impossible to activate (except for {{c|Eve}}).'], ['{{i|Whore of Babylon}}: No further effect when multiple copies are acquired.']]

name: Wire Coat Hanger
description: Increases [[tears]] by 0.7.

name: X-Ray Vision
description: Reveals and opens all {{R|Secret Room}} and {{R|Super Secret Room}} entrances.
effects: [['Opens {{R|Secret Room}}s and {{R|Super Secret Room}}s automatically.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} When in {{s|The Void}}, the entrances are not automatically opened or even identified if the room is not yet cleared. Re-entering the room once enemies are killed and/or {{E|Silver Button}}s pressed will open the doors normally.']]

name: Telepathy for Dummies
description: Gives [[homing tears]] for the current room. {{dlc|r}} Also gives +3 [[range]].
effects: [['Grants the following effects for the current room:', ['[[Homing tears]].', '{{dlc|r}} +3 [[range]].']], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [["For any item interactions, check the corresponding sections on {{i|Spoon Bender}}'s page."]]

name: Death's Touch
description: +1.5 [[damage]], -0.3 [[tears]]. Tears are replaced with large [[piercing tears|piercing]] scythes.
effects: [['+1.5 [[damage]]'], ['-0.3 [[tears]]'], ['Grants [[piercing tears]].'], ['Tear size multiplier: 2x.'], ["Tears are replaced by {{E|Death}}'s scythes."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs travel through enemies. When combined with {{I|Ipecac}}, bombs do not explode upon hitting enemies.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bombs also deal 2.5x Isaac's damage to enemies when passing through them."]], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Stat effects apply. Fired tears will retain piercing effect; however, burst tears will not. All other effects do not apply.'], ["{{i|Ipecac}}: Tears explode at their center, not where they touch the enemy, which means the very large size from Death's Touch may be detrimental. Piercing effect does not apply."], ["{{I|Trisagion}}: Overrides Death's Touch. Only stat changes apply."], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}} Overrides the scythe visual including the ranged attack.'], ["{{I|Tech X}}: Overrides Death's Touch. Only stat changes apply."]]

name: Humbling Bundle
description: Transforms {{e|Bomb}}s, {{e|Key}}s, {{e|Penny|display=Pennies}}, and {{e|Red Heart}}s into their respective Double versions. {{dlc|r}} This will occur only 50% of the time.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Transforms all {{e|Bomb}}s, {{e|Key}}s, {{e|Penny|display=Pennies}}, and {{e|Red Heart}}s into their respective Double versions.', ['{{dlc|r}} Provides a 50% chance to transform the aforementioned pickups into their respective Double versions.']]]
notes: [['Only works specifically on {{e|Bomb}}s, {{e|Key}}s, {{e|Penny|display=Pennies}}, and {{e|Red Heart}}s; other variants, like {{e|Nickel}}s or {{e|Soul Heart}}s, etc., are not doubled.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} By bombing {{m|Donation Machine}}s, Isaac can earn more money than is taken from the machine, giving an endless supply of coins until the machine breaks or he runs out of bombs.'], ['When used while fighting {{e|Greed}}, {{e|Hanger}}s, or {{e|Keeper}}s, every coin knocked out of Isaac will be worth two coins, allowing Isaac to net a profit.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Contract From Below}}: Single pickup drops have a 2/3 chance to be doubled, which then become their doubled versions by Humbling Bundle. This essentially results in an average increase from 1.33x more pickups to 2.67x more.', ['{{dlc|r}} The average gain is reduced to 2x more pickups instead.']], ['{{i|The Jar|nr}}: Allows for replicating hearts. Using the jar with 4 hearts inside it will cause 8 to drop, allowing Isaac to create an infinite amount of Red Hearts.'], ["{{i|Maggy's Bow}}: Allows all normal heart pickups to be worth four hearts. However it's bugged sometimes{{reconfirm}}."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Humbling Bundle}}: No further effect if multiple copies are obtained.']]

name: Strange Attractor
description: [[Pickup]]s, [[trinket]]s, and [[monster]]s are magnetically attracted to Isaac's tears.
notes: [['Extra caution must be taken when using this item, as the attraction effect will pull small, lightweight monsters like {{E|Boom Fly|display=Boom Flies}} towards the character very fast and in an unpredictable manner, with the consequent risk of taking damage.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Enemies and pickups are sucked towards the beam, increasing accuracy significantly.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Enemies are sucked towards bombs, increasing accuracy and making enemies easier to kill.'], ['{{i|Explosivo}}: When the shot sticks to an enemy, every enemy near it will be attracted to them.'], ["{{i|Godhead}}: Enemies will be pulled into Godhead's damaging aura, increasing the aura's effectiveness at causing damage."], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Enemies and pickups are pulled towards the shots, increasing accuracy. The color of shots and their explosive effect is a darker green.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Enemies, items, and even most bosses will be sucked to the single floating tear, dealing constant damage while keeping Isaac well away from harm, making this combination extremely effective in almost all scenarios.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Enemies are pulled towards the knife. The effect is minor while not firing and much stronger while the knife is launched."], ['{{t|Nose Goblin}}/{{I|Sinus Infection}}:  Attraction effect will remain on the booger shot stuck to an enemy. This can drag the enemy across the whole room until they reach one wall and get stuck on it, effectively disabling their normal movement.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}: Tainted Forgotten attracts enemies, putting them in range of his bone club attack.'], ['{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Technology 2}}/{{i|Tech.5}}: The beam will attract enemies, often sucking them into the beam and holding them there.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Enemies and pickups are attracted to the outer ring, increasing accuracy.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: The lack of random spread and momentum-based trajectories on tears makes the way enemies are pulled around more predictable.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|Compound Fracture}}: Since tears will split into more tears, all traveling different directions, enemies will be randomly moved around."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Strange Attractor.', ['{{dlc|a}} Enemies get drawn towards the target mark on the ground, ensuring that the missile will hit.']], ['{{i|Explosivo}}: Enemies will be pulled toward the stuck on tears, dragging them helplessly or grouping them for the explosion.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Enemies and pickups are attracted to the main tear, but not burst tears.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Enemies will often get sucked into tears, making it more difficult to feed tears or let them burst.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Due to the high concentration of tears, enemies will be pulled towards Isaac at great force; in certain cases, enough force will be generated to pull enemies through rocks. This can greatly increase accuracy but depending on enemies' movements and positions can also damage Isaac."], ["{{i|The Parasite}}: Enemies will be pulled towards both fired tears and split tears. However, because they both travel in opposite directions, the split tears' magnetic effects tend to cancel each other out."], ["{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Due to tears being reflected, enemies tend to be pulled towards Isaac with much force. Additionally, the random angle of tears being reflected results in erratic enemy movement.
