'''Not recommended.'''"], ["{{i|Soy Milk}}: The rapid tears will pull enemies quickly and erratically around the room. '''Not recommended.'''"], ["{{i|Tiny Planet}}/{{i|Immaculate Heart}}: The orbiting tears will cause enemies to be pulled towards Isaac. '''Not recommended.'''"]]

name: Blue Map
description: Reveals the locations of {{r|Secret Room}}s and {{r|Super Secret Room}}s on the map.
effects: [['Reveals the locations of {{r|Secret Room}}s and {{r|Super Secret Room}}s on the map.']]
notes: [['When combined with {{i|The Compass}} and {{i|Treasure Map}}, the entire floor is revealed, identical to the effect of {{i|The Mind}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Blue Map does not display {{r|Ultra Secret Room}}s.']]
synergies: [['{{t|Fragmented Card}} / {{I|Luna}}: Extra {{r|Secret Room}}s / {{r|Super Secret Room}}s are revealed as well.']]

name: Sissy Longlegs
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that wanders randomly, occasionally spawning [[Blue Spider]]s.
synergies: [['{{i|Hive Mind}}: The Spiders she spawns deal double damage.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect.']]

name: Cricket's Body
description: When tears hit an object or deplete their range, they spawn 4 smaller tears, whose range and [[damage]] scale with Isaac's. {{dlc|nr}} Grants -1 tear delay and reduces [[range]]. {{dlc|r}} Grants +0.5 fire rate and reduces [[range]].
effects: [["When Isaac's normal tears disappear (either from hitting the ground or hitting something else), they spawn 4 smaller tears.", ["Each smaller tear deals half of Isaac's normal [[damage]]."]], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 1.2x.', ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.1 tear size.', 'Split tears are scaled down by 0.6x from the main ones, ignoring damage based size reduction.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} -10 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} -20% [[range]] multiplier.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|1|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].']]
notes: [['Any [[status effect]]-carrying tears: split tears will carry the same status effect.'], ['If Isaac has less than {{dlc|nr}}10 range/{{dlc|r}}10 [[tear height]], the split tears appear but cannot cause damage before hitting the floor.', ['{{dlc|nr}} {{c|Cain}}, {{c|Lazarus}}, and {{c|Samson}} have lower starting range and are particularly susceptible.', "[[Tear falling speed]] ups can't mitigate this downside."]]]
synergies: [['{{i|Angelic Prism}}: All tears split by the prism will burst into split tears.'], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: Bob's Rotten Head splits into four smaller heads on detonation."], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}: When bone tears split into bone shards after hitting an obstacle or enemy, the bone shards will split into 4 smaller bone shards after hitting the ground.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: All normal Haemolacria burst tears burst again into 4 split tears.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}/{{i|Fire Mind}}: Main tear splits into four explosive splash tears. The split tears can still damage Isaac. Having {{i|Host Hat}} or {{i|Pyromaniac}} is strongly recommended.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Fed tears split into 12 tears.'], ["{{i|Lead Pencil}}/{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: All tears fired will splash after landing. Increased damage potential only noticed when firing into groups, due to the random pattern of each tear when it splashes."], ['{{i|The Parasite}}: Eight split tears instead of four.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The split tears orbit Isaac instead of spreading.'], ['{{i|Tough Love}}: Teeth tears will split into 4 smaller teeth.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Main tears and split tears will travel along the beam.']]
interactions: [["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Cricket's Body.", ['{{dlc|r}} Small red brimstone tears will fire out upon the beam hitting a wall or enemy.', "{{dlc|r}} '''Brimstone''' + {{i|Soy Milk}}: Brimstone tears always fire out at the end of the beam."]], ['{{i|Dead Onion}}: Significantly decreases effective range, potentially preventing the split tears from causing damage.'], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Greatly reduces range, bombs do not split.', ['{{dlc|a}} The bombs fired by Dr. Fetus will split into smaller bombs, much like {{i|Scatter Bombs}}.', ['This synergy stacks with Scatter Bombs.']]], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Only tear stat change applies.'], ['{{i|Euthanasia}}: Needle tears will split into 4 small needle tears upon hitting the ground or an enemy. Split tears produced have a chance to deal triple damage but will not cause tear bursts.'], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Tears will usually only bounce twice, unless Isaac has high range, and spawns burst tears when they bounce.'], ['{{T|Hook Worm}}: Split tears gain a significant range increase, allowing them to potentially hit farther targets'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Drastically decreases range, potentially preventing the split tears from causing damage. The stone will not split.'], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Overrides Cricket's Body except for stat effects which apply."], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Range of the knife is significantly decreased."], ['{{i|Number One}}: Drastically decreases range, potentially preventing the split tears from causing damage.'], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Tears will only split after landing on the ground.'], ['[[Spectral tears]]: Tears will only split after landing on the ground.'], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Technology}}: Overrides Cricket's Body except for stat effects, which apply normally.", ["{{dlc|r}} Cricket's Body tear splitting effect applies when lasers hit something."]], ["{{i|Tech X|force=anr}}: Overrides Cricket's Body except for stat effects, which apply normally.", ["{{Dlc|r}}Cricket's Body tear splitting effect applies when laser rings hit something."]]]

name: Leech
description: Spawns a leech [[familiar]] that chases enemies, dealing ~3 damage per second. Heals a {{E|Half Red Heart}} whenever Leech kills an enemy.
notes: [["The Leech's healing effect does not affect [[characters]] that do not have [[Health|Heart containers]].", ['{{dlc|a}} {{C|Keeper}}/{{Dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Keeper}} will be healed by The Leech.']], ['Enemies that turn into flesh piles and regenerate when killed such as {{E|Globin}}s and some [[champion|dark red champions]] regenerate quicker than the Leech can kill them. Isaac will gain half a heart each time the enemies collapse, granting an easy way to regenerate all Red Hearts. This can also open up many powerful synergies with any item that provides a benefit or resource when Isaac takes damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}}Like with {{I|Ghost Baby}} having a chance to drop from [[Rocks#Skulls|skulls]], Leech can rarely drop from the [[Rocks#Buckets|buckets]] in {{S|Downpour}} or {{S|Dross}}.']]
synergies: [['{{R|Arcade}}s: The player can let the Leech eat {{E|Fly|display=Flies}} from the {{M|Shell Game}} and use the resulting health to gamble on the {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}.'], ['{{i|BFFS!}}: Leech grows bigger and does double damage. Still only heals for a Half Red Heart.'], ['{{i|Flush!}}: The leech still can attack the enemies turned into poop and gain health.'], ['{{i|E. Coli}}: Enemies can be turned into {{E|poop}} at the cost of a Half Red Heart, then consumed by the leech to regain health. Utilization of temporary immunity when hit can allow multiple enemies to be turned into poop, resulting in a net gain of health. However, when combined with Gnawed Leaf (see below), the player can simply stand still and let Leech do the dirty work.'], ['{{i|Gnawed Leaf}}: The player can stand still and allow the Leech to clear a [[Rooms|room]], granting simple clears and easy health.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: The leech can grant blood charges by killing enemies.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Maggy's Bow}}: No effect on healing."]]

name: Unicorn Stump
description: Gives [[invulnerability]] and increased [[speed]] for six seconds, but removes the ability to shoot tears.
effects: [['Gives [[invulnerability]] and +0.28 [[speed]] for six seconds, but removes the ability to shoot tears while the effect is active.']]
notes: [['The invulnerability effect negates all forms of damage, including health loss from {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.'], ['Does not prevent [[Red Heart container]] loss from [[Health Down]] pills or {{R|Devil Room}} deals.'], ['The item is similar to {{i|My Little Unicorn}}, with faster recharge time at the cost of being unable to damage enemies while under its effects.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} If another active item is picked up while in the [[invulnerability]] state granted by Unicorn Stump, Isaac will return to normal immediately, becoming able to shoot tears and take damage.']]
synergies:
[['{{i|4.5 Volt}}: With some damage source while this item is active, it can be permanently invulnerable inside the room while you have enemies.'], ["{{i|???'s Only Friend}}: The fly can still be controlled while invincible."], ['{{bov}}
'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Doubles the duration of invulnerability.'], ["{{I|Mom's Knife}} does contact damage in the same direction it was being held at the time of using the Unicorn Stump, giving a massive amount of free damage by ramming into an enemy.", ['If you have the [[Yes Mother?]] Transformation, you can basically do the same thing using this item.']], ['On contact items ({{i|Aries}}, {{i|The Virus}}, etc.): Freely usable in basically every room.', ['[[Orbital Familiar]]s ({{i|Cube of Meat}}, {{i|Sacrificial Dagger}}, etc.): The orbital can be used freely in every single room, making it a great alternative source of damage.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear stays in place while Isaac is invincible; although Isaac cannot move the tear, it will continue to damage enemies during his invincibility. This is very useful for stationary enemies.'], ["{{i|Marked}}: Isaac's tears will still fire, but he will be unable to move the crosshair while invincible."]]

name: Abel
description:
{{dlc|na}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that mirrors Isaac's movements and shoots in the opposite direction.
{{dlc+|a}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that mirrors Isaac's movements and shoots towards him.{{dlc-}}
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that mirrors Isaac's movements and shoots tears that deal 3.5 damage.", ['{{dlc|nr}} Abel shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Abel shoots once every half-second.', '{{dlc|na}} Abel shoots tears in the opposite direction of Isaac.', '{{dlc|a}} Abel shoots tears towards Isaac regardless of which direction Isaac is shooting.', "{{dlc|r}} When used by {{C|Cain}} or {{C|Tainted Cain}}, Abel's tears are red and deal 7.5 damage."]], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['Although it is difficult to hit enemies with Abel, he can be useful in certain situations. {{E|Dople}}s and {{E|Evil Twin}}s can be easily taken care of without risk of damage using Abel. Abel can also assist in killing slow or stationary [[monster]]s that happen to be around the center of the [[Rooms|room]].'], ['In symmetrical room layouts Abel can be used to clear away destructible [[obstacle]]s such as fire places and poops.']]
synergies: [['{{t|Extension Cord}} creates a line of lightning between Isaac and Abel that damages enemies that come in contact.']]

name: Experimental Treatment
quote: Some stats up, some stats down
description:
{{dlc|na+}} Randomly increases and decreases some of Isaac's [[Attributes|stats]].
{{dlc|a+}} Increases four random [[Attributes|stats]] and decreases the other two.
effects: [["{{dlc|na+}} Randomly increases at least 1 and decreases 1-3 of Isaac's [[Attributes|stats]]. The same stats can be increased/decreased multiple times."], ["{{dlc|a+}} Randomly increases 4 and decreases 2 of Isaac's [[Attributes|stats]]."], ['Each increase or decrease for a stat will change it by a fixed value:', ['±1 [[health]].', '±1 flat [[damage]].', '{{dlc|nr}} ±0.5 [[tears]].', '{{dlc|r}} ±0.5 [[fire rate]].', '{{dlc|nr}} ±0.5 [[range]].', '{{dlc|r}} ±1.5 [[range]].', '±0.2 [[shot speed]].', '±0.2 [[speed]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).'], '±1 [[luck]].']], ['If a stat that is already at an upper or lower limit is chosen, there is no visible effect.'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|r}} This makes the item especially useful for {{c|Tainted Isaac}}, since he gets to keep the stats while having the option to switch Experimental Treatment for another item and the transformation progress isn't lost in the process.\n{{dlc|r}} The tears up from this item is allowed to go past the normal tear cap of 5.0. However if it decreases tears, the normal tear cap will also be decreased."]]

name: Red Candle
description: Throws out a flame that damages everything in its path, diminishing in size as it hits enemies or blocks shots.
effects: [['On use, Isaac raises the candle above his head. On pressing a fire button, a red flame, similar to a {{E|red fire place}}, will fire in the chosen direction. It can pass over pits, but can not travel through [[obstacles]].', ['The flame deals 23 damage per tick, and can hit up to 5 times for a maximum of 115 damage per flame.', 'The flame also destroys enemy shots it comes into contact with, which decreases its size each time being hit until the flame is entirely extinguished by this process.', '{{dlc|nr}} The flame projectile is persistent and will remain active in the [[room]] until it deals a set amount of damage.', '{{dlc|r}} Flames will disappear automatically after 10 seconds.']]]
notes: [['While Isaac holds the candle above his head, his movement speed is reduced.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} There is no limit to the number of fires that can be active. This is useful in situations where mob spawning can be controlled: for example, beating {{R|Boss Rush}} or [[Greed Mode]] as {{C|The Lost}}. This is time-consuming but can be viable if other sources of damage are weak or unreliable.'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} It will block Isaac's tears but won't burn him. Isaac's tears can also shrink the size of the flame."], ["{{dlc|r}} Flames do not block Isaac's shots, nor are they put out by them."], ['Flames will destroy {{E|shopkeeper}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Flames will turn certain enemies (such as {{E|Hopper}}s and {{E|Clotty|display=Clotties}}) into their flaming variants, making them stronger. The flame is unable to damage these monsters.']]
synergies: [['{{I|9 Volt}}: Decreases cooldown.'], ['{{bov}}']]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{dlc+|nr}}{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: When the fire hits the tear, the tear resets and appears again on the player.{{dlc-}}']]

name: Little Baggy
description: Isaac can hold 2 [[pill]]s at once and all [[card]]s and [[rune]]s are replaced by pills.
effects: [['Allows Isaac to carry two [[pill]]s. Tapping the Drop button will cause a cycle through the two pills.'], ['Spawns a random pill.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Changes all [[card]] and [[rune]] drops into pills.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Only changes [[card]] drops into pills.', ['Any Tarot card or rune held when picking this item up will change into a pill.', '{{p|Dice Shard|nr}} counts as a card and will be converted.', '{{dlc|r}} If playing as {{C|Jacob and Esau}}, if one character picks up Little Baggy while the other character holds a card, that card will remain until used or dropped.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Blowing up the [[Rocks#Marked Skulls|skull]] marked with a small "X" in {{s|Depths}} will drop [[Telepills]] instead of {{P|0 - The Fool}}.', ['But already generated {{P|0 - The Fool}} cards will NOT be transformed into [[Telepills]] and could become any pill, thereby making the [[Ascent]] impossible!']], ['{{dlc|r}} [[Tainted Characters|Tainted characters]] or anyone who already has an active item in the pill slot will be allowed a third slot for pills.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Crystal Ball}}: Generates pills instead of cards upon use.'], ["{{i|Deck of Cards}}: Generates pills instead of cards upon use, similar to{{I|Mom's bottle of pills}}."], ['{{I|False PHD}}: Since all cards turn to pills, there is potential for a lot of damage ups.'], ['{{i|PHD}}/{{i|Virgo}}: Most negative pills will be converted to their positive counterparts.', ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Lucky Foot}}: Most negative pills will be converted to their positive counterparts.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Starter Deck}}: Overrides Little Baggy. Pills may still be for sale in shops, but dropping them turns them into cards.', ['{{dlc|r}} Having both items allows both cards and pills to appear again.', 'Picking up Starter Deck while already holding Little Baggy will turn any held pills into cards for one time.']]]

name: Robo-Baby 2.0
quote: We worked out all the kinks
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that fires lasers at any enemy in its line of sight and moves based on the direction Isaac is firing tears.
notes: [['Unlike {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}, Robo-Baby 2.0 cannot be controlled with the mouse if mouse control is enabled in the config files.']]

name: Mysterious Liquid
description: Tears leave a small, short lasting pool of [[creep]] on impact or when their range is depleted.
effects: [['Tears leave a small, short-lasting pool of [[creep]] upon hitting an enemy or when their range is depleted.', ['The creep deals 1 damage per tick or 30 damage per second.', '{{Dlc|r}} The creep can deal up to 25 damage.', 'Multiple creep pools can inflict damage on an enemy simultaneously.']]]
synergies: [["{{I|Compound Fracture}} / {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}}: Each split tear leaves a creep, creating lots of creep pools."], ['{{I|Explosivo}}: Leaves an explosion-sized creep whenever the Explosivo tear goes off.'], ['{{I|Flat Stone}}: Every time tears bounce, creep spawns.'], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: Spawns creep trail under the tear on a constant time interval.'], ["{{I|Mom's Knife}}: Spawns a line of creep behind the knife as it shoots towards enemies, each one left on random time interval."], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}}: The projectiles from the sword spawn creep pools, sword attacks do not.'], ['{{I|Tech.5|force=a+}}: The lasers spawn creep pools always when it hits obstacles and occasionally on enemies.'], ['{{I|Technology 2|force=a+}}: The lasers rapidly spawn creep pools on hitting both obstacles and enemies.'], ['{{I|Tech X}}: The laser rings spawn creep pools when it hits enemies on a constant time interval.'], ['{{I|Trisagion}}: The blasts leave long trails of creep pools, and a creep for each damaging tick. Since the effect stacks, they cause massive damage.']]
interactions: [['Following items leave the creep pools:', ['{{I|Eye of Greed}}', "{{I|Fate's Reward}}", '{{T|Found Soul}}', '{{I|Gello}}', '{{I|Host Hat}}', '{{I|Incubus}}', '{{I|Kidney Stone}}', '{{I|Lead Pencil}}', '{{I|Metal Plate}}', '{{I|Sad Bombs}}', '{{I|Saturnus}}', "{{I|Tammy's Head}}", '{{I|Twisted Pair}}', '{{I|Varicose Veins}}']], ['Following items do not leave the creep pools:', ['{{I|Akeldama}}', '{{I|Brimstone Bombs}}', '{{I|Circle of Protection}}', '{{I|Divine Intervention}}', '{{I|It Hurts}}', '{{I|Large Zit}}', '{{I|Shard of Glass}}', '{{I|Slipped Rib}}', '{{I|Vasculitis}}']], ['{{I|Athame}} / {{I|Maw of the Void}}: Only creates the creep pools when damaging enemies or destroyable obstacles.'], ['{{I|Brimstone}}: Overrides Mysterious Liquid.', ['{{Dlc|a}} The beam spawns pools of liquid always when it hits obstacles and enemies on a constant time interval.', ["{{C|Azazel}}: Leaves the creep pools at the end of Azazel's shorter brimstone beam."]]], ['{{I|Dr. Fetus}} / {{I|Epic Fetus}} / {{I|Ipecac}}: Overrides Mysterious Liquid.', ['{{Dlc|a}} Explosions caused by these items will leave a large pool of creep.']], ['{{I|Fire Mind}}: Mysterious Liquid removes explosion chance, but fire damage over time is preserved.', ['{{Dlc|a}} Tears can explode as expected. The explosions leave a large pool of creep.']], ['{{I|Flat Stone}}: Each tear bounce leaves a pool of creep.'], ['{{I|Haemolacria}}: Only the main tear spawns creep.', ['{{Dlc|r}} All tears leave the creep pools .']], ['{{I|Lachryphagy}}: Only the burst tears spawns creep.'], ['{{I|Lost Contact}}: Overrides Mysterious Liquid.', ['{{Dlc|a+}} The combination works as expected, with tears spawning liquid even when stopping enemy shots.']], ["{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: Mysterious Liquid's graphical effect remains, but the tear leaves no creep.", ['{{Dlc|a}} The tear leaves a trail of creep pools on a constant time interval.']], ["{{I|Montezuma's Revenge}}: Constantly creates pools of creep at the end of the beam. Corn projectiles do not spawn creep."], ['{{I|Mucormycosis}}: All tears including spores spawn creep upon burst, but not on contact with enemies.'], ["{{t|Nose Goblin}} / {{I|Sinus Infection}}: Spawns creep after each tear's effect wears off and drops to the ground but not on contact with enemies."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Tears do not leave creep pools  when they hit and pass through an enemy, and only leave creep pools when they hit an obstacle or run out of range.'], ['{{I|Revelation}}: The beam spawns pools of liquid always when it hits obstacles and enemies on a constant time interval.'], ['{{I|Rubber Cement}}: Tears do not create creep when they bounce off enemies or obstacles and only when they land.'], ['[[Spectral tears]]: Tears only spawn creep pools after they land, not while passing through obstacles.'], ['{{I|Strange Attractor}}: Overrides Mysterious Liquid.', ['{{Dlc|a+}} The combination works as expected.']], ['{{I|Technology}}: Overrides Mysterious Liquid.', ['{{Dlc|a}} The laser spawns pools of liquid always when it hits obstacles and occasionally on enemies.']]]

name: Sad Bombs
description: +5 {{E|Bomb}}s. Upon exploding, bombs shoot 10 tears around them, affected by tear modifiers.
notes: [['The tears generated by the bombs can push other bombs. Dropping multiple Sad Bombs is not advised since they could be pushed near you.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Tears will hover in place for a few seconds before dispersing.'], ["{{i|BBF}}/{{i|Best Friend}}/{{i|Bob's Brain}}/{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}/{{i|Mr. Boom}}: Gains the Sad Bombs effect."], ['{{i|Blood Bombs}}: Gives the bombs a unique visual appearance (red tears), and changes the color of the tears shot to red.'], ['{{i|Blood Clot}}: The bombs produce tears that mimic the tear last fired before explosion.'], ['{{i|Bomber Boy|anr}}: Each explosion releases 10 tears in all directions.'], ['{{dlc|a}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Bombs explode into Brimstone beams in all directions.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Bombs explode into tears that will split."], ['{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}/ {{I|Epic Fetus}}: Fired bombs/missiles will explode into tears.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fired bombs/missiles have a chance to explode into tears. This effect occurs randomly based on the luck stat.']], ['{{transf|Guppy}}: The bomb’s tears can also generate flies.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Bombs explode into Haemolacria tears which burst into tears.'], ['{{i|Kamikaze!}}: Tears will explode after activating the item.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Bombs explode into knives that don't return."], ['{{i|Multidimensional Baby}}: Each tear from the bomb will be duplicated.'], ["{{dlc|a+}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: A ring of 10 tears is shot outward upon detonation, which are affected by Isaac's tear modifiers, and deal damage equal to 15 + 0.6x, where x is Isaac's Damage."], ['{{i|Scatter Bombs}}: All mini bombs gain the effect and deal full damage.', ['{{dlc|r}}Tears from extra explosions deal 65% of their normal damage.']], ['{{i|Technology}}: Bombs explode into Technology beams in all directions.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Bombs explode into Technology beams in all directions.']]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: Does not affect the amount of tears when bombs explode.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Bomber Boy}}: Only the center most explosion creates 10 tears.'], ['{{i|Explosivo}}: Tear explosions are not affected by Sad Bombs.'], ["{{i|Ipecac}}: Normal Ipecac shots won't explode into tears, but placed bombs will shoot Ipecac shots in every direction."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|Marked}}: Tears that burst from bombs cannot be controlled.'], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Tears will return to the place where the bomb exploded, not Isaac.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears orbit around where the bomb exploded, not Isaac.'], ['{{i|Tech.5}}: No effect.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Technology 2}}: Bombs only explode into tears with a slight damage reduction.', ['{{dlc|r}}The damage reduction is removed.']]]

name: Smart Fly
description: Spawns an [[Familiar#Orbital familiars|orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots. Upon taking damage, the familiar will pursue enemies for the rest of the [[Rooms|room]], dealing 22.5 damage per second.
notes: [['Smart Fly does not take up one of the three orbital slots; it floats between two of the other orbitals.'], ['While behaving like an orbital, Smart Fly will break away from Isaac if he is traveling fast enough and will follow Isaac until he slows down enough to reattach. This is the only orbital item in the game that exhibits such behavior.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Duct Tape}}: Fly will stay in place when orbiting Isaac but will still pursue enemies.']]

name: Synthoil
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[damage]], +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].
{{dlc|r}} +1 [[damage]], +1.5 [[range]].
effects: [['+1 [[damage]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]

name: Lil Haunt
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that chases down enemies, dealing 4 damage per second and inflicting [[fear]].

name: Satanic Bible
quote: Reusable evil... but at what cost?
description: Gives one {{e|Black Heart}}. {{dlc|r}} Replaces the [[Boss (Item Pool)|boss room item]] on the current [[floor]] with a [[Devil Deal]].
effects: [['Gives one {{E|Black Heart}}.'], ["{{dlc+|r}} Once used, the {{r|Boss Room}} item pedestal for that [[floor]] will be replaced by a Deal with the Devil. These items must be paid for as a normal [[Devil_Room#Deals_with_the_Devil|Devil Deal]] would. This ''does'' affect {{r|Angel Room}} / {{r|Devil Room}} chance, so if Isaac takes this item, no Angel Rooms will appear for the rest of the run unless he has {{i|Act of Contrition}}, {{I|Book of Virtues}}, {{I|Duality}}, or {{I|Eucharist}}. Alternatively, playing {{R|Sacrifice Room}}s and {{Machine|Confessional}}s (usually) allows Angel Rooms to spawn on the current floor.", ["This does not affect {{i|The Polaroid}}, {{i|The Negative}}, or {{i|Dad's Note}}.{{dlc-}}"]], ['{{transf|Bookworm|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} Bosses with set drops aside from {{E|Mom}} will still drop their normal item, but at the cost of one [[Heart Container]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} On XL floors, both items will become Devil Deals, even if Satanic Bible was only used once.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|The Lost}}, {{c|Tainted Lost}}, and {{c|Tainted Jacob}} in his ghost form can safely take any {{r|Boss Room}} item pedestals and it has no effect on subsequent devil deals.', ['This also applies to the Lost form granted by the white fire on {{s|Downpour}} / {{s|Dross}} II. Taking a deal in this form will not remove hearts, making the player able to get at least 2 {{r|Devil Room}} items for free on that floor.']], ['{{dlc|r}} This does not affect the items dropped on {{s|The Void}}.'], ["{{dlc+|r}} Using the Satanic Bible changes the Boss Room's item pool to the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool]] for purposes other than direct boss rewards as well. This works even if the boss does not normally drop items, such as {{E|Mom}}, {{E|Satan}}, or {{E|???}}.", ['Rerolls such as {{i|The D6}}, {{p|Rune of Perthro}}, or {{p|Soul of Isaac}} will generate {{r|Devil Room}} items.', "Using Satanic Bible ''after'' the Boss Room item has spawned, followed by any reroll, causes the new item to be drawn from the Devil Room item pool, but it will have no heart cost. Taking this item will not prevent Angel Rooms from spawning.{{dlc-}}"]], ["{{dlc|r}} In True Co-op, the pedestal's additional items will also be Devil deals, but be drawn from the Boss item pool."]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Gives Isaac two black hearts.'], ['{{p|Soul of the Lost}}: The Devil Deal can be taken for free.'], ["{{dlc|r}} {{I|There's Options}}: 2 Devil Deals will be offered, but only one can be taken."]]
interactions: [['{{I|Chaos|r}}: The item spawned will be chosen from a random [[item pool]] instead.'], ['{{I|Lemegeton}}: Will generate wisps from the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool]] when used inside the {{r|Boss Room}} after Satanic Bible is used.'], ['{{I|Vanishing Twin}}: The second boss spawned will also drop an item from the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool]].'], ['{{I|Book of Revelations|r}}: The spawned {{i|Ball of Bandages}} or {{i|Cube of Meat}} will cost hearts like a normal devil deal.']]

name: Cain's Other Eye
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that floats slowly around the room on a zig-zag pattern similar to {{I|The Peeper}} and shoots normal tears in the same direction as Isaac.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that floats slowly around the room in a zig-zag pattern similar to {{i|The Peeper}} and shoots normal tears in the same direction as Isaac. Each tear deals 3.5 damage.', ["{{dlc|a}} Each tear deals Isaac's damage."]]]
notes: [["Unlike {{i|The Peeper}}, Cain's Other Eye does no contact damage."]]

name: Undefined
description: Teleports Isaac to the {{R|Secret Room}}, {{R|Super Secret Room}}, {{R|Treasure Room}}, or {{R|I AM ERROR}}.
effects: [['Teleports Isaac to the {{R|Treasure Room}}, the {{R|Secret Room}}, the {{R|Super Secret Room}} or {{r|I AM ERROR}}. There is also a minuscule chance of teleporting into a {{R|Black Market}}.', ['The chances for each main destination are equal.', '{{dlc|r}} Has no effect when used in {{s|Home}}.']]]

name: BBF
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that flies around the room in a zig-zag pattern and explodes on contact with an enemy. Respawns after ten seconds.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar that flies around the room like a {{E|Boom Fly}} and explodes on contact with an enemy, dealing 60 damage to all enemies within its blast radius and 10 damage to the enemy it touched.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Deals 100 damage to all enemies within its blast radius and 10 damage to the enemy it touched.', ['It will respawn 10 seconds after exploding, or upon entering a different room.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['Most obtained bomb modifiers are applied to BBF as well.'], ['The blast can damage Isaac as a normal bomb would.'], ["For the first few moments after entering a room, the familiar will do contact damage instead of exploding. This means the familiar will not blow up in Isaac's face if there is an enemy right next to the familiar's starting point. However, it may kill enemies that explode on death."]]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}} / {{I|Hive Mind}}: Doubles the contact damage to 20 and increases explosion damage by 25.', ['{{dlc|r}} Contact damage becomes 20 and explosion damage increases to 125.']], ['{{i|Mr. Mega}}: The explosion damage increases by 50 points.']]
interactions: [['Effects applied as normal:', ['{{I|Blood Bombs}}', '{{I|Brimstone Bombs}}', '{{I|Butt Bombs}}', '{{I|Glitter Bombs}}', '{{I|Hot Bombs}}', '{{I|Nancy Bombs}}', '{{I|Sad Bombs}}']], ['No effect:', ['{{I|Bobby-Bomb}}', '{{I|Fast Bombs}}', '{{I|Ghost Bombs}}', '{{I|Rocket in a Jar}}', '{{I|Scatter Bombs}}', '{{I|Sticky Bombs}}']], ["{{I|Bob's Curse}}: The explosion applies [[Status Effects|poison]] effect.", ['{{Dlc+|r}}Does not leave the poison cloud.{{Dlc-}}']], ['{{i|Bomber Boy|nr}}: No cross explosions. Damage from the explosion is halved against the initial target, but others caught in the blast take full damage.', ["{{dlc|r}} Explodes in a cross-shaped pattern. Damage from the main explosion deals a flat 37.5 damage, and any additional explosion deals flat 75 damage to which Bomber boy's damage reduction is not applied.", ['Bomber Boy + {{I|BFFS!}} / {{I|Hive Mind}}: Explosion damages are increased to 1.25x, which are 46.875/93.75 each.', 'Bomber Boy + {{I|Mr. Mega}}: Explosion damages are increased to 1.5x, which are 56.25/112.5 each.', 'Bomber Boy + {{I|BFFS!}} / {{I|Hive Mind}} + {{I|Mr. Mega}}: Explosion damages are increased to 1.75x, which are 65.625/131.25 each.']]]]

name: Tech.5
description: Isaac occasionally fires an unlimited range [[piercing tears|piercing]] laser alongside his normal tears. The laser can glitch, mimicking the effects of certain items and trinkets.
effects: [['Grants an unlimited range [[piercing tears|piercing]] laser with random rate of fire that does not replace tears.'], ['The laser has a 1/6 chance to fire every ~0.07 seconds (4 frames), firing at an average rate of 2.5 times per second.'], ['The laser occasionally fires with the effect of a random item or trinket, including:', ['{{t|Hook Worm}}', '{{i|Spoon Bender}}', '{{i|Tiny Planet}}', '{{dlc|a}} {{i|Mysterious Liquid}}', '{{dlc|a}} {{i|Rubber Cement}}', '{{t|Brain Worm}}']]]
notes: [["The damage of the laser scales directly with Isaac's damage."], ['Unlike {{i|Technology}} or {{i|Technology 2}}, Isaac can still fire tears from both eyes in addition to firing the laser.'], ['The laser can be fired independently from tears by slightly tilting the right analog stick, just like shooting familiars.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Unlike {{i|Technology}}, Tech.5 Lasers do not have momentum, and fire exclusively in the cardinal directions unless Isaac has an item like {{i|Analog Stick}}, {{i|Eye of the Occult}} or {{I|Marked}}.']]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Anti-gravity}}:  Creates floating laser balls that will all fire simultaneously when the fire button is released.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: Tech.5 does not fire. However, it will still fire when playing as {{C|Azazel}} with his short-ranged Brimstone. Since the laser scales with player damage, this can be a devastating combination.', ['{{dlc|a}} Tech.5 fires normally while Brimstone laser is charging.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Cricket's Body}}: Tear delay down as expected, but no benefit from the splash effect.", ['{{dlc|r}} Releases a 4-way spread of tears whenever the laser hits a wall or an enemy.']], ['{{I|Gello}}: Laser only fires from Isaac.'], ['{{C|Lilith|anr}}: No effect, as Lilith is inherently Blindfolded.', ["{{dlc|r}} Lilith fires the Tech.5 laser from her forehead as expected, though the costume doesn't appear."]], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Laser is fired in the same direction that the controlled tear is moving.'], ['{{I|Ipecac|r}}: Laser explodes and poisons enemies on contact.'], ['{{dlc|a}}{{I|Rubber cement}}: Laser will bounce in angle depending on the obstacle hit.']]

name: Isaac's Tears
description: Fires 8 tears around Isaac, which retain the [[damage]], [[range]], [[shot speed]], and special [[Tear Effects|tear effects]]. Each tear shot by Isaac increases item charge by one.
effects: [['Each tear shot by the player increases item charge by one.'], ['Upon use, fires 8 tears around Isaac, which retain the [[damage]], [[range]], [[shot speed]], and most special [[Tear Effects|tear effects]].']]
notes: [["The effect of {{i|Tammy's Head}} is similar to Isaac's Tears, but Isaac's Tears will not benefit from tear-replacing items like {{i|Brimstone}}."], ["{{dlc|na+}} It takes 1.3 seconds to use, during which time Isaac cannot shoot tears normally. Because of this it is only worth it to use Isaac's tears DPS-wise if 4 or more tears successfully land.", ['{{dlc|a+}} It takes 0.4 seconds to use, during which time Isaac cannot shoot tears normally.', '{{dlc|r}} It takes 0.1 seconds to use, short enough that it usually will not interrupt shooting tears normally.']]]
interactions: [["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Brimstone}} / {{i|Mom's Knife}}: The item fires normal tears, although it will charge nearly instantly while the attack charges.", ["'''Brimstone''' + {{i|Lachryphagy}}: When tears burst, they will shoot out Brimstone lasers in a fashion similar to {{i|Tammy's Head}}."]], ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Brimstone}}: Rapidly charges Isaac's Tears, while firing, instead of charging."], ['{{I|Car Battery|anr}}: No effect.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: The size and damage of tears fired depend on how far Isaac has charged up his shot. For example, if Isaac has completely charged his shot, the tears fired by the item will be fully charged.', ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Charge does not have any effect on the damage of the tear, but will still be colored like Chocolate Milk tears.']], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Fires normal tears.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The item fires normal tears, but charges very quickly as the crosshairs are moved.', ["{{dlc|r}}The item charges when the crosshair is on screen, and charge speed scales with Isaac's [[tears]] stat."]], ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Makes the tears controllable and able to be made most use of.'], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The item charges based on the tear's movement.", ["{{dlc|r}} The item charges even while the tear is not moving, with the speed based on Isaac's tears stat."]], ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Charges the item like normal."], ["{{i|Schoolbag|a+nr}}: When Isaac's Tears is in the first active item slot, the secondary item does not charge upon clearing rooms. {{dlc-}}"], ["{{I|Spirit sword}}: The item fires normal tears and can be charged as fast as the sword can be swung. Doing a spin attack will fully charge Isaac's Tears."], ['{{i|Technology}}: Fires normal tears.'], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: Fires normal tears.']]

name: Judas' Shadow
description: Upon [[death]], respawns Isaac as {{c|Dark Judas}} with two {{e|Black Heart}}s in the most recent non-hostile room.
effects: [['Upon [[death]], respawns Isaac as {{c|Dark Judas}} with two {{e|Black Heart}}s in the most recent non-hostile room.']]
notes: [["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Judas' Shadow is {{dlc|nr}} 8th / {{dlc|r}} 10th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, {{i|Dead Cat|nr}}, {{c|Lazarus|nr}}' inherent extra life ({{dlc|r}} swap the order of the previous two), {{i|Inner Child}}, {{i|Guppy's Collar}}, {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}, {{i|Ankh}}, and {{t|Broken Ankh}}."], ['Beating bosses as {{c|Dark Judas}} will give [[Completion Mark]]s for {{c|Judas}} and will unlock the associated items and achievements.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Judas}}: Revived as Tainted Judas instead of Dark Judas.']]

name: The Negative
description: If Isaac has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, all enemies in the room take significant damage. Allows entrance into the {{s|Dark Room}}. {{dlc|r}} +1 [[Damage]] and also allows access to {{s|Home}}.
effects: [['If the character has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, it triggers {{i|The Necronomicon}} effect, damaging all enemies in the room.'], ['Allows entrance into the {{s|Dark Room}} after beating {{E|Satan}} in {{s|Sheol}} by touching the chest.'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1 [[damage]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Opens {{A|A Strange Door|n}} in {{s|Depths}} II and its variants that leads to {{s|Mausoleum}}/{{s|Gehenna}} II.', ["Unlike with the Dark Room entrance, The Negative gets consumed by the door and vanishes from Isaac's inventory."]]]
notes: [['This item is a guaranteed drop from {{E|Mom}}, if unlocked. Will drop alongside {{i|The Polaroid}}, provided they are both unlocked. However, they are mutually exclusive: Once one of them is picked up, the other one will disappear.', ['With the use of a teleportation item and either a 5 pip {{R|Dice Room}} or a {{i|Forget Me Now}}, or  {{i|R Key}}, both The Polaroid and The Negative or multiple copies of The Polaroid or The Negative can be obtained.', 'With {{dlc|r}}{{C|Jacob and Esau}}, proper alignment of both characters can enable picking up both The Polaroid and The Negative.']], ["The Negative always triggers when taking damage as characters who lack heart containers, such as {{C|Azazel}} and {{C|Tainted Azazel}} (by default), {{C|???}} and {{C|Tainted ???}} (permanently), {{dlc|r}}{{C|Dark Judas}} and {{C|Tainted Judas}} (permanently) {{C|The Forgotten}} (only as the soul), {{C|Tainted Forgotten}} (permanently), {{C|Dead Tainted Lazarus}}(by default), {{C|Tainted Bethany}} (permanently) or any other character who has chosen to trade away their heart containers in [[Devil Room|deals with the Devil]], {{R|Black Market}}s, or with {{i|Guppy's Paw}} or {{i|Potato Peeler}}. It will also trigger if the character has only half of a red heart left."], ['The Negative will be the rightmost item after defeating Mom, in case {{cu|blind}} is active.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} It is possible to obtain two Negatives by obtaining one as an {{C|Eden}} starting item.'], ['Obtaining multiple copies of The Negative does not cause its effect to stack.'], ["As with all items crucial to story progress ({{I|Key Piece 1}} and {{I|Key Piece 2}}, {{I|Knife Piece 1}} and {{I|Knife Piece 2}}, {{I|Dad's Note}}, and {{I|Dogma}}), this item has protection from full-run rerolls. It does not, however, share the immunity {{I|Dad's Note}} has to D6-type rerolls and {{I|Void}}."]]
synergies: [['{{T|A Missing Page|r}} / {{I|Missing Page 2|r}}: Increases the damage from 40 to 80.', ["'''A Missing Page''' + '''Missing Page 2''': The damage increase stacks for a total of 120 damage."]]]

name: Guillotine
quote: DMG + tears up. An out-of-body experience!
description: Isaac's head is removed from his body and floats around him as an [[orbital familiar|orbital]]. {{dlc|nr}} Gives +1 [[damage]] and grants -1 [[tear delay]]. {{dlc|r}} Gives +1 [[damage]] and grants +0.5 [[fire rate]].
effects: [["Isaac's head rotates around his body and can be used to inflict contact damage similar to a {{i|Cube of Meat}}. Blocking tears with Isaac's head does not damage Isaac. His tears still originate from his head, so the line of fire is no longer constant while standing still."], ['+1 [[damage]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{tear delay down|1|no bullet=yes}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[fire rate]].'], ['The head orbital deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second ({{dlc|r}} 56 damage per second).']]
notes: [["{{dlc|r}} Isaac's body will spew a fountain of blood like a {{E|Gusher}}. This is purely cosmetic."], ["While Isaac's actual hitbox (his body) does not change, the position of the head can easily confuse the player on the body's exact position, making some tasks such as dodging tight bullet hell patterns or collecting pickups more difficult."], ['Items that apply contact damage and effects ({{I|The Virus}}, {{I|Aries}}, etc.) do not apply to the head.']]
synergies: [["{{i|BFFS!}}: Though the head doesn't physically increase in size, it now deals 2x contact damage."], ['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Adds another rotating head on each use. Each head increases damage and tears and blocks projectiles. With more heads, it is easier to locate the position of the body, and Box of Friends can be used multiple times in the same room to continue gaining heads.'], ["[[Spectral tears]]: Guillotine can move Isaac's head into walls and obstacles, which results in lots of wasted shots. Spectral tears allow all shots to have a chance to hit instead of being wasted."], ['{{T|The Twins}}: Has a chance to add another head, increasing damage and tears.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Berserk!}} /{{C|The Forgotten}} /{{C|Tainted Samson}} /{{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The melee weapon is swung from the body instead of the head.'], ['{{I|Big Fan}}: Slows down the head orbital.'], ["{{I|1=C Section}}: Fetuses are fired from Isaac's body, not his head."], ["{{i|Diplopia}}: Adds another head and further increases tears and damage, but only fires tears from one head. <!-- check if the tears up stacking is something new added in repentance since this originally said it didn't stack -->"], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{t|Duct Tape}}: Causes tears to be fired from far below and to the right of Isaac. This causes tears to be out of bounds unless Isaac is standing in the top-left corner of the room.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tears are fired from whatever position the head is stuck in.']], ["{{I|Guardian Angel}}: Does not increase the head's rotation speed."], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife fires from Isaac's body, not his head."], ['{{i|Sacrificial Altar}}: The head orbital cannot be sacrificed.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Scissors}}: Isaac will have two heads: the one from Scissors, which will shoot as normal, and the Guillotine one, which only acts as an orbital.'], ['{{I|Spin to Win}}: Affects the head, which boosts its damage and defense properties at the cost of shots being harder to hit.'], ["{{I|Spirit Sword}}: The sword is swung from Isaac's body, not his head. This also applies to the sword's projectiles."], ["{{C|Tainted Lilith}}: The baby fires from Lilith's body, not her head."], ['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Tiny Planet}}: Tears may fire from the head, but they orbit the body.'], ["{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Despite the beam moving with Isaac's head as it orbits the body, tears will be fired from the body."], ["{{i|Transcendence}}: Makes Isaac's body invisible, leaving only a shadow where his body is. As a result, Isaac becomes very difficult to control."]]

name: The Soul
description: Grants two {{E|Soul Heart}}s. Isaac gains a pulsing aura that repels enemies and projectiles.
effects: [['Grants two {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['Isaac gains a pulsing blue aura that repels enemies and projectiles.', ['The power of the repel force alternates in strength at random, sometimes strong enough to counter a projectile well before it hits Isaac, sometimes only strong enough to slow it down.', 'Ground-based enemies will overcome the counterforce easier than flying enemies and projectiles.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} A stronger effect of this item is given temporarily by {{P|I - The Magician?|x}}.'], ["{{dlc|r}} When playing as {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}, this item works only on the Forgotten's body and not the soul."], ["{{dlc|r}} When playing as {{C|Tainted Jacob}}, Dark Esau is unaffected by this item's repelling properties."]]

name: The Mind
description: Reveals the entire map, including all special rooms and {{R|Secret Room}}s.
effects: [['Grants the combined effects of the {{i|Blue Map}}, {{i|Treasure Map}}, and {{i|The Compass}}, revealing the floor layout and all special rooms, including {{R|Secret Room}}s and {{R|Super Secret Room}}s.\n== Synergies ==']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Book of Secrets}}: Immediately gives the {{i|X-Ray Vision}} effect for the floor upon use.']]

name: The Body
description: Adds 3 [[Red Heart Container]]s.

name: Key Piece 1
description: Combined with {{I|Key Piece 2}}, unlocks the golden gate in the starting [[Rooms|room]] of {{S|Chest}} and {{S|Dark Room}} to fight {{E|Mega Satan}}.
notes: [['This item is a guaranteed drop from {{E|Uriel}} if not already in possession.'], ["The Golden Gate can alternatively be opened using {{i|Dad's Key}}, {{p|Get out of Jail Free Card}} or {{i|Mr. ME!}}."], ['This item, along with {{i|Key Piece 2}}, can be rerolled into any item from the [[Item Pool#Angel Room|Angel Room pool]].'], ['This item also counts as a [[familiar]], meaning it takes up a familiar slot.'], ['Unlocking the Golden Gate with the combined key pieces and then restarting the floor with {{i|Forget Me Now}} or an {{R|I AM ERROR}} room will waste the key, which will not respawn.'], ['Will not be rerolled by {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, or {{R|Dice Room}} effects.'], ['Will not be doubled by {{i|Box of Friends}}'], ['Picking up two copies with {{I|Diplopia}} will not double its{{E|Eternal Heart}} effect.']]
interactions: [["{{I|Spindown Dice}}: Rerolls into {{I|Death's Touch}}."]]

name: Key Piece 2
description: Combined with {{I|Key Piece 1}}, unlocks the golden gate in the starting [[Rooms|room]] of {{S|Chest}} and {{S|Dark Room}} to fight {{E|Mega Satan}}.
notes: [['This item is a guaranteed drop from {{E|Gabriel}} if not already in possession.'], ["The Golden Gate can alternatively be opened using {{i|Dad's Key}}, {{p|Get out of Jail Free Card}} or {{i|Mr. ME!}}."], ['This item, along with {{i|Key Piece 1}}, can be rerolled into any item from the [[Item Pool#Angel Room|Angel Room pool]].'], ['This item also counts as a [[familiar]], meaning it takes up a familiar slot.'], ['Unlocking the Golden Gate with the combined key pieces and then restarting the floor with {{i|Forget Me Now}} or an {{R|I AM ERROR}} room will waste the key, which will not respawn.'], ['Will not be rerolled by {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, or {{R|Dice Room}} effects.'], ['Will not be doubled by {{i|Box of Friends}}']]

name: ???'s Only Friend
description: Spawns a controllable [[familiar]] that deals 37.5 damage per second on touch. It can be moved using the shooting directional keys
effects: [['Spawns a controllable [[familiar]] that damages enemies on touch. It can be moved using the shooting directional keys, similarly to {{i|The Ludovico Technique}} and {{i|Robo-Baby 2.0}}.', ["{{dlc|nr}} ???'s Only Friend deals 2.5 damage per tick, and ticks 15 times a second, dealing a total of 37.5 damage per second.", ["{{dlc|r}} ???'s Only Friend deals 3.5 damage per tick, and ticks slower."]]], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['Unlike The Ludovico Technique, it cannot be controlled with the mouse, even with mouse control enabled.'], ['Holding two opposite fire keys (both left and right or both up and down) at the same time will keep the familiar in place, while making Isaac fire in the direction of whichever fire key was pressed second.', ['This can help during combats with bosses who do not move a lot, as the familiar can continuously damage the boss when kept stationary.', 'On some keyboards, holding opposite fire keys may cause other keys to become unresponsive.']]]

name: D4
description: Rerolls all of Isaac's [[passive item]]s.
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Items rerolled away from Isaac do ''not'' return to circulation and can't be encountered again.", ['{{dlc|r}} Items rerolled away are returned to circulation and can be encountered again later in the run.']], ['The D4 does not re-roll {{i|Dead Cat|nr}}, {{i|Halo of Flies|nr}}, {{i|Key Piece 1}}, {{i|Key Piece 2}}, {{i|Missing No.}}, {{i|The Negative}}, {{i|The Polaroid}}, or {{i|Tonsil}}.', ["{{dlc+|r}} The D4 can reroll Dead Cat and Halo of Flies, but will not reroll {{i|Dad's Note}}, {{I|Damocles}}, {{i|Dogma}}, {{i|Knife Piece 1}} and {{i|Knife Piece 2}}, in addition to the above.{{dlc-}}"]], ["The D4 does not remove traits or abilities inherent to a character, i.e. {{c|Azazel}}'s Brimstone-like attack, {{c|Lilith}}'s Incubus or {{C|The Forgotten}}'s Bone club.", ['Starting items from [[Challenges]] will also not be rerolled']], ['Items that grant pickups (like {{i|Pyro}} or {{i|A Dollar}}) do not remove their bonuses when rerolled.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The D4 does not remove gained hearts from health up items.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} The D4 does not give hearts that would be otherwise gained from item pickups.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} If Isaac has a [[transformation]], its effects will not be lost upon re-rolling.', ['{{dlc|r}} Transformations are removed with the items being rerolled.']], ['The D4 can grant items that have not yet been unlocked.'], ['The items gained by the D4 count towards the [[collection page]].'], ["{{dlc|anr}} If it is unlocked, {{C|The Lost}} starts with this item along with spectral tears and flight. Using it ''will'' reroll {{i|Holy Mantle}}.", ['{{Dlc|r}} The Lost no longer starts with the D4. If used however, it will no longer reroll their Holy Mantle.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Every {{i|Cube of Meat}} produced using {{i|Potato Peeler}} count as an item for rerolling to the D4. Because health usually is not removed in rerolling items this is useful to increase the number of items at the expense of the item pool.'], ['Multiple copies of the same item (as generated by {{i|Diplopia}}, the [[Debug Console]], or gathering them from multiple item pools (e.g. {{i|Steam Sale}} from both the {{r|Shop}} and [[Greed]]) will each be rerolled into a different item, {{dlc|nr}} even though the duplicates are not present on the pause screen.'], ['There is a small chance that D4 will not reroll every item: the game makes a number of attempts to reroll each item, but if they all fail to produce a new item that is available and applicable, the original remains unchanged.'], ['{{dlc|r}} If used while playing as {{C|Jacob and Esau}} or {{C|Tainted Lazarus}}, it will only reroll the items on the character that used it.'], ['Smelted/Swallowed trinkets (via {{i|Marbles}}, {{i|Smelter}} or [[Gulp!]]) will not be rerolled.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Abyss}}: Locusts created by Abyss are not rerolled.'], ['{{bov}}']]

name: Mongo Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that copies the tears of Isaac's other familiars.
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that cycles between the tears of Isaac's other familiars.", ['If no familiars are present, Mongo Baby will fire normal tears that deal 3.5 damage.', '{{dlc|nr}} Mongo Baby shoots once every half second.', '{{dlc|r}} Mongo Baby shoots once every 1/3rd of a second, shooting at the same speed as Isaac at base [[tears]].']], ['{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['[[Familiar|Familiars]] that Mongo Baby can copy include:', ['{{i|Brother Bobby}}', '{{i|Ghost Baby}}', '{{i|Harlequin Baby}}', '{{i|Little Gish}}', '{{i|Little Steven}}', '{{i|Rainbow Baby}}', '{{i|Robo-Baby}}', '{{i|Rotten Baby}}', '{{i|Sister Maggy}}', '{{I|demon baby}}', '{{I|Freezer Baby}}']], ["Mongo Baby will not copy the tear effects of trinket familiars ({{t|Isaac's Head}} and {{t|???'s Soul}})."], ['Mongo Baby will not copy the tear effects of the level 2 {{i|Cube of Meat}} or {{i|Ball of Bandages}}.'], ["Mongo Baby will not copy the tear effects of {{i|Buddy in a Box}}, {{i|Fate's Reward}}, {{i|Incubus}},{{I|Lil Monstro}} or {{i|Seraphim}}."], ["With {{i|Lil Loki}}, Mongo Baby's tears will become red, but Mongo Baby will not fire in four directions."], ["If Isaac has {{i|Demon Baby}} alongside other familiars, Mongo Baby's behavior switches between the two. When Isaac is firing tears, Mongo Baby fires alongside him with a reduced fire rate. When Isaac is not firing tears, Mongo Baby copies Demon Baby's effect and automatically fires at nearby enemies.", ['If Isaac only has Demon Baby and Mongo Baby, Mongo Baby behaves like the Demon Baby exclusively.']], ['Mongo Baby will not copy familiars spawned by {{i|Monster Manual}}.']]

name: Crack the Sky
description: Summons 5 beams of light in random locations on the ground, dealing large amounts of damage to any enemies that touch them.
effects: [['Summons 5 beams of light in random locations on the ground. Each beam lasts for 0.8 seconds and deals large amounts of damage to enemies that touch them. They have a hitbox in a 3x3 cross shape.', ["Each beam can hit the same enemy up to 8 times, and deals Isaac's tear damage plus a flat 20 damage per hit."]], ['{{dlc|na}} The beams tend to gravitate towards the enemies, unlike the original game.', ['{{dlc|a}} The beams have a high chance to directly target enemies, unlike the original game.']]]

name: Book of Secrets
description: Gives the effect of {{i|Treasure Map}}, {{i|The Compass}}, or {{i|Blue Map}} for the duration of the current [[Chapters|floor]]. {{dlc|r}} If all effects are active,  {{i|X-Ray Vision}} is provided for the floor instead. Highlights any [[Rocks#Tinted_Rocks|Tinted Rocks]] and rocks with {{R|Crawl Space}} in the room.
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Book of Secrets has no effect on floors affected by {{Curse|lost}} or an [[Amnesia]] pill.'], ['{{dlc|r}} If {{Curse|lost}} or an [[Amnesia]] pill is active on a floor, X-Ray Vision effect is provided immediately.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery|r}}: Gives 2 different mapping effects and extends the duration of the glow effect applied onto special rocks.'], ['{{i|The Mind|r}}: Immediately gives the {{i|X-Ray Vision}} effect for the floor upon use.']]

name: Eve's Mascara
quote: DMG up, tears + shot speed down
description:
{{Dlc|nr}} Doubles [[damage]], halves [[tears]] stat, and greatly reduces [[shot speed]].
{{Dlc|r}} Doubles [[damage]], 0.66x [[tears]] multiplier, and greatly reduces [[shot speed]].
effects: [['2x [[damage]] multiplier.'], ['-0.5 [[shot speed]].'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} 0.5x tears / 2x [[tear delay]] multiplier. (The player's tear value will always be halved.)"], ['{{Dlc|r}} 0.66x tears / 1.5x tear delay multiplier.']]
notes: [["{{Dlc|nr}} Eve's Mascara is DPS neutral, though often the reduction of shot speed is a downgrade."], ["Combos very well with any item that scales with damage but not with fire rate, such as {{i|Rotten Baby}} or {{i|Fate's Reward}}."], ["{{Dlc|r}} Eve's Mascara is effectively a 33% increase in DPS, and the shot speed down is no longer as detrimental due to changes in how range works."]]
synergies: [["{{i|Abyss}}: When Eve's Mascara is picked up instead of being converted into a locust, it grants all of Abyss's locusts the high damage up without suffering the tears down allowing Isaac to increase his damage rate substantially the more items he uses Abyss on."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Missiles are not affected by low shot speed and the fire rate difference is negligible, granting double damage with nearly no downside.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The Knife is not affected by shot speed. Tears down and 2x damage multiplier still apply."], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Beams turn black and do double damage. The low shot speed makes beams damage enemies more frequently.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Tech X benefits from a lower shot speed due to it staying on enemies longer and is also not affected by range, giving little downsides.', ["{{Dlc|r}} The tears down can be a major downside as it takes longer to charge Tech X and the damage dealt by Tech X is less than Isaac's damage when it is not fully charged."]]]
interactions: [['{{i|Diplopia}}: The damage and tear multipliers do not stack. The shot speed decrease does stack.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Ipecac}}: Shots travel a very short distance, so having {{i|Host Hat}} or {{i|Pyromaniac}} is strongly recommended.'], ["{{i|Eve's Mascara}}: No further effect when stacked."], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: '''Not recommended.''' Tear travels very slowly, making it hard to kill mobile enemies."]]

name: Maggy's Bow
description: Gives one [[Red Heart Container]] and doubles the healing provided by {{E|Red Heart}}s. {{dlc|r}} Also heals 1 Red Heart when obtained.
effects: [['Adds one [[Red Heart Container]].'], ['{{E|Red Heart}}s heal double their value. A {{E|Half Red Heart}} replenishes one Red Heart, a Red Heart or {{E|Scared Heart}} replenishes two Red Hearts, and a {{E|Double Heart}} replenishes four Red Hearts. {{E|Blended Heart}}s either replenish two Red Hearts or replenish one Red Heart and add one {{E|Soul Heart}}, depending on how many empty Red Heart Containers Isaac has.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|Red Heart}}'], ['Does not affect {{E|Rotten Heart}}s.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Candy heart}}: Doubles the stat boosts from any picked up Heart. Half Red Hearts give two boosts, full Red Hearts give four, and Double Red Hearts give eight.'], ['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: Doubles all blood charges gained from Red Hearts.'], ['{{i|The Jar|nr}}: Allows for generation of infinite Red Hearts.']]
interactions: [['{{P|0 - The Fool?}}: Due to doubled healing, extra hearts will be left on the ground to be used for later.'], ['{{dlc|a+}} {{C|Keeper}} / {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Keeper}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Yum Heart}}: No effect; will still only replenish one full Red Heart.']]

name: Abaddon
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[damage]], +0.2 [[speed]]. Removes all Red [[Heart container]]s, grants six {{E|Black Heart}}s, and adds a chance to shoot [[fear]] tears.
{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[damage]], +0.2 [[speed]]. Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s, converts all Red [[Heart Container]]s into Black Hearts, and adds a chance to shoot [[fear]] tears.
effects: [['+1.5 [[damage]].'], ['+0.2 [[speed]]', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Removes all Red [[Heart container]]s and grants 6 {{E|Black Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Converts all Red [[Heart container]]s into {{e|Black Heart}}s, and adds 2 additional Black Hearts.'], ['{{dlc|a+}} Will not remove {{E|Bone Heart|n}}s, but will empty them.'], ['Adds a chance to shoot [[fear]] tears.'], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [['The fear effect chance depends on the [[Luck]] stat, starting at 15% at 0 Luck, reaching 100% with 85 Luck.', ['{{i|Dark Matter}} is significantly better at inflicting fear than Abaddon.']], ['Does not remove {{E|Soul Heart}}s or {{E|Eternal Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} As it removes all Red Heart Containers, other Deals with the Devil can be taken for "free" as long as Abaddon is taken last while still having at least 1 Container.'], ['Has no negative trade-off when taken as {{c|???}}, minus losing the opportunity of an {{r|Angel Room}}.'], ['Can always be taken when offered as a 3 Soul Heart Deal. Even if Isaac only has one or two Soul Hearts, the Black Hearts will be granted after taking the item.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Will instantly kill the {{c|Keeper}} when picked up.', ["{{dlc|r}} Sets {{c|Keeper}}'s [[Coin Heart]]s to 1."]], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{c|Bethany}} will be left with half a Red Heart with her other [[Heart Container]]s removed.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Bethany}} will not lose stored Red Hearts, but can't gain more black hearts from this item as a result."]]
synergies: [['{{t|Black Feather}}: Grants a damage boost.']]

name: Lazarus' Rags
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Upon dying, resurrect as {{c|Lazarus Risen}} in the current room with one Red Heart container and {{i|Anemic}}.
{{dlc|r}} Upon dying, resurrect as {{c|Lazarus Risen}} in the current room with one less Red Heart container (but no less than 1), {{i|Anemic}}, and a permanent +0.5 [[Damage]] up. Going to the next floor reverts him back into {{c|Lazarus}}, with his inherent extra life effect.
effects: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Upon dying, resurrect as {{c|Lazarus Risen}} in the current room with one Red Heart container and {{i|Anemic}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Upon dying, resurrect as {{c|Lazarus Risen}} in the current room with one less Red Heart container (but no less than 1), {{i|Anemic}}, and a permanent +0.5 [[Damage]] up.', ['Going to the next floor reverts him back into {{c|Lazarus}}, with his inherent extra life effect.']]]
notes: [["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Lazarus' Rags is {{dlc|nr}} 5th / {{dlc|r}} 7th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, {{i|Dead Cat|nr}}, {{c|Lazarus|nr}}' inherent extra life ({{dlc|r}} swap the order of the previous two), {{i|Inner Child}}, and {{i|Guppy's Collar}}."], ['Completion marks earned after being revived by this item will go toward {{c|Lazarus}}, regardless of who the original character was.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Spindown Dice}}: Turns into {{i|Godhead}} when rerolled by Spindown Dice.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Lazarus}} / {{c|Dead Tainted Lazarus}}: Revived as Tainted Lazarus / Dead Tainted Lazarus correspondingly instead of Lazarus Risen.']]
interactions: [["{{I|Birthright}}: Dying and reviving as any character will ''not'' give Lazarus Risen a damage boost; however, picking up Birthright as him will."], ["{{i|Plan C}}: Isaac can use Plan C on end-game bosses (e.g. {{E|Hush|n}}, {{E|Delirium|n}}) and survive, although, if going for unlocks, he will get Lazarus's post-it notes instead."]]

name: D100
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Combines the effects of {{i|D4}}, {{i|The D6}}, and {{i|D20}}.
{{dlc+|r}} Combines the effects of {{i|D1}}, {{i|D4}}, {{i|The D6}}, {{i|D7}}, {{i|D8}}, {{i|D10}}, {{i|D12}}, and {{i|D20}}.{{dlc-}}
effects: [['{{dlc+|r}} Duplicates 1 random pickup in the current room (like the {{i|D1}}).{{dlc-}}'], ['Rerolls all passive items on Isaac (like the {{i|D4}}).'], ['Rerolls all pedestal items in the [[Rooms|room]] (like {{i|The D6}}).'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Restarts the room and respawns all enemies (like the {{i|D7}}).{{dlc-}}'], ["{{dlc+|r}} Rerolls Isaac's [[damage]], [[tears]], [[range]] and [[speed]] (like the {{i|D8}}).{{dlc-}}"], ['{{dlc|r}} Rerolls all monsters in the room (like the {{i|D10}}).'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Rerolls all rocks in the room (like the {{i|D12}}).{{dlc-}}'], ['Rerolls all pickups in the room (like the {{i|D20}}).']]
notes: [['If Missing No. is given to the player, it will activate and remove the D100, preventing further rerolls.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} D100 is a [[special item]].'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} See the {{i|D4}}, {{i|The D6}}, and the {{i|D20}} to learn more about the respective individual effects.', ['{{Dlc|r}} See the {{i|D1|force=n}}, {{i|D4}}, {{i|The D6}}, {{i|D7|force=n}}, {{i|D8|force=n}}, {{i|D10}}, {{i|D12|force=n}}, and the {{i|D20}} to learn more about the respective individual effects.']]]

name: Isaac's Heart
description: Isaac himself is now immune to all damage, and a heart [[familiar]] follows him. If the heart is hurt, Isaac is hurt. {{dlc|r}} The heart charges up as Isaac shoots, firing 8 blood shots, knocking back enemies, and leaving a puddle of [[creep]] when released.
effects: [["Isaac's body becomes immune to all damage."], ['A heart [[familiar]] appears and closely follows Isaac. If the heart is hurt, Isaac is hurt.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The heart tries to position itself in the opposite direction of where Isaac is shooting.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The heart charges up as Isaac fires. At full charge, upon releasing the fire button, it knocks back nearby enemies and tears, creates a small puddle of red [[creep]] on the ground, and releases blood shots in 8 directions that deal 8 damage.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Enemies that come in contact with Isaac take 2x Isaac's current damage per tick or 4x Isaac's damage per second."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Most enemies now target the heart instead of Isaac. {{E|Eye}}s and other similar enemies, however, will still target Isaac.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s can be used for free.', ['During {{chal|The Guardian}}, Devil Beggars and Blood Donation Machines deal damage to Isaac.']], ['[[Spikes]], {{R|Curse Room}} doors and {{E|Spiked Chest}}s do no damage. {{R|Sacrifice Room}} spikes still work, though the heart has to go on the spikes instead of Isaac. The door to {{Stage|Mausoleum}} / {{Stage|Gehenna}} is not affected.'], ["Picking up a non-orbital familiar will cause either Isaac's Heart or the other familiar to be layered over the other's sprite. This is due to the heart not taking up the spot that the other familiar follows in."], ['Co-op babies gain the immunity effect without spawning additional hearts.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Enemy Brimstone shots (such as from {{E|The Bloat}}) will not do any damage to the heart.'], ['The tracking lasers from {{E|Hush}} and light pillars from {{E|Isaac}} do not damage the heart.']]
synergies: [["{{i|120 Volt}}/{{i|Monstrance}}: These items become much safer to use offensively as they are centered around Isaac's body which no longer takes damage."], ['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Box of Friends does not duplicate the heart, making it safe to use.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Breath of Life}}: Isaac can be infinitely invulnerable, as invincibility carries out to the heart without hurting the player. Note that the item needs to be activated for longer than one second for the invulnerability to kick in, however.'], ['{{t|Duct Tape}}: Makes dodging significantly easier.'], ['{{i|E. Coli}}: Isaac can turn enemies into poop without taking damage.'], ['{{i|Holy Mantle}}: The shield effect carries over to the heart.'], ['Items granting [[invulnerability]] or a [[shield]]: The invincibility carries over to the heart.', ['{{dlc|r}} Due to the contact damage, {{i|Gnawed Leaf}} allows Isaac to clear most rooms without moving.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|IV Bag}}: Can be used without taking damage, resulting in an infinite amount of coins.'], ['{{i|Kamikaze!}}: As long as the heart is away from the blast radius, no damage is taken. The character must be at high enough speed for this.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Razor Blade}}: Isaac cannot take damage from the Razor Blade, allowing for infinite uses of the item.'], ["{{i|Sacrificial Altar|a+nr}}: Can remove the Isaac's Heart familiar while the item remains, making Isaac invulnerable.", ["{{dlc|r}} Sacrificial Altar now doesn't remove Isaac's Heart."]], ["{{i|Serpent's Kiss}}: Isaac can poison enemies by contact without taking damage, allowing for free black hearts."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Aries|r}}: The invulnerability does not extend to the heart.'], ["{{T|Baby-Bender}}: The heart's tears do not gain homing."], ['{{i|BFFS!|force=r}}: Fires additional shots in random directions, and leaves larger puddles of creep.'], ["{{i|Dry Baby}} / {{i|Farting Baby}}: If you have picked up either of the babies into the first familiar spot ''before'' Isaac's Heart, they will block enemy shots before they can hit the heart. Enemies touching the heart can still do damage, and picking up the babies after the heart will cause the heart's hitbox to be checked first against shots."], ['{{t|Gigante Bean}}: Increases the knockback amount and radius of the heart when fully charged. Highly useful.'], ['{{i|King Baby}}: The Heart will follow King Baby. This makes it much harder to avoid damage, but also makes other synergies like {{i|Kamikaze!}} much easier to use.'], ['{{I|A Pound of Flesh}}: Consumables can no longer be picked up in Shops.'], ['{{i|Sharp Plug}}: Sharp Plug can no longer be used.'], ["{{i|The Soul}}: Isaac's body repels projectiles, but Isaac's Heart doesn't."], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}: The heart follows Tainted Soul.']]

name: Pandora's Box
description: Upon use, spawns specific [[pickup]]s or [[item]]s depending on the [[floor]] it is used on. Disappears after use.
effects: [['Upon use, spawns specific [[pickup]]s or [[item]]s depending on the [[floor]] it is used on. Disappears after use.']]
notes: [["Floors affected by {{cu|Labyrinth}} are counted as the first floor by Pandora's Box."], ['When playing [[Greed Mode]], the normal [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool]] is still used in Sheol, instead of the [[Devil Room (Greed Mode Item Pool)|Greed Mode Devil Room item pool]].'], ['In [[Greed Mode]], it will always generate its 2nd floor drops for each Chapter that is before {{s|The Shop}}, such as 20 pennies in the {{s|Depths}}, etc.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{t|Strange Key}}: Instead of its normal effect, Pandora's Box spawns six generally higher quality items from a set of item pools. Both items are consumed.", ["This will prevent unlocking {{I|Moving Box|n}} if it hasn't already been unlocked, when used in {{S|Dark Room}}."]]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ["{{p|? Card|anr}}: Will consume both the card and Pandora's Box, but nothing will happen, wasting both of them.", ["{{dlc|r}} Will activate Pandora's Box without consuming it, allowing for multiple activations.", "{{Dlc|r}} If Isaac is holding {{T|Strange Key|n}}, using the ? Card will consume the card and trinket, spawning 6 items, but Pandora's Box will not be consumed."]]]

name: Ankh
description: Upon [[death]], Isaac will respawn as {{c|???}} in the most recent non-hostile room, with 3 {{e|Soul Heart}}s.
notes: [["Resurrection items activate in a [[:Category:Revival items|set order]]. Ankh is {{dlc|nr}} 6th / {{dlc|r}} 8th in this order after {{p|Soul of Lazarus}}, {{i|1up!}}, {{i|Dead Cat|nr}}, {{c|Lazarus|nr}}' inherent extra life ({{dlc|r}} swap the order of the previous two), {{i|Inner Child}}, {{i|Guppy's Collar}}, and {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}."], ['Like other items that grant an extra life, but respawn Isaac as a different character, all [[completion mark]]s earned from the moment of death onward will count towards the new character, not the old.'], ['{{dlc|r}} During {{E|The Beast}} fight, Isaac respawns in the place he died.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Birthright}}: Dying and reviving as ??? will give him full benefit of Birthright, which is doubling all soul hearts gained from health ups.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted ???}}: Revives as himself, rather than normal ???. Effectively acts as a {{I|1up!}}.']]

name: Samson's Chains
description: Attaches a ball and chain to Isaac that pulls behind him that damages enemies, blocks shots, and destroys most [[Obstacles]].
effects: [["Attaches a ball and chain to Isaac's ankle that blocks projectiles and deals 5 damage per tick (~10.7 damage per second)."], ['If the ball is moving fast enough, it will destroy any [[Obstacles]] it comes into contact with (aside from Iron Blocks).']]
notes: [["The item doesn't change the Speed [[Attribute]]. Instead, whenever the chain is fully extended the ball will have to be dragged, which causes Isaac to slow down slightly."], ['Cannot be used to open {{R|Secret Room}}s or {{R|Super Secret Room}}s.']]
synergies: [["[[Flight]]: Any method of flight makes it easier and quicker to use Samson's Chains to smash rocks, making for an efficient way to search for {{R|Crawl Space}}s."]]

name: Godhead
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants [[homing tears]] with a damaging halo. +0.5 [[Damage]], -0.3 [[Tears]] -0.3 [[Shot Speed]], +0.8 [[Tear Falling Speed]], and +1.2 [[Range]].
{{dlc|r}} Grants [[homing tears]] with a damaging halo. +0.5 [[Damage]], -0.3 [[Tears]], and -0.3 [[Shot Speed]].
effects: [['+0.5 [[Damage]].'], ['-0.3 [[Tears]].'], ['-0.3 [[Shot Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.2 [[Range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.8 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['Grants [[homing tears]].'], ['Tears gain a damaging aura.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Godhead is a [[special item]].'], ["The damaging aura gets bigger with items that make tears bigger, e.g. {{i|Cricket's Head}}, {{i|Polyphemus}}, and {{i|Pupula Duplex}}."], ["{{dlc|nr}} The aura deals 30% of Isaac's damage 15 times per second."], ['{{dlc|r}} The aura deals 2 damage 15 times per second.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Main tears and burst tears retain all effects."], ['{{i|Explosivo}}/{{i|Mucormycosis}}: Causes damaging aura to grow once attached to an enemy.'], ['{{i|Euthanasia}}: Needles retain homing and damaging aura.'], ['{{i|Glass Cannon}}: The huge tear gains the homing ability and a much larger, more powerful damaging aura.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Fired tears and burst tears retain aura and homing effect.', ["[[Piercing tears]]: When a tear bursts, the 8 smaller tears' auras can stack, doing massive damage to enemies within."]], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear increases in size and gains the damaging aura effect.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tear also gains homing effect. May cause Tear to get stuck near enemies.']], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The size and damage of the aura increases as long as the tear is on screen.'], ['{{T|Pulse Worm}}: The aura increases and decreases in size.'], ['{{i|Saturnus}}: The orbiting tears also have the damaging aura, but without the homing effect.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Brimstone}}: Brimstone laser retains the homing effect, but doesn't receive the damaging aura."], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs retain the homing effect, but don't receive a damaging aura."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The crosshair homes in upon enemies, but neither the crosshair nor the missiles receive the damaging aura.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Main tear retains all effects, but burst tears do not.', ['{{dlc|r}} Burst tears also retain all effects.']], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Knife retains the homing effect, but doesn't get the damaging aura."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Once the tear hits the enemy, the aura also ceases to do damage to that particular target.', ['{{dlc|r}} Enemies can be damaged by the aura after being pierced, but only if the tear is no longer in contact.']], ["{{i|Sinus Infection}}: The aura on booger tears stuck to an enemy won't hurt that particular enemy, but still damages other enemies."], ["{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Technology 2}}/{{i|Tech.5}}/{{i|Tech X}}: Lasers retain the homing effect, but don't receive the damaging aura."], ["{{i|Trisagion}}: Causes Godhead's aura to visually disappear; however, the aura is still there and can still damage enemies."]]

name: Scissors
description: Turns Isaac's head into a stationary [[familiar]] for the current [[room]] which fires tears automatically. {{dlc|r}} Isaac's body also shoots a controllable fountain of blood shots for the room.
effects: [["Detaches Isaac's head from his body and turns the head into a stationary [[familiar]] that fires tears for the current [[room]].", ["The player still controls Isaac's headless body, which also shoots tears.", ['{{dlc|r}} The body constantly spews a controllable fountain of blood shots, dealing about 0.66x-1.01x damage.'], "{{dlc|nr}} The tears fired by the head do not scale with Isaac's damage and always do 3.5 damage.", ["{{dlc|r}} The head's tears are affected by Isaac's stats and attack modifiers."]]]]
notes: [['Can spawn multiple heads if used in the same room more than once.', ['{{dlc|r}} Only the most recent head is able to fire.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}} and {{i|Technology}} are not fired from the stationary head.'], ['If Isaac has an invisible body due to the cosmetic effect of {{i|Transcendence}}, only a shadow will be seen after using the Scissors.'], ['If Isaac is [[Blindfolded]], the floating head can still fire tears.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The floating head does nothing as {{c|Lilith}}, {{c|Tainted Lilith}}, and {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}.', ['As {{c|The Forgotten}}, the floating head will only fire tears when the Soul is active.', 'The floating head will not fire tears as {{c|Tainted Samson}} while he is enraged.']], ['{{dlc|anr}} Each wave of {{R|Boss Rush}} fully recharges the item, allowing many heads to be spawned.'], ['Only deaths which end runs (i.e. Isaac is not revived by a revival item such as {{i|1up!}}) count towards unlocking the Scissors.']]
interactions: [['{{I|The Pinking Shears}}: If Scissors and Pinking Shears are used together, control is given back to an invisible head with only a shadow visible as both the head and body are mobilized to attack.'], ["{{i|BFFS!}}: The loose head won't become larger, but will deal double damage."], ['{{i|Box of Friends}}: No effect.'], ['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Stop Watch
quote: Let's slow this down a bit...
description:
{{dlc|na}} Automatically inflicts [[slow]] to all enemies in every room.
{{dlc|anr}} Upon taking damage, inflicts slow to all enemies for the current room.
{{dlc|r}} Slows all enemies in every room to 80% speed.
effects: [['{{dlc|na}} Automatically inflicts [[slow]] to all enemies in every room, which slows them down to approximately 51.3% of their original movement and attacking speeds.'], ['{{dlc|anr}} Inflicts slow to all enemies in the current room after the player is hit.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Slows all enemies to 80% of their original movement speed and attacking speeds. This is separate from the [[slow]] status, and fully stacks with it.'], ['+0.3 [[speed]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nar}} Once activated, the effect lasts permanently.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} The background music is slowed down to 70% of the original speed of the music during the item's effect.", ['{{dlc|r}} The background music is slowed down to about 90% of the original speed, not affecting boss tracks. The slowdown makes the music approximately 2 semitones lower.', "If acquired through {{i|Eden's Blessing}},the starting track will be affected as well"]], ['The {{i|Broken Watch}} is an item similar to this item, but functions in a different way.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}Because of the slow effect, champion versions of enemies will be tinted the same color as all other enemies. This makes it much harder to distinguish certain champion types, such as those that explode upon death.'], ['{{E|Poky|display=Pokies}}, {{E|Slide}}s and {{E|Mega Troll Bomb}}s are not affected and will move in their regular speed.'], ['{{dlc|na}} Stop Watch is a [[special item]].']]
