synergies: [['{{dlc|anr}} {{i|Holy Mantle}}: Blocking damage with Holy Mantle triggers the Stop Watch effect.'], ['{{dlc|r}} All [[Slow]] effects: Stacks with the status resulting in enemies moving at about 41% of their original speed.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|na}} {{i|Broken Watch}}: Overridden by Stop Watch; the speed up effect will not occur.', ['{{dlc|a}} Both the slow effect and the rarer speed up can trigger at the start of a room.', ['{{dlc|nr}} This results in enemies being slowed to around 71.8% of their original speed.', '{{dlc|r}} This results in enemies being sped up by 12%.']]]]

name: Missing No.
description: Randomizes all passive items and stats upon pickup and at the start of each succeeding floor.
effects: [['Randomizes passive items and [[attribute]]s on pickup and at the start of every floor.', ['Stats gain a random modifier. These modifiers do not stack between levels and are instead rerolled every time.', ['[[Speed]] -0.2, 0 or +0.2.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed, may never exceed 2.0.'], '{{dlc|nr}} [[Range]] -0.5, 0 or +0.5.', '{{dlc|r}} [[Range]] -1.5, 0 or +1.5.', '{{dlc|nr}} [[Tears]] -0.5, 0 or +0.5.', '{{dlc|r}} [[Fire rate]] -0.5, 0 or +0.5.', '[[Shot speed]] -0.2, 0 or +0.2.', '[[Damage]] flat -1, 0 or +1.', '[[Luck]] -1, 0 or +1.'], 'Does not affect [[trinket]]s, [[card]]s, [[pill]]s, [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]], {{i|The Polaroid}} / {{i|The Negative}}, {{i|Key Piece 1}} / {{i|Key Piece 2}}, {{i|Knife Piece 1}} / {{i|Knife Piece 2}}, or active items.']]]
notes: [['See {{i|D4}} for more details of the rerolling process.'], ['Like other full-reroll effects, Missing No. has a small chance to not reroll every item.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Can cause [[transformation]]s.', ['{{dlc|r}} Transformations are lost when rerolling out of the items that caused them.']], ['Missing No. cannot be re-rolled or removed by most means after being picked up, including {{i|D4}}, {{I|Clicker}}, {{p|XVII - The Stars?}}, or taking damage as {{c|Tainted Eden}}.']]
synergies: [['{{t|Butter!}} / {{i|Genesis}}: Provide the only available methods for getting rid of Missing No.']]
interactions: [["{{I|The Stairway}} : When getting the Stairway at the start of a floor, the ladder doesn't spawn. It will spawn at the start of the next floor even if rerolled"]]

name: Mystery Sack
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a [[Heart]], [[coin]], {{E|bomb}}, or {{E|key}} every 5-6 [[rooms]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a [[Heart]], [[coin]], {{E|bomb}}, or {{E|key}} (or any of their variations) alternatingly every 5 or 6 [[rooms]].']]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The familiar drops pickups alternatingly every 4 or 5 rooms.']]

name: The Polaroid
description: If Isaac has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, he gains a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 5 seconds. Allows entrance into {{s|Chest}}. {{dlc|r}} Also allows access to {{s|Home}}.
effects: [['If the character has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, it triggers the {{i|Book of Shadows}} effect, creating a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 5 seconds.'], ['Allows entrance into {{s|Chest}} after beating {{E|Isaac}} in the {{s|Cathedral}} by touching the chest.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Opens {{A|A Strange Door|n}} in {{s|Depths}} II and its variants that leads to {{s|Mausoleum}}/{{s|Gehenna}} II.', ["Unlike with the Chest entrance, The Polaroid gets consumed by the door and vanishes from Isaac's inventory."]]]
notes: [['This item is a guaranteed drop from {{E|Mom}}, if unlocked. Will drop alongside {{i|The Negative}}, provided they are both unlocked. However, they are mutually exclusive: Once one of them is picked up, the other one will disappear.', ['With the use of either a teleportation item and 5 pip {{R|Dice Room}}, a {{i|Forget Me Now}}, or  {{i|R Key}}, both the Polaroid and the Negative or multiple copies of the Polaroid or Negative can be obtained.']], ["The Polaroid always triggers when taking damage as characters who lack [[Red Heart container]]s, such as {{C|???}} and {{C|Tainted ???}}  {{dlc|r}}{{C|Dark Judas}} and {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|The Forgotten}} (only as the soul), {{C|Tainted Forgotten}} , {{C|Tainted Bethany}}  or any other character who has chosen to trade away their heart containers in [[Devil room|deals with the Devil]], {{R|Black Market}}s,{{i|Guppy's Paw}} or the {{i|Potato Peeler}}. It will also trigger if the character has only half of a red heart left."], ['Since {{C|The Lost}} and {{C|Tainted Lost}} don’t have health, The Polaroid will never trigger.'], ['The Polaroid will be the leftmost item after defeating Mom, in case {{Cu|Blind}} is active.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} It is possible to obtain two Polaroids by obtaining one as an {{C|Eden}} starting item.'], ['Obtaining multiple copies of The Polaroid does not cause its effect to stack.'], ["As with all items crucial to story progress ({{I|Key Piece 1}} and {{I|Key Piece 2}}, {{I|Knife Piece 1}} and {{I|Knife Piece 2}}, {{I|Dad's Note}}, and {{I|Dogma}}), this item has protection from full-run rerolls. It does not, however, share the immunity {{I|Dad's Note}} has to D6-type rerolls and {{I|Void}}."]]

name: Little Steven
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] who follows Isaac around and fires [[homing tears]].

name: Sacrificial Dagger
description: Spawns a dagger [[orbital familiar]], blocking enemy shots and dealing a high amount of damage to enemies in contact.
notes: [['The dagger orbits further away from Isaac than many other orbital familiars (minus {{i|Big Fan}}), making it easier to use both offensively and defensively.']]

name: Friendly Ball
description: Throwing the ball at a [[monster]] instantly kills and captures it. The captured enemy can later be released and will be [[friendly]], fighting for Isaac and persisting between rooms.
effects: [['Once thrown, the Friendly Ball will instantly capture any [[monster|non-boss enemy]] it hits, removing them from the room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Walking over a Friendly Ball after it captures an enemy will instantly recharge the item.'], ['The next time the Friendly Ball is thrown, it will release the previously captured enemy as a [[friendly]] enemy.', ['Released enemies persist between rooms and floors and will follow Isaac until they die.', 'Friendly enemies cannot harm Isaac and do not need to be defeated to clear a room.', 'If Isaac leaves the room before the monster is released, the monster will stay in the ball until it is thrown again.']], ['If the Friendly Ball does not capture an enemy, it will simply disappear after a couple seconds being on the ground. The next throw will work the same.']]
notes: [["All enemies that aren't invincible and are not designated as a boss or mini-boss can be captured by the Friendly Ball. This includes enemies summoned from bosses such as {{E|Brownie}}'s spawned {{E|Dip}}s or {{E|The Cage}}'s unique {{E|Vis}}es.", ["One exception to this is if you capture a {{E|Portal}}, as it can spawn enemies such as {{E|Death's Head}}."]], ['It is generally wasteful to use this item on {{E|Mulligan}}s and their variants as they will immediately rush towards enemies and try to kill themselves, leaving behind friendly debris.'], ['If the captured enemy is a {{E|Globin}} variant (besides {{E|Black Globin}}s for their lack of regenerative abilities) or a [[Champion|Dark Red Champion]], the enemy will regenerate after dying, granting a much longer lifespan.'], ['{{E|Wall Creep}}s and their variants stick to walls, backing far away from any potential danger they might encounter.'], ['Stationary enemies that move underground (such as {{E|Round Worm}}s or {{E|Lump}}s) work surprisingly well as an ally as they shoot foes from far away and rarely ever get hurt.'], ["{{E|Mom's Hand}} and {{E|Mom's Dead Hand}} will both one-shot almost all normal enemies and greatly damage most bosses with an incredibly small window for the hands to be hit, making them ideal for capturing."], ['Brimstone-capable enemies are very potent as their lasers can cause an obscene amount of damage to both enemies and most bosses.'], ['If the captured enemy is one that spawns enemies, those enemies will be friendly as well.'], ['If the ally is immune to damage (such as a {{E|Mobile Host}} while its head is lowered), it will not take contact damage.'], ['If the captured enemy is a [[Champion|Solid White Champion]], it will be completely invincible, as it cannot be killed until the room counts as being cleared, at which point it can be killed by [[spikes]] or a {{E|Wall Hugger}}.'], ['{{dlc|a+}} If the captured enemy is a [[Champion|Pulsing Red Champion]], it will regenerate the health of other monsters in the room, including friendly ones.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} If an enemy that leaves behind a trail of damaging [[creep]] is caught, the creep created by the friendly mob will still damage Isaac when he walks over it.', ['{{dlc|a+}} All creep created by a friendly enemy will only hurt grounded enemies and not the player.']], ['The ball will only capture one segment of a {{E|Grub}}, one {{E|Buttlicker}}, or one {{E|Swarm|display=Swarm Fly}}. However, when releasing a Swarm Fly, a new swarm is generated for it.'], ["If a {{E|Mask + Heart}}'s Heart is caught and then released, a Mask can use the friendly heart to live even if its original heart is destroyed. The room will not be cleared unless the Mask is killed.", ['The mask will ignore the friendly heart yet can still damage it. Bait the mask to charge towards the heart to destroy both.']], ['If an Ipecac-capable enemy is caught, the explosive Ipecac shots it fires will not hurt Isaac.', ['This explosion immunity also applies to enemies that explode on death, and even the {{E|Troll Bomb}}s left behind by {{E|Mulligoon}}s.']], ['The head of {{E|Rag Man}} can be captured by the ball while detached. It will not become a Ragling after being released, and only chases enemies by rolling.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Captured {{E|Bishop|n}}s will protect Isaac with their shield generation ability, as well as all other friendly enemies. Isaac cannot take any damage while the Bishop is alive, as it will protect him with the shield. Protecting the Bishop can be a powerful defensive tool, especially when playing as {{C|The Lost}}.', ['The shield does not protect against instant death effects such as {{p|Suicide King}} or {{i|Plan C|x}}.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Captured {{E|Cultist|n}}s will revive killed enemies as friendlies, allowing one to slowly amass an army of friendlies by protecting the Cultist.', ['Bosses and degraded bosses can be revived by a friendly Cultist, but will not persist between rooms.']]]
synergies: [["{{I|The Battery}}: Walking over a captured enemy will double charge the ball, allowing the enemy to be released, and allowing to catch a new one in the same room, and the process repeats. This allows the Friendly Ball to be used much, ''much'' more often, and gathering many more friends. Note: trying to catch a new enemy while the old one is in the process of spawning will result in the ball phasing thru, catching nothing, thus wasting charge."], ['{{bov}}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Hive Mind}}: No effect on captured flies or spiders.'], ["{{i|Skatole}} or {{i|Bursting Sack}}: Friendly Fly/Spider enemies will be unable able to shoot, slowed down, and/or reverted to a weaker form, hindering this item's effectiveness on those enemies."], ['{{i|Void|r}}: Walking over a thrown Friendly Ball that captured an enemy will not recharge Void.']]

name: Continuum
description: Grants [[spectral tears]] and increases [[range]]. Tears travel through walls and appear at the opposite side of the room.
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]].'], ['When tears travel off-screen, they loop back around through the opposite wall.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +2.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +3 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[tear falling speed]].']]
synergies: [["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: The skeleton form's charge attack can loop through walls."], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Tears will continually gain damage when passing through walls.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{C|Azazel}}/{{C|Tainted Azazel}}/{{I|Brimstone}}: The laser continues behind Isaac and back once again, potentially hitting enemies twice in one blast.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Causes Mom's Knife to appear on the opposite wall if thrown through one. It then returns through the wall to Isaac.", ["'''Mom's Knife''' + '''Brimstone''': The barrage of knives flies across the room until it hits the wall twice."]], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: When shooting through a wall, tears speed up towards Isaac rather than returning through the original wall. With enough [[shot speed]] and [[range]] the tears can loop twice.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Laser rings will go through walls, extra distance depending on [[shot speed]].', ["'''Tech X''' + {{i|Incubus}}: Incubus's laser rings cannot go through walls. This applies to {{C|Lilith}} too.", "{{Dlc|r}}:'''Tech X''' + {{i|Incubus}}: Laser rings travel through walls and continue on the other side of the room."]], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Causes the tears to loop right back in front of Isaac after they go offscreen.'], ['{{I|Revelation}}: The laser will loop around, potentially hitting enemies twice.'], ["Any item that grants multiple shots like {{i|Loki's Horns}} and {{i|Mom's Eye}} are good items to take."]]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overridden by Brimstone.'], ['{{dlc+|nr}} {{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears will only split when hitting obstacles or enemies but not walls.{{dlc-}}', ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears will split on contact with walls. Only one split will occur on contact with Walls and Objects.']], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs cannot go through walls, but are spectral.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overridden by Epic Fetus, stat effects apply.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: When the tear is moved offscreen, it loops back through the opposite wall.'], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: Tears shrink while traveling through walls and often disappear before they can reappear on the other side.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Overrides Continuum.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Tears will travel through walls; however, the electricity will not connect the tears while they are outside the room. Once tears have passed through walls, the electric arcs connect very erratically to other tears, limiting the efficiency of the combination.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears that travel through walls will travel until they reach Isaac and start orbiting him again.']]

name: Dead Eye
description: Isaac's [[damage]] increases each time an enemy is hit. Damage is reset upon missing a shot.
effects: [["Isaac's [[damage]] increases for each successive tear hit on enemies.", ['The multiplier increases by 0.25x for each hit, going up to a maximum of 2x after 4 successive hits.', 'If a tear misses and hits nothing (wall/floor), there is a chance for the multiplier to be reset back to 1.', ['The chance is 20% for the first miss, 33% for the second miss, and 50% for the third miss and beyond.'], "As the multiplier increases, Isaac's tears glow red and increase in size."]]]
notes: [['The effect is triggered by many entities aside from enemies. Shooting {{Dlc|nr}} {{E|Fire Place}}s, {{E|Wall Hugger}}s, and {{E|Stone Grimace}}s will count towards the multiplier. This can be used to preemptively increase damage before entering a new room.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} Because blue fires do not deteriorate when shot at with tears, maximum damage can always be achieved as long as the fire is not destroyed by an explosion.', 'Shooting {{E|poop}} will count as a miss.', 'Shooting {{E|Host}}s will increase the damage multiplier even if their skull is lowered down.']], ['If Dead Eye is removed by re-rolling it with {{i|D4}}, {{i|D100}}, or a 1 or 6 pip {{R|Dice Room}}, the damage multiplier will be removed, but the tears will continue to glow red.'], ['Tears do not have to be landed on only one enemy to build the multiplier; as long as they do not miss, Isaac gains damage.'], ['If Isaac is shooting multiple tears at once, like with {{i|Mutant Spider}}, only one of them has to land for the multiplier to build up.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Because there are no walls or floors for tears to collide with in the fight with {{E|The Beast|n}}, the damage boost will not fade away.'], ['Due to the natural {{i|Brimstone}} effect of {{C|Azazel}}, he gains no benefit by picking up Deadeye unless his tear effect has been replaced.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Haemolacria}}/{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Main tears and burst tears will contribute to damage multiplier.', ["{{i|Lachryphagy}} Firing into the floating tear won't reset the multiplier unless it hits a wall.  The burst tears never reset the multiplier."]], ["{{i|Dark Arts}}: Hitting enemies/bullets successfully with Dark Arts contributes to Dead Eye's damage multiplier."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Damage bonus increases until it hits the max of 2x. Since the controllable tear never hits the ground or wall, the bonus cannot be lost.'], ['[[Petrification]]/[[Slow]] items: Enemies will be petrified or slowed, making them easier to hit without missing.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears that miss an enemy and do not hit a wall or obstacle will not fall to the ground immediately, allowing many damage-amplified tears to be fired before the damage boost is lost.'], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: Tears are larger and easier to hit with at a low range. Additionally, if the tear fades out of existence instead of running out of range, it does not count as a miss.', ['{{i|Rubber Cement}} The bonus cannot be lost since tears cannot run out of range.']], ["{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Isaac's tears no longer hit walls and stay in the air for longer, allowing many damage-amplified tears to be fired before the damage boost is lost."]]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}/{{I|cursed eye}}: If all tears hit, they all contribute to the damage multiplier. However, the spread shot granted by The Inner Eye and Mutant Spider may make it hard to retain the damage multiplier.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: The damage multiplier that was gained before picking up this item will now be a permanent damage up.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears that do not hit enemies are considered misses, nearly guaranteeing the chance of losing the multiplier."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: The damage multiplier that was gained before picking up this item will now be a permanent damage up.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The damage multiplier that was gained before picking up this item will now be a permanent damage up.'], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Each skip counts as missing.'], ["{{dlc|a+}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: The Forgotten's swing increases the multiplier when successfully hitting enemies, resets the multiplier upon swinging and missing. The multiplier changes normally when firing tears as {{C|The Soul}}, and the two forms share the same multiplier.", ['{{C|The Forgotten}} + {{I|Soy Milk}}: Damage multiplier will not reset as long as the fire key is held, and will quickly build up to the maximum value of x2. The multiplier will only reset if, upon releasing the fire button, the thrown bone does not hit any enemy.']], ['{{i|Host Hat}}: Tears fired by the Host are affected by Dead Eye.'], ['{{I|Saturnus}} enemy Tears collected by the ring affects the damage multiplier of Dead Eye.'], ["{{i|Incubus}}: Incubus's tears do not affect the multiplier, but Incubus can gain damage from Isaac's normal tears increasing the multiplier. The familiar's tears do not reset the multiplier if they miss, either.", ["{{dlc|nr}} {{C|Lilith}}'s Incubus doesn't work with Dead Eye.", "'''Incubus''' + {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Tears fired by Incubus are now affected by Dead Eye."]], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: Electricity sparks do not contribute to damage multiplier."], ["{{i|Isaac's Tears}}: If the tears fired by Isaac's tears miss, they cause the multiplier to reset."], ['{{i|Marked}}: Damage buff often lost quickly because of the constantly firing tears.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The damage multiplier that was gained before picking up this item will now be a permanent damage up. Picking up Dead Eye after Mom's Knife has no effect."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Damage buff is halved, .125x, reaching the 2x multiplier with 8 successive hits.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears that hit enemies may bounce off and still count as misses.'], ['{{i|Sad Bombs}}: Tears spawned by sad bombs that miss will reset the multiplier.'], ['{{i|Technology}}: The damage multiplier that was gained before picking up this item will now be a permanent damage up. Saving and quitting, however, will remove the multiplier.'], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: No effect from the laser itself, but the tears fired from the second eye are affected by Dead Eye.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Tech X overrides the effects of Dead Eye and damage stays at the 2X multiplier.', ['{{dlc|r}} Dead Eye does not provide any damage multiplier.']], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Electricity connecting tears will not increase the damage multiplier.'], ['{{i|Trisagion|a+nr}}: No effect.', ['{{dlc|r}} Trisagion blasts are affected.']]]

name: More Options
description: Two item pedestels are presented in every {{r|Treasure Room}}. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.
effects: [['Two item pedestals are presented in every {{r|Treasure Room}}. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Small {{r|Treasure Room}}s only present one item, nullifying this item's effect."], ['If the Treasure Room has already been entered and the item was not taken, then picking up More Options later on the same floor will not retroactively add a second item to the room.'], ["The very rare Treasure Rooms that have either no item or two items that can ''both'' be picked up will be replaced with a one-out-of-two choice room, like other Treasure Rooms. In the latter case, this is a downgrade."], ['{{dlc|r}} In {{s|Downpour}} / {{s|Dross}} / {{s|Mines}} / {{s|Ashpit}} / {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}}, Treasure Rooms will have two known items and one unknown item, instead of the usual one known and one unknown.'], ["{{dlc|r}} In {{s|Downpour}} || / {{s|Dross}} ||, The Mirrored world's treasure room will '''not''' contain a second item."], ['More Options will work for Treasure Rooms during the [[Ascent]] as long as those rooms were never originally entered.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|r}} {{I|Crooked Penny}} / {{I|Diplopia}}: Both items are copied, allowing Isaac to take both copied items without the other disappearing. The original pedestals will function as normal, disappearing the other if one is collected.{{dlc-}}'], ["{{t|Devil's Crown}}: Both items can be taken, although they must be paid for with hearts."], ['{{C|Jacob and Esau|r}}: Both brothers can take one item each if they are lined up properly.']]

name: Sack Head
description: {{E|Penny|display=Coin}}s, {{E|bomb}}s, {{E|key}}s, cards, runes and batteries have a chance to become {{E|grab bag|n}}s.
effects: [["{{E|Penny|display=Coin}}s have a 10% chance to be replaced with {{E|Grab Bag}}s. {{E|Bomb}}s, {{E|Key}}s, [[Card]]s, [[Rune]]s, and {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}} have a 20% chance.", ['This includes pickups spawned by most sources: room rewards, chests, slot machines, special shopkeepers, etc.', '{{dlc|r}} Coins bombed out of a {{M|Donation Machine}} can become sacks.', 'The exception to this are pickups spawned by Isaac himself directly, e.g. with the likes of {{i|IV Bag}} or {{i|Fanny Pack}}, and contents of other sacks.']], ['Spawns a sack upon pickup.']]
notes: [['The item does not replace hearts, pills and chests.'], ['The item can also replace {{E|Troll Bomb}}s and {{E|Mega troll Bomb}}s that are not used as attacks, i.e. generated as room rewards, chest contents and such.'], ['The pickup replacement is applied retroactively when the item is collected: any appropriate pickup already existing on the current level may be replaced by a sack.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} Sacks on each floor tend to have the same contents, which can be taken advantage of if cards are involved.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Picking up a {{E|Golden Penny|n}} may spawn a sack instead of another Golden Penny.'], ["{{p|Cracked Key}} in the [[Ascent]] can be replaced by a sack, thus it is not recommended to take the item if you're going to unlock a tainted character."]]
synergies: [['{{t|Equality!}}: Sacks may drop new sacks while Equality! is active, potentially resulting in massive amounts of resources from a single sack.']]

name: Fruit Cake
description: Isaac's tears gain a random effect that changes every shot.
synergies: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Each tick of brimstone has a random effect.'], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs pull their effects from bomb modifiers ({{i|Bobby-Bomb}}, {{i|Bob's Curse}}, {{i|Bomber Boy}}, {{i|Butt Bombs}}, {{i|Glitter Bombs}}, {{i|Hot Bombs}}, {{i|Mr. Mega}}, {{i|Sad Bombs}}, {{i|Scatter Bombs}}, {{i|Sticky Bombs}}) as well as tear effects."], ['{{i|Finger!}}/{{i|Technology 2}}: Each tick of the laser has a random effect, allowing it to rapidly afflict enemies with multiple status effects.', ['This also includes the {{i|Sulfuric Acid}} effect to destroy rocks and enter secret rooms.']], ["{{i|Isaac's Tears}}/{{i|Tammy's Head}}/{{i|Tear Detonator}}: Each tear will have its own tear effect."], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear will cycle through different effects, based on Isaac's tear rate.", ['{{dlc|a+nr}} If Isaac stays in one room long enough the Ludovico tear will often fill the room with many stationary {{i|Trisagion}} tears that last until Isaac leaves the room. This combination can easily clear most rooms.']], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The benefits of fruit cake still occur but are short lived due to the high damage of Mom's knife."]]

name: Incubus
description: Spawns a demonic [[familiar]] that shoots tears identical to Isaac's in terms of [[damage]], [[tears]], and [[tear effect]]s.
effects: [["Spawns a demonic familiar that copies Isaac's tears.", ["{{Dlc|nr}} Incubus' tears ignores Isaac's range and shot speed.", "{{dlc|r}} Incubus' damage is reduced by 25% when playing as characters other than {{C|Lilith}} and {{C|Tainted Lilith}}."]]]
notes: [["Lilith's starting Incubus is technically not a collected item but an intrinsic part of the character, and is removed if an item such as {{i|Ankh}} or {{i|Clicker}} are used to become a different character. As such, playing as Lilith will not add Incubus to the [[collection page]], nor does her personal Incubus count towards the {{transf|Conjoined}} transformation."], ['Incubus is one of the familiars that can be spawned by {{i|Cambion Conception}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Incubus has the second highest priority of following familiars, below {{I|King Baby|n}}.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{Dlc|nr}} {{C|Azazel}} / {{i|Brimstone}}: Fires a full length Brimstone laser that can be charged while still firing the previous laser, allowing it to fire more rapidly than normal.', ["The laser fired by Incubus has the same width as {{i|Lil Brimstone}}'s.", "{{Dlc|r}} When playing as {{C|Azazel}}, Incubus' Brimstone laser has the same range as him.", '{{Dlc|r}} Multiple copies of {{I|Brimstone}} will not grant Incubus the mega brimstone effect.']], ['{{Dlc+|r}} {{I|Berserk!}} / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{I|Spirit Sword}}: Incubus will carry the respective melee weapon, using it exactly like Isaac.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{t|Forgotten Lullaby}}: Doubles fire rate of Incubus. This notably makes it fire and charge attack faster than Isaac does.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Analog Stick|a+nr}}: No effect. Stat changes still apply.'], ['{{I|Cursed Eye|na+}}: No effect.', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} A burst of 3 tears is fired at the regular tear delay without needing to charge.', '{{dlc|r}} Incubus now charges and fires a burst of 5 tears just as Isaac would.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Dead Eye}}: Only Isaac's tears affect the damage multiplier."], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{I|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|Loki's Horns}}/{{i|Mom's Eye}}: No effect."], ['{{i|Evil Eye|anr}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Eye Drops}}: Incubus does not have the staggered attack, stat bonuses still apply.'], ['{{i|Eye of Greed|a+nr}}: No effect.'], ['{{dlc+|a+nr}} {{C|The Forgotten}}: Fires bone tears like {{i|Compound Fracture}} without the splitting effect. Reverts to normal tears when switching to {{c|The Soul}}.{{dlc-}}'], ["{{i|Flat Stone|a+nr}}: The effective range of Incubus' tears is roughly doubled, with a single bounce in the middle of the flight."], ["{{i|Guillotine}}: Incubus will fire tears in relative position to its body depending on where Isaac's head is currently."], ['{{i|Ghost Pepper}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Immaculate Heart}}: Incubus can create its own orbiting tears, which will orbit the Incubus that created it, and not Isaac.'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Isaac's Tears}}: The item is recharged by Isaac's tears, not Incubus'. This item works with {{C|Lilith}}.", ["{{Dlc|r}} Incubus' tears contribute to the item charge."]], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Incubus ignores the range down from this item, and will fire the tear barrage but not the stone.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Incubus is still able to fire tears while Kidney Stone is charging.']], ['{{i|Large Zit}}: No effect.'], ["{{i|The Ludovico Technique|nr}}: Incubus' tears become piercing and spectral but otherwise fires normal tears."], ['{{i|Maw of the Void}}: No effect. {{Dlc|nr}} Stat changes still apply.'], ['{{i|Marked|anr}}: No effect. Stat changes still apply.'], ["{{i|Mongo Baby}}: Does not copy Incubus's tear effects."], ['{{i|My Reflection|nr}}: Since Incubus ignores shot speed the tears turn back very quickly, greatly reducing effective range.'], ['[[R U a Wizard?]]/{{i|Tech.5}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Tech X|anr}}: Incubus shoots small, fixed-size Tech X laser rings, with a very slightly longer minimum charge than Isaac.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology 2}}: No effect. Stat changes still apply.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Incubus can fire laser as normal.']], ['{{i|Tractor Beam|anr}}: No effect. Stat changes still apply.', ["'''Tractor Beam''' + {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Tears now follow the beam.", '{{Dlc|r}} The Incubus tears will follow the beam.']]]

name: Diplopia
description: Duplicates all pickups and item pedestals in the room.
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Using Diplopia on a [[trinket]] will spawn another random trinket instead of duplicating the trinket.', ['{{dlc|r}} Using Diplopia on a trinket does nothing.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Does not duplicate {{p|Rune of Jera}}.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} Using Diplopia on an empty item pedestal will spawn another random item.'], ['If used in a {{R|Shop}}, the duplicated pickups and items can be taken for free.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} If used in the {{R|Boss Rush}} room, all available items will be duplicated and all the duplicates can be taken ('''this will still start the Boss Rush'''); however, only one of the original items may be taken. Taking one of the original items does not cause the duplicates to disappear.", ['{{dlc|r}} Only one duplicate can be taken.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} If used on the {{i|The Polaroid}} and {{i|The Negative}} after defeating {{E|Mom}}, the duplicates can be taken without affecting the originals.', ['{{dlc|r}} Only one duplicate can be taken.']], ['If an item pedestal that is duplicated is visible as "?" (for example with the {{cu|Blind}}), duplicate will be visible as "?" until taken, just like the original item pedestal.'], ['{{dlc|r}} If used in a {{R|Treasure Room}} on the alternate path, only one duplicate can be taken. However, this allows Isaac to essentially take both items.'], ['If used in a {{R|Devil Room}} or the {{R|Black Market}}, the duplicated items can be taken for free. The original items will still be offered at an HP price, and Deal with the Devil precedent will not be obtained.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} If used in an {{R|Angel Room}} that has multiple [[item]] pedestals, the duplicated items can be taken for free.  The original items will still behave as normal: once an item is chosen, the others will disappear.', ['{{dlc|r}} Only one duplicate can be taken.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Picking up multiple copies of items that can cause Isaac to [[transformation|transform]] will not count towards transformation progress.', ['{{dlc|r}} Multiple copies of the same item do count towards transformations.']], ['Using Diplopia on another copy of Diplopia will not work.'], ['{{C|Jacob and Esau}} can use this item to duplicate an active item to each have the same active item.'], ['Tear-boosting items, if stacked, cap at shooting 16 tears at once.']]
synergies: [['{{i|20/20}}: Isaac fires 3 tightly-packed tears with no increase in tear delay.', ['{{dlc|r}} Damage down does not stack.']], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Isaac fires two lasers simultaneously.', ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac gains a powered-up version of Brimstone with a unique costume that deals 1.2x damage and has +1 damage. Further copies will add another +1 damage.']], ['{{i|Contract From Below}}: Triples the drops upon clearing a room.'], ['{{I|Damocles}}: Spawns an extra item for each item cloned.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Isaac fires two bombs simultaneously.'], ["{{i|Eden's Blessing}}: Tears upgrades stack and Isaac gains two items at the start of the next run. Stacks up to 10 times."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Two missiles drop, one after the other.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|The Inner Eye}}: Isaac fires 6 tears. Tears down stat does not stack.', ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac fires an additional tear. Tears down stat does not stack.']], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: A smaller tear orbits the main tear.'], ['{{i|Maw of the Void}}: Increase damage for tears and ring.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Isaac fires two knives simultaneously."], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: The tear burst gains another 10 tears, nearly doubling in size. Stacks up to 5 times."], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Mutant Spider}}: Isaac fires 8 tears. Tears down stat does not stack.', ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac fires 2 additional tears. Tear down stat does not stack.']], ['{{i|Schoolbag}} + any active item: While there is no use in duplicating the Schoolbag, it gives Isaac a use for duplicating an active item.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Steam Sale}}: All items in Shops become free. With {{i|Restock}}, items can be infinitely bought for free.', ['{{dlc|r}} Each additional Steam Sale will further halve the price. Items cannot be reduced below 1 cent.']], ['{{i|Technology}}: Isaac fires two lasers simultaneously.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Isaac fires two laser rings simultaneously.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} {{i|The Wiz}}: Isaac fires 4 tears diagonally.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Isaac fires 3 tears, one straight ahead and two diagonally.']], ['{{p|Wild Card|force=r}}: <s>Allows infinite uses of Diplopia as long as Diplopia was the last item used.</s> Only produses a pickups.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{p|? Card}}: Expends both the card and the item with no additional benefit.', ['{{dlc|r}} Now expends the card without consuming Diplopia, allowing for potential multiple uses.', ['If 2 ? Cards are gathered in the same room, one can be used to duplicate the other, allowing for infinite duplication of everything else in that room.', 'If 3 ? Cards are gathered in the same room, one of them can be used to duplicate infinite ? Cards as well.']]], ["{{i|Belly Button}} / {{i|Mom's Purse}}: Does not allow more than two trinkets to be held at once."], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}: Range increases twice. No effect on how many bone tears are fired or how many bone shards are fired.'], ['{{i|Continuum}}: Only increases range further.'], ['{{i|Crown of Light}}: Only further decreases shot speed and increases range.'], ['{{i|Dead Eye}}: The damage multiplier increases twice as fast, but still caps at double damage.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Deep Pockets}} / {{i|Little Baggy}} / {{i|Polydactyly}} / {{i|Starter Deck}}: Does not allow more than two pills or cards to be held at once.'], ["{{i|Eve's Mascara}}: The damage and tear multipliers do not stack. The shot speed does stack."], ['{{i|Eye of Belial}}: Only further increases range.'], ['{{i|Finger!}}: Spawns two familiars completely overlapping each other.'], ['{{i|Godhead}}: Only stat ups and downs compound, but the aura gains no bonus.'], ['{{i|Guillotine}}: Isaac will have two orbital heads, but only one will fire tears.'], ['{{i|Holy Mantle}}: An extra effect is added in the room it was found in, but only a single effect will be given in future rooms.'], ['{{i|Iron Bar}}: Increases damage but not chance of concussive tears being fired.'], ['{{i|Key Piece 1}}, {{i|Key Piece 2}}: Spawns a copy of the same Key Piece. The copy does not increase the chance for an Angel Room.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Only further decreases speed.'], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Only further decreases shot speed.'], ['{{i|Magic Mushroom}}: Increases all stats twice, but damage significantly less the second time as the 1.5x multipliers do not stack.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Only increases range and firerate.'], ["{{i|Mom's Contacts}}: Only increases range."], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Only increases range.'], ['{{i|Piggy Bank}}: Only grants 3 more coins. Does not drop more pennies when taking damage.'], ['{{I|Placenta}}: Only increases HP with no change to the regeneration effect.'], ['{{i|Pointy Rib}}: Spawns two familiars that completely overlap each other.'], ['{{i|Purity}}: No effect. Aura changes after a second pickup.'], ['{{i|Quints}}: Increases maximum familiar count by 5.'], ['{{i|Sacred Heart}}: Further decreases tears and shot speed with no increase in damage.'], ['{{I|Stop Watch|force=r}}: Further increases speed with no further effect on movement speed or shot speed of enemies.'], ['{{i|Sulfuric Acid}}: Only further increases damage.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Further increases shot speed, fire rate, and range with no other effects.'], ['{{i|Twisted Pair}}: Adds two more familiars that float further away from either side of Isaac.']]

name: Restock
description: Causes {{R|Shop}}s to instantly restock their items when they are bought. {{dlc|r}} Outside of [[Greed Mode]], the restocked item's cost is increased after each purchase.
effects: [["Upon purchasing an item from the {{R|Shop}}, a new purchasable item is added to the store's inventory.", ["[[Collectible]]s created correspond to the [[Shop (Item Pool)|shop's item pool]]."]], ['{{dlc|nr}} Drops 3 random pickups around Isaac.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Outside of [[Greed Mode]], the restocked item's cost is increased after each purchase.", ['For [[items]], the price increase is 2 coins times the number of purchases. For example, an item starting at 15 cents would next be +2 to 17, then +4 to 21, +6 to 27, etc. The cost follows the formula 15+n(n+1) with n being the number of times restock has triggered.', 'For everything else, the price increase is 1 coin times the number of purchases. For example, a heart starting at 3 cents would be +1 to 4, +2 to 6, +3 to 9 etc. This follows the formula (original price)+(n(n+1))/2', "The increase is not affected by discounts occurring naturally or through {{i|Steam Sale}}: costs will increase at the same rate, though the base price is still discounted. Once the item's cost goes over what it would naturally be, the price is no longer highlighted red.", 'The maximum price is 99 cents.']], ['A small restock icon appears under the map, just like {{I|Treasure Map}}, {{I|Blue Map}}, {{I|The Compass}} {{dlc|r}} and any active [[curses]].']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If used with {{i|IV Bag}}/{{M|Blood Donation Machine}} and an item which can spawn additional coins ({{t|Counterfeit Penny}}, {{t|Swallowed Penny}}, {{i|Humbling Bundle}}, etc.), infinite money can be produced by buying hearts for 3 coins and getting more than 3 coins back after donating health.'], ['Using a {{P|Credit Card}} in a Shop prevents Restock from working for that shop only.', ['A {{M|Shop Restock Machine}} will refresh the items, which Restock will interact with normally.']], ['When purchasing Restock from a Shop, the slot that Restock was purchased from will not be restocked.'], ['Restock does not affect {{R|Black Market}}s or purchasable items generated via {{i|A Pound of Flesh}} or {{i|The Stairway}}.'], ['{{dlc|a+}} Purchasing an item that is on sale will replace it with another that is on sale.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Steam Sale}} x2: Items can be infinitely bought from shops.'], ["{{i|Blank Card}} + {{p|2 of Diamonds}}: {{dlc|nr}} If a {{E|Lil' Battery}} is on sale, items can be bought infinitely.", ["{{dlc|r}} If a {{E|Lil' Battery}} is on sale, Isaac can buy a lot of items before the prices become too high in that shop."]], ['{{i|Chaos}}: Restock is affected by Chaos, and can be used to obtain otherwise rare items.', ["{{dlc|nr}} '''Chaos''' + {{i|Steam Sale}} x2: Items can be bought infinitely, allowing Isaac to theoretically obtain every item in the game."]], ["{{i|Keeper's Box}}: Items spawned by the box are affected by Restock. Curiously, Restock's price increase on buying an item does not trigger making it easier to buy more items."], ['{{i|Member Card}}: Items bought in the separate shop will also be restocked.']]

name: Little Horn
notes: [["The {{i|Gnawed Leaf}} can make the battle easier, as Little Horn will damage himself with his bombs over time. Isaac can still fall into the pits and be transported around the screen, and will ''appear'' to suffer damage, but no actual loss of HP will occur if he is in statue form when he falls in."], ['The Dark Balls that Little Horn spawns can appear in [[Closets]] in the {{Stage|Caves}} and the {{Stage|Flooded Caves}}. They also appear in a room with Little Horn in the {{Stage|Chest}}.'], ['If Isaac has the {{t|Safety Scissors|n}}, he can acquire maximum bombs from the fight at fairly little risk since the bombs Little Horn spawns will turn into bomb pickups and all his hole attacks are easy to dodge.'], ["Little Horn's Dark Ball is considered a monster. Killing it will activate items such as {{i|Charm of the Vampire}}, {{i|Infestation 2}}, and {{i|Jar of Flies|n}}."], ['Occasionally, a Pitfall that Little Horn summons will not vanish after defeating the boss. The Pitfall is still active and can damage Isaac, even if it does not actively chase the player.']]

name: Crack Jacks
quote: HP up. Don't swallow the prize!
description: Grants one full [[Red Heart container]] and drops a random [[trinket]].
effects: [['Grants one full [[Red Heart container]].', ['{{Dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{E|red heart}}.']], ['Spawns one random [[trinket]].']]

name: The Wiz
description: Tears simultaneously fire out of both eyes diagonally, similar to the effect of the [[R U a Wizard?]] pill. Isaac's tears also travel above all obstacles.
effects: [['Isaac fires tears from both eyes at the same time.'], ["Isaac's tears are fired diagonally outwards, similar to the effect of the [[R U a Wizard?]] pill."], ["Isaac's tears become [[Tear Effects|spectral]]."]]
notes: [['The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating {{i|20/20}}, {{i|The Inner Eye}}, {{i|Mutant Spider}} and The Wiz is 16.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}}{{i|20/20}}: Fires 2 tears to both diagonal directions.'], ['{{i|Diplopia}}/{{i|Crooked Penny}}: Picking up a second The Wiz will make Isaac fire 4 tears in a wider diagonal layout.', ['{{dlc|r}} Picking up an additional The Wiz will make Isaac fire 1 additional tear in front of him, giving the same effect as the {{transf|Conjoined}} transformation without the stat penalties. Every further copy of The Wiz will add 1 more tear per volley and make the spread wider. It should be noted that picking up the 8th copy will double the tears fired per volley and thus will reach the 16-tear limit.', '{{dlc|r}}If combined with 20/20, The Inner Eye, or Mutant Spider, it will add 2 more tears per additional copy.']], ['{{I|Eye of The Occult}}: Both tears shoot much closer together and can be controlled, creating for a better double shot similar to what Tractor Beam would grant.'], ["{{dlc|r}}'''Mutant Spider''' /{{C|Tainted Keeper}}: Fires 3 tears to both diagonal directions."], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Electricity arcs between both tears instantly, providing incredible crowd control.', ["'''Technology Zero''' + [[Piercing tears|Piercing]]: Tears cannot be stopped by enemies, resulting in an unstoppable array of electricity between tears."]]]
interactions: [['{{i|Analog Stick}}: Will make one tear go forwards and the other tear fire at a 90-degree angle to the other tear.'], ['{{C|Azazel}}: Azazel fires two short diagonal {{I|Brimstone}} beams in the chosen direction (Same with {{C|Tainted Azazel}}).'], ['{{I|Brimstone}} beams remain diagonal even if Isaac has {{i|Tractor Beam}}.', ['{{C|Azazel}} + {{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Overrides The Wiz.']], ['{{C|Cain}} / {{C|Tainted Cain}}: Makes Cain fire in the two diagonal directions instead of just his right eye as the [[R U a Wizard?]] pill does.'], ['[[Conjoined]]: Fires double tears in both directions, but removes the center tear.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The crosshair is controlled diagonally as if rotated 45 degrees clockwise from usual (i.e.: the up arrow will move it in a northeast direction), and two missiles are fired, similar to the effect of {{i|20/20}}. The crosshair can be moved in the cardinal directions by pressing two arrow keys at once (e.g.: pressing the up and right arrows will move the crosshair right).'], ['[[Homing tears]]: Tears are more likely to home in on enemies if enemies are coming towards Isaac diagonally. Otherwise, it only minorly improves accuracy.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Small tear orbits the main tear. Tear controls rotated 45 degrees clockwise - holding up makes it move northeast and so on.'], ['{{i|Marked|n}}: Fires two shots aimed diagonally from the crosshair.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: 7-8 tears are fired at each diagonal direction instead of a full burst."], ['[[R U a Wizard?]] pill: Makes Isaac fire forward with a normal fire rate and 90 degrees outwards with half fire rate.'], ['{{i|Sad Bombs}}: Does not affect the number of tears when bombs explode.'], ['{{i|Varicose Veins}}: No effect on number of tears when taking damage.']]

name: Athame
description: When Isaac takes damage, a black ring briefly appears around him, dealing damage to all nearby enemies.
notes: [['The ring is similar in appearance to the combination of {{i|The Ludovico Technique}} and {{i|Brimstone}}.'], ['It is identical to the ring created by {{i|Maw of the Void}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Especially effective against {{E|Envy}} and {{E|Super Envy}}. Each piece of Envy grants a 15% chance for a Black Heart. It is also effective against {{E|Brownie}} due to all the {{E|Brownie Corn}}s it spawns.']]
synergies: [['[[Homing tears]]: The black ring becomes homing, curving around to hit enemies.'], ['{{i|Hemoptysis}}: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the black ring deals to 2x and +3 flat damage. Enemies who die to the black ring under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Massively increases damage and poisons enemies.', ['{{dlc|r}} Causes the ring to explode upon contact with walls or obstacles. The explosions can damage the player, causing the ring to appear again, damage the player, and cause a loop of damage.']], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: The ring is much larger and deals 1.5x damage.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The ring deals normal damage.', '{{dlc|r}} The ring is now normal size.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Holy Mantle}}: Getting hit when the Holy Mantle shield is active prevents Athame from triggering its effect.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The ring damage is halved.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The ring deals normal damage.']]]

name: Kidney Bean
description: Isaac farts, [[charm]]ing all nearby enemies.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac farts, [[charm]]ing all nearby enemies.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The cloud deals 5 damage.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: Spawns two charming farts on top of each other.'], ['{{i|Ghost Pepper}}: Whenever the player creates a charming fart, a fire will be shot in a random direction.']]

name: Epiphora
description: Shooting in one direction increases Isaac's [[Tear delay|rate of fire]] until the cap is reached. As soon as Isaac changes direction or stops shooting, rate of fire is reset to its normal amount.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} [[Tear delay]] gradually decreases as the player shoots in one direction. Accuracy also decreases as the fire rate increases.', ['At max "charge", it will reduce tear delay by half, rounding down.']], ['{{dlc|r}} [[Fire rate]] gradually increases as the player shoots in one direction. Accuracy also decreases as the fire rate increases.', ['At max "charge", it will increase fire rate by double.']], ['Rate of fire returns to its original value if Isaac stops firing, changes firing directions, uses an active item, or is hit.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Being hit, changing rooms, and using items no longer reset the Epiphora bonus.', '{{dlc|r}} Entering an unexplored boss room will reset the Epiphora bonus.', ["During the delay when transitioning between rooms, picking up an item, or using an active item, it's possible to change the firing direction without resetting the bonus."]]]]
notes: [["Epiphora technically works with items that require a charge (such as {{i|Monstro's Lung}}), but requires releasing the key or button, causing players to lose the effect."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Continuum}}: Reduces the need to change firing direction, allowing Isaac to maintain the increased rate of fire.'], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Ipecac}}: Firing bombs continually will decrease tear delay, although doing so is '''not recommended''' since it increases the risk of self-damage."], ['{{C|The Forgotten}}: When tapping the attack button in a single direction repeatedly, the Ephiphora effect will cause the bone swings to speed up.'], ['{{i|How to Jump}}: Changing firing direction while jumping does not reset the bonus, similar to when changing rooms.'], ["{{i|Incubus}}: Incubus's fire rate will match Isaac's."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Fire rate increases while moving the tear in one direction; it has a negligible effect during normal gameplay.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Both items work as normal, with tear rate gradually increasing until Isaac turns his head, which can happen via him or the crosshair moving too out of parallel.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Reduces the need to change firing direction allowing Isaac to maintain the increased rate of fire.'], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: Isaac will never lose the benefits of Epiphora, even after he stops firing. This effectively makes Epiphora a substantial tears up. Fully charging Ephiphora is still needed to gain a higher tears stat if an item that would increase the tears stat is picked up.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Fire rate still increases when shooting in one direction, but will stay on the line (i.e. no loss in accuracy).'], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}} / {{i|Mom's Eye}}: Allows for firing in multiple directions at once, decreasing need to change firing direction."]]
interactions: [["Charging items such as {{i|Brimstone}}, {{i|Chocolate Milk}}, {{i|Cursed Eye}}, {{i|Mom's Knife}}, {{i|Monstro's Lung}}, and {{i|Tech X}}: Effect only activates when holding charge in a specific direction, and deactivates when the charge is released, effectively making Epiphora useless unless Isaac has exceedingly low fire rate.", ["{{dlc|r}} {{i|Soy Milk}} / {{i|Almond Milk}} + {{i|Chocolate Milk}} / {{i|Cursed Eye}} / {{i|Monstro's Lung}} / {{i|Tech X}}: Due to constant firing, Epiphora's fire rate bonus can now be used.", "{{dlc|r}} {{i|Soy Milk}} / {{i|Almond Milk}} + {{i|Brimstone}}: The Brimstone laser only gains the increased damage from higher tear rates when the laser starts firing, making Epiphora's bonus useless."]], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Epiphora.'], ['{{C|Lilith}}: Lilith and her Incubus cannot gain extra fire rate from Epiphora.', ["{{dlc|r}} Incubus' fire rate will increase without the accuracy penalty"]], ['{{c|Tainted Isaac}}: If you pick up an item and drop Epiphora while holding the attack button you will keep the fire rate. The effect will disappear upon entering a new floor.'], ['{{i|Bag of Crafting}}: Bag of Crafting can be used to switch directions without reducing fire rate when activated.']]

name: Glitter Bombs
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Bombs have a chance to drop random [[pickup]]s or [[charm]] enemies when they explode.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["Isaac's bombs have a 25% chance to spawn a [[pickup]] or [[trinket]] when they explode including other bombs.", ["{{dlc|r}} Isaac's bombs have a 63% chance to spawn a pickup or trinket when they explode, but the chance for either to generate decreases by 1% for each spawn until Isaac enters a new floor. This is to prevent items such as {{i|Dr. Fetus}} or a {{E|Golden Bomb}} from providing unlimited resources. This means that the maximum spawns per floor is 63, although the final generation of a pickup or trinket will have a 1% chance to occur."]], ["Isaac's bombs have a 15% chance to [[charm]] random enemies in the room when they explode."]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} Picking up a {{E|Golden Bomb}}, {{i|Dr. Fetus}}, {{i|Epic Fetus}}, or {{i|Number Two}} with Glitter Bombs allows infinite pickup generation.', ['In [[Greed Mode]], infinite pickup generation is still possible, but excludes coins, presumably to prevent the player from filling the {{M|Greed Donation Machine}} in a single run. However, this can be worked around if Isaac has the {{t|Swallowed Penny}} or {{i|Piggy Bank}}, since it does still produce health.']]]
synergies: [['{{I|Anarchist Cookbook}}/{{i|Curse of the Tower}}: Each Troll Bomb has a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket including a [[battery]] or [[heart]] which can be taken advantage of for repeated uses of Anarchist Cookbook or Curse of the Tower respectively.'], ["{{I|BBF}}/{{I|Bob's Brain}}: Has a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket when exploding."], ["{{I|Best Friend}}/{{I|Bob's Rotten Head}}/{{I|Mr. Boom}}: The active item’s bomb has a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket."], ['{{I|Bomber Boy}}: Each additional explosion created has a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket.'], ["{{I|Doctor's Remote}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Missiles have a chance of spawning a pickup or trinket upon exploding."], ['{{I|Dr. Fetus}}: Bombs have a chance of spawning pickups or trinkets upon exploding.'], ['{{I|Everything Jar}}: At eleven charges guarantees a golden bomb.'], ['{{I|Kamikaze!}}: Has a chance to drop a pickup or trinket each time it is used.'], ['{{I|Number Two}}: Bombs have a chance of spawning pickups or trinkets upon exploding.'], ['{{dlc|r}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: Red locust explosions have a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket.'], ['{{I|Scatter Bombs}}: Each smaller bomb also has a chance of dropping a pickup or trinket.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Hot Bombs}}: Removes contact damage from bombs due to overriding the flaming bomb graphics.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: No effect on shots.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: No effect on red locust explosions.']]

name: Mom's Pearls
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +1.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], +1 [[luck]].
{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]], +1 [[luck]]. Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +1.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['+1 [[luck]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]

name: Binky
description: Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}, +0.75 [[tears]] and decreases Isaac's size.
effects: [['Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['+0.75 [[tears]].'], ["Decreases Isaac's size."], ["Increases the pitch of Isaac's voice."]]

name: Mr. Dolly
description:
{{dlc|nr}} +0.7 [[tears]], +5.25 [[range]], +0.5 [[tear falling speed]], spawns 3 random types of {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}s on the floor when picked up.
{{dlc|r}} +0.7 [[tears]], +1.5 [[range]], spawns 3 random types of {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}s on the floor when picked up.
effects: [['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['Spawns 3 random types of {{E|Red Heart|display=Heart}}s on the floor when picked up.', ['These hearts are not subject to the Red/Soul/Black Heart chances; each type has an equal chance to spawn.']]]

name: Tech X
description: Tears are replaced with laser rings that pierce through enemies and deal damage to enemies within them. Can be charged to increase the effectiveness of the ring.
effects: [["Isaac's tears are replaced with ring-shaped lasers.", ['Shots can be charged to increase the size of the rings.', 'The rings deal damage 15 times per second. Only the outer circumference of the rings will deal damage.', 'Rings pass through obstacles and enemies. Rings have infinite range and will travel until they hit a wall.', "{{Dlc|r}} Damage dealt is based on the amount charged, starting at around 25% Isaac's damage and approaches 100% at maximum charge.", ['<math>\\text{Charge Time} = \\frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay} \\times 3) + 1) \\approx \\frac{3}{\\text{Fire Rate}}</math>', '<math>\\text{Max Charge Damage per Tick} = \\text{Damage} \\times \\frac{5}{4}(\\text{Fire Rate} \\times (Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay} \\times 3) + 1) - 10)</math>', '<math>\\text{Min Charge Damage per Tick} = \\text{Damage} \\times \\frac{5}{4}(\\text{Fire Rate} \\times (Roundup(\\text{Tear Delay}) + 1) - 10)</math>', 'At 30.00 fire rate or above (0 tear delay or lower), charging is no longer needed and fires 30 rings per second. Higher fire rate results in higher laser damage.', ['<math>\\text{Damage per Tick} = \\text{Damage} \\times \\frac{5}{4}(\\text{Fire Rate} - 10)</math>', "Damage per Tick is capped at 100% Isaac's Damage, at 90.00 fire rate."]]]]]
notes: [['The rings are similar in appearance to the combination of {{I|The Ludovico Technique}} and {{I|Technology}}.'], ['The laser rings will linger for a brief moment upon touching a wall, allowing more damage to be dealt to enemies closer to walls.'], ['The "R U A WIZARD?" pill effect does not work with Tech X.'], ['Acquiring an extra copy of Tech X will shoot an extra laser ring.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Charging only increases size, not damage. It is useful for hard-to-hit enemies or hitting a wide area at once, but spamming small, uncharged shots will lead to much higher damage output.', ['{{Dlc|a+nr}} With the charge bars option enabled, the rings can be released immediately as the charge bar appears for easier gauging of maximum damage output.']], ["{{Dlc|r}} The maximum ring size is slightly smaller in ''Repentance''."]]
synergies: [['{{I|20/20}}: Fires two Tech X rings instead of one. Damage down applied.'], ['{{I|Brimstone}}: Fires a Brimstone ring. This Brimstone ring is larger than the laser ring and has a much wider hitbox.', ['{{C|Azazel}}: Picking up Brimstone will still override Tech X. When you pick up Tech X as Azazel with his inherited Brimstone, Tech X does nothing at all.', ["{{Dlc|a+}} As Azazel, Brimstone no longer overrides Tech X, instead Tech X overrides Azazel's Brimstone. This works quite well with Azazel's good initial damage stat and also negates his initial range penalty.", '{{Dlc|r}} Azazel fires a Brimstone ring instead of Tech X ring with a 35% damage penalty. If combined with Brimstone, the damage penalty is negated.', ['The same applies to {{C|Tainted Azazel}}.']], '{{Dlc|nr}}{{I|Brimstone}} + {{I|Technology}}: The damage boost from Brimstone + Technology is lost, but the laser fires while charging the Brimstone ring.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Fires a Brimstone ring coiled by a laser. Once again increases Isaac's damage by 1.5x."], '{{Dlc|r}} Double {{I|Brimstone}}: Further increases the width of the ring, and grants +1 Damage.']], ['[[Bookworm]]: Can fire an additional Tech X ring with same 25% chance.'], ["{{I|C Section}}: Overrides the charging effect, but shoots a laser ring with a fetus tear in the middle. The ring's damage is half the fetus' damage."], ["{{I|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides the charging effect, but shoots a laser ring with a bomb in the middle. The ring's damage is Isaac's Damage."], ["{{I|Epic Fetus}}: Each missile shoots 10 laser beams like from {{I|Technology}} in each direction with a flat 25 damage bonus, similar to {{I|Tammy's Head}}."], ["{{I|Haemolacria}}: Haemolacria tears will burst into 3-5 Tech X rings on impact. The sizes of the rings are various, but they deal 100% Isaac's Damage."], ['{{I|Lost Contact|nr}}: Tech X rings are able to block projectiles as they travel.'], ["{{I|Mom's Knife|nr}}: Simultaneously fires the knife and laser ring(s).", ["{{Dlc|r}} The knife is fired with a Tech X ring around it, similarly to the forgotten's club throw. The ring's damage is based on the amount charged, starting at 33% Isaac's damage and 100% at maximum charge."]], ["{{I|Monstro's Lung}}: Fires 3-5 extra rings in 30° spread. Extra rings deal from 50% to 100% damage of the main ring.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Fire Rate is divided by 3.1.']], ['{{I|Sad Bombs}}: Bombs explode into {{I|Technology}} beams in all directions.'], ["{{I|Spoon Bender}}: While the rings won't home in on enemies, they will bend inwards to hit enemies within each ring, resulting in a substantial damage area increase."], ['{{I|Strange Attractor}}: Magnetic effect pulls pickups and objects to the ring, increasing accuracy.'], ['{{I|Tech.5}}: Occasionally fires a linear laser while charging Tech X.'], ['{{I|Technology|nr}}: Fires a linear laser while charging Tech X.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Fires a {{I|Brimstone}} ring coiled by a laser. Despite its appearance, it does ''not'' give 1.5x damage (see {{I|Brimstone}} synergy above)."]], ['{{I|Technology 2}}: Fires a linear laser while charging Tech X.'], ['{{T|Wiggle Worm}}: Rings take star-shape, slightly increasing its area of effect.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Almond Milk}}: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. Tech X overrides most of the worm trinket effects.'], ['{{I|Anti-Gravity}}: Only tear delay down applies.'], ['{{I|Apple!|nr}}: Only tears up applies, without a chance of high-damage rings.', ["{{Dlc|r}} 4x damage will apply randomly at each damage tick depending on Isaac's luck stat."]], ["{{C|Azazel|na+}}: Azazel's brimstone overrides Tech X.", ["{{Dlc|a+}} Tech X overrides Azazel's brimstone."]], ['{{T|Brain Worm}}: No effect.'], ['{{I|Blood Clot}} / {{I|Chemical Peel}} / {{I|The Peeper}}: The effects have 80% chance to be applied per damage tick.'], ["{{I|Chocolate Milk|nr}}: Doesn't increase damage, but reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Overridden by Tech X.']], ["{{Dlc|nr}}{{I|Continuum}} + {{I|Incubus}}: Incubus's laser rings cannot go through walls.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Works as expected.']], ["{{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}} / {{I|Compound Fracture}}: Only stat effects, if any, apply.", ["{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Cricket's Body}}: Shoots out smaller tears on hit."]], ['{{I|Cursed Eye}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Dead Eye}}: Prior to picking up Tech X, the damage multiplier is preserved to where its at, and missing shots will not remove it. Saving and quitting the game will remove the multiplier. Picking Dead Eye after Tech X has no effect.'], ["{{I|Death's Touch}}: Only stat changes apply."], ['{{I|Euthanasia}}: No high-damage/instant death rings.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Effect of Euthanasia applies randomly on every tick of the ring.']], ['{{I|Evil Eye}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Explosivo|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Regular explosive tears may stick to enemies in contact with the laser.']], ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Fire Mind}}: Laser rings set enemies on fire and do not explode.'], ['{{I|Flat Stone}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: A laser ring forms around the bone toss attack. {{C|The Soul}} uses Tech X normally, and {{C|Tainted Soul}} cannot use it at all.'], ['{{I|Fruit Cake}}: Only status effects granted by Fruit Cake work on the laser rings.'], ['{{I|Gello}}: The [[familiar]] charges based on the distance from the target enemy. It charges more when it is further from the enemy.'], ['{{I|Godhead}}: Damaging halo effect lost, but retain [[Homing]] effect.'], ['{{I|Head of the Keeper|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The tears turn into the Tech X tears, but they still retain the chance to drop money on hit. This chance procs with every tick of damage, rather than with the rings themselves.']], ['{{T|Hook Worm}}: Trajectory altering effect is not applied to the rings.'], ['{{I|Holy Light|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The rings can create beams of light.']], ["{{I|Incubus|nr}}: The rings fired by the Incubus have a fixed size; charging the ring will only increase the size of the player's own rings.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Works as expected.']], ['{{I|Ipecac|na+}}: Overridden by Tech X. The damage bonus is lost upon entering a different room. Still poisons enemies like Ipecac does.', ['{{Dlc|a+nr}} +4 damage and poisons enemies.', '{{Dlc|r}} Tech X ring causes an explosion on every rock or enemy it passes through. The ring will not open {{R|Secret Room}}s.', '{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Ipecac}} + {{I|Almond Milk}} / {{I|Soy Milk}}: Explosion damage maintained as tears vastly increases.']], ["{{I|Jacob's Ladder|nr}}: The rings do not spawn the sparks.", ['{{Dlc|r}} The rings gain a light blue tint and generate sparks when hitting enemies or obstacles. A ring can generate only one spark per tick.']], ['{{I|Lachryphagy}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Lead Pencil|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Every 15th laser ring fired also shoots a cluster of tears.']], ['{{I|Little Horn|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Occasionally fires a Little Horn laser ring.']], ["{{I|Loki's Horns|a+nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Adds a chance to fire 4 laser rings at once with 2 in front and 2 behind Isaac, each pair firing on top of each other.']], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} [[Technology]]: The ring thickens and its appearance changes.'], ["{{I|A Lump of Coal|nr}}: Damage and size of the ring increases the further away it is from the player, but is actually roughly 2/3rds of tear damage up close. It takes a few tiles of distance to reach normal damage and go above it, with the maximum being 1.5x at roughly a room's width away.", ['{{Dlc|r}} The damage is normal at point blank range but the damage increase per tile is significantly lower.']], ['{{I|Marked|nr}}: Only stat changes apply, no targeting effect.', ["{{Dlc|r}} The rings are now fired automatically with ring size depending on Isaac's distance from the cursor; the further he is, the larger the rings are."]], ["{{I|Mom's Eye|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Isaac will now sometimes fire an additional ring from his back.']], ['{{I|Mucormycosis}}: Hitting enemies has a chance to stick a spore to them.'], ['{{I|My Reflection}}: Only stat changes apply.'], ['{{I|Neptunus}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{T|Ouroboros Worm|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The ring inherits the [[homing]] chance benefit, without being affected by the pattern.']], ['{{I|Parasitoid}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ["{{I|Proptosis}}: The ring's damage and size substantially increase, but decreases the further it travels.", ["{{Dlc|r}} The ring's damage and size is based on the distance from Isaac. The damage is 4.38x when Isaac is on the center of the ring, down to 1.5x."]], ['{{I|Pop!}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{T|Pulse Worm}}: The ring pulsates in size between 0.67x to 1.33x over a 2 second cycle.'], ['{{I|Pupula Duplex}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Rubber Cement|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The rings bounce off walls once.']], ['{{I|Saturnus}}: Normal tears orbit Isaac.'], ['{{I|The Scooper}} / {{I|Stye}}: The effects have 20% chance to be applied per damage tick.'], ['{{I|Soy Milk|r}} : Fires automatically upon reaching full charge.'], ['{{I|Sulfuric Acid|nr}}: Only damage up applies.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The ring has a chance to destroy [[Obstacles]].']], ["{{I|Tammy's Head}}: Tammy's head fires regular tears."], ['{{I|Technology Zero}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Terra}}: The ring can destroy [[Obstacles]]. Also greatly increases knockback.'], ['{{I|Tiny Planet}}: Overridden by Tech X.'], ['{{I|Tough Love|nr}}: Overridden by Tech X.', ["{{Dlc|r}} 3.2x damage will apply randomly at each damage tick depending on Isaac's [[Luck]]."]], ['{{I|Tractor Beam}}: Tech X overrides the beam. Any previous effects rendered moot by Tractor Beam (e.g. {{I|The Wiz}}) will return.'], ['{{I|Trisagion}}: Overridden by Tech X.']]

name: Tractor Beam
description: Isaac emits a beam from his face that his tears are bound to. {{dlc|nr}} Increases [[Tears]], [[Range]], and [[Shot Speed]]. {{dlc|r}} Increases [[Fire Rate]], [[Range]], and [[Shot Speed]].
effects: [["A beam appears directly in front of Isaac in the direction that his head is facing. Isaac's tears travel in the path of the beam.", ['When Isaac moves or turns his head, tears that are mid-flight will snap to the beam.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[Tears]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1.0 [[Fire Rate]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[Range]].', ['{{dlc|r}} +1.5 [[Range]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['+0.16 [[Shot Speed]].']]
notes: [['This item prevents Isaac from firing tears at angles using momentum.'], ['Having this item equipped prevents Isaac from automatically aiming downwards after he stops firing.'], ['This item grants Isaac immunity from the [[R U a Wizard?]] pill effect.']]
synergies: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{transf|Bookworm}}/{{transf|Conjoined}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{c|Keeper}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}/{{dlc|r}}{{c|Tainted Keeper}}/{{i|The Wiz}}: Every extra tear will follow the beam instead of having a spread, making it easier to hit enemies with the extra tears. Essentially increases damage per second.'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture|a+nr}}: All split tears will follow the beam greatly increasing effective damage. Bone tears will not burst into bone shards when fired at obstacles, however, bone tears will burst into bone shards when fired at enemies.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Obstacles now also cause bones to split.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: All split tears will follow the beam greatly increasing effective damage."], ['{{i|Continuum}}: The tears will re-appear directly in front of Isaac and continue their flight path after going off screen.'], ["{{i|Guillotine}}: The beam will visually follow Isaac's head as it orbits, but tears will still stay centered relative to Isaac's body making his tears easier to aim."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Incubus}}/{{i|Sumptorium}}/{{i|Twisted Pair}}: Tears shot by these familiars will originate from Isaac, following the beam.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears can still be fed and will still burst. {{dlc|nr}} Burst tears will travel along the beam.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: All tears are fired along the beam but at different heights."], ['{{t|Ouroboros Worm}}: The altered patterns tears travel in is confined to the beam allowing Isaac to benefit from the stat bonus and [[spectral tears]] granted without losing accuracy.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears stick along the tractor beam even when they slow down and collide, capable of creating a dense line of shots.'], ['{{t|Rainbow Worm}}: The altered patterns tears travel in is confined to the beam allowing Isaac to benefit from the stat bonuses granted without losing accuracy.', ['{{dlc|r}} Many of the worm trincket effects it gives now grants spectral tears as well.']], ['{{dlc|r}}{{t|Ring Worm}}: The altered pattern tears travel in is confined to the beam allowing Isaac to benefit from its stat bonus and spectral tears without losing accuracy.'], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}} / {{t|Super Ball}}: Tears will no longer be bound to the beam after bouncing off of something.'], ['{{i|Sinus Infection}}: Once the booger falls off the enemy, Isaac can loosely control it by moving and firing in different directions, and make it stick to another enemy.'], ['{{t|Wiggle Worm}}: The altered pattern tears travel in is confined to the beam allowing Isaac to benefit from its stat bonus without losing accuracy.', ['{{dlc|r}} Wiggle Worm also grants spectral tears with little downside in accuracy.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Analog Stick|nr}}: Tears cannot be fired diagonally; however, stat effects apply.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tractor Beam can be angled diagonally or in any direction using an analog stick or mouse controls.']], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Tears that are still hovering can be pushed in the direction Isaac is aiming by walking into them.'], ['{{T|Brain Worm}}: Overrides Brain Worm.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}} / {{i|The Ludovico Technique}} / {{i|Tech X}}: Overridden by Brimstone. Stat effects still apply.'], ['{{i|C Section}}: Overridden by C Section. Stat effects apply.'], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: After firing a bomb and moving, the bomb will have a homing-style effect towards the beam, but will not stay directly on the beam. '''Not recommended''', as changing directions while firing will cause the bomb to reel back to Isaac at high speed, making self-damage very likely."], ['{{i|Euthanasia}}: Needles fired will follow beam; however, burst needles will not.'], ['{{i|Evil Eye}}: Tears fired by the evil eyes will not follow the beam.'], ['{{i|Explosivo|ana+}}: Explosivo\'s tears will become "entangled" when sticking on an enemy, causing them to jump from the tractor beam to the enemy and vice versa every frame. The tear will explode only once regardless while attached to an enemy or bound to the beam.'], ['{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: Tears will only move forward while being fired, but control is otherwise overridden.'], ['{{i|Eye Sore}}: No effect on the extra tears.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Fired tears will travel along the beam; however, the burst tears will not.'], ['[[Homing tears]]: The tears will stay in the line but will slow down when near enemies.'], ['{{t|Hook Worm}}: Overridden, except for the range increase.', ['{{dlc|r}} The tears increase and spectral tears it now grants are also still in effect.']], ["{{i|Incubus|nr}}: The Incubus tears aren't affected by the beam, but the beam will still be there.", ["'''Incubus''' + '''Monstro's Lung''': Incubus's tear barrage will follow the beam."]], ['{{i|Lead Pencil}}: Tears fired will follow beam; however, tear barrage will not follow the beam.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Tears will only fire in cardinal directions.', ['{{dlc|r}}Tears fired will follow beam, otherwise, Marked works as normal.']], ['{{i|Multidimensional Baby}}: The beam only affects the original tears, not the duplicated ones.'], ['{{t|Ouroboros Worm}}: Tears will stall at points along their path; the normal spiral pattern is negated entirely, however.'], ['{{i|Saturnus}}: No effect on orbital tears.'], ['{{i|Spirit Sword}}: Overrides Tractor Beam. Stat effects still apply.'], ["{{i|Sprinkler|nr}}: Tears fired by the sprinkler will follow Isaac's beam."], ["{{i|Tammy's Head}}: Tractor Beam does not affect the tears created by Tammy's Head."], ['{{i|Technology|nr}}: Overridden by Technology.', ["{{dlc|r}} The beam becomes unaffected by Isaac's momentum."]], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The orbitting effect is overridden, but Isaac still gains the Range increase and spectral tears.']]

name: Multidimensional Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that will follow Isaac's movements on a 2.5-second delay. Tears that pass through the baby will be doubled and increase in speed.
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's path with a 2-second delay.", ['{{dlc|r}} The delay is 0.66 seconds instead.']], ['When a friendly tear passes through Multidimensional Baby, the tear splits into two parallel tears that gain a 1.33x shot speed boost, {{dlc|nr}} x1.5 range /{{dlc|r}} x1.5 [[tear height]] (which also increases effective range), and also a visual black and white flashing effect.']]
notes: [['It is possible to crash the game when combining this item with rapid-fire or multi-shot laser tears.'], ["Duplicated tears will deal the same damage as Isaac's tears."], ['If other familiars that move with a similar pattern such as {{i|Shade}} have been collected before the Baby, it will follow them instead with further delay.'], ['Standing perfectly still with the Multidimensional Baby inside of Isaac will activate its effect, as the tears will pass through it as they spawn.', ['This does not work with attacks such as Brimstone.']], ['{{dlc|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: If a brimstone laser is shot through the baby, it will double the laser.', ['{{C|Azazel}}\'s short-ranged Brimstone attack will also be "fired again" from the baby, increasing the range.']], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears that pass through Multidimensional Baby will duplicate and their split tears will duplicate. Half of the tears fired through Multidimensional Baby retain The Parasite's look and the other half have the flashing appearance."], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Haemolacria shots will be duplicated and more burst tears will spawn. Burst tears that pass through Multidimensional Baby will also be duplicated.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Papa Fly}}: Papa Fly will always shoot two shots due to both familiars having the same movement delay.'], ['{{i|Revelation}}: If a revelation laser is shot through the baby, it will double the laser.'], ["[[Shooting familiar]]s: Duplicates familiar's tears."], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: Tears fired by the sprinkler can be duplicated.'], ['{{i|Technology}}: When the laser passes through Multidimensional Baby, it doubles the laser.']]
interactions: [["{{t|???'s Soul}}/{{i|Abel}}/{{i|Cain's Other Eye}}: Familiar tears will be duplicated if they pass through the baby. However, due to their independent movement pattern, it can be hard to achieve duplication."], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Multidimensional Baby will travel the same path as the Anti-Gravity tears, easily doubling any stationary shots. Any moving tears that hit it will produce a normal moving copy, however stationary tears will spawn a copy that will eventually fall to the ground even after the direction is released.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Stationary duplicated tears will release normally.']], ["{{t|Baby-Bender}}: No effect as Multidimensional Baby only duplicates Isaac's tears."], ['{{i|BFFS!}}: The baby is larger, but tears shot through it will not do more damage.'], ['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Each copy of Multidimensional Baby follows the previous copy with a 2-second ({{Dlc|r}}0.66-second) delay.  Tears shot through multiple babies will only be duplicated once.'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}: Tears that pass through Multidimensional Baby will be duplicated and cosmetically look like normal tears. Bone shards will not duplicate unless they pass through Multidimensional Baby separately.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: No effect.'], ['{{I|Eye of the occult}}: Makes it more easy to use Multidimensional Baby, as Isaac can simply stand while the familiar stays on top of him.'], ["{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Duplicates tears, which tend to merge after traveling a certain distance, making it easier to feed tears. Burst tears can only be duplicated if the tear they come from didn't pass through the baby already."], ['{{i|Lil Brimstone}}/{{i|Robo-Baby 2.0}}: Familiar lasers that pass through the baby will not be duplicated.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Spawns another tear that will slowly follow Isaac but cannot be controlled.', ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns a stationary tear where Multidimensional Baby first appeared in the room. The tear does not follow Isaac.']], ["{{i|Mom's Bracelet}}: Throwing any obstacles through Multidimensional Baby will transform it into two 40 damage tears.
