Throwing obstacles that can drop pickups like mushrooms through Multidimensional Baby will cease the possibility of anything dropping from such tears. Crawl spaces, though, appear right after picking up an obstacle."], ["{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: No effect.", ['{{Dlc|r}}Fired knife is doubled when passing through Multidimensional Baby. No effect on held knife and returning knife.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: No effect.']]

name: Night Light
description: A cone of light shines in the direction Isaac is moving that [[slow]]s enemies and enemy shots.
effects: [["A cone of light shines from Isaac's chest that slows all enemies and enemy shots.", ['The light will face the direction Isaac is moving.', "The light doesn't affect [[boss]]es, but it will slow their shots.", 'The slow effect will disappear from enemies when the light stops shining on them, but shots will remain slow.']], ['Removes {{curse|darkness}} for the current floor.', ["Doesn't provide immunity on later floors, but lessens the visual effect significantly, effectively removing the curse."]]]
notes: [['The light only needs to touch a shot once to slow it permanently.', ['Doing a quick circular motion is effective to slow surrounding enemy shots, especially while fighting {{E|Hush}}.', 'Overuse of this effect can cause unavoidable patterns, as the slowed shots will often still travel most of their original distance.']], ["{{dlc|r}} This item is '''not recommended''' against {{E|The Beast|n}}, as the fires spawned by her will be slowed down significantly and pile up quickly, leading to no room to dodge."], ["{{dlc|r}} Doesn't remove Curse of Darkness afflicted by {{p|XIX - The Sun?}}, no matter if Night Light was picked up before or after using the card. However, the visual effect is still lessened by the beam of light."]]

name: Box of Friends
description: Duplicates all of Isaac's [[familiar]]s for the current room. If Isaac has no familiars, spawns a {{i|Demon Baby}} for the room instead.
notes: [["{{C|Lilith}} starts with this item by default, even if it hasn't been unlocked yet."], ['If Isaac has more than one copy of the same familiar, it will still only add one copy.'], ['Blue Flies, Blue Spiders, and orbitals ({{i|Halo of Flies}}, {{i|Leprosy}}, etc) are not copied.', ['{{dlc|r}} It now copies some orbitals.']], ['Many familiars can be spawned in [[Greed mode]] and {{R|Boss Rush}}, as completing waves charges the item.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Familiars with the [[Item Tags uniquefamiliar|uniquefamiliar]] item tag are ignored by Box of Friends. If Isaac has only unique familiars, a Demon Baby is spawned.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Lil Dumpy}}: Will copy Lil Dumpy, adding an extra charge to Lil Dumpy's {{i|Holy Mantle}}-like protection.", ['this process can be repeated to make Isaac near-invincible.']], ['{{i|Ball of Bandages}} / {{i|Cube of Meat}} / {{i|Potato Peeler}}: Upgrades the cube/ball for the current room. This can be used to easily unlock the [[Super Meat Boy]] and [[Bandage Girl]] achievements.', ['{{dlc|r}} Cubes of Meat from {{i|Potato Peeler|n}} cannot be duplicated or upgraded.']], ["{{i|Bob's Brain}}: When used upon entering a room, Box of Friends eliminates the item delay, which allows Isaac to launch Bob's Brain immediately."], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Adds two copies of each familiar.'], ['{{i|Charged Baby}}: All around useful, can charge box of friends mid room to spawn more of itself creating a charging loop.'], ['{{i|Daddy Longlegs}}: Familiar will be copied.'], ['{{i|Incubus}}: Creates additional Incubus familiars, which share the same tear modifiers as the player.'], ['{{i|Multidimensional Baby}}: Each copy of Multidimensional Baby follows the previous copy with a 2.5-second delay.'], ['{{i|Smart Fly}}: Very useful on Greed mode, as using it will add an attacking fly, killing enemies and bosses very quickly.'], ['{{I|Twisted Pair}}: Creates additional Twisted Pairs with the same tear modifiers as the player. Multiple twisted pairs will line up horizontally, covering a broader area.']]
interactions: [['{{i|1up!}} / {{i|Dead Cat}}: Familiars are multiplied but do not give Isaac additional lives.'], ['{{I|Abyss}}: Flies gained from Abyss do not count as familiars for Box of Friends, and are not copied.'], ['{{i|Best Bud}}: If used before taking damage, the white fly will circle Isaac. However, multiple white flies cannot be spawned, so using Box of Friends after taking damage or using it multiple times in a room creates no effect.'], ['{{i|Buddy in a Box}}: Creates another randomly generated familiar, rather than copying the same one.'], ["{{i|Bumbo}}: Will spawn a level 1 Bumbo regardless of the original Bumbo's current level."], ["{{i|Dead Bird}} / {{t|Eve's Bird Foot}} / {{t|Isaac's Head}} / {{t|???'s Soul}}: These familiars are not copied."], ["{{i|Guillotine}}: Duplicates the Head circling Isaac's body. Only one head will shoot tears.", ['Considers the second head as an extra copy, granting Isaac a temporary stat boost for the room']], ['{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Hallowed Ground}}: All poop familiars turn into white poop at the same time, and their effects are accumulative. A new poop familiar appears even if the previous poops have been used up.'], ["{{T|Isaac's Head}}: Not copied."], ["{{i|Isaac's Heart}} / [[Super Bum]]: Not copied. They will not spawn a {{i|Demon Baby}} if no other valid familiars are found, unlike other familiars that aren't copied."], ['{{i|Key Piece 1}} / {{i|Key Piece 2}}: Key pieces are multiplied, but do not complete the other half.', ['{{dlc|r}} Key pieces are not copied.']], ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Knife Piece 1|force=x}} / {{I|Knife Piece 2|force=x}}: Knife pieces and the knife are not copied.'], ['{{dlc|ab+}}{{i|Lil Spewer}}: Creates a random spewer rather than copying the current one.'], ["{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Milk!}}: The familiar itself doesn't appear, but instead, it decreases tear delay by 2 (effective tears up) when used, without needing to take damage.", ['{{dlc|r}}No extra tear delay is granted, neither before or after breaking.']], ['{{i|Monster Manual}}: Familiars spawned by Monster Manual are not copied. It will still spawn a {{i|Demon Baby}} if a familiar from Monster Manual is generated and there are no other valid familiars that can be duplicated.'], ['[[Pickup generation familiar]]s: The copied familiars will drop pickups independently.'], ['{{i|Quints}}: Existing Quints familiars will not be duplicated, nor more will be created. If Isaac has no other familiars, the generated Demon Baby will hover with the Quints instead of following Isaac.'], ['{{i|Shade}}: A new follower Shade spawns even if Isaac has already absorbed the original.'], ['{{i|Scissors}}: Not copied.'], ['{{P|XV - The Devil?}}: The Seraphim familiar is not copied.']]

name: D7
description: Restarts the current [[room]] and brings back all [[enemy|enemies]], allowing more rewards to be acquired by completing the room.
effects: [['Upon use, it restarts the room and respawns all enemies. [[Pickups]] or {{E|Chest}}s may be granted for clearing the room.']]
notes: [['Has no effect in [[Greed Mode]].'], ['Has no effect when used in a room that had no enemies, {{r|Challenge Room}}s, or {{r|Boss Challenge Room}}s.'], ['Will work in a {{r|Mini-Boss Room}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} When used in a {{r|Boss Room}}, {{r|Devil Room}}, or {{r|Angel Room}}, Isaac is teleported to another room on the floor, and the room he was in does not reset. The room Isaac teleports to will respawn enemies if it had them.', ['{{dlc|r}} D7 will not work when used in a {{r|Boss Room}}, {{r|Devil Room}} (it can be used to respawn [[Krampus]]), or {{r|Angel Room}}.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} When used in a {{r|Secret Room}} that previously contained {{E|Greed}} or {{E|Super Greed}}, the room becomes a regular Secret Room.', ['{{dlc|r}} No longer rerolls the room into a regular Secret Room; instead respawns Greed or Super Greed (depending on which one was present before).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} When used in a {{r|Shop}} that previously contained {{E|Greed}} or {{E|Super Greed}}, the Shop items will spawn. Rolling it again will cause new items to spawn on top of each other.', ['{{dlc|r}} No longer spawns a regular Shop; instead Greed or Super Greed respawns.']], ['When used in a room with a [[Champion]] enemy, the enemy will not respawn as a Champion.'], ['Can be used to generate infinite rewards with both {{i|9 Volt}} and {{t|AAA Battery}} and/or {{I|4.5 Volt}} depending on the enemies in the room.', ['If Isaac only has either {{i|9 Volt}} or {{t|AAA Battery}}, rewards can still be endlessly generated in a quadruple-sized room or an L-shaped room.']], ["Enemies respawn exactly where they first spawned, even if that's where Isaac is standing, in which case Isaac will take damage immediately upon use of the D7. Right next to doors is usually a safe place to use it."], ["{{Dlc|r}} If used in the [[Mirrored World]] of {{s|Downpour}} or {{s|Dross}} II, the rooms will not only have their enemies respawn, but all the normal non-mirrored contents such as pickups are restored. Using it in the Shop causes it to be stocked normally, and additional uses will restock the Shop's contents, unlike normal Shops."], ['{{Dlc|r}} As {{C|Tainted Keeper}}, enemies respawned by the D7 will drop the same type of coins as they had before using the D7. This can be used to quickly generate money from enemies that dropped high-value coins or greatly increase [[Luck]] if an enemy dropped a Lucky Penny.']]

name: Ventricle Razor
description: Can be used to place an orange portal and a blue portal. Upon entering a portal, Isaac is teleported to the other portal.
effects: [['When used for the first time, Isaac creates a blue portal under where he is standing. The next time he uses the item, he creates an orange portal under his feet. Isaac can then walk over either of the portals to teleport instantly to the location of the other one.'], ['Activating the item more than twice will replace the older of the two portals.'], ['The portals can be placed in any room. However, if a portal leads to a room with a negative grid index (i.e. {{R|Devil Room}}, {{R|Angel Room}}, {{R|I AM ERROR}} room, {{R|Crawl Space}}, {{R|Boss Rush}}, {{R|Black Market}}, {{E|Mega Satan}} room, or {{S|???}} portal room), Isaac will not be able to enter the portal.']]
notes: [['This item can be used to escape a {{R|Challenge Room}} or the {{R|Boss Rush}}.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Upon teleportation, Isaac is granted with a short invulnerability period which can be abused to trigger the {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} and {{M|Devil Beggar}} without losing health by placing a portal just next to it, teleporting, and touching the Donation Machine or Beggar in the same move. This trick is particularly useful for {{C|The Lost}}. The teleportation trick can also be used to escape a {{R|Curse Room}} without taking damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} This no longer works because the {{M|Blood Donation Machine}} and {{M|Devil Beggar}} take hearts without accounting for invincibility frames, however, a {{R|Curse Room}} can still be entered/exited for free.']], ['Portals will stay even if the item is dropped or changed.'], ['The item can prove useful in close quarters combat, allowing the player to attack one side, then dodge attacks and jump to the other side of the room to attack the enemies on that side.'], ['Upon entering a new floor, the previously placed portals will disappear.'], ['If {{cu|Maze}} is active, using portals placed between different rooms may result in a random destination. Two portals in the same room work reliably.', ["If room contents are randomized by the curse, it's possible for the portals to end up completely surrounded or even inside rocks or pits. If Isaac can't move to safety, the run can be quit and resumed to be placed at a door."]], ['{{Dlc|r}} On {{S|Downpour}} II, Ventricle Razor cannot be used to teleport between the normal and mirror world.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} This item can be useful to exit Mom's boss room to start the [[Ascent]], as long as you use it at least once before entering the boss room."], ['If this item is used while having the {{T|Broken Remote}} trinket Isaac will be teleported to a random room']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery|ana+}}: Renders the item conventionally useless, however; two portals on top of one another can create invincibility<ref>https://youtu.be/vRYclaFycH0</ref> at the cost of mobility and almost, but not all tears.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Ventricle Razor works normally.']]]

name: Cambion Conception
description: After taking damage a certain amount of times, a permanent demonic [[familiar]] spawns.
effects: [['Upon taking damage a certain number of times, Isaac gains a permanent demonic [[familiar]]. Possible familiars include:', ['{{i|Dark Bum}}', '{{i|Demon Baby}}', '{{i|Incubus}}', '{{i|Leech}}', '{{i|Lil Brimstone}}', '{{i|Succubus}}', '{{i|Lil Abaddon}}', '{{i|Twisted Pair}}']], ['The first and second familiars will each spawn after taking damage 15 times. The third and fourth familiars will each spawn after taking damage 30 more times. No further familiars will spawn. As a result, after taking damage 90 times, four out of eight possible familiars will have spawned.'], ['Isaac will look progressively more pregnant as he takes damage.']]
notes: [["{{C|Lilith}} starts with this item by default, even if it hasn't been unlocked. Lilith can get a second {{I|incubus}} through this."], ['Only one of each type of familiar can be spawned.'], ['Familiars that have yet to be unlocked can spawn,  {{dlc+|r}} with the exception of {{i|Lil Abaddon}} and {{i|Twisted Pair}}, which must be unlocked before they can spawn through Cambion Conception.'], ['Only actually getting damage counts towards the payout. For example, negating damage with the {{i|Holy Mantle}} will not count.'], ['Familiars spawned this way do not count towards [[transformation]]s nor the [[collection page]].'], ['Familiars spawned by the item do not affect item pools, so multiple copies of one familiar can be obtained. For example, a second Incubus can be purchased after Cambion Conception spawns one.'], ['If a familiar obtained is a copy of another one already obtained, using {{i|Box of Friends}} will only clone one of that familiar.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} If this item is removed with {{P|XVII - The Stars?}}, it will also remove any familiars already obtained through Cambion Conception.{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|Dull Razor}}: Dull Razor counts towards the payout despite not removing health to Isaac.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Caffeine Pill}}: Makes it impossible to tell how far along the pregnancy is.'], ['{{i|Cambion Conception}}: Having a second Cambion Conception allows the player to get the eight familiars, but cannot give an already obtained familiar.']]

name: Chaos
description: Drops 1-6 random [[pickups]] on the floor. Causes [[items]] to be chosen from random [[item pool]]s.
effects: [['Drops 1-6 random [[pickups]] around Isaac.'], ['Causes items to be chosen from random [[item pool]]s.', ["Fixed item drops that ignore the current room's item pool will not be replaced. Examples include {{i|Cube of Meat}} after defeating one of [[The Harbingers]] as a floor boss, or {{i|the Small Rock}} after breaking a [[Tinted Rock]]."]]]
notes: [["When playing [[Greed mode]], items that are available only in the normal game will still not appear despite Chaos; the modes' different item pools stay separate."], ['As the item does not mix or combine item pools, it is possible to deplete smaller item pools and end up with {{i|Breakfast}} before all items in the game have been taken.', ['Thus, if Chaos tries to pull from an item pool that is already depleted, it will not pull from a different pool and instead give Isaac Breakfast.', ['As many Greed Mode item pools are small, Chaos tends to result in Breakfast more often during Greed mode.']]], ["{{dlc|nr}} Chaos will draw items even from item pools that are not used in the game, but defined in the game's files. The unused pools are bossrush containing nearly all bomb related items, challenge with a smaller selection of bomb items and dungeon containing several Mom related items and food items."], ['{{dlc|nr}} Since all item pools have the same probability of being selected, bomb-related items are much more common due to the [[Bomb Bum (Item Pool)|Bomb Bum]], bossrush and challenge item pools.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Each pool has a weight based on the number of items in the pool. Items from large pools such as [[Treasure Room (Item Pool)|Treasure Room]], [[Shop (Item Pool)|Shop]], and [[Boss (Item Pool)|Boss]] are very likely, while items from small pools like [[Bomb Bum (Item Pool)|Bomb Bum]] and [[Planetarium (Item Pool)|Planetarium]] are more rare.'], ['If an item outside of the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room pool]] appears as a [[Devil Deal]], it will always cost 1 Red Heart Container (or 3 Soul Hearts should Isaac have no Red Hearts).', ['{{dlc|r}} If an item from the [[Angel Room (Item Pool)|Angel Room pool]] appears as a [[Devil Deal]], it will cost 2 Red Hearts if it would cost 30 cents in the Angel Shop generated by {{i|The Stairway}}, and 1 Red Heart if it would cost 15 cents in the Angel Shop.', ['Similarly, if an item from the [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room pool]] appears in an Angel Shop generated by {{i|The Stairway}}, it will cost 30 cents if it would cost 2 Red Hearts as a [[Devil Deal]], and 15 cents if it would cost 1 Red Heart as a [[Devil Deal]].']]], ["If an item that grants an {{E|Eternal Heart}} is taken in a devil deal, the eternal heart will ''not'' keep Isaac alive if he has no other hearts."], ['{{dlc|a+}} Bosses defeated in {{s|The Void}} drop items as if Chaos was active. Re-rolling the items uses the Boss Room pool as normal.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Sacrificial Altar}}: Ignores Chaos's effect and always picks items from the normal [[Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room pool]], even on Greed Mode."]]

name: Scatter Bombs
quote: We put bombs in your bombs!
description: Adds 5 {{E|bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs explode into 2-4 tiny bombs.
effects: [['Gives Isaac +5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Isaac's bombs split into 2-4 tiny bombs after exploding.", ['{{dlc|r}} Bombs split into 4-5 tiny bombs.', 'Tiny bombs deal half damage and have decreased blast radius.', "Tiny bombs retain Isaac's bomb synergies (with the exception of {{i|Mr. Mega}} {{dlc|nr}} and {{i|Bomber Boy}}'s increased blast radius).", '{{Dlc|r}} Tiny bombs explode immediately upon landing.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Anarchist Cookbook}}/{{i|Curse of the Tower}}: Not recommended. The extra bombs makes it very hard to avoid taking damage.'], ['{{i|Best Friend}}: The explosion creates mini decoys.'], ['{{t|Blasting Cap}}: Can cause more than one bomb pickup to spawn.'], ["{{i|Blood Bombs|r}}/{{I|Bob's Curse}}: Area-of-Effects from extra explosions have decreased size but deal the same damage."], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}/{{i|Doctor's Remote}}/{{I|Epic Fetus}}: Explosions are unaffected."], ['{{i|Brimstone Bombs}}/{{I|Sad Bombs}}: Lasers/tears from extra explosions deal 65% of their normal damage.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Butt Bombs}}: The room damage from extra explosions deal 6.5 damage instead of 10.'], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: No effect other than the +5 bombs.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Mr. Boom}}: Explosions are affected.'], ["{{i|Ghost Bombs}}: Extra explosions create ghosts that instantly launch themselves at enemies and explode, similar to {{i|Purgatory}}. They each deal 2x Isaac's damage, up to 4 times."], ['{{i|Glitter Bombs}}: Each additional explosion created has a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket.'], ['{{i|Hot Bombs}}: Extra explosions create additional fires.', ['{{dlc|r}}Fires from extra explosions start with 1 less durability.']], ['{{i|Nancy Bombs}}: Extra bombs will have the same bomb modifiers as the original.'], ['{{i|Rocket in a Jar}}: Rockets create extra bombs as normal when they explode.']]

name: Jar of Flies
description: Killing an enemy adds a fly to the jar, up to a maximum of 20. On use, releases [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] equal to the number of flies in the jar.
effects: [['Killing an enemy adds a fly to the jar, up to a maximum of 20.'], ['Upon use, releases [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] equal to the number of flies in the jar.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [["Kills by blue flies and locusts (including flies from the jar) and shooting familiars (including {{i|Incubus}} and the launch attack from {{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Lilith}}'s fetus) do not add flies to the jar."], ['Blue spiders, orbital familiars, and chasing familiars do add flies to the jar.'], ['Friendly enemies such as from the {{i|Friendly Ball}} add flies to the jar, but not those spawned from other enemies.'], ['Batteries do not affect the number of flies in the jar.'], ["Enemies must be actually ''killed'' to add a fly; transformations (such as {{E|Gaper}}s turning into {{E|Pacer}}s) or knockouts (such as incapacitating a {{E|Globin}}) do not count as kills."], ['Destroying a {{E|shopkeeper}} will count as a kill.'], ['With items that kill normally unkillable enemies, killing things like {{E|Stone Grimace}}s will add flies to the jar.'], ['Killing minions in the Hush fight does not add flies to the jar.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{T|Fish Tail}}: Doubles the number of flies that spawn.'], ['{{i|Hive Mind}}: Flies are bigger and deal double damage.'], ['{{i|Schoolbag}}: Flies will be gained even while the Jar of Flies is in the inactive slot.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{I|Uranus}}: Enemies frozen by Uranus do not grant extra flies, even if shattered. Only enemies killed with bombs will add flies.'], ['{{i|Void}}: Flies will not collect when absorbed by Void, making the interaction worthless.']]

name: PJs
description: Grants 4 {{E|Soul Heart}}s and fully restores Isaac's [[health]].
effects: [['Grants four {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['Heals 12 [[Hearts]].']]
interactions: [['{{C|Tainted Bethany}}: Grants 12 blood charges.']]

name: Lil Gurdy
description: A {{E|Gurdy Jr.}} [[familiar]] that charges up while Isaac is firing, bouncing around the room when released and dealing contact damage based on its speed.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that can be launched in the direction the player is firing after a short charge-up period.', ['{{dlc|nr}} At full charge, it initially deals 6 damage per tick or 90 damage per second, but quickly drops towards 0 the slower the familiar moves.', '{{dlc|r}} No longer deals damage per tick, instead deals a fix amount of damage depending on charge level, at lowest being ~5 and at max being ~20.']], ['It bounces off walls multiple times, much like {{E|Gurdy Jr.}}', ['{{dlc|r}} It will also bounce off enemies.']]]

name: Marked
description: Isaac will automatically fire tears directed at a red target on the ground. The target can be moved with tear controls. +0.7 [[tears]], {{dlc|nr}}+3.15 [[range]]/{{dlc|r}}+3.0 [[range]].
effects: [['Creates a controllable crosshair. Isaac automatically and continuously fires towards the crosshair.', ['{{dlc|r}} The crosshair will not appear in each room until Isaac fires. Pressing the "drop" key or button (Keyboard default: left Control key; Controller default: right trigger) will make the crosshair disappear and stop Isaac from firing tears until a firing key is pressed again.<ref>https://www.reddit.com/r/bindingofisaac/comments/mi3z0l/important_protip_that_could_save_your_run_from/</ref>']], ['+0.7 [[tears]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +3.15 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +3.0 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +0.3 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['{{Dlc|r}} All familiars will fire towards the crosshair.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If taken with {{C|Lilith}}, Marked gives the stat upgrades but not the mark.'], ['On PC, it is possible to control Marked with the mouse. On Windows, go to {{code|C:/Users/[username]/Documents/My Games/The Binding Of Isaac [Rebirth/Afterbirth/Afterbirth+/Repentance]/}} and in the options.ini file, change the line that says {{code|MouseControl{{=}}0}} to {{code|MouseControl{{=}}1}}.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If taken with {{C|Tainted Lilith}}, when the baby is launched, it permanently fires at the crosshair. Pressing the "drop" key or button (Keyboard default: left Control key; Controller default: right trigger) will make the crosshair disappear and cause the baby to return to Tainted Lilith']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Automatically charges and fires in the direction of the mark.'], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Charge and fire rate based on proximity to mark. Fully charges when farther away, charges less but fires faster when closer. Damage scales with the distance between Isaac and the crosshair.'], ['{{i|Camo Undies|a+nr}}: Isaac will stay camouflaged until the crosshair is moved.'], ['{{i|Cursed Eye}}: Greatly increases the firing rate without needing to charge. The teleporting effect of the eye gets removed.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Lil Brimstone}}: While firing, Lil Brimstone automatically charges and fires the beam immediately upon full charge, the beam will now target the crosshair.'], ['{{i|Maw of the Void|r}}: While firing, the ring charges automatically and activates immediately upon full charge.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife|r}}: Charge and fire rate based on proximity to mark. Fully charges when farther away, charges less but fires faster when closer."], ["{{dlc|r}} {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Automatically charges and fires in the direction of the mark."], ['{{i|Revelation}}: Light beams are charged and fired at the crosshair automatically.'], ['{{i|Rocket in a Jar}}: Bombs placed will blast at the crosshair, and cannot be placed normally until the crosshair disappears.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Tech X}}: Fires in the direction of the crosshair, with charging time proportionate to the distance of the crosshair from Isaac.'], ['{{i|Quints}}: The spawned familiars will aim at the crosshair.'], ['{{i|Pointy Rib}}: The rib familiar will aim at the crosshair.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: The tear hover effect is nullified, though the tear delay down is applied.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply.'], ["{{i|Dead Tooth}}: The green aura only activates when pressing the buttons to fire Isaac's tears."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Continuously fires bombs towards the marked spot.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Continuously fires missiles at the marked spot.'], ['{{i|Epiphora}}: Both items work as normal, with tear rate gradually increasing until Isaac turns his head, which can happen via him or the crosshair moving too out of parallel.'], ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Tears will always attempt to land on the crosshair, changing direction mid-air to do so.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Familiar]]s: Shooting Familiars do not fire towards the mark, they fire as they normally would without the item.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Gnawed Leaf}}: Tears will stop auto-firing once the player is invulnerable.', ['{{dlc|r}} Auto-firing dont stop and it prevents Gnawed Leaf from activating.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Lil Brimstone}}: Lil Brimstone only charges while moving the mark.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply."], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply."], ['{{I|Mr. ME!}}: The Mr. ME! crosshair will move constantly in the direction of the Marked crosshair relative to Isaac. It will not attempt to match with where Marked is aiming, making it difficult to control. Pressing the drop button will stop the Mr. ME! crosshair.'], ["{{i|My Little Unicorn}}/{{i|Unicorn Stump}}: Isaac's tears will still fire, but he will be unable to move the crosshair while invincible."], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires in the direction of the crosshair']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology 2}}: Laser only fires while the crosshair is moving, and only in cardinal directions.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Continuously fires in the direction of the crosshair.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Marked, but stat bonuses still apply.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Tractor Beam}}: Tears are fired automatically but only in cardinal directions.', ["{{dlc|r}} The beam is aimed at Marked's crosshair. Moving the crosshair rotates the entire beam along with any tears inside it."]], ["{{I|Tiny Planet}}: The tears' center of orbit can be slightly modified using the crosshair."]]

name: Holy Light
description: Adds a chance to fire holy tears, which will create a damaging light beam in the area if they hit an enemy.
effects: [['Isaac has a chance to fire a glowing blue tear that, after colliding with an enemy, spawns a damaging beam of light (similar to {{i|Crack the Sky}}).', ["{{Dlc|nr}}Each beam of light deals quadruple (4x) Isaac's tear damage.", "{{Dlc|r}}Each beam of light deals triple (3x) Isaac's tear damage.", 'A single beam of light can damage multiple enemies.']], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{transf|Seraphim|item}}']]
notes: [['The chance to fire a holy tear (activation rate) depends on the [[Luck]] stat.', ['The activation rate is equal to 1/(11 - Luck).<ref>https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing</ref>', ['At base luck (0), the activation rate is 10%.', 'At 9 luck, the activation rate maximizes at 50%.']]], ["Its damage is multiplied from the tear's damage, not directly from Isaac's [[Damage]].", ["This means that, if the tears's damage has been multiplied from effects such as {{I|Proptosis}} or {{I|Tough Love}}, the beam's damage is also multiplied."]]]
synergies: [['{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Holy Light it turns into a glowing cyan locust. Every tick of damage it deals has a chance to call down a beam of light dealing triple Isaac’s damage.'], ["{{I|Compound Fracture}} / {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}}: Holy Light tears will have split tears with Holy Light effect; normal tears will not have split tears with Holy Light effect."], ['{{I|Lachryphagy}}: If Holy Light tears feed normal tears, fed normal tears will not gain Holy Light effect; however if normal tears feed Holy Light tears, it will just increase the size of fed Holy Light tears.'], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: The controlled tear will sometimes glow and trigger the beam.'], ['{{I|c section}}: Glowing shots will rapidly strike light beams on contact, making short work of most enemies.']]
interactions: [['Following items can trigger Holy Light effect:', ['{{I|Eye of Greed}}', "{{I|Fate's Reward}}", '{{T|Found Soul}}', '{{I|Gello}}', '{{I|Host Hat}}', '{{I|Incubus}}', '{{I|Kidney Stone}}', '{{I|Lead Pencil}}', '{{I|Metal Plate}}', '{{I|Sad Bombs}}', '{{I|Saturnus}}', "{{I|Tammy's Head}}", '{{I|Twisted Pair}}', '{{I|Varicose Veins}}']], ['Following items do not trigger Holy Light effect:', ['{{I|Akeldama}}', '{{I|Athame}}', '{{I|Brimstone Bombs}}', '{{I|Circle of Protection}}', '{{I|Divine Intervention}}', '{{I|It Hurts}}', '{{I|Large Zit}}', '{{I|Maw of the Void}}', "{{I|Montezuma's Revenge}}", '{{I|Revelation}}', '{{I|Shard of Glass}}', '{{I|Slipped Rib}}', '{{I|Vasculitis}}']], ['{{I|20/20}} / {{C|Keeper}} and other multi-shot effects: Each shot can have Holy Light effect separately.'], ['{{I|Brimstone}} / {{C|Azazel}} / {{C|Tainted Azazel}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The Brimstone shot can create beams of light.']], ['{{I|Dr. Fetus}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The bombs created by Dr. Fetus can create beams of light upon exploding for each enemy hit by the explosion, although there is no visual indication that this will happen. The beams deals a flat 10.5 damage.']], ['{{I|Epic Fetus}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The rockets created by Epic Fetus can create beams of light upon exploding for each enemy hit by the explosion, although there is no visual indication that this will happen. The beams deals a flat 10.5 damage.']], ["{{I|Euthanasia}}: Having Holy Light effect on a tear does not affect the burst tears from it. They can have Holy Light effect applied depending on Isaac's Luck."], ['{{I|Explosivo}}:', ['{{Dlc|r}}Explosivo tears can have the Holy Light effect applied to them. These tears spawn beams of light upon exploding for each enemy hit by the explosion. The beams deal a flat 10.5 damage.']], ['{{C|The Forgotten}}: The melee and ranged attack can create beams of light.'], ['{{I|Haemolacria}}: Occasionally fires Haemolacria tears with Holy Light effect. Only the main tear will contain the effect and not the burst tears.', ['{{Dlc+|r}} If the main tear has the effect, burst tears also gain the effect.']], ['Holy Light: Additional copy of this item through {{I|Diplopia}} or {{I|Crooked Penny}} etc. has no effect.', ['{{Dlc+|r}} Additional copy of this item is counted for [[Seraphim (Transformation)|Seraphim]] set.']], ["{{I|Ipecac}}: If the explosives don't kill enemies instantly, explosives with Holy Light will spawn a light beam after the explosion is over.", ['{{Dlc|r}} A beam of light with a tripled damage spawn on top of the closest enemy from the explosion, and beams with a flat 10.5 damage spawn for each enemy hit by the explosion']], ["{{I|Mom's Knife}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.", ['{{Dlc|a+}} Holy Light can trigger on both held and thrown knives.']], ['{{I|Mucormycosis}}: The spores with Holy Light effect do not spawn beams of light, including the one from Isaac.'], ['{{I|Multidimensional Baby}}: Duplicated tears have Holy Light effect if the tear they originated had it.'], ['{{I|Sinus Infection}}: The boogers with Holy Light effect do not spawn beams of light.'], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}}: Hitting an enemy with Spirit Sword has a chance to spawn a damaging beam of light.'], ["{{I|Tear Detonator}}: Having Holy Light effect on a tear does not affect the burst tears from it. They can have Holy Light effect applied depending on Isaac's Luck."], ['{{T|Teardrop Charm}}: Activation rate is affected.'], ['{{I|Technology}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The lasers can create beams of light.']], ['{{I|Technology Zero}}: Electricity connecting tears with Holy Light tears will not gain Holy Light effect.'], ['{{I|Technology 2}}: Tears will occasionally have Holy Light effect.', ['{{Dlc+|r}} The lasers can create beams of light.']], ['{{I|Tech X}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The lasers can create beams of light.']], ['{{I|Trisagion}}: {{Dlc|nr}}Overrides Holy Light.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Blasts can apply Holy Light, with a light beam being generated on each damage tick, dealing Isaac's tear damage per beam (three times Trisagion's damage)."]]]

name: Placebo
description: When used, copies the effect of the [[pill]] Isaac is currently holding without consuming it. Does not copy the effects of [[Cards and Runes|cards or runes]].
effects: [["Mimics the effect of Isaac's held [[pill]], like {{i|Blank Card}} does with [[Cards and Runes#Cards|cards]] and {{i|Clear Rune}} does with [[Cards and Runes#Runes|runes]].", ["Does not consume Isaac's held pill.", 'Does not mimic cards or runes.']], ['Will identify unknown pills when used.']]
synergies: [['[[Pills#Pill Effects|48 Hour Energy]]:', ["{{dlc|nr}} Can spawn an unlimited number of {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}}, allowing unlimited use of another activated item or pill.", "{{dlc|r}} One battery is guaranteed to be a {{E|Lil' Battery}}, any additional batteries spawn as {{E|Micro Battery|display=Micro Batteries}}. The item does not recharge upon use."]], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Pills#Pill Effects|Balls of Steel]] + {{i|Sharp Plug}}: The player can gain functional invincibility.', ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|The Wafer}}: Allows for Virtually infinite health.']], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{T|butter!|force=r}}: Because Placebo is dropped upon usage, the recharge time is reset to 4, allowing to use more expensive pills much more frequently.'], ['{{dlc|r}} [[Pills#Pill Effects|Vurp]]: Allows pills that normally take 12 rooms for Placebo to charge to be used twice as frequently.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Starter Deck}}: All pills are replaced by cards, rendering Placebo useless.'], ["If used with {{c|Bethany}} or {{c|Tainted Bethany}}, using a pill that has a larger charge requirement than Placebo's current will still consume soul or blood charges equal to the difference (likely a bug)."]]

name: Car Battery
description: Causes Isaac's activated item to activate twice on each use.
notes: [['Having more than one Car Battery has no effect.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Broken Shovel 1}}: Prevents the Mom's Foot from appearing for two rooms (empty or not), or for two waves of a {{R|Challenge Room}} or the {{R|Boss Rush}}, essentially removing the stomping attacks for the entire duration of the Boss Rush"], ['{{i|Crooked Penny|force = a+nr}}: Splits the 50% chance to succeed into a 25% chance to quadruple all items and a 25% chance to duplicate all items while consuming the originals; the latter will make Devil deal and Shop items free.', ['{{dlc|r}} The 25% chance to duplicate all items while consuming the originals now generates 2 pennies instead.']], ['{{i|Sulfur}}: Will count as giving double Brimstone, giving extra damage and a x1.2 damage multiplier for the current room.'], ['{{i|Void}}: Doubles effects of all absorbed activated items. Absorbing passives will not give extra stat ups.'], ['{{i|Wooden Nickel}}: 25% chance to spawn nothing, 50% chance to spawn one coin, and 25% chance to spawn two coins.']]
interactions: [["{{I|Berserk!}}: Will only increase rage duration if no enemies are killed in the first half, effectively only affecting bosses that can't spawn enemies."], ['{{I|Book of Virtues}}: Doubles the spawned wisps on activation.'], ['{{i|Book of Secrets}}: Activates twice, {{dlc|nr}} but has a chance to uselessly activate the same effect twice.'], ['{{i|Book of Shadows}}/{{I|The Gamekid}}/{{I|My Little Unicorn}}/{{i|Unicorn Stump}}: Doubles the length of invincibility, but no effect on damage where applicable.'], ['{{i|Clicker}}: If the Car Battery is removed by the first activation, a second activation will not happen. Two activations in a row is mostly detrimental, removing two items and possibly cycling through a character that lowers health.'], ['{{I|Spindown Dice}}: Lowers ID by 2, good for some items, bad for others.'], ['{{i|Dark Arts}}: Doubles the duration, giving more time to walk through more enemies, if you end the effect before the end of the first second, the item will reactivate itself; allowing to target the same enemies twice.'], ["{{i|D4}}/{{i|D100}}: Instantly re-rolls Isaac's items twice, which doubles the speed at which the item pools are exhausted and transformations are achieved.", ["{{dlc|r}} As items are returned back into the item pool when re-rolled, the item pools aren't exhausted at all. In addition, you need to actively be holding a transformation's respective items to retain them now, so using the double re-roll to gain multiple transformations is no longer possible."]], ['{{i|The D6}}/{{i|D8}}/{{i|D12}}/{{i|D20}}: Re-rolls twice instantly without any benefits. {{Dlc|nr}} The D6 depletes item pools at double the speed.'], ['{{i|D7}}: Doubles the amount of enemies summoned, but does not give double rewards.'], ['{{i|Dead Sea Scrolls}}: Activates 2 random effects.'], ['{{i|D Infinity|a+nr}}: Activates 2 dice. The second activation die cannot be predicted.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Activates 2 dice. The second activation die is determined by the seed and never changes.']], ['{{i|Dull Razor}}: The invulnerability time is not increased, but damage-triggered items will activate twice if applicable.'], ['{{i|Eternal D6}}: Re-rolls twice like The D6 (see above), but the 30% chance of the item disappearing is increased to 51%.'], ['{{I|Everything Jar}}: Instead of doubling its effect, Everything Jar will spawn a poop alongside its normal drop.'], ["{{i|Head of Krampus}}: Doubles the damage the brimstone beams deal (for a total of {{Dlc|nr}}880 damage/ {{Dlc|r}}380 damage per use). Doesn't double the brimstone beams' duration."], ['{{i|The Hourglass}}: Doubles the length of the effect.'], ['{{i|Mega Mush}}: Makes the effect twice as long.'], ['{{i|Mine Crafter|ana+}}: Spawns a Movable TNT and instantly detonates it, damaging Isaac.', ['{{dlc|a+}} This has been changed to spawn two Movable TNT barrels instead, which you can detonate at will.']], ['{{i|Moving Box}}: Activation swaps the contents of the box with the contents of the room.', ['{{dlc|r}} This has been changed to have have no effects.']], ['{{i|Spider Butt}}: Deals 10 damage to enemies twice but does not increase slow effect.'], ['{{i|Stitches}}: Swaps places with Isaac twice in quick succession, rendering Stitches useless for collecting pickups & items beyond pits, rocks etc.', ['However, it can still be used to telefrag enemies.']], ['{{i|The Bean}}/{{I|Mega Bean}}/{{I|Kidney Bean}}: Deals double damage, but charms/poisons/petrifies for the same amount of time.'], ['{{i|Tear Detonator}}: Multiplies detonated tears, resulting in 6x more tears than normal.'], ['{{I|Telekinesis}} doubles the duration of the effect, with 6 sec. of use and 6 sec. of charge time'], ['{{I|The Scooper}}: Will summon 2 peepers in a bifurcated direction'], ['{{i|Ventricle Razor}}: Places both trapdoors in same location.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Ventricle Razor works normally.']]]

name: Charged Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that occasionally drops a {{E|Lil' Battery}}, gives an active item charge, or [[Status Effects#Petrification|petrifies]] all enemies in the room.
effects: [['Spawns a battery [[familiar]] that, while the player is in an uncleared room, every 30 seconds, starting from the moment it has been picked up, does one of the following:', ["Spawns a {{E|Lil' Battery}}. It does this a maximum of 2 times per [[Rooms|room]].", ['{{dlc|r}} Can also spawn a {{E|Micro Battery|n}} or {{E|Mega Battery|n}} instead.'], "Adds a charge to Isaac's [[Items#Activated Collectibles|activated item]]. It does this a maximum of 2 times per [[Rooms|room]].", '[[Status Effects#Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies for 1.3 seconds.']]]
notes: [["Charged Baby becomes very powerful as {{C|Lilith}} in [[Greed mode]], as the duplicates will continue to spawn Lil' Batteries, leading to a huge chain of familiars."]]
synergies: [["{{i|BFFS!}}: Familiar is bigger and drops Lil' Batteries more often. No effect on its other abilities."]]

name: 8 Inch Nails
description: +1.5 [[damage]]. Replaces Isaac's tears with nails, which have increased [[knockback]].
effects: [['+1.5 [[damage]].'], ["Isaac's tears are replaced with nails, which have increased [[knockback]]."]]
notes: [["Does not grant penetrative shots, despite the appearance of Isaac's tears."], ["Any item that normally colors Isaac's tears red will cause the nails to become bloody."]]
synergies: [['{{t|Blister}}: The knockback from Blister is stronger than from 8 Inch Nails, and knockback boosts do not stack.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: The beam gains knockback.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}} / {{i|Ipecac}}: Explosions also gain increased knockback.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The controlled tear gains knockback.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The knife gains knockback."], ['[[Piercing tears]]: Allows tears to knock enemies back again.'], ['{{i|Tech.5}} / {{i|Tech X}} / {{i|Technology}} / {{i|Technology 2}}: The lasers gain knockback. Especially powerful with Tech X, as the knockback helps keeps enemies within the ring for longer.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: The blasts gain knockback.']]

name: Pay to Play
description: {{dlc|nr}} +5 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}. Most doors require one {{e|Penny}} to open instead of a {{e|Key}}.</br>{{dlc|r}} +5 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}. All locked doors, {{E|Locked chest}}s, and [[Key Block]]s must be opened with one {{e|Penny}} instead of {{e|Key}}s.
effects: [['+5 [[coins]].'], ['{{r|Shop}}s, {{r|Treasure Room}}s, and {{r|Libraries}} must be opened with a {{e|Penny}} instead of a {{e|Key}}. {{dlc|nr}}These doors appear identical to {{r|Arcade}} doors.'], ['{{dlc|r}} All locked doors, {{E|Locked chest}}s, and [[Key Block]]s must be opened with a {{e|Penny}} instead of {{e|Key}}s, including those that require 2 keys to open.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} Locked doors, chests, and key blocks gain a unique visual where their key slot is replaced with a vertical coin slot.']]
interactions: [["{{t|Mom's Locket}}: Renders Mom's Locket less effective as the trinket requires a key is consumed by the lock in order to heal Isaac."], ['{{i|Sharp Key}}: Thrown keys cannot unlock doors that originally were accessible by keys, but can still open chests and open secret room doors.'], ['{{t|Store Key}}: Overridden by Pay to Play. Stores still require coins to unlock.']]

name: Eden's Blessing
quote: Tears up + your future shines brighter
description: +0.7 [[tears]] up. Grants a random [[item]] at the start of the next run.
effects: [['+0.7 [[tears]] up.'], ['Grants a random [[item]] at the start of the next run.', ["{{i|Key Piece 1}}, {{i|Key Piece 2}}, {{i|Broken Shovel 1}}, {{i|Broken Shovel 2}}, {{i|Mom's Shovel}}, {{i|Knife Piece 1}}, {{i|Knife Piece 2}}, and {{I|Dogma}} cannot be granted."]]]
notes: [['The effect still occurs whether the run was successful or not, even if the run was restarted.'], ["The effect does not work if Eden's Blessing was obtained on a [[seed]]ed run, during a [[Victory Lap]], a [[RERUN]], or during a [[challenge]].", ["Likewise, Eden's Blessing will not grant a free item at the start of a challenge or RERUN, instead granting the free item on the next valid run started.", ["Interestingly, seeded runs will still gain the benefit of banked Eden's Blessings, without depleting them. This means that it is possible to play an infinite amount of seeded runs, and they all start with a free item until a normal run is started."]]], ["Even if Eden's Blessing is re-rolled, such as with the {{i|D4}} or {{i|D100}}, a random item will still be granted at the start of the next run.", ["If Eden's Blessing is then regained through {{i|Glowing Hour Glass}}, only one extra item will be given.", "Absorbing Eden's Blessing with {{i|Void}} will not grant an extra item in the next run."]], ["Eden's Blessing can choose itself as the free item you gain, but will not give you an item on your next run."], ["If more than one Eden's Blessing is acquired in a single run, that quantity of random items will be granted at the start of the next run, although it's capped at ten items.", ['It is possible to obtain multiple copies of an item at once this way.']], ["If Eden's Blessing effect is obtained through {{i|Metronome}}, no extra item will be given."], ['If gained from {{I|Lemegeton}}, it will not grant an item next run.'], ["Taking Eden's Blessing and then starting a run as {{dlc|r}}{{c|Jacob and Esau}} will only give item(s) to Jacob."], ['{{dlc|r}} As {{c|Tainted Lazarus}}, the item will be given to his alive form.', ["If {{c|Tainted Lazarus}} somehow acquires the item before flipping for the first time of the run, Eden's Blessing will be consumed upon flip and a random item will be granted to {{C|Dead Tainted Lazarus}}."]], ["Using {{I|R Key}} or {{i|Genesis}} will not consume Eden's Blessing."], ["{{p|XVII - The Stars?}} can't remove the item(s) given by Eden's Blessing and using it will consume the first item(s) acquired after them or do nothing if there are no other items."], ["{{p|XVII - The Stars?}} can remove Eden's blessing and the item will be granted in the next game."]]

name: Farting Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and blocks enemy shots. If a shot hits Farting Baby, it has a chance to fart, which [[Status Effects#Charm|charms]], [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]], or [[Hidden Attributes#Knockback|knocks back]] nearby enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac around and blocks enemy projectiles. Upon blocking a shot, it has a 10% chance of farting. There are three possible fart effects:', ['[[Charm]]s all nearby enemies.', '[[Poison]]s all nearby enemies.', '[[Knockback|Knocks back]] nearby enemies.']], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['Farting Baby does no contact damage.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The knockback fart deals no damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} The knockback fart deals 6 damage.']], ['The charm fart deals 5 damage.'], ['The poison fart initially deals 5 damage and the poison deals 3.5.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect on damage or blocking radius; only the visual size is changed.']]

name: Serpent's Kiss
description: Tears have a chance to apply a [[poison]] effect to enemies. Isaac poisons enemies on contact. Poisoned enemies have a chance to drop a {{E|black heart}} when killed.
effects: [["Grants a 15% chance to fire [[poison|poison tears]], each tick dealing damage equal to Isaac's.", ['Poison from the shots will tick 2 times.']], ['Inflicts [[poison]] on enemies who make contact with Isaac.', ['Contact poison will tick 6 times.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop {{E|black heart}}s.', ['Enemies can still drop black hearts after the poison has worn off.', '{{dlc|r}} Only enemies that were inflicted with contact poison drop black hearts.']]]
notes: [['Not affected by [[luck]].'], ['Enemies and bosses with multiple segments, such as Chub and Larry Jr., have a chance to drop multiple Black Hearts.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Although {{E|Stoney|display=Stonies}} and {{E|Shopkeeper}}s can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched."], ['If a boss would have been poisoned, but negates it with status immunity, they can still drop a black heart.']]
synergies: [['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Dr. Fetus}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Bombs and missiles may become poisonous, and enemies hit by them may drop black hearts.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bombs no longer grant black hearts but poison bombs leave a poison cloud similar to {{i|Bob's Curse}}."]], ["{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Enemies poisoned by the knife may drop black hearts."], ['{{i|Mars}}: Dashing into enemies will often both kill enemies, and cause them to drop black hearts.'], ['{{c|Tainted Forgotten}}: Especially strong as you are likely to apply contact poison when attacking enemies, giving you black hearts frequently.'], ['[[Gnawed Leaf]]: Standing still allows for safe kills and possibly spawn infinite black hearts.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Godhead}}: The Godhead aura cannot inflict poison but the tears themselves may poison enemies on contact.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} The following interactions are trivial in Repentance:', ['{{i|Athame}} / {{i|Maw of the Void}}: The black rings may poison enemies but do not generate black hearts.', '{{i|Brimstone}}: The blood barrage may poison enemies but does not generate black hearts.', '{{i|Tech.5}} / {{i|Tech X}} / {{i|Technology}} / {{i|Technology 2}}: The lasers may poison enemies but do not generate black hearts.', '{{i|Trisagion}}: May poison enemies but does not generate black hearts.']]]

name: Spear of Destiny
description: In addition to tears, Isaac holds a spear in front of him which deals contact damage equal to 2x his [[Damage|tear damage]], and occasionally inflicts [[fear]].
notes: [['Spear of Destiny does not replace tears.'], ["The item is similar to {{I|Mom's Knife}}, although it cannot be fired."], ["{{dlc|nr}} Despite its size, the spear's hitbox is only located on the silver part and the handle, making it only effective at very close range."], ['{{dlc|nr}} The spear can kill permanently charmed enemies.']]
synergies: [['{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Proptosis}}: Triples the damage. Has no penalty with range.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect on size or damage.'], ['{{I|Sacrificial Altar}}: No effect.']]

name: Host Hat
description: A host familiar that sits on Isaac's head and has a random chance to block enemy shots and retaliate with 3 tears. Grants immunity to explosions.
effects: [["Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a 25% chance to be blocked. When a projectile is effectively blocked, Host Hat fires 3 bullets similar to the {{E|Host}}'s.", ["Bullets fired from Host Hat use Isaac's [[Damage]] and [[Range]], and copy Isaac's [[Tear effects]].", ["The bullets do not use Isaac's [[Shot Speed]]."], 'Can block:', ['Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), but their lines of fire harm Isaac.', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', 'Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.'], 'Does not block:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}).', 'Lasers or beams.', 'Lines of fire from fireballs.', 'Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.']]], ['Grants immunity to explosions.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Grants immunity to bullets falling from above.']]
notes: [['Does not protect against exploding [[Rocks#Mushrooms|mushrooms]].'], ["{{Dlc|nr}} Isaac becomes immune to {{E|Mom}} and {{E|Satan}}'s stomp attacks, as they are considered explosions. This makes the item very valuable if trying to unlock {{C|The Forgotten}}, as it will protect Isaac from the effects of the {{I|Broken Shovel 1}}."], ["{{dlc|a+}} This item is invaluable in [[Greedier Mode]] as nearly all of {{E|Ultra Greedier|n}}'s attacks are considered explosions."], ['One of only two items that grant full immunity to explosive damage, the other being {{I|Pyromaniac}}.'], ['Although Host Hat has firing animation that expose itself after it blocks a tear, it can still block tears in this state, firing bullets as much it blocks.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Dr. Fetus}} / {{I|Ipecac}}: Isaac becomes immune to his explosives.'], ['{{I|Epic Fetus}}: Isaac becomes immune to his own airstrikes.']]
interactions: [["The following items that change the property of Isaac's tears affect Host Hat's bullets:", ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}', '{{I|Haemolacria}}', '{{I|Ipecac}}', '{{I|Lachryphagy}}', '{{I|My Reflection}}', '{{I|Pop!}}', '{{I|Tiny Planet}}', '{{I|Trisagion}}']], ["The following items that modify Isaac's tears do not affect Host Hat's bullets, aside from stat changes (if present):", ['{{I|Brimstone}}', '{{I|Chocolate Milk}}', '{{I|C Section}}', '{{I|Cursed Eye}}', '{{I|Dr. Fetus}}', '{{I|Epic Fetus}}', '{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}', "{{I|Mom's Knife}}", "{{I|Monstro's Lung}}", '{{I|Neptunus}}', '{{I|Spirit Sword}}', '{{I|Technology}}', '{{I|Tech X}}']], ["{{I|20/20}} / {{C|Keeper}} and other multi-shot effects: Do not add Host Hat's bullets."], ["{{I|Anti-Gravity}} / {{I|Tractor Beam}}: Does not affect Host Hat's bullets, aside from stat changes."], ["{{I|Cone Head}}: Cone Head's chace of blocking effect is applied first. Tears blocked by Cone Head do not cause Host Hat to fire.", ['This leaves Isaac 36% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["{{I|Dead Eye}}: Host Hat's bullets grant the damage multiplier, but do not reset it even when they miss."], ["{{I|Eye of Greed}} / {{I|Lead Pencil}}: Host Hat's bullets are not counted for shots fired."], ['{{I|Gnawed Leaf}}: Tears can be reflected while Isaac is invulnerable.'], ["{{I|Hallowed Ground}}: Host Hat's chance of blocking effect is applied first.", ['This leaves Isaac 60% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["'''Host Hat''': Additional copies of this item, such as from {{I|Diplopia}} / {{I|Crooked Penny}}, have no effect."], ["{{I|Infamy}}: Infamy's chance of blocking effect is applied first. Tears blocked by Infamy do not cause Host Hat to fire.", ['This leaves Isaac 60% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["{{I|Isaac's Heart}}: Tears can be reflected when hitting the heart, not Isaac."], ["{{P|Holy Card}} / {{i|Holy Mantle}}: Host Hat's chance of blocking projectiles is applied before the shield, allowing it to be saved."], ["{{I|Metal Plate}}: Host Hat's chace of reflecting effect is applied first. Tears blocked by Host Hat are not reflected by Metal Plate.", ['This leaves Isaac 40% chance to negate tears in any way.']]]

name: Bursting Sack
description: [[Spider]] enemies no longer target or deal contact damage to Isaac.
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} If either one of {{C|Jacob and Esau}} holds Bursting Sack, both gain the benefits.']]

name: Maw of the Void
description: Charged by firing for 2.5 seconds and when released, creates a black ring around Isaac that rapidly deals damage. {{dlc|nr}} +1 [[damage]], the ring can cause enemies to drop {{E|Black Heart}}s.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +1.0 [[damage]].'], ['After firing tears for 2.35 seconds, releasing the fire button unleashes a black {{i|Brimstone}} ring around Isaac that expands and contracts, dealing damage at a rapid rate to all enemies touching it.', ["The charge is completed when a red upside-down cross appears on Isaac's forehead.", '{{dlc|a+}} With charge bars enabled, there is also an indicator that displays the charge.', "The black ring deals damage equal to Isaac's current damage per tick, and ticks a total of 30 times. It lasts ~1.97 seconds (118 frames).", '{{dlc|nr}} Enemies killed by the black ring have a 5% chance to drop {{E|Black Heart}}s.', ['Black Hearts will drop as soon as the enemy is killed. (In other words, the heart will drop at the beginning of the death animation rather than at the end of the death animation.)']]], ['{{transf|Leviathan|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This item does not work while playing a [[blindfolded]] character, as it requires tears to charge.', ['This restriction can, however, be bypassed by picking up {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}.', "This item's effect will not fully activate if picked up by {{c|Lilith}}; its stat ups will still apply to her {{i|Incubus}} familiar, but the ring will not appear unless she also has the Ludovico Technique."]], ['{{dlc|r}} This item will still work while playing as a [[blindfolded]] character.'], ['The ring will apply any tear status effects such as [[poison]] if Isaac has them.'], ['This item can begin to be recharged again immediately after activating it, effectively cutting its charge time in half in situations where it may be needed again quickly.']]
synergies: [['{{transf|Guppy}}: Damaging enemies with Maw of the Void allows flies to spawn from the Guppy transformation. Flies are spawned at a rate of approximately one fly per tick of damage for each enemy it hits. This causes a lot of flies to spawn very quickly. The spawned flies will also move to attack the nearest enemy immediately.'], ['{{i|Hemoptysis}}: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the black ring deals to 2x and +3 flat damage. Enemies who die to the black ring under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.'], ['[[Homing tears]]: The ring curves towards enemies.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Massively increases ring damage and poisons enemies.', ['{{dlc|r}} The ring also explodes on enemy or obstacle contact.']], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder|r}}: The ring sends out electric currents when it hits something."], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Ring can destroy projectiles.'], ['{{I|Mysterious Liquid}}: Occasionally spawns a pool of creep where the ring makes contact with an enemy.'], ['{{I|Pisces}}/{{I|8 Inch Nails}}: Ring obtains knockback effect.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Proptosis}}: The ring is much larger and deals 1.5x damage per tick.', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} The ring is larger but deals normal damage.', '{{dlc|r}} No effect.']], ['{{i|Strange Attractor}}: Ring attracts pickups and enemies towards it.'], ['{{t|Wiggle Worm}}: The ring has wavy edges.']]
interactions: [['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear must be moved before the ring activates.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The ring damage is halved.', ['{{dlc|a+}} The ring deals normal damage.']], ['{{i|Marked}}: {{dlc|nr}} Crosshair must be moved for 4 seconds before the ring activates.', ['{{dlc|r}} While firing, the ring charges automatically and activates immediately upon full charge.']], ['{{i|Soy Milk}}: No effect on charge time but massively reduces damage.']]

name: Bomber Boy
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs will now explode in a large cross-shaped pattern (roughly 5 bombs explosions wide). This also affects player-spawned {{E|Troll Bomb}}s.
effects: [['Grants 5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ['Causes bombs to explode in a large cross-shaped blast by adding two additional explosions in each cardinal direction.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The damage for a single explosion is unchanged, but each successive explosion that hits the same enemy has its damage halved. The damage per successive explosion is: 60, 30, 15, 7.5, 3.75, 1.875, 0.9375, 0.46875, 0.234375', '{{dlc|r}} The damage for a single explosion is 0.75x times its normal damage, resulting in 75 damage per explosion. Each successive explosion that hits the same enemy has its damage halved. The damage per successive explosion is: 75, 37.5, 18.75, 9.375, 4.6875, 2.34375, 1.171875, 0.5859375, 0.29296875.', "{{i|Mr. Mega}} changes the explosions' base damage to {{dlc|nr}}110/{{dlc|r}}185, with the same damage reductions as above."]]]
notes: [['With Bomber Boy, [[Bedroom]]s, [[super special rock]]s and {{dlc|r}}the {{s|Mines}} can be accessed with a single bomb.'], ['Bombing the {{M|Donation Machine}} will cause a greater than normal amount of coins to drop from the Donation Machine.', ['The total amount of dropped coins is still deducted from the Donation Machine, however.']], ['{{dlc|na+}} Bombing a {{E|Blue Fire Place}} or {{E|Purple Fire Place}} may cause it to drop multiple {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Bombs are colored blue and no longer have a skull on them.']]
synergies: [["{{i|BBF|r}}/{{i|Best Friend}}/{{i|Bob's Brain}}: Bomber Boy affects the item’s explosion."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bomber Boy affects the bombs fired by Dr. Fetus.'], ["{{i|Doctor's Remote|r}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Bomber Boy affects the missiles' explosions from Epic Fetus, with the explosions' multiplier resulting in 15 times Isaac's damage per explosion. Unlike with regular bombs, Bomber Boy won't decrease the damage from each of the missile's successive explosions, drastically increasing damage."], ['{{i|Glitter Bombs}}: Each additional explosion created has a chance to spawn a pickup or trinket.'], ['{{i|Hot Bombs}}: Each extra explosion creates an additional fire.'], ['{{i|Mr. Boom}}: Bomber Boy affects the active item’s bombs.'], ["{{i|Mr. Mega}}: All explosions deal more damage, have a larger radius and will overlap each other more, potentially vastly increasing damage. Caution should be exercised, as the explosions' increased radius make self-damage likely."], ['{{dlc|r}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: Additional smaller explosions will spawn in a tight cross formation.'], ['{{i|Sad Bombs|anr}}: Each explosion releases 10 tears in all directions.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Anarchist Cookbook}}/{{i|Curse of the Tower}}: Not recommended. The cross pattern explosion makes it very hard to avoid taking damage.'], ["{{i|BBF|nr}}/{{i|Best Friend}}/{{i|Bob's Brain}}: Explosion damage is halved with no additional explosions."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus|nr}}: Epic Fetus explosions are unaffected.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Ipecac explosions are unaffected.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}}[[Familiars#Locusts|Red Locusts]]: Explosion damage is halved with no additional explosions.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Sad Bombs}}: Only the center most explosion creates 10 tears.']]

name: Empty Vessel
description: Grants two {{E|Black Heart}}s. While Isaac has no [[Health#Red Heart Containers|red hearts]], grants [[flight]] and periodically grants an invincibility [[shield]] for a few seconds.
effects: [['When Isaac has no [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Hearts]]:', ['Grants [[flight]].', 'Every 40 seconds since activation or pickup, when the seconds on the timer hit 00, 20, or 40, while in a room with enemies, a [[shield]] triggers, nullifying all types of damage for 10 seconds.']], ['Grants 2 {{E|Black Heart}}s on pickup.']]
notes: [['Does not affect {{C|Keeper}}/{{C|Tainted Keeper}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}This item is difficult to use for anyone with red health, as it is impossible to have no red hearts without removing all heart containers (such as through [[Devil Room|Devil deals]]). It is best used by characters that cannot gain red health at all, such as {{C|???}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}}Characters can now deplete their red health fully through sources like {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s while having other hearts like {{E|Soul Heart}}s. As a result, this item is usable for a wider amount of characters, and has synergies with characters who prefer to have no red health (such as {{C|Eve}}).']]
synergies: [['{{i|Brittle Bones}}: The empty {{E|bone heart|x}}s will trigger Empty Vessel.'], ['{{I|Gnawed Leaf}}: If the player has no Red Hearts, they can stand still and wait for the shield to activate, allowing the player to deal damage without leaving invulnerability.']]

name: Evil Eye
description: Adds a chance to fire a slow-moving eye that fires tears in the same direction as Isaac. The eye will be destroyed if it hits an enemy or obstacle.
notes: [['The eye has the same rate of fire and damage as Isaac.'], ["The direction of the eye's tears is affected by the direction the eye is traveling in.", ['{{dlc|r}} Now fire in the same direction as Isaac.']], ["If the eyes are spawned from {{C|The Forgotten}}'s melee attack, the eyes will pick up items off the floor in the same way The Forgotten's melee attack does."], ['The eyes are not treated as familiars and therefore will not synergize with items like {{i|BFFS!}}.'], ['Eyes disappear when hitting walls, enemies, and obstacles, even if Isaac has piercing or spectral tears.', ['Familiars like {{I|Dry Baby}}, {{I|Angry Fly}} and even {{I|Finger!}} also destroy the eye on collision.']]]
synergies: [['{{I|Astral Projection}}: During the time-stop period of Astral Projection, there is a chance that the eyes fired will stop in the air instead of flying in a direction, and will last indefinitely until an enemy bump into it, greatly increase the existing time of evil eyes. Triggering of Astral Projection also greatly increase fire rate, giving a higher possibility to fire eyes.'], ['[[Homing tears]]: Eyes will fire homing tears; however, the eye itself will not home in on enemies.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Eyes will fire eyeball tears but cannot be knocked around by them.'], ['{{i|spirit sword}}: Massively powerful, will "swing" in the direction isaac is firing for as long as it is held and has slightly less range than Isaac\'s base stat.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Eyes will fire beams. Occasionally causes Trisagion beams to stay static in the air for a few seconds, dealing damage to enemies that come in contact with them.'], ['Items that reduce shot speed, such as {{I|Dead Onion}}, can be beneficial, as eyes will stay on the screen longer.'], ["{{i|Mom's Eye}}: Evil eye has a chance to be shot backwards.", ['{{dlc|r}} Eyes shot backwards will still fire in the direction Isaac is shooting.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{i|Cursed Eye}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: No effect; the eyes will still fire single tears.'], ['{{i|Angelic Prism}}: Eyes that hit the prism will be destroyed. Tears that the eyes fire will split if they travel through the prism.'], ["{{C|Azazel}}/{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Evil Eye."], ['{{I|Ball of Bandages}}/{{I|Cube of Meat}}/{{i|Dry Baby}}: Blocks the Evil Eye, making it hard to use.'], ["{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: The tears fired by the eyes match Isaac's current charge. The eyes still have continued fire rather than charging shots."], ['{{i|Continuum}}: Eyes will still disappear when hitting walls; however, they will fire tears that can travel through walls.'], ['{{i|C Section|r}}/{{c|Tainted Azazel}}: Overrides Evil Eye.'], ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: The eye itself cannot be controlled, but the tears it shoots can be.'], ['{{i|Incubus}}: Incubus cannot fire eyes.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Tears fired by eyes can damage Isaac.'], ['{{i|Lead Pencil}}: Eyes will fire barrages of tears every 15 times they fire their own tears.'], ['{{i|Lil Gurdy}}: Destroys eyes if it touches them.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Marked}}: Tears shot from the eye shoot in the direction that Isaac is moving the cursor towards, not at the cursor.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Eyes spawn more often but only fire one tear at a time."], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: Sprinkler cannot fire eyes.'], ['{{i|Tech.5}}/{{i|Technology 2}}: Eyes only fire normal tears and the laser cannot fire eyes.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Eyes travel straight forward, and tears fired by eyes orbit around Isaac.']]

name: Glowing Hour Glass
description: Rewinds time, putting Isaac back in the previous room and undoing anything that happened in the current room.
notes: [['The Glowing Hour Glass is very useful for finding out hidden information. For example, the player can grab every pill on the floor and use them all in the same room, then activate the Glowing Hour Glass to figure out which pills are worth or not worth taking. As another example, if Isaac has {{cu|Blind}}, Glowing Hour Glass can be used to pick up or purchase an unknown item to see what it is, then decide whether or not to undo picking it up.'], ['If the Glowing Hour Glass to go back in time to previous room, without moving to another room after the activation, each use will multiply some [[Familiar|familiars]] that persist through rooms by duplicating them. (This is possibly a bug)', ['Familiars that can be multiplied:', ['[[Tainted Eve#Blood Clots|Blood Clots]] from {{C|Tainted Eve}}/{{I|Sumptorium}}', 'Blue [[Familiar#Blue Flies|flies]] and [[Familiar#Blue Spiders|spiders]]', '{{I|Abyss}} locusts', '[[Friendly]] monsters spawned by items (i.e. {{I|Friend Finder}})', 'Mini-Isaacs spawned by {{I|Giant Cell}}', '[[Wisps.xml|Wisps]]', ['Wisps from {{I|Vengeful Spirit}} act very unusual, they appear at the entrance of each room Isaac enters and shoot in the direction that Isaac currently shooting. Wisps from the {{I|Book of Virtues}} that exceed the limit of 26 wisps will have this same behavior.', ['{{I|Lemegeton}} wisps, however, do not retain this behavior and will still spin around Isaac even if they exceed they limit of 26 possible wisps, they also only multiply existing ones.']]], 'There appears to be a limit to the number of familiars that can be gained through this method.']], ['Using a {{p|Joker}} and then the Glowing Hour Glass to return does not guarantee a Devil Room for every floor as the Joker card does not get refunded. The reason for this is that you immediately change rooms after the Joker card is used, as such reverting to before it was used is impossible.'], ['Does not return health lost entering or leaving a {{R|Curse Room}}, as the health was lost in the previous room.'], ['Does not preserve the Devil Room or Angel Room door if used to return to the Boss Room.'], ["Does not turn a character back into another should they have been revived by {{i|Ankh}}, {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}, or {{i|Judas' Shadow}}.", ['{{dlc|a+}} Character changes are reverted by Glowing Hour Glass.']], ["{{dlc|a+}} Does not affect the chance for a portal to {{Stage|The Void}} to spawn (the portal will not spawn if it didn't spawn initially).", ['Does not affect the chance for a {{R|Devil Room}} or {{R|Angel Room}} to spawn (it will not spawn if it didn’t initially.']], ['Using the Glowing Hour Glass to prevent picking the Glowing Hour Glass up while previously having had an active item will return the active item and discharge it completely.'], ['No Damage Achievements are still available if the Glowing Hour Glass is used to reset damage.', ['{{t|Perfection}} is still able to drop if the Glowing Hour Glass is used to reset damage.']], ['The Retro Vision [[Pill]] will continue to affect the game even after using the Glowing Hour Glass.', ["Similarly, the delayed effect of the I'm Excited pill will still occur after rewinding."]], ['If taken a hit and reversed Samson can still be unlocked'], ["If there is a Lil' Battery in a Shop, the Glowing Hour Glass can be used infinitely, by entering the Shop without a charge and using the Lil' Battery to recharge and exit the shop. This is useful for duplicating temporary familiars or {{dlc|nr}}filling up the Donation Machine, among other uses."], ['Does not remove [[collection page]] entries if it undoes collecting an item for the first time.'], ['{{Dlc|na+}} Donations to the {{m|Donation Machine}} or {{M|Greed Donation Machine}} are not reverted, and they can be reset into a working state once jammed.', ['Other counters not tied to your specific run, such as {{M|Slot Machine}}s or [[Tinted Rock]]s destroyed, continue to accumulate, allowing easy unlocking of secrets such as the {{t|Counterfeit Penny}}, the {{i|D4}}, and {{E|Conquest}} if you have access to infinite uses of the Glowing Hour Glass (see below).']], ['{{dlc|nr}} Does not return keys or health used to enter [[Rooms#Special_rooms|special rooms]].'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Can be used to unlock multiple achievements tied to the killing of certain bosses such as {{E|Mom's Heart}} / {{E|It Lives}}."]]
synergies: [['{{dlc|na+}} {{p|? Card}}: Allows for infinite usage as the ? Card gets refunded upon usage.'], ['{{i|4.5 Volt}}: Allows for infinite usage in rooms where a lot of damage can be dealt, most notably boss rooms.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|9 Volt}}: Clearing any room is enough to instantly recharge the hourglass, allowing infinite tries for best outcome.', ['{{dlc|r}} With {{t|AAA Battery}} the hourglass is instantly recharged.']], ['{{Dlc|na+}}{{i|The Battery}}: When the item is double charged and used it will also refund the used extra charge bar, making it possible to use it endlessly.'], ['[[48 Hour Energy]] pill: Allows for infinite usage as the pill gets refunded upon use.'], ['{{i|Moving Box}}: Using the Glowing Hour Glass after retrieving it from Moving Box will not deplete its charge. Allows for infinite usage as long as Moving Box is fully charged.'], ['{{i|Sharp Plug}}: Allows for infinite usage as long as you have more than 2 ({{dlc|r}} 1.5) full hearts as the hearts used to charge will be refunded upon use.'], ['{{i|Habit}}: Allows rooms to be repeated infinitely as long as Isaac has enough health to take {{dlc|nr}} two ({{dlc|r}} three) hits, which are refunded on use.'], ['{{t|Hairpin}}: If Hairpin is held while entering any Boss Room for the first time, Glowing Hourglass may be used indefinitely on said room to repeat the fight until you beat it.'], ["{{dlc|r}} If {{C|Tainted Eden}}'s active item re-rolls into Glowing Hourglass, it can be used immediately to return Tainted Eden to their previous state. This allows the player to have practically infinite attempts to keep their loadout of passive items."], ["{{Dlc|r}}If a use of Glowing Hour Glass by {{C|Tainted Lazarus}} involves changing to his other form - either due to room completion or by using {{i|Flip}} beforehand, Glowing Hour Glass's charges will not be consumed. This essentially allows infinite retries of any room you enter as the form that does ''not'' hold the item."], ['{{bov}}', ['While playing as {{C|Tainted Eden}} and rerolling an active item into the Glowing Hour Glass, you can infinitely spawn wisps as much as possible until you reroll it again.']], ['{{i|Curse of the Tower}}: If used quickly after taking damage, Troll bombs will spawn in the previous room. If you have the {{t|Safety Scissors}}, these can be harvested as normal.'], ['{{i|Duality|r}}: The doors to the {{R|Devil Room}} and {{R|Angel Room}} stay open if you use the Glowing Hour Glass inside their rooms, so Duality lets you check the items of one of them before deciding which room to use.'], ['{{I|Alabaster Box}} + {{I|Schoolbag}}: Using Glowing Hour Glass before the Alabaster Box opening animation is complete will return the box to you while still opening it, allowing for infinite uses of Alabaster Box.'], ['{{I|Luna}}: Activating the beam of light in the secret room and going back in time before isaac raises Luna above its head will give Isaac the tears and half a soul heart while the beam of light will still stay untouched in the secret room, allowing for multiple uses of the same beam of light.'], ['{{i|Eraser}}/{{I|Notched axe}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: Using Glowing Hourglass to return to the previous stage will keep the charge received from entering the next stage.'], ["{{I|Empty heart}}/{{T|maggy's faith}}/{{T|hollow heart}}: Going back to the previous floor will not remove empty heart containers/white/bone hearts that were obtained in the process."], ['{{I|redemption}}: Going back to the previous floor before Redemption will finish its animation will make it activate on the previous floor without wasting itself, allowing for multiple uses.', ['You will need to reenter boss room to get the bonus second time.']], ['{{i|More Options}}: If used after entering the Treasure Room for the first time, upon reentering the room, the items may change.'], ['{{i|Crooked Penny}} + {{i|Schoolbag}}: If there is infinite battery and an item in the same room, you can multiply items an infinite number of times. Every time you fail the Crooked Penny flip, you can activate the Glowing Hourglass, go back in, grab a battery, then try again. Every time you succeed a flip, you must leave the room and enter it again to "save" your progress.', ['{{dlc|r}}You must also activate the Crooked Penny in another room between each failed attempt.']], ['{{i|Saturnus}}: Using the Glowing Hourglass will activate the effect of Saturnus again, essentially allowing for double the amount of orbiting tears, if the player returns to a room, where the tears created by Saturnus were not destroyed.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}If activated while under the effect of  [[Soul of Azazel]], as long as you had the consumable in the previously visited room, you will keep the Megablast effect while having another copy of the soul in your inventory.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Bag of Crafting}}: The bag's contents will be reverted to its previous state."], ['{{i|The Battery}}: Glowing Hour Glass will receive a maximum of two full charges as normal, however, using the item twice consecutively will not result in the player being teleported two rooms previous, only one. This means that if Glowing Hour Glass is used twice in succession, they will rewind as normal with the first use to the previous room, then, upon second use, everything will be rewound, but the player will not be teleported to the room previous to the one they just teleported to and will instead find themselves teleported to the room they are currently in. Rewinding works as normal, but teleportation is limited to the last room visited.'], ['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Void|force=a+nr}}: It is impossible to absorb a Glowing Hour Glass pedestal without using the item and preventing it from having been absorbed.', ["{{Dlc|r}} The Glowing Hour Glass is absorbed like normal. Subsequent uses of '''Void''' send Isaac back to the previous room reverting most changes, nullifying many other effects that '''Void''' may have absorbed. Energy is still reset back to full upon each use, allowing for infinite re-tries of any room.
