This does, however, prevent you from consuming any further powers as you will instead reset the room.", ['Notably, the {{i|Broken Watch}} triggers the slow effect on every fourth room, based on the room counter which does not reset on use, allowing you to undo a fast room and get all slow rooms.', 'The {{i|Placenta}} re-rolls regeneration at the minute mark, allowing you to re-roll entering a new room shortly before the minute mark and almost guarantee a regeneration (mind the one-second animation tick on the clock).']]], ['{{C|Tainted Jacob}}: Using this item in a room where Dark Esau has spawned will cause him to remain with the player after teleporting, but once enough time has passed he will suddenly disappear and respawn elsewhere. This may be a bug.']]

name: Succubus
description: Spawns a flying [[familiar]] that bounces around the room with a black aura, dealing rapid damage to any enemies inside it. While standing in the aura, Isaac gains a 1.5x [[Damage|tear damage]] multiplier.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar that bounces around the room and has a dark aura around it.', ['Enemies within the radius of the aura take damage. The aura deals:', ["{{dlc|nr}} 30% of Isaac's [[damage]] per tick or about 129% of Isaac's damage per second.", '{{dlc|r}} 2.5 damage per tick or about 7.5-10 damage per second.'], 'If Isaac is within the aura, his tears gain a 1.5x [[damage]] multiplier.', ["This aura stacks with other Succubi, as well as other damage multipliers (e.g. {{i|Cricket's Head}}, {{i|Sacred Heart}}, etc.)."]]]]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Succubus and its damaging aura are visually larger, but the damage multiplier is not increased any further away from the familiar. However the damaging aura is increased.'], ['{{I|Libra}}: When Isaac is within the aura, affects re-balanced stats rather than just damage.']]

name: Wooden Nickel
description: When used, has a 50% chance to drop a random [[coin]].
effects: [['When used, has a 50% chance to drop a random [[coin]].']]
notes: [['This is a starting item for {{C|Keeper}} after he beats {{E|Isaac}}.']]
synergies: [['{{i|9 Volt}}: Allows for infinite generation of coins in a room with enemies.'], ['{{bov}}']]

name: D12
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Re-rolls all [[Rock]]s and [[Metal Block]]s in the current room into other random obstacles.
{{dlc|r}} Re-rolls most types of [[Obstacles]] in the current room into other random obstacles.
notes: [['Can be used to net more of a certain desired obstacle for interactions such as more poops making {{t|Petrified Poop}} more effective or more rocks to farm [[Coins]] with {{t|Lucky Rock}}.'], ['Chapter-specific obstacles ([[Urn|Urns]], [[Mushroom|Mushrooms]], [[Skull|Skulls]], and [[Polyp|Polyps]]) can be re-rolled. Depending on the current [[Chapter]], rocks can also be re-rolled into them.'], ['{{E|Rainbow Poop}}, {{E|Golden Poop}}, and [[Tinted Rock]]s are much less likely to be created by the D12 than all other obstacles.'], ['Destroyed obstacles will not be rerolled.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} While TNT can be created by the D12, {{E|Movable TNT}} cannot be.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} The D12 will not re-roll [[Key Block]]s or {{E|Fire Place}}s.', ["It also won't re-roll {{e|Stone Grimace}}s or other enemies."]], ['{{dlc|r}} This item can rarely reroll obstacles into {{E|Reward Plate}}s, {{E|Red Button|display=Red Buttons}}, and very rarely into [[Crawl Space]]s or trapdoors to the next floor.'], ['{{dlc|r}} It is possible reroll the spikes in a {{R|Sacrifice Room}} and render the room unusable.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The D12 will not re-roll {{E|silver Button|display=Buttons}}, [[Marked Skull]]s, [[Dirt Patches]], [[Teleporters]], or Bomb Rocks.'], ['{{dlc|r}} These obstacles will only reroll into another one in this group: {{E|Poop}}s, [[Retractable Spikes]], Normal and Red {{E|Fire Place}}s, both types of {{E|TNT}}, and [[Cobwebs]].', ['These obstacles can also reroll into {{E|Reward Plate|display=Reward Plates}} and {{E|Red Button|display=Red Buttons}}, but will not reroll any further.']]]

name: Explosivo
description: Isaac's tears have a chance to stick to enemies and explode.
effects: [["Isaac's tears have a chance to stick to enemies and explode a few seconds afterward, dealing 60 damage plus Isaac's tear damage."]]
notes: [['Explosivo does damage to Isaac while in proximity to the explosion'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Tears that stick to enemies do not deal any damage until they explode.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Explosivo shots deal regular tear damage upon sticking to an enemy.'], ['If an enemy dies or teleports with an Explosivo tear attached, the tear detaches and drops to the ground. If the detached tears touch an enemy, they will stick to that enemy and explode.', ['However, when an Explosivo tear is attached to {{E|Loki}} or {{E|Lokii}}, the tear teleports with the respective boss when the boss teleports.']], ['Be careful with large-sized tears: as Explosivo causes them to grow even larger, they can completely obscure enemies and their surroundings.'], ['Explosivo is not affected by [[luck]].'], ['Explosivo shots can go through any type of {{E|fire place}} and coal from {{e|Coal Spider}} and {{e|Coal Boy}}.']]
synergies: [["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Tech X}}: Every tick of damage Isaac’s tears deal have a chance to attach a separate Explosivo tear on a hit enemy."], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: The explosion results in split Explosivo shots being generated. If the target survives, they're likely to immediately stick again."], ['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Dr. Fetus bombs may occasionally turn into {{i|Sticky Bombs}}.'], ['{{i|Godhead}}: The tear keeps its damaging aura while attached to the enemy, the aura grows as the tear does until it explodes. The aura can damage only enemies other than the one the tear is stuck to, however.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Main tears and burst tears can have the Explosivo effect. If a main tear has the Explosivo effect, it will burst with its explosion, the burst tears dealing damage based off the explosion damage.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Sticky shots will explode even if they fall to the floor after the initial target dies.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Explosivo tears can be fed and will burst into Explosivo tears; however, if normal tears are fed first, Explosivo fed to the normal tears will not give the tear the Explosivo effect.'], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Tears that stick to enemies can still block/be destroyed by enemy shots.', ["{{dlc|r}} Shielded Explosivo tears are no longer destroyed by shots while they're stuck to enemies. Up to the point that they explode, they block all enemy shots that come into contact with them, effectively cutting off an entire direction of attack (much like Dry/Fart Baby, but with a larger area of blockage and without forcing the player to waste time positioning). As such, this is an extremely powerful synergy between otherwise adequate items."]], ["{{i|Mr. Mega}}: Increases the damage bonus of Explosivo's explosions to 110."], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Leaves a pool of green creep on the floor.'], ['{{t|Nose Goblin}}/{{i|Sinus Infection}}: Explosivo tears can also be booger tears which damage the enemy over time while stuck to them before exploding.'], ["{{i|Soy Milk}}: The 60 point explosion damage bonus is not affected by Soy Milk's penalty, combining efficiently with the high fire rate."], ["{{i|Spirit Sword}}: The fired projectile can take on Explosivo's effects. The sword swing can leave behind Explosivo tears."], ['{{i|Strange Attractor}}: When a tear sticks to an enemy, nearby enemies will be quickly pulled in the direction of the tear. The constant pull may however make enemy movement unpredictable.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Tech.5}}: The laser also has a chance to apply explosive tears on enemies.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Technology}}: Regular explosive tears may stick to enemies hit by the laser.'], ["{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Technology 2}}: The laser has a chance to apply an explosive tear every tick. The 60 point explosion damage bonus is not affected by the laser's penalty, combining efficiently with the high tick rate."], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Stuck tears will still generate arcs of electricity. Multiple tears stuck to a single enemy can cause very rapid damage.'], ['{{i|Trisagion|r}}: Every tick of damage Isaac’s tears deal have a chance to attach a separate Explosivo tear on a hit enemy.']]
interactions: [['[[:Category:Bomb items|All other bomb modifiers]]: No bomb modifier outside {{I|Mr. Mega}} and {{T|Short Fuse}} has an effect on Explosivo tears.'], ["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: Bob's Rotten Head has a chance to stick onto enemies. The explosion damage bonus increases to 110."], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Explosivo."], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Explosivo.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Holy Light}}: Some Explosivo tears have the Holy Light effect applied to them. These tears spawn a beam of light after a few seconds of sticking to an enemy instead of exploding.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Not recommended. Tear will alternate between "normal" and black. If it touches an enemy, it will stick to it, grow in size, then explode. While the tear is stuck to an enemy, it stops doing damage and cannot be controlled, leaving the player helpless.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Tech.5}}/{{I|Technology 2}}: The laser is unaffected by Explosivo.'], ['{{i|Trisagion|a+nr}}: Overrides Explosivo.']]

name: Circle of Protection
description: Surrounds Isaac with a large white halo that occasionally deals Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] to enemies inside it, and can convert enemy shots into friendly [[homing tears]].
effects: [['Surrounds Isaac with a large white halo.', ["Once per second, the halo deals Isaac's [[Damage]] to all enemies currently inside it.", 'Each enemy shot has a 30% chance to be reflected by the halo.', ['The chance is predetermined, and not affect by how long it is exposed by the halo.', "The reflectable tears are reflected once they touch the middle line of the halo, and is converted into friendly purple [[homing tears]] that have Isaac's Damage and no other tear modifiers.", 'Projectiles that create other projectiles (e.g. {{E|Shady}}) do not create the projectiles once reflected.', 'Can reflect:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}), which do not explode once reflected.', 'Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), which do not create lines of fire once reflected.', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', 'Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.'], 'Does not reflect:', ['Lasers or beams.', 'Lines of fire from fireballs.', 'Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.']]]]]
interactions: [['Circle of Protection: Multiple copies of this item through sources such as {{I|Diplopia}} or {{I|Crooked Penny}} has no effect.']]

name: Rune Bag
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a random [[Cards and Runes|rune]] after clearing enough [[rooms]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a random [[Cards and Runes|rune]] after clearing enough rooms.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Runes are dropped alternating every 5 or 6 rooms.', '{{dlc|r}} Runes are dropped alternating every 7 or 8 rooms.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} If there are no runes unlocked, it will drop [[Cards and Runes|cards]] instead.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Rune Bag will also drop Soul Stones if any have been unlocked.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} If not every rune is unlocked, it will drop a {{p|Rune Shard}} in place of the corresponding rune.{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The drop rate is improved to every 4-5 rooms.', ['{{dlc|r}} The drop rate is improved to every 6 rooms.']]]

name: My Shadow
description: Each time Isaac takes damage, inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies in the room and spawns a black [[friendly]] {{E|Charger}} that will attack enemies. The Charger will be killed if it is damaged too much.
effects: [['Upon taking damage, inflicts [[fear]] on all enemies in the room.'], ['Upon taking damage, spawns a dark [[friendly]] {{E|My Shadow|display=Charger}}', ['{{dlc|nr}} The Chargers deal 5 damage per hit to enemies.', ['{{dlc|r}} The Chargers deal 8.7 damage per hit to enemies.'], 'Isaac keeps the chargers when transitioning between rooms.']]]
notes: [['{{dlc|ana+}} If this item is triggered in the {{s|Flooded Caves}}, there is a chance that the black charger will be replaced by a {{E|Drowned Charger}}. The summoned Drowned Charger will behave like normal black chargers, and upon death will explode into 4 blood shots that do not damage the player.'], ["Shadows of incoming attacks from above will be harder to see, as they're covered by the item's shadow initially."], ['This item can only spawn a maximum of 5 chargers.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Box of Friends|n}}: No effect.'], ['{{I|Eraser}}: Erasing a {{E|Charger}} will prevent all newly created [[friendly]] Chargers from spawning, rendering the item useless. The item spawns a normal Charger before changing it to the special My Shadow variant.'], ['{{I|Ghost Bombs}} / {{I|Purgatory}}: Explosions from the ghosts can and will kill the chargers.\n{{clear}}']]

name: Friend Zone
description: Spawns a white attack fly that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] somewhere between {{i|Distant Admiration}} and {{i|Forever Alone}}, dealing 45 damage per second.
effects: [['Spawns a white fly [[familiar]] that slowly [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] Isaac and deals 3 damage per tick or 45 damage per second on contact.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['This familiar orbits Isaac at a middle-length distance somewhere between {{i|Distant Admiration}} and {{i|Forever Alone}}.']]

name: Pupula Duplex
description: Gives Isaac [[spectral tears]] and gives his tears a wide arc shape, increasing their size.
effects: [['Grants [[spectral tears]].'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tear size multiplier: 2x.', ['{{Dlc|r}} +0.6 tear size.', 'Despite their crescent shape, the tears are still considered round hitbox-wise.']]]
synergies: [['{{i|Godhead}}: The damaging aura benefits from the increased size significantly.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: No effect on Brimstone.', ["{{c|Azazel}}: Also does not affect Azazel's mini-brimstone."]], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: No effect on Epic Fetus.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Only tear appearance changes, no tear size up.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: No effect on Mom's Knife."], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{I|My reflection}}: Tears will spin like boomerangs, purely cosmetic effect.'], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: No effect on Tech X.'], ['{{i|Technology}}: Lasers become spectral.', ['{{dlc|r}} Laser beams are thicker in terms of width.']]]

name: Glass Cannon
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Fires a high-damage piercing spectral tear, but lowers Isaac's health to half a heart.
{{dlc|r}} Fires a high-damage piercing spectral tear. If Isaac takes damage while holding this, he takes extra damage and it becomes {{i|Broken Glass Cannon|force=n}}.
effects: [['Fires a single high-damage [[piercing tears|piercing]] tear which can travel over [[obstacle]]s.', ["The damage dealt by this tear is ten times Isaac's damage, plus a flat 10 damage.", 'The shot has an additional 1.5x size multiplier on top of damage-increased size.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} Sets Isaac's health to half a heart with each use (half a Soul Heart if these are present but there are no Red Heart containers). This also removes any other {{E|Soul Heart}}s or {{E|Black Heart}}s, but not {{E|Eternal Heart}}s.", ['{{dlc|a+nr}} If Isaac has no Red Hearts and at least one {{E|Bone Heart}}, only an empty Bone Heart remains.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Upon taking damage, this item turns into {{i|Broken Glass Cannon}}, and Isaac will lose an additional 2 hearts of health on top of the damage he already took. Isaac gains 1.5 range and leaves a trail of red [[creep]] behind him, identical to the effects of {{i|Anemic}} for the rest of the current room.', ['If the damage from breaking Glass Cannon would result in death, Isaac will remain at half a heart, gaining half a soul heart if necessary. This does not apply if the damage Isaac took would be lethal before the extra damage is taken.', 'Self-damage (e.g. from {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s) will not break Glass Cannon.']]]
notes: [['Glass Cannon can be fired diagonally, even without {{I|Analog Stick}}.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: The current charge of Chocolate Milk affects Glass Cannon.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Tears fired by Glass Cannon will split."], ['{{i|Godhead}}: Creates a giant aura around Glass Cannon tears that almost fills up normal sized rooms.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Glass Cannon will fire giant Lachryphagy tears. Tears are harder to feed as they will burst very quickly but they can be fed if you fire tears beforehand and then fire Glass Cannon into those tears.'], ['{{i|Multidimensional Baby}}: The Glass Cannon tears will be doubled by Multidimensional Baby.'], ['{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: Creates a large pool of creep when tears land.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears produced by Glass Cannon will orbit Isaac.']]
interactions: [["{{dlc|ana+}}{{i|9 Volt}}, {{dlc|nr}} {{i|20/20}}, {{i|Anti-Gravity}}, {{i|Car Battery}}, {{i|The Inner Eye}}, {{i|Mutant Spider}}, {{i|Brimstone}}, {{i|Dr. Fetus}}, {{i|Epic Fetus}}, {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}, {{i|Marked}}, {{i|Mom's Knife}}, {{i|Monstro's Lung}}, {{i|Technology}}, and {{i|Tech X}}: No effect, Glass Cannon fires a normal tear.", ['{{dlc|a+}}{{i|9 Volt}}: Reduces charge time to 2 seconds.', "{{dlc|r}} {{I|20/20}}: Gives a 25% damage down, hurting Glass Cannon's performance."]], ["{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Cannon shot can be controlled. If a synergy is given a crosshair (e.g. {{i|Brimstone}}, {{i|Technology}} etc.), the tear will follow wherever it's pointed."], ['{{I|Habit}}: Upon taking damage, {{I|Broken Glass Cannon}} will be half-charged. However, taking damage before the last charge will break the cannon again.'], ["{{i|Holy Mantle}}: Doesn't prevent damage done by Glass Cannon, but will protect against other types of damage."], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Ipecac}}: As the Glass Cannon tears are so large, even a modest damage increase or a single tear size increasing item is likely to render the tear unable to damage enemies, their explosions too far from them.'], ['{{i|Pluto}}: Allows Isaac to cross small gaps using the knockback of Glass Cannon.'], ['{{I|Schoolbag}}: The cannon will break on damage, regardless if it or another active is on hand.', ["+ {{I|Tear Detonator}}: Glass Cannon shots will detonate into normal tears. The tears don't inherit [[Tear Effects|spectral]] or [[Tear Effects|piercing]]."]], ['{{i|Soy Milk}}: Reduces damage of shots, no effect on charge time.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Fires normal Trisagion beams that do not have increased damage.'], ["{{dlc|r}} {{i|The Wafer}}: Doesn't reduce the damage taken while Glass Cannon is held."], ['{{i|Stye}}: Copies the eye used most recently.']]

name: Key Bum
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and collects {{E|Key}}s for himself, giving random {{E|Chest}}s in return.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac around and collects {{E|key}}s, dropping random {{E|Chest}}s in return. (He does not fill up a familiar "slot".)'], ['{{transf|Super Bum|item}}']]
notes: [['Key Bum will not pick up {{E|Golden Key}}s.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Key Bum will pick up {{E|Charged Key|n}} without additional benefit.', ["{{dlc|r}} Key Bum will leave a {{E|Lil' Battery}} behind when picking up {{E|Charged Key|n}}.", 'From a scoring perspective, Keys that Key Bum picks up count towards your Schwag bonus on daily runs. (only applies to Afterbirth and Afterbirth ✞ dailies)']]]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Familiar is bigger and drops chests more often.'], ['{{T|Flat Penny}}: Chests frequently contain pennies, which have a chance of spawning more keys for Key Bum to pick up, possibly lead to a loop.'], ['{{T|Gilded Key}} / {{T|The Left Hand}}: Works as expected.'], ["{{I|Guppy's Eye}}: Allows Isaac to choose which Locked Chests are worth opening and which to pass, thus saving keys. Great for min-maxing."]]

name: Censer
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] which creates a circular aura that [[Status Effects#Effects|slows]] down enemies and enemy shots inside.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] projecting a circular aura that [[Status Effects#Effects|slows]] enemies and enemy shots within its radius and for some time once they exit.']]
notes: [['The aura does not affect bosses but slows down their shots.', ['Bosses that use tight volleys of projectiles are extremely difficult to avoid without additional items to block, remove, or redirect those shots, as the slowing effect will cause their attacks to clump together.']]]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|r}}{{i|2Spooky}}/{{i|Venus}}: The slowing aura mitigates the delay between fast enemies that charge Isaac and the [[Status Effects|status effect]], making it much harder for Isaac to take contact damage.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{i|Bot Fly}}/{{i|Psy Fly}}: The slowing aura allows these items to deal with the incoming projectiles more reliably.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{i|The Soul}}: The slowing aura allows incoming enemies and shots to be more reliably deflected.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The aura does not slow things from further away despite increased visual size.']]

name: Lusty Blood
description: Isaac's [[damage]] increases for the current room each time he kills an enemy.
effects: [['Each time an enemy is killed, Isaac gains a [[damage]] boost for the current room.', ['Each kill increases damage by 0.5, up to a maximum of 5 damage after 10 kills.']]]
notes: [["Some summoned enemies like {{E|Rag Man's Ragling}}s do not trigger the effect when killed."], ['{{E|Mr. Maw}} does not trigger the effects of Lusty Blood, even after splitting.'], ['Blowing up a {{E|shopkeeper}} will grant Isaac a damage bonus as well.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Meat Cleaver}}: Both of the smaller enemies produced by Meat Cleaver add to the damage bonus, allowing rooms with few enemies to grant much more damage.'], ["{{T|Samson's Lock}}: Both the item and the trinket stack, granting 1 damage per kill. With 100% proc rate on the Lock, Isaac may gain up to 10 damage after 10 kills."]]
interactions: [['{{I|Uranus}}: Only enemies killed by icicles from statues, bombs, familiars and other sources will increment Lusty Blood counter, thus rendering Lusty Blood quite difficult to use.']]

name: Lil Chest
description: Spawns a chest [[familiar]] that spawns a random [[pickup]] (25% chance) or [[trinket]] (10% chance) upon clearing a [[Rooms|room]].
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: The chance to spawn a pickup increases to 31.25%, and the chance to spawn a trinket increases to 12.5%.']]

name: Purity
description: Boosts one of Isaac's [[Attributes|stats]] depending on the color of the aura around him. The aura disappears upon taking damage and reappears with a random color upon entering a new room. Red boosts [[damage]], blue boosts [[tears]], yellow boosts [[speed]], and orange boosts [[range]].
effects: [["Grants an aura around Isaac that grants a boost depending on the aura's color.", ["'''Red''': +4 [[damage]].", "{{dlc|nr}} '''Blue''': -4 [[tear delay]].", "{{dlc|r}} '''Blue''': +2.0 [[fire rate]].", "'''Yellow''': +0.5 [[speed]].", ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).'], "{{dlc|nr}} '''Orange''': +7.5 [[range]], +1.0 [[tear falling speed]].", "{{dlc|r}} '''Orange''': +3.0 [[range]]."]], ['Taking damage causes the aura to disappear. When the next room is entered, the aura will reappear with a random color.']]
notes: [["The tear delay boost can allow the player's tears to go over the normal maximum [[tear delay|rate of fire]]."], ['It is especially difficult for {{C|The Lost}} to change auras. However, it is possible through the use of {{i|Dull Razor}}.'], ['As {{C|Tainted Isaac}} you can easily change auras by swapping Purity for another item and picking it back up again.']]

name: Betrayal
description: Every time Isaac takes damage, a [[charm]] effect is applied to every enemy in the room, causing them to attack each other rather than Isaac.

name: Fate's Reward
description: A blue head [[familiar]] that will follow Isaac and fire tears copying his [[tear effects]] and [[damage]].
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that fires tears with the same [[damage]] and [[tear effects]] as Isaac's tears."], ['Fires at half the normal fire rate of a familiar.'], ['The familiar is not affected by {{dlc|nr}} [[range]]/{{dlc|r}} [[tear height]], only [[tear falling speed]].', ["{{dlc|r}} Since tear height and shot speed ups lower tear falling speed in order to adjust Isaac's range, increases to either stat will decrease the familiar's range, and decreases to either stat will increase the familiar's range."]]]
synergies: [["{{i|Flat Stone}}: Familiar's tears will travel very far and then bounce once, traveling up and hitting the nearest wall."], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Will fire tears that burst into split tears. Does not affect fire rate.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Will fire explosive tears. Does not affect fire rate.'], ["{{i|Lachryphagy}} + {{i|Brimstone}}: The tears fired by the familiar will eventually explode in a star-like pattern of Brimstone lasers if they don't hit anything."]]
interactions: [["Following tear modifiers do not affect Fate's Reward, and the familiar will only fire normal tears:", ['{{I|Brimstone}}', '{{I|C Section}}', '{{I|Dr. Fetus}}', '{{I|Epic Fetus}}', '{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}', "{{i|Mom's Knife}}", "{{i|Monstro's Lung}}", '{{i|Technology}}', '{{i|Tech X}}']]]

name: Kidney Stone
description: Randomly while firing tears, Isaac will stop firing and turn red, where he will charge and release a lot of 'tears' in one go. The burst of tears also includes a kidney stone, which deals a lot of damage.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} -0.2 [[speed]] and maximum speed.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} -15 [[range]].', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} -17 [[range]].']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +2.0 [[tear falling speed]].', ['{{dlc|na+}} The increased tear falling speed and decreased range results in slightly increased firing distance.', '{{dlc|a+nr}} The increased tear falling speed and decreased range results in nearly identical firing distance.']], ["Occasionally, firing tears will cause Isaac to charge an attack with his head pulsating with a red color. After the attack has charged up, the fire button can be released to fire a kidney stone that does 5 times Isaac's damage and pierces enemies, followed by a rapid, inaccurate spray of tears.", ['This effect occurs approximately every 25 seconds.', "Isaac won't be able to fire tears normally until the kidney stone has been fired.", 'The kidney stone has approximately twice the range of normal tears.', 'The barrage will continue for its full length between [[room]]s, as will the state of charging the attack instead of firing tears.']]]
notes: [['Tints tears red. This is only a cosmetic change.'], ['{{i|Incubus}} will still fire tears normally while retaining the barrage effect, making this a good item for {{C|Lilith}}.', ['The barrage from the Incubus will be in a straight line (similar to {{i|Cursed Eye}}) instead of an inaccurate burst.', 'The kidney stone itself will come out of Lilith, not the Incubus follower, even though she cannot fire tears. The barrage of tears will still only come from the Incubus. This also applies if blindfolded as another character.', 'This is the only item to be able to override the Grayscale easter egg.', 'This item does not appear to work at all for {{Dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Lilith}}.']]]
synergies: [['{{i|Maw of the Void}}: Whenever the kidney stone is fired, the tear barrage will continuously charge and activate Maw of the Void until Isaac can fire normally.'], ['{{I|Rock Bottom}}: The temporary tears up from the kidney stone burst becomes a permanent x6 fire rate multiplier.']]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: Only fires one stone.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: The stone will not hover and will travel regardless.'], ['{{C|Azazel}}/{{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Kidney Stone. {{Dlc|nr}}Speed and range downs still apply.'], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk|force=nr}}: When Kidney Stone activates, it fires one kidney stone and then no more tears until tears stat is under a certain value (unknown).'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Kidney Stone. The range down ({{dlc|r}} or [[tear height]] down) is especially harmful with Dr. Fetus, making self-damage very likely.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Kidney Stone.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: The stone cannot split into smaller stones."], ['{{C|The Forgotten|a+}}: The Forgotten will swing his club rapidly instead of shooting the burst of tears (The Forgotten still fires the stone normally).'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Overridden by Haemolacria. {{Dlc|nr}}Only stat changes apply.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Fires a barrage of Haemolacria tears upon activation']], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: The stone will only spawn sparks when hitting enemies."], ['{{i|Libra}}: Stats are greatly increased during the barrage. {{dlc|nr}}The harsh speed and range down make Libra a large stats down.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Overrides Kidney Stone.'], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: The stone will not grow bigger as it travels, but it will increase in damage.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Occasionally, Isaac will stop automatically firing, and an attack key must be held to release the kidney stone and continue firing.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Kidney Stone."], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Overrides Kidney Stone.", ['When also having {{i|Technology}}, does not override, however the combination of the two items is not properly implemented and sometimes Kidney Stone will prevent Isaac from shooting.']], ["{{i|Number One|force=nr}}: Number One's range down overrides Kidney Stone, for an additional -0.62. The stone is not affected by the range decrease."], ['{{i|Spirit Sword}}: Overrides Kidney Stone.'], ['{{i|Technology|force=nr}}: Overrides Kidney Stone.', ['{{dlc|r}} Fires the stone like normal, followed by a barrage of Technology lasers.']], ['{{i|Tech X|force=anr}}: Overrides Kidney Stone.', ['{{dlc|r}}: Synergizes now, behaving pretty buggy however (look into "bugs" down below).']], ['{{i|Revelation}}: The laser fires automatically at intervals during the tear spray, regardless of whether or not you are holding the fire button.']]

name: D8
description: Re-rolls Isaac's [[damage]], [[tears]], [[range]], and [[speed]].
effects: [["Re-rolls Isaac's [[damage]], [[tears]], [[range]], and [[speed]].", ['Each stat is given a multiplier, ranging from 0.5x to 2.0x, which applies after all other adjustments.']]]
notes: [['[[Luck]], [[Shot Speed]], and {{dlc|nr}} [[Tear Falling Speed]] are unaffected.'], ["The Tears multiplier can cause Isaac's tear delay to decrease beyond the normal cap of 5."], ["The Speed multiplier cannot cause Isaac's speed to decrease or increase past the normal range of 0.1 to 2.0.", ["The multiplier overrides the Speed Up effect of {{i|A Pony}} or {{i|White Pony}}, which normally raise Isaac's Speed to 1.5 if it is below that value.", "{{dlc|nr}} The hidden maximum Speed value also gets the same multiplier, which may further cap Isaac's Speed."]], ["The multipliers are chosen in a way that keeps their total product roughly the same; the item will most often increase two and decrease two of Isaac's stats, although it can increase three and decrease one or increase one and decrease three. Larger increases are balanced by larger decreases."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: Allows affected stats to reach high multipliers, potentially doubling them if used enough.'], ['{{bov}}']]
interactions: [['{{C|Jacob and Esau|r}}: Only the brother using D8 will get their stats rerolled with the exception of Speed, which is shared between both brothers.']]

name: Immaculate Conception
description: Upon picking up a certain amount of [[Hearts|health]], spawn a permanent angelic [[familiar]].
effects: [['Upon picking up enough [[Hearts|heart pickups]], Isaac gains a permanent angelic [[familiar]] and generates a {{E|Soul Heart}} drop. Possible familiars include:', ['{{i|Holy Water}}', '{{i|Guardian Angel}}', '{{i|Sworn Protector}}', '{{i|The Relic}}', '{{i|Seraphim}}']], ['All five familiars will spawn in a random order, each after collecting 15 hearts.'], ['After all familiars have been spawned, a {{E|Soul Heart}} will still drop every 15 hearts collected.'], ['Isaac will look progressively more pregnant as he collects heart pickups.']]
notes: [['All types of hearts except {{E|Gold Heart}}s and {{e|Blended Heart}}s count.'], ['Items that directly add health such as {{i|Yum Heart}}, {{i|Book of Revelations}}, {{i|Satanic Bible}}, and {{i|The Nail}} do not count towards spawning a familiar.'], ['Only one of each type of familiar can be spawned.'], ['{{C|The Lost}} can pick up Soul Hearts and Black Hearts despite having no health and thus can activate Immaculate Conception.'], ['{{C|Keeper}} cannot encounter hearts, thus the item is useless for him.'], ['As the short-lived Half Red Hearts dropped by {{C|Tainted Magdalene}} also count, it is an excellent choice for her since she will constantly be picking up hearts and gain all five familiars quickly.'], ['The familiars spawned by Immaculate Conception will still spawn even if Isaac has already obtained the familiar through their respective pedestal item.'], ['The familiars spawned by Immaculate Conception will not contribute to [[transformations]], such as [[conjoined]].']]
interactions: [['{{i|The Jar}}: Hearts collected in the jar do not count towards activation.']]

name: GB Bug
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms|room]], applying a random [[status effect]] to enemies it hits and has a chance to re-roll [[pickup]]s it passes over.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac. Double tapping the fire button launches it forward, causing it to reroll the first [[monster]] or [[pickup]] it hits.
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} Spawns a [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms|room]], deals 8 damage per tick or 120 damage per second and applies a random [[Status Effects|status effect]] to enemies it comes in contact with. The familiar also has a chance to re-roll [[pickups]] that it passes over into other pickups, {{E|chest}}s, or [[items]], in an uncleared room only (with at least one enemy alive).'], ['{{dlc|r}} Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac. Double tapping the fire button launches it forward, causing it to reroll the first [[monster]], [[Trinkets|trinket]], or [[pickup]] it hits. It respawns after clearing a room.', ['If it cannot reroll an enemy (e.g. a boss), it will deal 8 damage instead.', 'Items and opened chests cannot be rerolled.', 'Pickups have a 10% chance of becoming chests (see [[#Algorithm|the algorithm]]).', ['If a chest is rerolled, it has a 28% chance of staying as some kind of a chest.']]]]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} GB Bug can block projectiles.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} GB Bug does more damage per second than {{i|The Peeper}}, with the added random status chance.'], ['{{dlc|r}} GB Bug is able to reroll {{e|Throwable Bomb|n}}s into normal consumables. After doing so, the corresponding {{e|Bomb Grimace|n}} will generate another Throwable Bomb, making it able to generate a potentially large amount of free consumables.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Rerolled [[champion]] enemies will retain their color, unless they reroll into a monster that cannot naturally spawn as a champion.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Caution is advised as GB Bug can also reroll certain entities such as the hot rock left by a dead {{e|Coal Spider}} adding another enemy to the room.']]
interactions: [['{{T|The Twins}}: The familiar can be duplicated even if it hasn’t respawned; by constantly moving to new rooms, GB Bug can constantly respawn, allowing pickups to be rerolled indefinitely.']]

name: Sworn Protector
description: Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] which does 105 damage per second and attracts and blocks enemy shots. Upon blocking 10 shots in a [[Rooms|room]], it drops an {{E|Eternal Heart}}.
effects: [['Spawns an [[orbital familiar]] that blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second on contact ({{dlc|r}} 53 damage per second).', ["It also attracts enemy shots to itself, making them more likely to be blocked. A shot actively being attracted can no longer damage Isaac and is essentially nullified, but if it slips outside the Protector's range, it can again deal damage."]], ['Sworn Protector has a chance to drop an {{E|Eternal Heart}} upon blocking 10 shots in one [[Rooms|room]].', ['This can only happen once per room, but leaving and re-entering a room will allow another eternal heart to be dropped.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{transf|Seraphim|item}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['Sworn Protector can be exploited with the help of a {{E|Constant Stone Shooter}} to spawn unlimited eternal hearts.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Extension Cord}}: Familiar and Isaac are occasionally connected by electricity, but it is very hard to notice because Sworn Protector orbits so close to Isaac.'], ['{{i|Friendly Ball|n}} / {{i|Poke Go}}: Catching an enemy that shoots bullets allows Eternal Hearts to be farmed since the enemy will fire at Isaac if no other enemies are in the room.']]

name: Tear Detonator
description: When used, will detonate any tears currently on the screen and cause each one to split into 6 more tears which will fire in a circle, similar to Tammy's Head.
effects: [['Once activated, all tears in the air split into 6 more tears in all directions, which retain their damage and shot speed.', ['Luck-based effects from items such as {{i|Tough Love}} or {{i|Holy Light}} are applied individually to each tear.']]]
synergies: [["{{I|Akeldama}}: Will bust tears generated by Akeldama into Isaac's current tears."], ['{{i|Angelic Prism}}: Tears that are split by the prism can be split again by Tear Detonator.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: All tears currently floating in the air will be multiplied, resulting in a massive amount of tears.'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Multiplies the tears, effectively creating dozens of tears.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears that are split can split again into burst tears."], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Splits tears into 6 Haemolacria tears that burst into split tears. If split tears are burst, all of them will split into 6 Haemolacria tears creating an enormous amount of tears when the main tear splits again.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: All tears will split into 6 explosive tears, making it very powerful (but also dangerous unless Isaac has {{i|Host Hat|n}} or {{i|Pyromaniac}}).'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Similar to the Haemolacria synergy, if the main tear splits, 6 tears will spawn that can be fed. However, if burst tears are split, all burst tears will split into 6 tears resulting in an enormous amount of tears that are likely to feed each other.'], ['{{I|Lead Pencil}}: Each of the tears explodes into 6 smaller tears.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear explodes into six smaller tears, then reappears next to the player.'], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: The shrapnel tears will curve back to the location of the original detonated tear.'], ['{{i|Sad Bombs}}: Bomb tears are multiplied.'], ["[[Shooting familiar]]s: Shooting familiars' tears explode into Isaac's tears, with his actual damage and effects."], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears split, and then orbit around where the tear was originally from, three spinning clockwise, three counterclockwise.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Tears split into six beams.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: No matter how charged the tears are, split tears always deal a tiny amount of damage.'], ['{{i|Explosivo}}: Tears that are stuck to enemies will not deal explosion damage; tears released by it may be sticky tears that immediately stick back onto the enemy.']]

name: Mine Crafter
description: Places a {{E|Movable TNT}} barrel that can be pushed and used to destroy rocks or damage enemies. If used again in the same room while the previous TNT barrel is still intact, remotely detonates the TNT.
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} The Movable TNT has a unique cubic appearance, but it functionally identical to a regular Movable TNT.']]
interactions: [["{{i|120 Volt}}: The TNT is spawned and then instantly detonated by 120 Volt's electric shock, inflicting 1 full heart of damage."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Magdalene}}: Tainted Magdalene immediately attempts to hug the TNT upon holding it up, instantly detonating it and dealing damage to her.'], ['{{dlc|na+}} {{i|Car Battery}}: The TNT will be spawned and then instantly explode, dealing a full heart of damage.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Spawns two TNT barrels.']], ["{{i|Midas' Touch}}: Occasionally spawns a golden TNT barrel which turns into a regular movable TNT after 3 seconds. While in its gold state, Isaac cannot collide with the barrel nor push it, although it can be pushed by enemies. In some cases, the golden barrel will explode immediately after spawning, dealing damage to Isaac. Apart from that, it doesn't give any benefits."]]

name: Zodiac
description: Gives Isaac a random [[Signs of the Zodiac|zodiac item]] effect that changes every floor.
effects: [['Gives Isaac a random [[Signs of the Zodiac|Zodiac item]] effect that changes each floor.']]
notes: [['Getting {{i|Capricorn}}, {{i|Cancer}} and {{i|Libra}} does not grant {{E|Penny|display=Coins}}, {{E|bomb}}s, {{E|key}}s or {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Getting {{i|Leo}} will not change Isaac's size."], ['If already in possession of the item given by Zodiac, most have no effect. The only exceptions are {{i|Capricorn}} giving an additional +0.5 damage, and {{i|Gemini}} giving another familiar.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Getting {{i|Virgo}} does not provide the {{i|PHD}} effect for the floor it is obtained. It does grant the chance to trigger a protective shield on taking damage however.']]

name: Toxic Shock
description: Upon entering a room, [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] all enemies, dealing double Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]]. Killing enemies leaves a small, short-lasting pool of [[Creep#Green Creep|green]] [[creep]] on the ground.
effects: [["Upon entering a room, all enemies are [[Status Effects#Poison|poisoned]], dealing double Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] and also creating a green fog for the first few seconds of the room."], ['Killing enemies leaves a small, short-lasting pool of [[Creep#Green Creep|green]] [[creep]] on the ground.', ['The creep deals 1 damage per tick or 30 damage per second.']]]
notes: [['High tear damage will cause this item to become very powerful for rooms with a lot of enemies, since they can die instantly and render the room harmless.'], ['Enemies which spawn after the first few seconds of each room are not affected by this item, e.g. Flies spawned from a {{E|Mulligan}} dying.'], ['Enemies that spawn with some form of invulnerability such as {{E|Host}}s, {{E|Wizoob}}s, or {{E|Needle}}s are not affected by this item.'], ['The poison effect only activates upon entering a room and not at the start of a wave. In {{R|Boss Rush}} and most of [[Greed mode]], the item will not poison enemies.'], ['If Toxic Shock is picked up in the middle of a room with enemies, the mass poison will occur immediately.']]

name: Spider Mod
description: Displays Isaac's tear damage and enemy health bars. Spawns a [[familiar]] that wanders around and inflicts random [[status effect]]s on enemies it touches. Can spawn a {{E|Lil' Battery}}/[[Blue spider]] upon clearing a [[Rooms|room]].
effects: [['Spawns a grey spider [[familiar]] that wanders around and allows Isaac to see tear damage and the health bars of all enemies.', ['The spider will inflict a random [[Effects#Status Effects|status effect]] on any enemies it comes into contact with.', "The spider will sometimes drop a {{E|Lil' Battery}} or spawn a [[Blue Spider]] when a [[Rooms|room]] is completed."]], ['{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} For the sake of simplicity, all damage values shown are multiplied by 10 and rounded up to the nearest number.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Damage values are no longer multiplied or rounded.']], ["All stats effect damage dealt by Spider Mod is based on Isaac's damage stat."], ["Spider Mod reveals {{E|Mega Satan}}'s health bar and is the only way to see his health.", ["{{Dlc|r}} In Repentance, doesn't reveal {{E|Mega Satan}}'s life bar during his second phase anymore.", '{{Dlc+|r}} Spider Mod also reveals the health bar for {{E|Mother}}, the [[Harbingers (Bosses)#Ultra Harbingers|Ultra Harbingers]], and {{E|The Beast}}.{{dlc-}}']], ['Spider Mod shows the health of invincible enemies, holes created by {{E|Little Horn}}, and the golden statue of {{E|Ultra Greed}}.'], ["Spider Mod doesn't show if a segmented enemy has individual segment health like {{E|Larry Jr.}} or a health pool like {{E|Chub}}. Against enemies with invulnerable segments such as {{E|Carrion Queen}} and {{E|Scolex}}, its indicators will not differentiate between damage dealt to invulnerable and vulnerable segments."], ["Spider Mod's damage doesn't account for enemy damage reduction or invulnerability, which means that the damage indicators for {{E|Mushroom}}s, {{E|Stone Grimace}}s, and similar enemies will be inaccurate."], ['{{dlc+|a+}} If Isaac transforms into {{transf|Spider Baby}}, it spawns a spider familiar who works similarly to Spider Mod.{{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Makes Spider Mod bigger and increases the chance for Spider Mod to spawn a battery or blue spider. No effect on stat effect damage.'], ['{{I|Hive Mind}}: Makes Spider Mod bigger. Whether or not this impacts spawn chances or damage is unknown.']]

name: Seraphim
description: Spawns an angel [[familiar]] who follows Isaac and fires [[Tear Effects#Effects|homing tears]] which deal 10 damage and have 75% shot speed.
effects: [['Spawns an angel [[familiar]] who follows Isaac and fires [[Tear Effects#Effects|homing tears]] similar to {{i|Sacred Heart}}, which deal 10 damage at 75% shot speed.'], ['{{dlc+|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}{{dlc-}}\n==In-game Footage==\n{{#ev:youtube|f4qDx64TD2I}}']]

name: Curse of the Tower
description: Upon taking damage, spawns six {{E|Troll Bomb}}s around the room, similar to the effect of {{p|XVI - The Tower}}.
notes: [["Despite appearing as Troll Bombs, the bombs are mechanically identical to player-placed bombs and will benefit from Isaac's bomb-enhancing items."], ['These bombs hurt the player as well as enemies.'], ["Taking damage from the Troll Bombs spawned by Curse of the Tower or any other type of bomb, including Isaac's bombs, will not re-activate the effect."], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Picking up this item will make all health transactions more difficult. {{M|Devil Beggar}}s and {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s will be almost impossible to use because they will very likely be destroyed by bombs.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Taking damage from {{M|Devil Beggar}}s and {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s does not trigger the effect.']], ['The bombs prefer to spawn near the center of the room.'], ['The 6 {{E|Troll Bomb}}s are difficult to dodge in small rooms.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Glitter Bombs}}: Each troll bomb has a chance to spawn a [[pickup]] or a [[trinket]] including [[hearts]] for repeated use.'], ['{{I|The Polaroid}}: If Isaac is damaged when he has half a {{E|red heart}} or less, the shield will activate and protect him from the Troll Bombs.'], ['{{I|Pyromaniac}}: Troll Bombs will heal Isaac instead, allowing for essentially infinite health with proper usage.', ["{{dlc|r}} Due to Pyromaniac being weakened to healing half a heart per explosion in ''Repentance'', this synergy requires {{i|The Wafer}} to continue being effective past [[Chapter 3]]/[[Chapter 3.5]]."]], ['{{I|Remote Detonator}}: The Troll Bombs generated will not explode until Remote Detonator is activated, unlike regular Troll Bombs.'], ['{{T|Safety Scissors}}: The Troll Bombs generated will be converted into bomb pickups rather than exploding.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Blood Oath}}: Not recommended. Spawns 6 Troll Bombs for each {{E|half red heart}} removed, making death highly likely if Isaac does not leave the room immediately after being stabbed by Blood Oath, and leaving the starting room unsafe.'], ['{{I|Bomber Boy}}: Not recommended. The cross pattern explosion makes it very hard to avoid taking damage.'], ['{{i|Mr. Mega}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Scatter Bombs|a+}}: Not recommended. Each Troll Bomb will spawn several smaller bombs upon exploding, making it very hard to avoid taking damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} No visual change can be seen with the Troll Bombs, but the smaller bombs have the sprite of the smaller normal bombs.']]]

name: Mega Bean
description: [[Status Effects#Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies in the current room for a couple of seconds, [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] any enemies near Isaac, and sends a rock wave across the room in the direction Isaac is facing.
effects: [['[[Status Effects#Petrification|Petrifies]] all enemies in the current room for a couple of seconds.'], ['Deals 5 damage and [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] any enemies near Isaac.'], ['Sends out a wave of rocks across the room in the direction Isaac is facing, dealing 10 damage to any enemies it comes in contact with.']]
notes: [['The rock wave can be used to open {{R|Secret Room}}s.'], ['The rock wave can break rocks to fill in gaps.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Ghost Pepper}}: Whenever Mega Bean is used, a fire will be shot out behind Isaac. Two flames will be shot if Isaac also has {{I|Car Battery}}.']]

name: Mom's Box
description: Increases [[luck]] by 1 and doubles the effects of [[trinket]]s while held. When used, drops a random trinket on the ground.
effects: [['Increases [[luck]] by 1 and doubles the effects of [[trinket]]s while held. When used, drops a random trinket on the ground.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|r}} About 68% of all trinkets (129 out of the 188 trinkets in Repentance) are not doubled by this effect or are not applicable.'], ["{{dlc+|r}} This effect stacks additively with {{a|Golden Trinket}}s; holding one with Mom's Box will cause applicable trinkets to have triple the regular effect.{{dlc-}}"]]
synergies: [['{{i|Book of Virtues}}: Spawns a normal wisp with no unique effect.'], ['{{dlc+|a+}} [[Gulp!]] Pill / {{i|Marbles}} / {{i|Smelter}}: Trinket effects are still doubled when permanently applied to Isaac.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{t|NO!}}: Prevents items with quality 0 from appearing.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Void}}: Passive effects of Mom's Box are lost if absorbed."]]

name: Lost Fly
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Spawns fly [[familiar]] that moves in a straight line and circles around the first wall or [[obstacle]] it hits, dealing 105 damage per second on contact.
{{dlc|r}} Spawns fly [[familiar]] that moves in a straight line and circles around the first wall or [[obstacle]] it hits, dealing 56 damage per second and forcing nearby enemies to attack it.
effects: [['Spawns a fly [[familiar]] that moves in a straight line and attaches itself to the first wall or [[Obstacles|obstacle]] it comes into contact within each [[Rooms|room]].', ['The Lost Fly will then move around the room functionally similar to the {{E|Guts}}.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} If any enemies walk into its path, it will deal 7 contact damage per tick or 105 damage per second.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Lost Fly deals 7 contact damage every 7 ticks, or 30 damage per second. Enemies near Lost Fly will target it instead of Isaac.', ['Some enemies that do not normally give chase to Isaac, such as {{E|Mulligan}}s, will chase after the Lost Fly if nearby it.']], ['If the obstacle it is attached to is destroyed then it will continue rolling in the direction it was previously traveling until it meets another wall or obstacle.'], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]

name: Sticky Bombs
description: +5 {{E|bomb}}s. Bombs stick to enemies and spawn 2-4 [[Blue Spider]]s if they kill an enemy.
effects: [['+5 {{E|bomb}}s.'], ['Bombs stick to enemies.'], ["Spawns [[Blue Spider]]s when one of Isaac's bombs kills the enemy it has stuck to."], ['{{Dlc+|r}}{{transf|Spider Baby|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['Sticky Bombs spawn the same amount of spiders even if multiple enemies are killed with a single bomb.'], ["Bombs spawned by {{i|Dr. Fetus}} retain the sticky effect of Sticky Bombs, but having an item that pierces enemies, such as {{i|Death's Touch}}, overrides the effect of Sticky Bombs.", ['Dr. Fetus bombs will not spawn spiders even if they stick to an enemy.']], ['Sticky Bombs can stick to [[Status Effects#Effects|friendly]] enemies.']]

name: Bumbo
description: Spawns a beggar [[familiar]] which picks up any nearby [[coins]], leveling up after collecting several coins. At level 2, Bumbo gains a body. At level 3, it begins to fire tears. At level 4, Bumbo follows enemies and gains contact damage.
notes: [['Level 1-3 Bumbo can fly over pits and [[obstacles]], despite having limbs at level 2 and 3 that serve him as legs.'], ['If Bumbo consumes an absurd amount of coins while level four, Bumbo can become level one again (Unsure if bug, likely a buffer overflow)'], ['If Level 4 Bumbo targets {{E|Mega Satan}}\'s head, Bumbo will attempt to "chase" him the entire fight by standing in the middle of the room.'], ["Level 4 Bumbo's bombs are unaffected by Isaac's bomb synergies."], ['Bumbo cannot pick up {{E|Sticky Nickel}}s and will hover over them. Level 4 Bumbo can eventually bomb the Sticky Nickel to free it.'], ['Bumbo will pick up {{E|Lucky Penny|display=Lucky Pennies}}, without additional benefit to evolution or drops.'], ["If Bumbo drops a pedestal item, it will be pulled from the current room's [[Item Pool|item pool]]."], ["In a [[RERUN]], Bumbo's level is reset."], ['Level 4 Bumbo can target charmed enemies and will try to follow them around to no effect.  This prevents him from picking up coins until the target is changed.'], ['{{Dlc+|r}} There is a similar [[boss]] named {{E|Bumbino}}.{{dlc-}}'], ['From a scoring perspective, Coins that Bumbo picks up count towards your Schwag bonus on daily runs. (only applies to Afterbirth and Afterbirth ✞ dailies)']]
synergies: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Doubles both the contact and shot damage, when applicable.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Box of Friends}}: Will spawn a level 1 Bumbo regardless of the original Bumbo's current level."], ['{{i|Bum Friend}}: The bum friend will follow Bumbo instead of Isaac.'], ['{{C|Keeper}}: Not recommended, as the coins Bumbo collects could have been used to heal Keeper.'], ["{{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Keeper}}: Due to the large influx of coins spawned, it's technically possible to sustain Bumbo while also maintaining a good level of wealth and health."]]

name: God's Flesh
description: Tears have a chance to [[shrink]] enemies, making them run away from Isaac. Shrunk enemies can be crushed and killed by walking over them.
effects: [['Tears now have a 10% chance to apply a [[Status Effects#Effects|shrinking]] effect, causing enemies to shrink in size and also run away from Isaac.', ['Shrunk enemies can be crushed and killed by walking over them.']], ['The shrinking effect lasts 5 seconds.'], ['{{transf|Fun Guy|item}}']]
notes: [['The shrinking effect does not affect bosses or mini-bosses.'], ['Any enemies that are spawned from the death of a shrunken enemy do not carry over the shrunken effect.'], ['[[Champion]]s and enemies that explode upon death will damage Isaac if crushed.'], ['Shrinking the heart of a {{E|Mask + Heart}} will cause its corresponding Mask to shrink as well. The Mask can be crushed and killed separately.'], ['The chance to fire a shrinking tear does not scale with [[Luck]].\n== Synergies =='], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears will retain shrinking effect if main tear had shrinking effect. With Compound Fracture and The Parasite, tears with a shrinking effect look like normal tears."], ['{{i|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the shrinking effect.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Will occasionally fire tears with shrinking effect. All burst tears have a chance to apply the shrinking effect.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear flickers blue, capable of shrinking enemies when it does.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Electricity connected to tears with shrinking effect has a chance to shrink enemies.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears will retain shrinking effect if main tear had shrinking effect. With Compound Fracture and The Parasite, tears with a shrinking effect look like normal tears."], ['{{i|Finger!}}: Finger can also apply the shrinking effect.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Will occasionally fire tears with shrinking effect. All burst tears have a chance to apply the shrinking effect.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear flickers blue, capable of shrinking enemies when it does.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Electricity connected to tears with shrinking effect has a chance to shrink enemies.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Only main tear has a chance to apply a shrinking effect.'], ['{{I|Brimstone}}/{{C|Azazel}}: Brimstone shot becomes blue.']]

name: Teleport 2.0
description: Teleports Isaac to a room that has not been explored yet. Normal rooms are prioritized over special rooms, and common special rooms take priority over rarer ones.
effects: [['Teleports Isaac to a room that has not been explored yet. Normal rooms are prioritized over special rooms, and common special rooms take priority over rarer ones.']]
notes: [['The room that Isaac is teleported into will be touching an explored room, if possible.'], ['When used in a room with enemies in it, Isaac is teleported back into the same room, resetting it.'], ['The order of types of rooms is predetermined, first available on this list chosen:'], ['# {{dlc|a+}} [[Grave Room]]'], ['# Normal rooms'], ['# {{dlc|r}} {{r|Red Room}}s (opened but unexplored)'], ['# {{r|Boss Room}}'], ['# {{r|Super Secret Room}}'], ['# {{r|Shop}}'], ['# {{r|Treasure Room}}'], ['# {{r|Sacrifice Room}}'], ['# {{r|Dice Room}}'], ['# {{r|Library}}'], ['# {{r|Curse Room}}'], ['# {{r|Mini-Boss Room}}'], ['# {{r|Challenge Room}} / {{r|Boss Challenge Room}}'], ['# {{r|Clean Bedroom}} / {{r|Dirty Bedroom}}'], ['# {{r|Arcade}}'], ['# {{r|Vault}}'], ['# {{dlc|r}} {{r|Planetarium}}'], ['# {{r|Secret Room}}'], ['# {{r|Devil Room}} / {{r|Angel Room}}'], ["# {{dlc|r}} {{r|Ultra Secret Room}} ([[Mirrored World]] only, even if it wasn't located)"], ['# {{r|I AM ERROR}} room.'], ['In {{s|Cathedral}} or {{s|Sheol}}, using the I AM ERROR room exit will bring Isaac to The Chest or Dark Room respectively.', ['This works even if Isaac has the wrong corresponding item ({{i|The Polaroid}} / {{i|The Negative}}) for that floor.']], ['In {{s|Chest}}, {{s|Dark Room}}, and {{dlc|r}} {{s|The Void}}, Teleport 2.0 will teleport Isaac to the Devil/Angel room instead of the I AM ERROR room. The same is true when using it on the final floor of a [[Daily Challenges]].'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} In {{s|The Void}}, using Teleport 2.0 in the I AM ERROR room will teleport Isaac to The Void again, allowing the floor to be restarted. The floor regenerates with new rooms and enemies. This can be done multiple times.'], ["A floor's [[Bosses|Boss]] must be defeated in order to access rooms prioritized after the {{r|Boss Room}} with this item.", ['{{dlc|r}} The exception to this is {{s|Corpse}} II, where simply entering the boss room will count the room as cleared. The hole to the {{E|Mother|n}} fight does not need to be entered. This allows the player to use this item to access rooms prioritized after the Boss Room without needing to fight Mother.']], ["{{dlc|r}} Using Teleport 2.0 in the [[Ascent]] sequence will teleport Isaac to the Angel/Devil Room if all other rooms have been explored. After returning from the Angel/Devil Room, using the Teleport 2.0 again will teleport Isaac to the I AM ERROR room. If it's instead used without exploring any rooms, Isaac will be teleported to the 'starting' room of the floor containing the beam of light up to the next floor.", ['This strategy also works in {{Stage|Home}}, taking Isaac to an Angel/Devil Room if all rooms have been explored. Isaac cannot use this to reach the hidden closet room containing Tainted characters, however. Using it after visiting the Angel/Devil Room will not teleport Isaac to the I AM ERROR room, and will instead merely teleport to the same Angel/Devil Room again.']], ['{{dlc|r}} Using Teleport 2.0 during the {{E|The Beast|n}} fight will teleport Isaac to a random spot on the screen without interrupting the fight.'], ["{{dlc|r}} In the [[Mirrored World]], Isaac will teleport to the {{r|Ultra Secret Room}} before the I AM ERROR room. Although it's empty like any other special room inside the Mirror, this can be useful to find the room in the normal world with {{i|Red Key|n}}.", ['If used again in the Mirrored World, Isaac will teleport to the {{r|Red Room|no link}} which leads Isaac back to the main floor; if used once again, Isaac will teleport to the I AM ERROR room of the normal, non-mirrored floor.']], ["{{dlc|r}} After killing {{e|Mom's Heart}} in {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} II, Teleport 2.0 will teleport Isaac to the I AM ERROR room with hole leading to {{s|Corpse}}, even if there are unexplored rooms on the floor."]]

name: Crown of Light
description: +2 {{E|soul heart}}s. While Isaac has no empty [[Health#Red Heart Containers|red hearts]], grants 2x [[damage]], increased [[range]], and -0.3 [[shot speed]]. Regardless of health, the crown deactivates for the current room when Isaac takes damage.
effects: [['Grants 2 {{E|Soul Heart}}s.'], ['Replaces normal tears with blue diamond tears while Isaac has no damaged [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart containers]] or {{E|Bone Heart}}s.', ["This includes whenever Isaac doesn't have any Red Heart containers.", 'The coin health of {{C|Keeper}} and {{C|Tainted Keeper}} count as red heart containers for the purposes of this item.']], ['While the effect is active, grants the following stats:', ['2x [[damage]].', '{{dlc|nr}} +5.25 [[range]].', '{{dlc|r}}+1.50 [[range]].', '{{dlc|nr}}+0.5 [[tear falling speed]].', '-0.30 [[shot speed]].']], ['The crown will glow blue while active; if inactive, it will appear grey.'], ["The effect will deactivate for the rest of the current room when damage is taken, regardless of Isaac's health.", ["Fighting waves in [[Greed Mode]] won't reactivate the crown."]]]
notes: [['Because the effect occurs if Isaac has no Red Heart containers at all, this is an extremely beneficial item for {{C|???}}, {{C|Tainted ???}}, {{C|The Lost}}, {{C|Tainted Lost}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Bethany}} and {{c|Tainted Forgotten}}.'], ['Due to the fact that they will be at full health a larger portion of the time than most characters, this item is also very powerful for {{C|Keeper}} and {{C|Tainted Keeper}}.'], ['If the damage is lost with {{C|Tainted Isaac}}, he can pick up another item in the same room and then swap it back to refresh the effect.  Holding onto pedestal generation like {{I|Mystery Gift}} will allow him to place an item inside a difficult boss room and regain the bonus damage after being hit.'], ['Using {{P|XI - Strength}} when already at a maximum 12 hearts, but having taken damage (hence visually having full maximum health) will not reactivate the item.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Holy Mantle}}: This will block damage and keep Crown of Light active.'], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: While the diamond tear effect will disappear when Isaac is hit, the damage up will not be reverted.']]

name: Black Powder
description: Isaac leaves a trail of black powder on the floor. Walking in a circle will spawn a pentagram symbol on the floor, which deals 10 damage per tick to any enemies inside it.
notes: [['The trail of black powder left on the floor will quickly disappear, meaning that there is an effective limit to the size of the pentagram that can be created, though bigger pentagrams can be created if the player has higher movement speed.'], ['The traced pattern does not have to be even nearly circular: closed shapes such as squares or very narrow crescents will work, with some luck and practice.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Ventricle Razor}}: When the Ventricle Razor portals are placed on the opposite wall of a room and Isaac goes from one portal to another, a pentagram symbol can be created which covers almost the whole room.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Lost Cork|force=a+nr}}: Although the powder trail is wider in appearance, it has no effect on how easily a valid shape is determined.']]

name: Obsessed Fan
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's movements on a delay and deals 30 contact damage per second to enemies.
effects: [["Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's movement with a 3-second delay and deals 2 contact damage to enemies per tick (30 damage per second).", ['{{dlc|r}} The fly follows Isaac on a 0.66 second delay instead.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['If other familiars that move with a similar pattern such as {{i|Multidimensional Baby}} have been collected before the Obsessed Fan, it will follow them instead with further delay.']]

name: Head of the Keeper
description: Isaac's tears become coins and now have a chance to drop [[Coins#Penny|Pennies]] on the floor upon successfully hitting an enemy.
effects: [["Enemies have a 5% chance to drop a {{E|Penny}} when hit with Isaac's tears.", ['The chance is not affected by [[Luck]].']], ["Turns Isaac's tears into coins (cosmetic effect)."]]
notes: [['{{Dlc|r}} As of Repentance, the only way of finding Head of the Keeper is by bombing Shopkeepers or using {{I|Spindown Dice|n}} on {{I|Papa Fly}}.'], ['Does not produce coins other than Pennies.'], ["Hitting the front side of enemies such as the {{E|Knight}} will still produce Pennies, even though the enemy does not sustain any damage. This can be exploited to produce an infinite amount of Pennies from a single enemy. This however doesn't work with lowered [[Host]]s.", ['Enemies that spawn other enemies, {{E|Globin}}s, or enemies that regain health can also be farmed for infinite money.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Head of the Keeper does not work with {{C|The Forgotten}} but will work with {{C|The Soul}}.'], ['When used against {{E|Ultra Greed}}, the coins are spawned directly in front of him and will thus heal him very often.']]
synergies: [['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear turns into a giant rotating coin.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Every tear in the burst of tears can spawn coins."], ['{{T|Nuh Uh!}}: From Chapter 4 and beyond, any coins spawned will be from the loot table of Nuh Uh! instead, with an occasional harmless black fly spawning.'], ['{{I|Sack Head}}: Coins spawned from hitting enemies have a chance to become sacks.'], ["{{i|Soy Milk}}: Due to the Soy Milk's high fire rate and low damage, enemies can be hit many more times than usual, resulting in a larger amount of coins dropping."], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Coin tears are connected via electricity. Beams of electricity can cause enemies to drop coins.'], ["{{i|Technology 2}}: Due to Technology 2's constant fire rate ({{Dlc|nr}} and reduced damage), enemies are hit many more times than usual, resulting in a higher likelihood of coins dropping."]]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper.', ["{{Dlc|nr}} This includes {{C|Azazel}}'s short-ranged Brimstone.", "{{dlc|r}} Makes the laser yellow and upon a tick has a chance to drop a coin. Applies to both normal Brimstone and Azazel's Brimstone."]], ["{{i|Death's Touch}}: Tears retain Death's Touch's cosmetic effect but both items are fully active."], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Bombs spawned via Dr. Fetus have a chance to spawn coins when exploding an enemy.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Missiles dropped by Epic Fetus have a chance to spawn coins when exploding an enemy.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Euthanasia}}: Main tears can cause enemies to drop Pennies; however, burst tears do not.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Burst tears have a chance to generate coins.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Haemolacria}}: Only the main tear retains the effect of Head of the Keeper.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears split from the main tear will generate coins.']], ["{{i|Ipecac}}: Because Ipecac's high damage will quickly kill enemies, and because enemies will often be hit with explosions rather than tears themselves, Pennies will not drop as frequently."], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper.", ['{{dlc|r}} Knife has a very low chance to drop coins.']], ["{{i|Sulfuric Acid}}: Tears retain Head of the Keeper's cosmetic effect but both items are fully active. Which tears are acidic can no longer be visually identified."], ['{{i|Technology}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper.', ['{{dlc|r}} Laser turns yellow and has a chance to drop a penny upon damaging an enemy.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Laser rings turn yellow and have a chance to drop a penny on each tick while damaging an enemy.']], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Overrides Head of the Keeper. Coin debris will still appear after beams dissipate.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Trisagion now has the potential to generate coins with each tick of the beam.']]]

name: Papa Fly
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's movements on a 3 second delay, firing tears at nearby enemies.
effects: [["Spawns a blue fly [[familiar]] that will follow Isaac's movement with a 1-second delay and fires tears at nearby enemies.", ['{{dlc|r}} Papa fly follows Isaac on a 0.66 second delay instead.']], ["Papa Fly's tears deal Isaac's damage, and are fired once per second."], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Multidimensional Baby}}: Papa Fly will always shoot two shots due to both of them having the same movement delay.'], ["{{I|ipecac}}: Each Papa Fly shot will do massive damage thanks to Ipecac's large damage increase."]]

name: Lil Loki
description: Spawns a Loki [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and fires 4 tears in a cross pattern.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that looks like {{E|Loki}} and follows Isaac, firing tears in all four cardinal directions that deal 3.5 damage.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Lil Loki shoots once per second.', '{{dlc|r}} Lil Loki shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.']], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['If an enemy is standing inside of Lil Loki, all four shots will hit it for a total of 14 damage.']]

name: Milk!
description: Spawns a glass [[familiar]] that spills on the floor upon taking damage. {{dlc|nr}} After the milk spills, Isaac's [[tear delay]] is decreased by 2 for the current [[room]]. {{dlc|r}} After the milk spills, Isaac's [[fire rate]] is increased by 1 for the current [[room]].
effects: [['Spawns a glass [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and spills on the floor upon taking damage.'], ['When the milk spills, Isaac receives -2 [[Attributes#Tear Delay|tear delay]] ({{dlc|r}} +1.0 [[fire rate]]) (increased rate of fire) until leaving the [[Rooms|room]].', ["Direct tear delay reduction can take Isaac's tears stat below the normal soft cap of 5."]], ['The milk puddle is purely visual, and will stay on the ground for a few seconds before disappearing. The familiar will reappear in the next room.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Box of Friends}}: The milk familiar is not duplicated; instead, tear delay decreases by 2 upon use even if the player has not taken damage in the current room.', ['{{dlc|r}} No extra tear delay is granted, neither before or after breaking.']], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: If activated at least once, the increased rate of fire will always be active.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Familiar is bigger but no effect on tear delay.']]

name: Mega Blast
description: Upon use, Isaac fires a laser similar to the one used by {{E|Mega Satan}}. This laser deals massive damage, lasts for approximately 15 seconds, and persists between rooms. Isaac is pushed backwards by the force of the laser while it is active.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac fires a giant, incredibly powerful blood laser, similar to the one used by {{e|Mega Satan}}, for 15 seconds.', ["The beam deals Isaac's current damage multiplied by 5 per tick.", 'The beam has enough power to push Isaac backward while being fired and will last between rooms, and across multiple floors.', 'The beam has spectral and piercing effects.', 'The beam can be moved while firing in many angles diagonally.', 'While Mega Blast is being fired, Isaac cannot:', ['Open {{E|chest}}s.', "Pick up a {{E|Lil' Battery}}, collectibles, [[pill]]s, [[trinket]]s, or [[Cards and Runes|cards or runes]].", 'Pick up the trophy or enter the chest that spawns after defeating a final boss.', 'Sleep in a [[bed]].'], 'The laser extinguishes fires, detonates TNT, and destroys poop.']]]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}} Picking up a {{E|Lil' Battery}} with this item will add 3 to its charge, meaning that 4 batteries are required to fully recharge the item.", ['{{dlc|a+nr}} A {{E|Charged Key|n}} will only add 3 charges.', ["{{E|Lil' Battery|r}}  and Charged Key add 6 charges instead of 3."], '{{dlc|r}} Picking up a {{E|Mega Battery|n}} will fully charge it twice.']], ['Using a [[48 Hour Energy]] pill with this item will fully charge it.'], ['Mega Blast has an 80% decreased item pool weight, making it less likely to appear than other collectibles.'], ['To unlock Mega Blast, Mega Satan must be defeated with all 13 characters.', ['{{dlc|a+}} Requires defeating Mega Satan as all 15 characters (Now including{{C|Apollyon}} and {{C|The Forgotten}}).', ['{{Dlc|r}} Requires defeating Mega Satan as all 17 non-tainted characters. (Now including {{C|Bethany}} and {{C|Jacob and Esau}})']]], ['{{dlc|r}} It is not recommended to use Mega Blast in fight with {{E|The Beast}}, because its beam forces you into obstacles on the level.', ["This can be mitigated to a degree with {{I|Anima Sola}}, especially with a {{I|Car Battery}} which doubles the Anima Sola's length. The Beast won't be able to spawn obstacles while chained."]]]
synergies: [['{{i|4.5 Volt}}: Item will gain charges for dealing damage, which is especially effective when fighting bosses with large health pool.'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Hemoptysis}}: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the beam deals to 10x and +3 flat damage (instead of just 5x). Enemies who die to the beam under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies. The sneeze can be activated while Mega Blast is firing.'], ['{{i|Schoolbag}}: Beam will continue to fire when switching to another active item. Other active items can be used while the beam is firing.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Angelic Prism}}: The beam does not split.'], ['{{i|Anti-gravity}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{T|Hairpin}} / {{I|Sol}}: Only grants 3 charges.'], ['{{i|Incubus}}: Familiar fires normal tears while Mega Blast is in use.']]

name: Deep Pockets
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Allows Isaac to carry two [[Cards and Runes|cards]] or [[pills]] (or a combination of both) at the same time.
{{dlc|r}} Increases the [[coin]] cap to 999. If a room would otherwise yield no reward, 1-3 coins will spawn.
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} This item has the same effects as {{i|Little Baggy}} and {{i|Starter Deck}}, but without removing pills/cards from the game.'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} This item has the same effect as {{i|Polydactyly|n}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Has no effect on spawning coins in [[Greed mode]], including the trapdoor/exit room.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Losing this item while holding more than 99 coins will reduce coin count to 99. Picking it back up again (if playing as{{C|Tainted Isaac}}, for example) will not restore lost coins.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}}{{i|A Dollar}}: Allows Isaac to gain the full 100 coins when picking this up.'], ["{{i|Greed's Gullet|r}}: After exceeding 100 coins, Isaac gains an extra [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Heart Container]] for every 100 coins instead of every 25.", ['{{C|Keeper}}/{{C|Tainted Keeper}}: The limit of 12 heart containers can be bypassed, allowing for up to 15 [[Health#Coin Hearts|coin hearts]] at 999 coins. Additional coin hearts past 12 are not displayed.']], ['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Money {{=}} Power}}: Increases maximum [[damage]] bonus. The damage caps at +39.96 damage with 999 coins.'], ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Midas' Touch}}: Increases maximum contact damage. The damage caps at 203.3 damage with 999 coins."], ['{{i|Options?}}: A [[pickup]], card, pill, [[trinket]], or {{E|Chest}} will accompany each coin.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc+|r}}{{i|Diplopia}}: No effect. Coin cap remains at 999, and no extra coins drop after completing rooms.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{t|Perfection}}: Possibly detrimental. Since room clear rewards become very common at high luck, the 1-3 coin drop will rarely occur.']]

name: Void
description: Consumes all pedestal items in the room. Active items will have their effects added to Void, and passive items will grant random stat upgrades.
effects: [['Upon use, destroys all pedestal items in the room. Items that require payment can not be absorbed unless they are bought first.', ["If Void destroys an [[active item]], it gains the activated ability of that item - whenever Void is used, it will simultaneously use all previous active items that were absorbed in the same order they were absorbed. Passive effects of absorbed active items will not apply (i.e. the passive effect of {{i|Mom's Box}}).", 'If Void destroys a [[passive item]], Isaac gains 2 random stat boosts. Possible stat changes include:', ['+1 flat [[Damage]]', '{{dlc|nr}} +0.5 [[Tears]]', '{{dlc|r}} +0.5 [[Fire Rate]], which can exceed the normal maximum tears limit.', '+0.2 [[Speed]]', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0)'], '+0.2 [[Shot Speed]]', '+1 [[Luck]]', '+0.5 [[Range]] ({{dlc|r}}+1.5 Range)', 'If speed or tears are at their maximum and are chosen, there will be no visible increase.', ['{{Dlc|r}} This still applies to the tears stat, however it is more difficult to see as the hard tear cap has been increased to 120.']]]]]
notes: [['{{c|Apollyon}} starts with this item by default.'], ['Using Void to absorb items in {{r|Boss Rush}} or {{r|Challenge Room}}s counts as taking the items and will cause waves of bosses or enemies to start spawning.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The ability of the newly absorbed active item(s) will activate even if the item has no charge. Using any multiple-use item before absorbing it with Void will effectively allow Isaac to use the item twice.'], ['{{dlc|r}} If Void is used while Isaac is holding an item above his head, it can still consume the item, allowing to immediately absorb passive items bought from {{r|Devil Room}}s, {{r|Black Market}}s, or {{r|Shop}}s.
