This also can be used to give Isaac a chance to see what an unknown item is before deciding if he wants to consume it, in the case of an active {{cu|Blind}} or a {{r|Treasure Room}} in {{s|Downpour}}, etc.', ['This mechanic can be used to absorb familiars granted by {{p|Soul of Lilith}}.', 'Active items can also be absorbed this way if Isaac has {{I|Schoolbag}} and is not carrying a second active item.']], ["{{dlc|r}} The newly absorbed active item(s) won't be used right away, but with the next usage of Void."], ['{{dlc|r}} If Isaac absorbs items from a room with choice pedestals, it will only absorb one item, and the other item vanishes as if Isaac took it.'], ['If Isaac finds another Void, such as during a [[Victory Lap]] where it is left behind in the previous lap, it will have the same active effects stored in it as the other Void.', ['Consuming a second Void will create no effect.', 'Using {{i|Genesis}} resets Void, stripping it of any extra active effects even if it is not currently held by Isaac.']], ['If multiple copies of an active item are absorbed, using Void will activate that effect equally many times.'], ['Stat boosts upon destroying passive items are determined by the seed and are tied to the number of items destroyed, not the items themselves. If Isaac runs the same seed and chooses to consume different passive items, the same stat boosts will be gained.', ["{{dlc|r}}Void's RNG is advanced once after each usage, so using Void will change what stat boosts you gain."]], ['Stat boosts are permanent and are retained if Void is dropped.'], ['Using Void to absorb {{i|Key Piece 1}} and {{i|Key Piece 2}} will not permanently remove them from the run. They will continue to spawn after defeating {{e|Uriel}} or {{e|Gabriel}} no matter how many times Isaac uses Void on them, as long as he does not pick them up normally.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Alabaster Box}}: Allows the box to be charged through normal means, rather than by absorbing soul hearts.'], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Breath of Life}}: Immediately grants invincibility frames.', ['{{T|Panic Button}}: Getting hit with Breath of Life stored inside Void will negate the damage.']], ['{{i|Crooked Penny|nr}}: Using Void with the Crooked Penny absorbed will result in items in the room being absorbed as usual, but afterwards new copies of the items or one coin are spawned.', ['{{Dlc|r}} If Crooked Penny deletes the contents of the room, they will not be consumed by Void.']], ['{{I|Eraser}}: Allows the Eraser to be used multiple times per floor.'], ['{{i|Glass Cannon}}: Can be used without it ever breaking or causing damage to the player.'], ["{{i|More Options|nr}} / {{i|There's Options|nr}}: Using Void will cause both items to be absorbed."]]
interactions: [["{{i|Abyss}}: Since consumed activated items are used before absorbing new items in a room, using Void with Abyss stored inside will destroy pedestals with Abyss' effect first, essentially overriding Void's item consumption effects. Previously consumed active items will still function as normal when using Void. Passive items can still be consumed with Void by picking them up before using Void."], ['{{i|Blank Card}} + {{p|? Card}}: Using the ? Card with an absorbed Blank Card simply activates Void. Isaac will not be teleported to the {{r|I AM ERROR}} room and Void will not be deleted.'], ['{{t|Broken Remote}} / {{i|Teleport!}} / {{i|Teleport 2.0|n}} / {{i|Undefined}} / any other teleport method: Void will still consume any item pedestals in the room, after which the teleport occurs.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{i|Clear Rune}} + {{p|Soul of Lilith}}: The familiar that the latter generates will immediately be consumed by Void.{{dlc-}}'], ["{{dlc|a+nr}}{{i|Clicker}}: If Void is either Isaac's only item or the item most recently picked up, it will be lost upon absorbing due to Clicker activating.", ['{{dlc|r}}If on the next usage of Void no new items have been found, Void will be deleted.']], ['{{i|The D6}} / {{I|d100}}: If absorbed while there are other pedestal items in the room, it will reroll the items before absorbing them. Likewise, if The D6 or D100 was previously absorbed and Void is used, pedestal items will get rerolled before being absorbed.'], ['{{I|D Infinity|nr}}: When absorbed and Void is used, replicates the effect of a random die item.', ['{{dlc|r}} Acts as a copy of one of the 10 dice {{I|D Infinity}} can replicate. This die is randomly chosen and does not change.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Diplopia}} / {{i|Forget Me Now}} / {{i|Pandora's Box}} / {{i|Mama Mega!}} / {{i|Mystery Gift}} / any single-use active item: They are used once upon being absorbed, but their effects are not absorbed and will not activate with subsequent Void uses.", ["{{dlc|r}} Single-use items won't be used upon their absorption, instead being invoked on the next usage of the Void, which allows Isaac to use the absorbed item later when needed. Their effects will still only be invoked once.", ['{{I|Car Battery}} As Void will be activated twice, single-use items are immediately used when absorbed.'], '{{I|Diplopia|r}}: On the next use, the pedestal items in the room will be consumed but another copy of the items will be spawned afterward.', ['{{i|Diplopia|n}} + {{i|Mystery Gift|n}}: If both items are absorbed in the same room, the next use of Void will only trigger Diplopia, with the use afterward activating Mystery Gift']]], ['{{I|Everything Jar}}: Consuming Everything Jar will cause Void to spawn a poop when used, regardless of charge level.'], ["{{i|Flip}}: When consumed by Void, it doesn't create ghost pedestals."], ['{{i|Genesis}}: All effects granted by absorbed items including stat ups and [[active item]] abilities Void takes are removed without creating items to replace them. Since Void is stripped of any active item abilities it would have gained, any other Void found will also have no other active effects stored in it.', ["Void's active effects are reset even if Isaac is currently not holding it."]], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Glowing Hour Glass}}: Upon using Void, Isaac is sent to the previous room and most changes are reverted, nullifying many other effects that Void may have absorbed. If the Glass is absorbed in a shop, Isaac is sent back to the previous room, but the Glass will be unused in the shop on its pedestal. This allows for an infinite shop donation circle, eliminating the need for a battery to be present in the shop.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Charges are reset back to full upon each use, allowing for infinite re-tries of any room. This does, however, prevent any other items consumed previously from being invoked, and usually prevents Isaac from absorbing new items.']], ['{{i|The Jar}}: Absorbing it with Void will not allow Isaac to pick up excess hearts.'], ['{{i|Jar of Flies}}: Absorbing it with the Void will not allow the collection and generation of flies.'], ['{{i|Jar of Wisps}}: Each use will spawn only one wisp.'], ['{{i|Moving Box}}: Moving Box will not be added to Void; instead, it is converted into stat boosts like a passive item.'], ['{{i|Remote Detonator}}: Absorbing it with Void does not cause bombs to remain on the ground until Void is used, but using Void explodes all player-placed bombs as usual.'], ['{{I|Telekinesis}}: Telekinesis effect will trigger anytime the Void will be used.'], ['{{I|Sharp Key}}: Using the Void will cause Isaac to shoot a key the next time he will press the fire key. Keys are consumed as always.'], ['{{i|Spin to Win}}: A spinning top orbital will spawn every time the Void is used. The orbitals will last until Isaac leaves the room.'], ["{{i|Stitches}}: Absorbing it with the Void won't do anything since the familiar doesn't spawn."]]

name: Smelter
description: Consumes Isaac's currently held [[trinket]] and applies its effect permanently.
effects: [['Upon use, any [[trinket]]s that Isaac is holding are destroyed, and their effects are permanently applied to him.', ["{{dlc|r}} Trinkets that are absorbed show up on the HUD's item tracker."]], ['Increases the chance for a trinket to drop. (Has a 2% chance to turn the pickup variant into a trinket.)']]
notes: [["While held, {{i|Mom's Box}} will double the effect of all absorbed trinkets (if their effects can be doubled)."], ['This item can remove the {{t|Tick}}.'], ['Trinkets whose effects only activate once, such as {{t|Store Credit}}, {{t|Missing Poster}}, and {{t|Walnut}}, will still only activate once after being absorbed.'], ['{{t|Perfection}} is still removed if Isaac takes damage from regular sources.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{T|Faded Polaroid}} cannot be used to open {{A|A Strange Door}} if smelted.{{dlc-}}'], ['It is possible to find previously smelted trinkets during a [[Victory Lap]], or if the trinket Item Pool is exhausted.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Picking up a copy of a trinket which was already absorbed will not duplicate that trinket's effect."], ['{{dlc|nr}} The trinket will not be absorbed if Smelter is activated during the pickup animation.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{I|Glyph of Balance}}: Allows a trinket to appear every time there's a room clear drop as long as the other room clear drop criteria aren't satisfied, as it empties the trinket slot."]]

name: Finger!
description: Spawns a finger [[familiar]] that points at enemies, dealing scaling damage.
notes: [["Finger! will fire in the exact direction it's pointed, meaning it can be fired diagonally, or at any angle, if using a controller - the same effect as {{I|Analog Stick}}."], ['The beam can be used to destroy {{E|TNT}} (among other destructible obstacles).'], ['The Finger! does not do contact damage.']]
synergies: [["{{I|BFFS!}}: Doubles the finger's damage, but does not affect its lasers' thickness."], ['{{I|Box of Friends}}: Adds another finger on top of the previous one, effectively doubling its damage.'], ['Finger!: Multiple fingers will stack on top of each other and move simultaneously, effectively boosting the damage of the original one.', ['Having too many fingers can cause the game to lag.']], ['{{Transformation|Guppy}}: Flies are generated from the damage the finger does.'], ['{{I|Ipecac}}: The finger gains massive damage boost as expected.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} The finger can [[poison]] enemies.']], ['{{I|Proptosis}}:', ["{{Dlc|nr}} Almost doubles the finger's damage as expected. Has no damage penalty with range.", "{{Dlc|r}} Triples the finger's damage, but does not affect its lasers' thickness. Has no penalty with range."]], ['{{I|Sulfuric Acid}} / {{I|Terra}}: The finger has a chance to destroy rocks when pointing at them.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Godhead}}: Only increases damage.'], ["[[Homing tears]]: The finger's lasers do not become homing."], ["{{I|A Lump of Coal}}: No effect on the finger's damage."], ['{{I|Marked}}: While actively aiming, the finger behaves as normal and while fire keys are not pressed, it points towards the targeting crosshair.'], ['{{I|Trinity Shield}}: When not firing, the finger will point towards the nearest cardinal direction as to where the shield is left. This favors the vertical directions when the shield is at a 45° angle.'], ["{{I|Trisagion}}: No effect on the finger's damage."]]

name: Lil Monstro
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that fires clusters of tears. Must be charged before shooting.

name: Depression
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that leaves a trail of [[creep]] that damages enemies at 6 damage per second. Has a chance to spawn damaging beams of light onto enemies that touch the cloud.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and leaves a trail of [[blue creep]] that damages enemies.', ['The creep deals 2 damage per tick or 6 damage per second to non-flying enemies.']], ['If the cloud touches an enemy, it has a small chance to spawn a damaging {{I|Holy Light}} beam onto the enemy.', ["The light beams deal 20 + Isaac's tear damage per tick and may strike an enemy up to 8 times."]]]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Increase cloud size but does not increase damage.']]

name: Eucharist
description: An {{R|Angel Room}} door will always spawn after every boss fight, excluding the first floor and floors after {{s|Womb}} II/{{s|Utero}} II/{{s|Scarred Womb II}}.
notes: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Eucharist applies two effects. Like {{i|Goat Head}}, it fixes the [[Devil Room#Conditions to make Devil Rooms appear|Devil Room chance]] at 100%, which forces an Angel/Devil Room to spawn whenever it can; it also fixes the [[Angel Room#Angel Room Generation Chance|Angel Room chance]] at 100%, so the game always chooses an Angel door over a Devil door.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Now instead fixes the Angel Room chance at 100%, and the Devil Room chance at 0%.']], ['If the Devil Room has been visited before picking up Eucharist, an Angel Room will not replace it, despite the Angel Room chance displaying 100%.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Duality}}: Both Angel and Devil Room doors spawn after every boss, and the selected door will never disappear.', ['This is the only way to encounter Devil deals while possessing Eucharist.']], ['{{t|Filigree Feather}}: Due to Angel Rooms being guaranteed, a large influx of items can be obtained over time.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Goat Head}}: Overridden by Eucharist.']]

name: Poke Go
description: Upon entering a room with enemies in it, has a chance to spawn a random [[friendly]] enemy that persists across rooms.
notes: [['The effect is not activated upon entering the main room of [[Greed Mode]], neither when fighting the waves, making it nearly useless.'], ['Multiple friendly enemies can spawn at the same time.'], ['For enemies that spawn other enemies, the spawned enemies will also be friendly.'], ['Enemy variants may spawn.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Eraser}}: Enemies erased via Eraser will never spawn again. This can be a detriment if Vises are erased, as it greatly reduces the usefulness of Poke Go.']]

name: Brown Nugget
description: Spawns a stationary fly turret that fires tears at nearby enemies.
effects: [['Spawns a stationary fly turret that shoots at enemies up to 3 tiles away'], ['The flies are completely invulnerable and ignored by enemies.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The flies deal 2 damage per shot.', ['{{dlc|r}} The flies deal 3.5 damage per shot.']], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{transf|Oh Crap|item}}{{dlc-}}']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} A maximum of 35 flies can be spawned in one room.', ['{{dlc|r}} A maximum of 64 flies can be spawned in one room.']], ['Flies spawned by Brown Nugget as{{C|Tainted Lazarus}} will disappear when flipping to his other form, and will not reappear when flipping back.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Two flies will be spawned instead of one.'], ['{{i|BFFS!}}: Flies are larger, but do not deal increased damage.', ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|BFFS!}}: Flies are larger and deal double damage. Can only be doubled once.']], ['{{i|Hive Mind}}: No effect.', ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Hive mind}}: Flies are larger and deal double damage. Can only be doubled once']], ['{{I|Sacrificial Altar|nr}}: Spawned fly turrets count as familiars for sacrificing; although dropping the Brown Nugget will despawn the last fly turret, older ones will remain and can be sacrificed.', ['{{dlc|r}} Spawned fly turrets count as regular blue flies for sacrificing, and thus are converted to pennies.']]]

name: Clicker
description: Transforms Isaac into a random character and removes the last item collected.
notes: [['Clicker can only transform Isaac into characters that have already been unlocked, along with {{C|Dark Judas}} and {{C|Lazarus Risen}}, who are counted as separate from {{C|Judas}} and {{C|Lazarus}} respectively. {{C|The Forgotten}} and {{C|The Soul}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Jacob and Esau}},{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Lazarus}} and {{dlc|r}} {{C|Dead Tainted Lazarus}}, and {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Forgotten}} and {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Soul}} are all counted as inherently linked dual-characters.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Non-tainted characters can only transform into other non-tainted characters, and tainted characters can only transform into other tainted characters.'], ['It is possible for the Clicker to choose the same character as the one that is already being played as, making it seem like the item created no effect at all.'], ['Transforming into a new character does not grant Isaac the starting items of the new character unless they are inherent to the character. For example, transforming into {{C|Cain}} does not grant {{i|Lucky Foot}}.'], ['Health is conserved between characters.', ['All [[Red Heart container]]s will be lost, and all {{E|bone heart}} containers will be emptied when changing into {{C|???}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Dark Judas}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted ???}}, {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Judas}} or {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}. They will gain a {{E|half Soul Heart}} if they would otherwise have no health.', 'All health will be lost when changing into {{C|The Lost}}. Changing from The Lost to any other character will leave them with a {{E|half Soul Heart}}.', '{{dlc|a+nr}} {{C|Keeper}} will always start with 2 [[Coin Heart]] containers. Bone and Half Soul/Black Hearts will be rounded up to 1 or 2 filled coins. Red Hearts are not rounded which allows him to have half Coin Hearts. Changing from Keeper to any other character will turn his Coin Hearts into Red Hearts.', ['{{dlc|r}} All Red Heart containers are converted to Coin Heart containers when transforming into Keeper, with a minimum of 2 and up to a maximum of 3. Only red hearts will determine if the coin heart containers are filled or not, and Soul/Black hearts will be converted into blue flies. One coin heart container will be filled if he would otherwise have no health. Changing from Keeper to any other character will turn his Coin Hearts into Red Hearts.'], "Changing into {{C|The Forgotten}} will not affect {{C|The Soul}}'s health. Red Hearts are converted into {{E|Bone Heart}}s. Soul/Black Hearts will be lost. He will gain an empty Bone Heart if he would otherwise have no health.", '{{dlc|r}} All soul hearts will be converted to soul charges when changing into {{C|Bethany}}. She will gain one full Red Heart container if she would otherwise have no health. Changing from Bethany to any other character will convert her soul charges into soul hearts.', "{{dlc|r}} Heart Containers will be divided evenly and split up when changing into {{C|Jacob and Esau}}. Changing from Jacob and Esau to any other character will leave them with Jacob and Esau's combined health."]], ['Activating Clicker typically only consumes passive items, but with {{i|Schoolbag}} it can consume the item in the other activated item slot if that item was the most recently collected.'], ["Similarly to items such as {{i|Judas' Shadow}} and {{i|Lazarus' Rags}}, any [[completion mark]]s obtained will correspond with the character the Clicker turns you into.", ["{{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Cain}} can craft the Clicker and other useful items and then use Clicker to change characters.  In this way, runs started as Tainted Cain can be useful to complete other character's completion marks, even when Tainted Cain's own completion marks are finished.  Although Clicker will only turn tainted characters into other tainted characters, Tainted Cain can also craft {{I|Lazarus' Rags}} and die to become a non-tainted character and could then use the Clicker to change into other non-tainted characters."]], ['{{dlc|a+nr}} Removed items still count towards [[transformation]]s.'], ["Changing into {{C|Eden}} or {{dlc|r}} {{C|Tainted Eden}} will not use tokens. Additionally, (Tainted) Eden's base stats will be the same as Isaac's if he wasn't the character selected at the start of the run."], ["{{dlc|r}} Changing into {{C|Jacob and Esau}} will randomly distribute items between the two. Changing from Jacob and Esau to any other character will leave them with Jacob and Esau's combined items. Changing into or from Jacob and Esau will drop the currently held consumables like [[pills]], [[cards]] etc. on the floor, but will keep trinkets (if they were held by Jacob or any other character). Esau's trinkets will always be dropped on the ground when changing to a different character."], ['If {{i|Dead Cat}} was the last item to be picked up, Clicker will remove individual lives instead of the entire item.'], ['If {{i|Halo of Flies}} was the last item to be picked up, Clicker will only remove one fly at a time (including [[Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]] obtained from [[pills]] and {{M|Slot Machine}}s) instead of the entire item.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: Isaac will transform twice and have the last two picked up items removed.'], ['{{I|Rock Bottom}}: Stat upgrades given by removed items are retained, and the best stats of each character you turn into are retained, possibly creating some powerful characters, like Tainted Keeper with all the Berserk stats of Tainted Samson.']]

name: Pause
description: Freezes all enemies until a fire button is pressed.
effects: [['Stops all enemies including bosses until a fire button is pressed.', ['This does not affect troll bombs.', 'Touching frozen enemies will still damage Isaac.', 'Co-op babies can fire without ending the effect.', 'Stops {{E|Red Fire place}}s/{{E|Purple Fire place}}s from shooting projectiles.', 'Using {{I|Dark Arts}} will not stop the effect.', "Bosses will resume their actions after 30 seconds have passed, while non-boss enemies (except {{E|Lil' Haunt}}) are still paused.", ['{{Dlc|r}} All enemies resume actions after 30 seconds'], "{{C|The Forgotten}}'s Soul will be able to extend far past the normal limits of the chain when activated while {{C|The Soul}} is out."]]]
notes: [['New enemies generated during Pause being active will not be frozen and act normally. This applies for spawn-upon-death effects such as {{E|Attack Fly|display=Attack Flies}} created by a {{E|Moter}}, or a Boss that stopped becoming frozen and began summoning enemies.'], ['Damage against paused multi-segmented bosses works unpredictably, most notably allowing you to damage {{E|Scolex}} on normally invulnerable parts.', ['The health bars of multi-segmented bosses may not be updated properly, making it seem as if they died without running out of health.']], ['Reducing a boss to zero health whilst they are paused will initiate their death animation but they will not die until a fire button is pressed or the 30 second timer has lapsed.'], ['Pausing in the room before entering the minecart in the {{Stage|Mines}} causes the minecart to freeze, trapping the player inside of it until they exit to the main menu.']]
synergies: [['{{I|120 Volt}}/{{I|Monstrance}}: Continues to damage enemies even while paused, allowing for insane amounts of damage.'], ['{{bov}}'], ["Items that can be used without firing, such a Mom's knife and orbitals can do massive amounts of damage.", ['Any item that does damage without firing + {{i|4.5 Volt}}: Pause can be recharged while the effect is active, allowing for potentially infinite uptime.']], ['{{I|Daddy Longlegs}}: Hitting pause stops all enemies from moving but Daddy Longlegs will continue his normal attack pattern, potentially clearing many rooms without any risk of damage unless spawn-on-death enemies are killed and Isaac has trouble avoiding them, forcing him to fire. This strategy is also time demanding so if going for Boss Rush etc. this synergy is detrimental.'], ['{{C|Tainted Jacob}}: Dark Esau will also be affected by Pause. With proper timing, this allows him to melt through endgame bosses with large amounts of armor-piercing damage by having Dark Esau sit on top of them.'], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: The giant tear keeps dealing damage in stopped time, making it easy for boss kills.']]
interactions: [['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Bloodshot Eye
description: Spawns an [[Familiar#Orbital Familiar|orbital  familiar]] that deals 30 damage per second and fires a randomly angled tear every 2 seconds.
notes: [["Caution is advised when placing {{E|bomb}}s with Bloodshot Eye, as the orbital's tears may knock the bomb elsewhere, {{Dlc|nr}}and Bloodshot Eye will never stop shooting."], ['{{Dlc|nr}}It may not not always be a good idea to pick up Bloodshot Eye if Isaac has one or more [[Familiar#Pretty_Fly|Pretty Flies]] as orbitals, as Bloodshot Eye can override Pretty Flies without giving protection from enemy shots.']]

name: Sulfuric Acid
description: +0.3 [[damage]]. Adds a chance to fire acidic tears which can destroy [[obstacles]].
effects: [['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['Adds a 25% chance to fire acidic tears that destroy [[obstacles]] and opens doors and {{R|Secret Room}} upon contact.']]
notes: [['The chance to fire an acid tear does not increase with [[luck]].'], ['The acidic tears affect static objects like {{E|Bomb}}s, but with some differences:', ['They do not open {{E|Bomb Chest}}s.', '{{dlc|nr}} They cannot bridge gaps with obstacles.', ['{{dlc|r}} Gaps are now bridged.'], '{{dlc|nr}} Poop is not destroyed in one hit.', '{{dlc|r}} The mirror leading to the [[Mirrored World]] cannot be destroyed.']]]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Sulfuric Acid, stat bonus still applies.', ['{{dlc|r}} Lasers will sometimes destroy rocks, but will not open doors or secret rooms and has no color change.']], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|Ipecac}}: Overrides Sulfuric Acid, stat bonus still applies.'], ['{{i|Finger!}}: The finger can destroy rocks when pointing at them.'], ["{{C|The Forgotten}}: The Forgotten's bone club will have colored swings, but these do not have the ability to break rocks."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The Ludovico tear occasionally becomes acidic.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Sulfuric Acid, stat bonus still applies.", ['{{dlc|r}} Knife can destroy obstacles and open doors and secret rooms upon contact with no visual indicator.']], ['{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Acidic tears can no longer break objects and doors and just bounce.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Spectral tears]]: Acidic tears will no longer be able to destroy obstacles or open secret rooms.', ['{{dlc|r}} Acidic tears break rocks and open secret rooms, without being broken themselves on impact.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Tech.5}}/{{i|Technology 2}}: Only the stat bonus applies to the laser.', ['{{dlc|r}} Lasers will sometimes destroy rocks, but will not open doors or secret rooms and has no color change.']]]

name: Polydactyly
description: Allows Isaac to carry two [[cards]], [[pills]], or any combination of both. Spawns one random card, [[rune]], or pill.
effects: [['Allows Isaac to carry two [[card]]s, [[pill]]s, or any combination of both.'], ['Spawns one random card, [[rune]], or pill.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Little Baggy}}: No additional effect.'], ['{{i|Starter Deck}}: No additional effect.'], ['{{i|Deep Pockets|force=anr}}: No additional effect.']]

name: Sharp Straw
description: Damages all enemies in the room. Has a chance to drop a {{E|half red heart}} or {{E|half soul heart|nr}} if an enemy is hit.
effects: [['Damages all enemies in the room.', ["The damage dealt is equal to Isaac's current [[Damage|tear damage]] plus 10% of the enemy's max health."]], ['Has a 15% chance to drop {{E|half red heart}}s when it damages an enemy.', ['{{dlc|nr}} May also drop {{E|half soul heart}}s. Half red hearts will always drop when the player has at least one red heart container; otherwise, half soul hearts will drop.', 'The amount of enemies damaged does not improve the chance.']]]
notes: [["When used on {{E|Delirium}}, this item should be used when it isn't transformed to deal the most damage, as Delirium doesn't have his [[Damage Scaling|armor]] up when in his true form."], ['For enemies that can disappear or go underground, it only affects them if they are visible.'], ['The Sharp Straw works exceptionally well with {{c|Samson}}, giving the chance to collect large amounts of health per floor, allowing more damage to be taken, and deal more damage per use.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery|n}}: Damage is doubled and two half hearts may be dropped.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Ipecac}}: Only provides a +2 damage bonus instead of +40.']]

name: Compost
description: Doubles Isaac's [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] and [[Blue Spider]]s, or spawns one if Isaac has none. Converts pickups in the current room into Blue Flies or Blue Spiders.
effects: [['Upon use, converts [[pickup]]s within the current room to [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] or [[Blue Spider]]s.'], ["Doubles Isaac's current amount of Blue Flies and Spiders.", ['If Isaac has no Blue Flies or Spiders, spawns one Blue Fly or Spider.']]]
notes: [['Does not work on {{E|Troll Bomb}}s or {{E|Mega Troll Bomb}}s.'], ['One character using it does not seem to double the spiders/flies for other characters. It only seems to double the ones following the character using the item.']]

name: Greed's Gullet
description: Grants a Red [[Heart container]] for every 25 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}} Isaac has.
effects: [['Grants an extra Red [[Heart container]] for every 25 {{E|Penny|display=Coins}} Isaac has, up to a maximum of 4 hearts at 99 coins.', ['Dropping below the number of coins required for a Red Heart container removes the Red Heart container.']]]
notes: [['The extra Red Heart container can exceed the maximum Coin Heart container limit of {{C|Keeper}}, allowing him to obtain more than {{Dlc|nr}}2 / {{Dlc|r}}3 Coin Heart containers.'], ['Depending on the character used, this item only affects Red Heart containers, Soul Hearts ({{C|???}}) or Coin Heart containers (Keeper). It does not affect {{C|The Lost}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The Red Heart container gain is not retroactive - picking it up at 99 coins will not grant 4 extra Red Heart containers.', ['However, picking it up at 99 coins and then dropping below 99 coins will lose a Red Heart container, decreasing the viability of picking this item up the more coins you have.', ["The player will die if they lose their last form of health as a result of Greed's Gullet.", "If Keeper drops to under 2 Coin Heart containers as a result of Greed's Gullet, or by any other means (Devil deal, etc.), he is unable to use an HP Up to increase his health back to 2 and has to regain the lost coins to do so."], "If Greed's Gullet is rerolled away after gaining health, the extra health will be preserved even if the player loses the coins afterward.", ["However, if this happens with Keeper, his health will drop back to 2 Coin Heart containers upon picking up an item, unless another Greed's Gullet is picked up."]]], ["{{dlc|r}} The Red Heart containers granted by Greed's Gullet are now retroactive - picking the item up at 99 coins will immediately grant 4 Red Heart containers. Consuming coins will still cause Isaac to lose Red Heart containers."], ["{{dlc|r}} This also applies in reverse; consuming Red Heart containers granted by Greed's Gullet through methods such as {{R|Devil Room}} items or {{i|Guppy's Paw}} will cause Isaac to lose an appropriate amount of coins."], ["{{dlc|r}} For {{C|Keeper}} specifically, Greed's Gullet in combination with {{I|Deep Pockets}} allows him to bypass the 12 heart container health limit, capping at 15 Coin Hearts at 999 coins. However, additional heart containers beyond 12 will not appear on the health bar.", ['Works the same for {{C|Tainted Keeper}} but caps at 14 Coin Hearts instead.']], ['Be careful when buying items from the {{R|Shop}}, as it can remove Red Heart containers.'], ["Enemies that drain Isaac's coins (such as {{E|Keeper}}s, {{E|Hanger}}s, {{E|Greed}}, or {{E|Super Greed}}) can remove Red Heart containers."], ['This item allows {{C|Keeper}} and {{C|Tainted Keeper}} to utilize Health Up pills and Health up items, as the Coin Hearts gained this way are kept even if the coins are lost, and can bypass the 99-coin limit.']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Deep Pockets}}: After exceeding 100 coins, Isaac gains an extra heart container for every 100 coins instead of every 25.'], ['{{I|1=Money = Power}}: Isaac will gain both damage and health.'], ["{{I|Strawman}}: The assisting Keeper may also gain extra coin hearts, and in fact will retain the extra health containers even if coin loss would otherwise drop him below the threshold. However, exiting the game and then continuing thereafter will update Keeper's health."]]
interactions: [['{{i|A Dollar}}: Isaac will instantly gain the max amount of Red Heart containers.'], ['{{I|Eye of Greed}}: Coins will be lost for every 20th tear fired, risking Red Heart container loss if Isaac has more than 24 coins.'], ['{{i|A Quarter}}: Isaac will gain a Red Heart container.']]

name: Adrenaline
description: Increases [[damage]] based on how many empty [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Red Heart containers]] Isaac has.
effects: [['Gives Isaac a flat [[damage]] up based on how many empty [[Health#Red Heart Containers|Heart containers]] he has.', ['{{dlc|nr}} The damage up given is 0.2 for each empty Red Heart container Isaac has.', ['{{dlc|r}} The damage up given is ((2']]], ['MissingHearts) ^ 1.6)'], ['0.1, where MissingHearts is the number of full red hearts of health missing.', ['Damage ups are only applied for every fully empty heart container.']], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]
notes: [["This item has no effect on characters that can't have any Red Heart containers, unless {{E|Bone Heart}}s are collected. If a Bone Heart is gone, so does the Adrenaline damage. This means that Adrenaline is only truly useless on {{C|The Lost}}."], ['This item affects both {{C|Keeper}} and {{C|Tainted Keeper}}; empty Coin Hearts increase damage.'], ['As {{C|The Forgotten}}, empty Bone Hearts increase damage, but if the Bone Hearts are broken, the damage buff is taken away.'], ['The maximum damage bonus from Adrenaline is 14.05 normally, 16.15 with Bone Hearts, and 30.9 for Magdalene with Birthright.']]
synergies: [['{{I|Birthright}} + {{C|Magdalene}}: Allows Magdalene to have 6 more Heart containers.'], ['{{I|Blood Oath}}: Activates the damage up effect of Adrenaline for the resulting empty heart containers at the start of each floor.'], ['{{I|Rock Bottom}}: Allows Isaac to keep the damage up after refilling hearts.']]

name: Linger Bean
description: Constantly shooting causes Isaac to release gas clouds that can be pushed by his tears and damage nearby enemies.
effects: [['Firing without a pause for 7.5 seconds creates a small brown cloud that damages enemies who walk through it.', ["The damage is equal to Isaac's base tear damage, dealt roughly 5 times per second.", 'The clouds can be moved by shooting them.', 'The clouds only last for 15 seconds, meaning a maximum of two can be active at any given time.', 'Changing firing direction is allowed, but any pause in holding a fire button or taking damage resets the timer.']]]
synergies: [['{{T|Gigante Bean}}: The clouds will be larger, increasing the range drastically. The damage is unaffected.']]

name: Varicose Veins
description: Taking damage releases a ring of 10 high damage tears.
effects: [["When Isaac gets hit, 10 tears are fired in a circle around him (similar to {{i|Tammy's Head}}).", ['Tears spawned on hit have a +25 damage bonus.']], ['When Isaac gets hit, has a chance to activate the {{i|Anemic}} effect for 2 seconds.', ["The effect doesn't seem affected by luck."]]]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}} / {{i|The Inner Eye}} / {{i|Mutant Spider}}: No effect. When Isaac gets damaged, only ten tears will be fired.'], ['{{i|Apple!}}: Each tear has a chance to fire the razor tear.'], ['{{C|Azazel}}: Fires ten short-ranged brimstone beams in a circle.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: Fires ten minimally charged tears. Damage of tears is reduced slightly.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Taking damage releases 10 bombs around Isaac, which often leads to taking damage again.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Fires ten normal tears when taking damage.'], ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Tears are controllable.'], ['{{i|It Hurts}}: Two rings of tears are released at once.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: No effect.'], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: Fires ten red tears when taking damage. No other effects."], ['{{I|Playdough Cookie|force=r}}: Each one of the 10 tears spawned on hit has one of the available random effects applied to it.'], ['{{i|Soy Milk}}: Fires ten tiny tears when taking damage. Tear damage is only slightly reduced.'], ["{{C|Tainted Azazel}}: Fires ten brimstone beams in a circle. These beams do not have the damage penalty T. Azazel's attacks have, and can be further boosted by his {{I|Hemoptysis}} sneeze."], ['{{i|Tech X}}: No effect.'], ['{{I|Technology}}: Fires ten lasers in a circle.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: No effect.']]

name: Ghost Pepper
description:
{{dlc|nr}}Gives a chance to shoot fires alongside tears that block enemy shots and deal damage to enemies that touch them.
{{dlc|r}}Gives a chance to shoot blue fires alongside tears that become smaller as they travel.
effects: [['{{Dlc|nr}}Shooting tears sometimes spawns a fire similar to {{i|Red Candle}}, damaging enemies and destroying shots it comes into contact with.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}Shooting tears sometimes spawns a blue fire similar to {{i|The Candle}}, damaging enemies and destroying shots it comes into contact with. It lasts on the ground for a limited time and can pass through obstacles.'], ['Creating farts through items/pills such as [[Re-Lax]], {{i|The Poop}}, {{i|Butter Bean}}, and etc. causes fire to shoot out alongside the fart.', ['{{dlc|a+nr}} The only exception to this is the farts generated by {{t|Butt Penny}}.']], ["{{Dlc|r}}The fire deals 3x to 6x of Isaac's damage, depending on the size of the flame."], ['The fire can destroy {{E|Shopkeeper}}s.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}Enemies with fire variants will change to their variants when they get hit with the flame.']]
notes: [['{{Dlc|a+nr}} The chance of spawning fire is not affected by [[luck]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} The fire is affected by luck. The activation rate is equal to 1/(12 - Luck). At base luck (0), the chance is 8.33%, maxing out at 50% at 10 luck.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Bird's Eye}}: Changes the activation rate to 1/(8 - Luck). At base luck (0), the chance is 12.5%, maxing out at 100% at 7 luck. Only one type of fire can be spawned at a time, however each flame has an equal chance of being launched."], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: The flames can still shoot from Isaac while holding the fire button.', ['{{dlc|r}} Occasionally emits a flame while the beam is firing.']], ['{{i|Butter Bean}}, {{i|Mega Bean}}, {{i|The Black Bean}}, {{i|Wait What?}}: Will spawn fires upon use/activation.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Fires can be spawned while firing bombs.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Fires can be spawned while moving the crosshair.'], ['{{I|Farting Baby|force=r}}: The familiar has a chance to spawn a flame upon farting.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Fires are spawned as normal and can be hit by Ipecac tears, making this especially dangerous with a multi-shot ability.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The flames can still shoot from Isaac while holding the fire button.", ['{{dlc|r}}Occasionally spawns a fire when fired.']], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: The flames can still shoot from Isaac while holding the fire button."], ['{{i|The Poop}}: Fire will appear behind Isaac.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Pupula Duplex}}: The fires gain a large size and duration increase.'], ['{{i|Technology}}: Will occasionally spawn a fire. The lasers will not douse the flames.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Will occasionally spawn a fire while firing lasers. Laser rings will not douse the flames.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Will occasionally spawn a fire while firing beams. Fires damage is not reduced.'], ["{{i|Urn of Souls}}: Causes the Urn to emit Ghost Pepper's flames in addition to its regular flames."]]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}}/{{i|The Inner Eye}}/{{i|Mutant Spider}}: Will only spawn one fire.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: When holding down the fire button, when fire spawns it will be almost immediately put out by the clumps of tears.'], ['{{i|Blood Clot}}: No effect.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Fires cannot split."], ["{{i|Ghost Pepper}}: No effect. Will not boost the chances of shooting out a fire like with Bird's Eye."], ['[[Homing tears]]: Flames will not be homing.'], ['{{i|Incubus}}/{{i|Twisted Pair}}/{{i|Gello}}: Will not spawn fire by themselves, Isaac will spawn an additional fire instead of the familiar.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Feeding tears will quickly douse the flames.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Lilith}}: Spawns fire from her mouth.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Fires created from Ghost Pepper will destroy the tear and cause it to respawn on Isaac.', ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac now periodically creates fires that shoot towards the Ludovico Technique tear.']], ['{{i|A Lump of Coal}}: Affects normal tears but no effect on fire.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Pop!}}: Eyeballs tears quickly douse flames.'], ['{{i|Proptosis}}: Flames will not lose damage or shrink as they travel.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Soy Milk}}: No effect on frequency or damage of flames.'], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: The sprinkler will not spawn flames.']]

name: Cone Head
description: Grants a {{E|Soul Heart}}. Gives Isaac a chance to ignore any damage taken.
effects: [['Grants a {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['Any damage dealt to Isaac has a 20% chance to be ignored.', ['This includes damage through tears, contact, explosions, {{R|Curse Room}}, {{M|Blood Donation Machine}}s, and {{M|Devil Beggar}}s.', ['Contact damage with enemies is difficult to avoid, as the damage negation does not provide invincibility frames.'], 'Isaac flashes briefly blue when damage is negated. The flash can occur even while invincible from taking a hit or using an invincibility effect.']]]
synergies: [['{{i|Blood Rights}}/{{i|IV Bag}}/{{i|Kamikaze!}}/{{i|Razor Blade}}: Has a chance to block the damage inflicted, but the effects will still occur.'], ["{{i|Holy Mantle}}: Cone Head's chance of blocking damage is applied before the Holy Mantle, allowing the Holy Mantle shield to be saved."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Dull Razor}}: Damage prevention will prevent on-damage effects from occurring.']]

name: Potato Peeler
description: Removes a [[Heart Container]], increases [[damage]] and [[range]], and grants a {{i|Cube of Meat}}.
effects: [['On use:', ['Removes one Red [[Heart Container]].', 'Increases [[damage]] by a flat +0.2.', 'Grants one {{i|Cube of Meat}}.', ["{{dlc|r}} The Cube of Meat is not added as a real item in Isaac's inventory."], 'Grants an active {{i|Anemic}} effect for the current room.', '{{dlc|r}} Counts as self-damage for the purposes of damage-triggered items.']]]
notes: [['It is possible for Isaac to kill himself by removing his final heart container.'], ['It is possible to generate multiple Meat Boys.'], ['Cubes of Meat given by this item do not remove any Cubes of Meat from [[Greed Mode]] item pools.'], ['{{dlc|r}} The Cube of Meat gained through this item will persist in the escape sequence of {{s|Mines}} II.'], ['This item cannot normally be used on {{E|Soul Heart}}s, {{E|Black Heart}}s, {{E|Bone Heart}}s, or {{E|Eternal Heart}}s.', ["{{dlc+|r}} If used with {{c|Bethany}}'s {{i|Book of Virtues}} and Bone Hearts, it can be used infinitely. This will only produce [[Book of Virtues#Combinations|wisps]], not cubes of meat.{{dlc-}}"]], ['This item does not work with {{C|The Lost}}, {{C|???}}, {{C|Tainted ???}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Bethany}}, or {{C|Tainted Lost}}. Using it will not hurt them, nor produce any Cubes of Meat.', ['Bone Hearts do not qualify either, so {{C|The Forgotten}} cannot use this item.']], ['Kills {{C|Tainted Jacob}} if used in his Lost form.'], ['Kills Isaac if used as the Lost caused by the {{E|White Fire place}} in {{S|Downpour}}/{{S|Dross}} II.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|D4}}: Every Cube of Meat produced using Potato Peeler counts as an item for rerolling. Because health usually is not removed when rerolling items, this is useful to increase the number of items at the expense of the item pool.', ['Cubes of Meat created by Potato Peeler will always reroll into [[Treasure Room (Item Pool)|Treasure Room items]], regardless of where Potato Peeler was obtained or the rooms it was used in.']], ['{{p|III - The Empress?}}/{{p|XI - Strength}}: The temporary hearts granted by the cards can be used to create a Cube of Meat.'], ['{{dlc|r}}{{c|Tainted Eden}}: The {{i|Cube of Meat}} is not re-rolled when Tainted Eden takes damage.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|r}} {{i|Box of Friends}}: The Cubes of Meat from Potato Peeler cannot be duplicated by Box of Friends.'], ['{{I|Car Battery}}: No effect.', ['Car Battery + {{I|book of virtues}}: Summons 2 wisps and one Cube of Meat upon use.']]]

name: Lead Pencil
description: After every 15 tears fired, Isaac will fire a high-damage cluster of tears.
effects: [["After every 15 tears fired, Isaac will fire a low range burst of 12 tears at once, in a similar fashion to {{i|Monstro's Lung}}.", ['{{dlc|nr}} Tears in the barrage deal double damage.']], ["Tears will fire only from Isaac's right eye."], ['{{dlc|r}} Fired tears have a 50% chance to be colored red.']]
notes: [['Lead Pencil gives characters other than {{C|Cain}} the same special properties that he has when it comes to one-eye items like {{i|Blood Clot}}.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears fired from items that cause multiple tears to be fired at once e.g. {{i|20/20}}, {{i|Mutant Spider}}, etc. are counted.', ["{{dlc|r}} Each tear fired from {{i|Monstro's Lung}} still count towards triggering the barrage, but only if Isaac does not have any tear modifying items, such as {{i|Technology}}."]]]
synergies: [["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: All tears from the barrage split."], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Fires a barrage of Haemolacria tears, all of which will burst.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears tend to clump together, becoming one giant tear which splits into 8 large tears. When tears burst, they can also spawn barrages of tears that can be fed.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Causes burst tears to remain in the room for much longer, forming a soft barrier of sorts, which enemies must survive through to reach Isaac.'], ['{{T|Torn Card}}: Decreases shot requirement by 1. Lead Pencil will fire every 14th shot, with Torn Card quickly following at 15th.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Fires a barrage of beams.'], ['{{I|The Scooper}}: All tears benefit from the damage bonus granted by The Scooper.']]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Lead Pencil.', ['{{dlc|r}} The effect from Lead Pencil fires as separate tears from {{i|Brimstone}}.']], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Lead Pencil.', ['{{dlc|r}} The Lead Pencil tears fire alongside the bombs.']], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Lead Pencil.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{C|Lilith}}: No effect, as Lilith is inherently Blindfolded.', ['{{dlc|r}} Firing with {{I|Incubus}} will now activate Lead Pencil.']], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}}: Lead Pencil can fire in any of the cardinal directions if it fires at the same time as Loki's Horns."], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The tear blinks red, but the effect is entirely cosmetic.', ["{{dlc|r}} Isaac's body will fire the lead pencil shot toward where the controlled tear is located at a regular time interval"]], ['{{i|Incubus}}: Fires red tears like Blood Clot with Cain, but without increased damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Incubus is capable of firing the barrage of tears like Isaac.']], ["{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Lead Pencil.", ["{{dlc|r}} A barrage of tears is fired alongside {{i|Mom's Knife}} every 15 Knife throws."]], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Technology}}: Overrides Lead Pencil.', ['{{dlc|r}} A barrage of tears is fired alongside {{i|Technology}} every 15 shots.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Technology 2}}: Overrides Lead Pencil and disables normal tears entirely, even if not playing as Cain.', ['{{dlc|r}} Replaces tears with lasers similar to Technology. These are shot from the eye that shoots Technology 2, dealing damage alongside the Technology 2 beam.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Lead Pencil.', ['{{dlc|r}} Every 15th laser ring fired also shoots a cluster of tears.']], ["{{i|Tiny Planet}}: The burst follows Tiny Planet's circular trajectory with minimal range, hitting the ground almost immediately."]]

name: YO LISTEN!
description: +1 [[luck]]. Spawns a fairy [[familiar]] that points out {{R|Secret Room}}s, {{R|Crawl Space}} entrances, and [[Obstacles#Tinted Rocks|tinted rocks]].
effects: [['+1 [[luck]].'], ['Spawns a [[familiar]] that sporadically moves around the [[Rooms|room]].'], ['Upon entering a room with a {{R|Secret Room}}/{{R|Super Secret Room}} entrance,  [[Obstacles#Tinted Rocks|tinted rock]], or a rock with a {{R|Crawl Space}} underneath, it will fly towards it.', ['If there are multiple secrets, then it will fly from one to the other.']], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['The familiar will sometimes hover over a pit, {{E|poop}} or empty tile, indicating that an unreachable crawl space has been generated there.', ['{{dlc|nr}}Although it might seem intuitive to dig the spot open with {{i|We Need to Go Deeper!}} or {{p|Rune of Ehwaz}}, their chance of spawning a crawl space is independent and not guaranteed to work.']], ["An extra crawl space that is added by {{t|Stud Finder}} won't be identified by the familiar."]]

name: Apple!
description: +0.3 [[tears]]. Adds a chance to fire a razor blade that deals 4x Isaac's [[damage]].
effects: [["Adds a chance to fire razor blades that deal quadruple Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]]."], ['+0.3 [[tears]].']]
notes: [['The chance to fire a razor blade depends on the [[luck]] stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(15 - Luck). At base luck (0), the chance is 6.66%, maxing out at 100% at 14 luck.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: When razors are fired, the split tears will also be razors and do quadruple damage. The Parasite's split tears look like normal tears."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Adds a chance for the bombs to deal increased damage. See the page for the specific damage formula.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Glass Cannon}}: Adds a chance to fire a giant razor that does roughly triple damage.', ['{{dlc|r}} Adds a chance to fire a giant razor that does quadruple damage (x40 + 10 flat damage).']], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Adds a chance for tears to do quadruple damage. Burst tears will also do quadruple damage if the main tear does quadruple damage.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: When razors are fired, they will connect to other tears via electricity. The electricity also does quadruple damage.'], ["{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Tears can be fed to razors, increasing damage and splitting into 8 razors after a little while. If razors are fed to the tears, the razor damage doesn't apply to the tear both before and after splitting."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Each entire beam has a chance to gain the damage boost.', ['{{dlc|r}} Each tick of the beam has a chance to gain the damage boost.']], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Apple!.', ['{{dlc|r}} Each tick of the laser rings have a chance to gain the damage boost.']], ['{{i|Tough Love}}: With 14 luck, overrides Tough Love, as the razor blades do more damage anyways. With 13 luck, Apple and Tough Love each have about an equal chance to trigger.']]

name: Dark Prince's Crown
description:
{{dlc|nr}} When at exactly one {{E|Red Heart}}, increases [[tears]], [[range]], [[tear falling speed]], and [[shot speed]].
{{dlc|r}} When at exactly one {{E|Red Heart}}, increases [[fire rate]], [[range]], and [[shot speed]].
effects: [["When at exactly 1 {{E|Red Heart}}, some of Isaac's stats are increased.", ['{{Dlc|nr}} +0.75 [[tears]].', '{{Dlc|r}} +2.0 [[fire rate]]. The bonus can break the soft tears cap.', '+1.5 [[range]].', '{{Dlc|nr}} +1 [[tear falling speed]].', '+0.2 [[shot speed]].']], ['The effect is lost any time Isaac gains or loses Red Hearts.', ['The crown will glow red while active; if inactive, it will appear black.']]]
notes: [['Full Bone Heart containers are counted towards the maximum.'], ["This item pairs well with {{C|Eve}}, since she starts with {{i|Whore of Babylon}}, and is the only character that can gain Whore of Babylon's effect at 1 heart."], ['This item does not affect {{C|???}}, {{C|The Lost}}, {{C|The Soul}}, {{dlc|r}}{{C|Dark Judas}}, {{C|Tainted Judas}}, {{C|Tainted ???}}, {{C|Tainted Lost}}, {{C|Tainted Soul}}, or {{C|Tainted Bethany}} since they cannot gain Red Hearts.'], ['This item only affects {{C|Keeper}} and {{C|Tainted Keeper}} when he has only one [[Health#Coin Hearts|Coin Heart]].'], ['This item only affects {{C|The Forgotten}} when he has one full Bone Heart.'], ["The effect does not stack with multiple Dark Prince's Crowns."]]

name: Dog Tooth
description: +0.3 [[damage]], +0.1 [[speed]]. Plays a howl or bark sound when entering a room with undiscovered {{R|Secret Room}}s or {{R|Crawl Space}}s.
effects: [['+0.3 [[damage]].'], ['+0.1 [[speed]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0).']], ['When entering a room connected to an undiscovered {{R|Secret Room}} or {{R|Super Secret Room}}, a howl sound effect will play.'], ['A barking sound will play if there is an undiscovered {{R|Crawl Space}} in the room.']]
notes: [["A sound won't play in the first room of a new floor until you re-enter the room."], ['An extra Crawl Space added by {{t|Stud Finder}} will not trigger the sound.']]

name: Dead Tooth
description: While firing, Isaac gains a green aura that [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] nearby enemies.
effects: [['While firing, creates an aura around Isaac that [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] any nearby enemies for 2 ticks.', ['The poison may stack up to 6 ticks at a time.', 'The aura range is approximately two tiles.']], ["Poison damage is equal to Isaac's [[damage]] stat."]]
interactions: [["{{C|Azazel}}/{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Chocolate Milk}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Monstro's Lung}}/{{i|Tech X}}: The green aura only activates when Isaacs' attack is charging."], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|Marked}}: The green aura only activates when pressing the attack buttons.'], ['{{C|The Forgotten}}: The green aura will activate when using melee and charging throw attack.'], ['{{C|Lilith}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Mega Blast}}: The green aura will not activate while the beams are firing.'], ['{{i|Sprinkler}}: Green aura will not activate if only the sprinkler is firing, and the sprinkler does not get its own green aura.']]

name: Shard of Glass
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Upon taking damage, Isaac has a chance to drop a full red heart, gain 5 range, and leave a trail of damaging red [[creep]] for the current room.
{{dlc|r}} Taking damage causes Isaac to bleed, spraying a volley of blood in the direction he fires. Bleeding will eventually damage him, but it can be stopped by picking up a {{E|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Adds a 25% chance to drop a full {{E|Red Heart}} upon taking damage.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Adds a separate 10% chance to gain the {{i|Anemic}} effect (+5 [[range]], red creep trail) for the current room upon taking damage.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} Taking damage will cause Isaac to bleed, spewing red tears around him constantly.', ['Holding a direction of fire focuses the bleeding tears to that direction, with slightly increased range.', ['The direction of bleeding can be aimed diagonally, even when Isaac does not possess {{i|Analog Stick}}.'], "After bleeding for 20 seconds, Isaac's Red Hearts or Rotten Hearts will take damage (bypassing other Hearts); this is indicated by Isaac slowly turning red after and eventually blinking. This damage also has a 25% chance to drop a full Red Heart. The damaging effect will continue to occur every 20 seconds until the bleeding effect ends.", ['The damage amount is always half a {{E|Red Heart}}, a [[Health#Coin Hearts|Coin Heart]], or a {{E|Rotten Heart}}, even in later [[chapters]] where most damage is now a full Heart or two Rotten Hearts.'], 'The bleeding effect ends when Isaac receives any form of {{E|Red Heart}} or {{E|Rotten Heart}} healing, if he has no more Red or Rotten Hearts, or if the next hit would kill him.{{dlc-}}', 'If Isaac has no Red or Rotten Hearts, the bleeding effect of Shard of Glass will not activate.', 'The bleeding effect carries over to the next floor if Isaac moves on to the next floor while still bleeding.', 'Filling an {{E|Eternal Heart}} will also end the bleeding.', 'Losing the item does not end the bleeding effect.']]]
notes: [['Red Hearts spawned by this item may become different hearts in certain {{R|Super Secret Room}}s.'], ['Playing as {{C|Keeper}} or {{C|Tainted Keeper}} will cause the hearts spawned to turn to Blue Flies immediately.'], ['Taking bleed damage will not effect Devil/Angel room chance.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Shard of Glass does not have the [[Item_Tags_nolostbr|nolostbr item tag]], meaning it can spawn while {{C|The Lost}} is holding a {{i|Birthright}}, even if it does not affect The Lost positively or negatively.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If Shard of Glass is rerolled while Isaac is bleeding, the bleeding will continue, but {{E|Red Heart}}s will no longer spawn when Isaac takes damage. This makes Shard of Glass especially deadly to {{C|Tainted Eden}}.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{C|The Forgotten}} can end the bleeding by switching to {{C|The Soul}}.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} The bleeding effect works with {{C|Keeper}} and {{C|Tainted Keeper}}. They will bleed and lose a coin heart until only one coin is left. Receiving coins will stop the bleeding effect. Due to Tainted Keeper only having two coin hearts in most circumstances, bleeding will rarely apply to him.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Rotten Hearts will take bleeding damage only when Isaac has no red hearts remaining. Picking up Rotten Hearts will also end the bleeding.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Using a [[bed]] or a Full Health [[Pills|pill]] to heal Isaac's red hearts will not stop the bleeding."], ['{{Dlc+|r}}Turning into The Lost via the {{E|White Fire Place}} or {{P|Soul of the Lost}} will stop bleeding effect.{{dlc-}}'], ['{{Dlc|r}}Using the {{I|Yum Heart}} will stop the bleeding effect.']]

name: Metal Plate
description: Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}. Enemy shots have a chance to be reflected at the shooter as [[confusion|confusing]] tears.
effects: [['Grants one {{E|Soul Heart}}.'], ['Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a 25% chance to be reflected.', ['Isaac does not take damage from the reflected tears, but gets pushed a bit.', "The reflected tears are [[homing]] and [[Status Effects#Confusion|concussive]], and use Isaac's [[Damage]] and [[Tear effects]].", ['Projectiles that create other projectiles (e.g. {{E|Shady}}) can harm Isaac and be reflected.'], 'Can reflect:', ['{{dlc+|r}} Fireballs (e.g. from {{E|Crackle}}), but their lines of fire harm Isaac.{{dlc-}}', 'Fire projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Mega Satan}}).', '{{dlc+|r}} Obstacles thrown by {{E|Polty}} or {{E|Kineti}}.{{dlc-}}'], 'Does not reflect:', ['Explosive projectiles (e.g. from {{E|Gurgle}}).', 'Lasers or beams.', '{{dlc|r}}Lines of fire from fireballs.', '{{dlc+|r}} Projectiles from {{E|Big Bony}}, {{E|Coal Boy}}, {{E|Danny}}.{{dlc-}}']]]]
interactions: [["The following items that change the property of Isaac's tears affect the reflected tears:", ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}', '{{I|Haemolacria}}', '{{I|Ipecac}}', '{{I|Lachryphagy}}', '{{I|My Reflection}}', '{{I|Pop!}}', '{{I|Tiny Planet}}', '{{I|Trisagion}}']], ["The following items that modify Isaac's tears do not affect the reflected tears, aside from stat changes (if present):", ['{{I|Brimstone}}', '{{I|Chocolate Milk}}', '{{I|C Section}}', '{{I|Cursed Eye}}', '{{I|Dr. Fetus}}', '{{I|Epic Fetus}}', '{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}', "{{I|Mom's Knife}}", "{{I|Monstro's Lung}}", '{{I|Neptunus}}', '{{I|Spirit Sword}}', '{{I|Technology}}', '{{I|Tech X}}']], ['{{I|20/20}} / {{C|Keeper}} and other multi-shot effects: Do not add the reflected tears.'], ['{{I|Anti-Gravity}} / {{I|Tractor Beam}}: Does not affect the reflected tears, aside from stat changes.'], ["{{I|Cone Head}}: Metal Plate's chance of reflecting effect is applied first.", ['This leaves Isaac 40% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ['{{I|Dead Eye}}: The reflected tears grant the damage multiplier, but do not reset it even when they miss.'], ['{{I|Eye of Greed}} / {{I|Lead Pencil}}: The reflected tears are not counted for shots fired.'], ['{{I|Gnawed Leaf}}: Tears can be blocked while Isaac is invulnerable.', ['This leaves Isaac 62.5% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["{{I|Hallowed Ground}}: Metal Plate's chance of blocking effect is applied first."], ["{{I|Infamy}}: Infamy's chance of blocking effect is applied first. Tears blocked by Infamy are not reflected by Metal Plate.", ['This leaves Isaac 62.5% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["{{I|Isaac's Heart}}: Tears can be blocked when hitting the heart, not Isaac."], ["{{P|Holy Card}} / {{i|Holy Mantle}}: Metal Plate's chance of blocking projectiles is applied before the shield, allowing it to be saved."], ["{{I|Host Hat}}: Host Hat's chance of blocking effect is applied first. Tears blocked by Host Hat are not reflected by Metal Plate.", ['This leaves Isaac 40% chance to negate tears in any way.']], ["'''Metal Plate''': Additional copies of this item, such as from {{I|Diplopia}} / {{I|Crooked Penny}}, have no effect."]]

name: Eye of Greed
description: Every 20 tears, Isaac loses 1 {{E|Penny}} and shoots an additional gold tear that [[Status Effects#Petrification|petrifies]] enemies and turns them into gold. Any enemy killed while in this state will drop coins.
effects: [["Adds a golden tear every 20 tears fired, which causes enemies to turn gold and [[Status Effects#Petrification|petrifies]] them for a few seconds (similar to {{i|Midas' Touch}}) at the cost of one {{E|Penny}}. Golden tears can still be fired if Isaac has no money.", ['Unlike other tear effects, golden tears are fired alongside regular tears rather than replacing a regular tear.', 'With multi-shot abilities, whichever tear is the 20th since previous will produce the additional golden tear.', '{{Dlc|nr}} The golden tear does 2x normal [[damage]].', '{{Dlc|r}} If Isaac has no money, the golden tear does normal tear damage. If Isaac does have money, the golden tear deals 1.5x normal damage +10.', '{{Dlc|nr}} Enemies killed while golden will drop 1-4 coins.', '{{Dlc|r}} Enemies killed while golden will drop 1-3 coins.', '{{dlc|r}} If Isaac has money, golden tears that hit enemies will drop a {{E|penny}}, effectively returning the cost.']]]
notes: [["Tears fired from items that cause multiple tears to be fired at once, e.g. {{i|20/20}}, {{i|Monstro's Lung}}, etc., are counted.", ['The gold tear is not duplicated by said items.']], ['{{C|The Forgotten}} has separate tear counters for The Forgotten and Soul.'], ['Using this item is an easy way of unlocking {{i|Golden Razor}} after obtaining 99 coins, since it drains them by just shooting and with enough patience it will reduce their count to 0.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Chocolate Milk}}: How much the 20th tear was charged determines the size and damage of the golden tear.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Golden tears will still look like coins and will still split into other golden coins when hitting obstacles."], ['{{T|Equality!}}: The coin lost when firing the tear can be quite useful for equalizing the pickup counter.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}{{I|Humbling Bundle}}: Affects coins dropped from hitting enemies, allowing Isaac to potentially farm money.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Golden tears can also be fed and will burst into split tears. Burst tears are not golden.']]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.', ['{{dlc|r}} Occasionally fires a coin tear with the beam.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.', ["{{dlc|r}} A coin shot is fired every 20 shots, but it's very likely to hit the bomb. This makes Eye of Greed drain money over time for no benefit, unless [[Tear Effects|piercing]] is gained."]], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.', ['{{dlc|r}} Occasionally fires a coin tear with the cross.']], ["{{I|Fate's Reward}}: Does not shoot coin tears."], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Flat Stone}}: No effect.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Incubus}}: Does not shoot coin tears.', ["{{dlc|r}} Incubus will fire coin tears in tandem with Isaac. His shot counter is independent of Isaac's. Coin tears still subtract from Isaac's pennies."]], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Lost Contact}}: No effect.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.', ['{{dlc|r}} Isaac occasionally fires a coin tear towards the controlled tear.']], ["{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.", ['{{dlc|r}} Occasionally fires a coin tear in addition to the knife.']], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Technology}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Eye of Greed.'], ["{{I|Twisted Pair}}: The two familiars will also fire coin tears which spend Isaac's coins. Their shot counter are independent from Isaac's."]]

name: Tarot Cloth
description: Drops a random [[Cards and Runes|card or rune]]. {{dlc|nr}} Doubles the effects of most cards and runes. {{dlc|r}} Doubles the effects of tarot cards.
effects: [['Drops a random [[Cards and Runes|card or rune]] on pickup.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} Adds an extra effect to a card, rune or other card-like pickup.', ['{{dlc|r}} Adds an extra effect to certain tarot cards.']]]
notes: [["Tarot Cloth's effect also applies to card effects used through {{i|Blank Card}}.", ['{{dlc|r}} Only certain cards gain the Tarot Cloth effect with Blank Card, which include: {{p|I - The Magician}}, {{p|II - The High Priestess}}, {{p|III - The Empress}}, {{p|IV - The Emperor}}, {{p|V - The Hierophant}}, {{p|VI - The Lovers}}, {{p|VII - The Chariot}}, {{p|VIII - Justice}}, {{p|IX - The Hermit}}, {{p|XVII - The Stars}}, {{p|XIX - The Sun}}, {{p|0 - The Fool?}}, {{p|III - The Empress?}}, {{p|V - The Hierophant?}}, {{p|VI - The Lovers?}}, {{p|VIII - Justice?}}, and {{p|XIV - Temperance?}}', ['Three of these cards will have diminished Tarot Cloth effects:', ['{{p|XIX - The Sun}}: Only 200 damage is dealt.', '{{p|0 - The Fool?}}: Only 3 items drop instead of 6, this also applies with Car Battery.', '{{p|VIII - Justice?}}: Only 2-7 chests spawn.']], 'As a result, using the Blank Card in conjunction with the {{i|Car Battery}} will cause the effect of the active card to quadruple, instead of double.', ['{{dlc|r}} Only certain effects will be doubled again, which include: {{p|I - The Magician}} (only the damage up), {{p|III - The Empress}}, {{p|IV - The Emperor}} (only the soul hearts), {{p|V - The Hierophant}}, {{p|VI - The Lovers}}, {{p|VII - The Chariot}}, {{p|VIII - Justice}}, {{p|V - The Hierophant?}}, {{p|VI - The Lovers?}}, and {{p|XIV - Temperance?}}.']]], ["{{dlc|r}} The enhanced effect of The Fool? can't drop starting items in [[challenges]] on the ground."]]

name: Compound Fracture
description: Increases [[Range]]. Tears turn into bones, which shatter into 1-3 bone shards upon hitting an enemy or obstacle.
effects: [["Tears turn into bones, which shatter into 1-3 shards upon hitting an obstacle or enemy, which each deal 50% of Isaac's [[Damage]].", ['Unlike {{i|The Parasite}}, there is no damage minimum on splitting, but the tears can also split only once.', 'The shards have a fixed size, about the same as a 3.5 damage tear, regardless of their Damage.']], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[Range]], +1.0 [[Tear Falling Speed]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[Range]].']]
synergies: [["{{i|Bob's Rotten Head}}: The bomb will break into 1-3 more bombs which are launched in random directions from the point of impact."], ['{{i|C Section}}: Fetuses are skeletons that shoot splitting bone fragments when in contact with an enemy.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Each tear splits into more tears, which will all shatter."], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Tears will sometimes burst into smaller tears when hitting obstacles or enemies. These smaller tears are miniature versions of Haemolacria tears, which will burst when hitting the ground.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: If the bone tear hits a wall or an obstacle, it will split into explosive half-damage shards. Hits on enemies and the floor behave as normal Ipecac.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Tear turns into a spinning bone that rapidly spews out smaller bone shots on contact with enemies.'], ['{{I|Kidney Stone}}: First bullet shatters into smaller kidney stone bullets'], ['[[Spectral tears]]: Bones pass through obstacles and generate shards for each obstacle they pass through, which can result in many shards being generated from a single bone.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Bone tears will hover until released but bone shards will travel normally.'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Compound Fracture.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Overrides Compound Fracture.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Compound Fracture.'], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Bone tears will bounce when they are fired, however, bone shards will not bounce when they travel.'], ['{{c|The Forgotten}}: Smaller bone shots appear whenever an enemy is hit with the melee attack. The throw is unaffected.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Bone tears can be fed and will burst into split tears. Bone tears will burst into bone shards when hitting obstacles or enemies which can also be fed and burst into split tears and bone shards yet again. When bone shards are fed, they turn back into bone tears which can repeat this process again and again.'], ["{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Compound Fracture.", ['{{dlc|r}} Knife will occasionally spawn bone fragments.']], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Rubber Cement}}: Tears turn to bones, but bones do not shatter.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tears hitting enemies will both shatter and bounce simultaneously.']], ['{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Compound Fracture.'], ["{{i|Technology 2}}: The laser is not affected, but bone tears still shoot from Isaac's left eye."], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Bone tears will not burst into bone shards when fired at obstacles, however, bone tears will burst into bone shards when fired at enemies.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Beams will only burst when hitting obstacles.']]

name: Glaucoma
description: Adds a chance to shoot tears that [[confusion|confuse]] enemies for an extremely long time.
effects: [['Adds a 5% chance to shoot [[Status Effects#Effects|concussive tears]], causing enemies to walk around randomly.', ['The confusion caused by Glaucoma tears is effectively permanent for normal enemies, and a very long duration compared to most status effects for bosses.']], ['Makes the screen darker.']]
notes: [['Not affected by Luck.']]

name: Mom's Razor
description: Spawns an [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbiting]] razor that deals contact damage and inflicts [[bleed]]ing on enemies, causing them to slowly take damage over time.
effects: [["Grants a razor familiar that [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbits]] Isaac. Enemies that touch the razor take damage equal to 20% of Isaac's tear damage per tick or 300% of Isaac's damage per second ({{dlc|r}} 150% of Isaac's damage per second) and start to [[bleed]].", ["{{dlc|nr}} Bleeding enemies take damage equal to 10% of their maximum health every 5 seconds. Bosses cannot bleed and won't take any damage from the razor.", '{{dlc|r}} Bleeding enemies take damage based on how quickly they move; the faster the enemy, the more damage they take. While moving, a bleeding enemy leaves behind [[Creep#Red_Creep|red creep]] that can damage other enemies. Bosses can bleed as well.', '{{dlc|nr}} The razor does not block enemy shots.', '{{dlc|r}} The razor blocks enemy shots.']], ['{{transf|Yes Mother?|item}}']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}}It may not always be a good idea to take Mom's Razor if Isaac has one or more [[Familiar#Pretty Fly|Pretty Flies]] as orbitals, as Mom's Razor can override Pretty Flies without giving protection from enemy shots."]]
synergies: [["{{i|BFFS!}}: Increases razor's size and contact damage. No damage increase on bleed effect."]]

name: Dad's Lost Coin
description:
{{dlc|nr}}+1.5 [[range]], +1 [[tear falling speed]]. Drops a [[Coins#Lucky Penny|Lucky Penny]].
{{dlc|r}}+0.375 [[range]]. Drops a [[Coins#Lucky Penny|Lucky Penny]].
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1 [[tear falling speed]]'], ['Drops a {{E|Lucky Penny}}.']]

name: Midnight Snack
description: Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. {{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.
effects: [['Grants one full Red [[Heart container]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} Heals 1 additional {{e|Red Heart}}.']]

name: Belly Button
description: Drops a random [[trinket]]. Grants a second trinket slot.
effects: [['Drops a random [[trinket]].'], ['Grants a second trinket slot.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Mom's Purse}}: No effect; Isaac can still only carry two trinkets."]]

name: Sinus Infection
description: Adds a chance to fire a booger that sticks to enemies and deals damage over time.
effects: [['Grants a 20% chance to fire a booger that sticks to an enemy and deals damage over time.', ['Multiple boogers can stick to one enemy and deal extra damage.', "Each booger deals damage equal to Isaac's tear damage every second.", '{{Dlc|nr}}The booger lasts for 60 seconds or until the enemy dies.', ['{{Dlc|r}}The booger lasts 10 seconds.'], 'Boogers cannot pierce and stick to the first enemy that they come in contact with, but will pass through fireplaces even without piercing shots.', "Boogers also cannot inflict [[status effect]]s, even if the booger's appearance changes."]]]
notes: [['The booger falls off the enemy after they die. If it hits another enemy before it touches the ground, it will stick to them and deal damage.'], ['Jumping enemies or bosses like {{E|Monstro}} and {{E|Leaper}}s and burrowing enemies like {{E|Round Worm}}s and {{E|Lump}}s can get rid of the booger when they leap or burrow.', ['Bosses like [[The Harbingers]] or {{E|Dark One}}, or enemies like {{E|Oob}} that have dash attacks do not lose the booger when they go off-screen.']], ["The tear-sticking effect is similar to {{i|Explosivo}} and {{i|Mucormycosis}}'s."], ['Booger shots behave like piercing shots against bombs and fireplaces, making it potentially difficult to evade hostile bombs or push bombs along.'], ["The {{t|Nose Goblin}} trinket's effect is almost identical to Sinus Infection, with an added [[homing tears|homing]] bonus.", ['When Isaac is holding both Nose Goblin and Sinus Infection each booger tear created by the item has a 50% chance to also have homing.']], ['Not affected by [[Luck]].']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}}{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}/{{i|Tech X}}/{{i|Trisagion}}: Every tick of damage Isaac’s tears deal have a chance to attach a separate booger tear on a hit enemy.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}: Booger tears will split into split booger tears that can attach to enemies."], ['{{i|Explosivo}}: Explosivo tears can also be booger tears which damage the enemy over time while stuck to them before exploding.'], ['{{i|Godhead}}: Shots retain their aura while stuck to an enemy, but the aura can damage only enemies other than the booger victim. If the enemy dies before the booger’s maximum duration, it will resume homing and will often stick to a second enemy.'], ['{{transf|Guppy}}: Damage instances from boogers attached to enemies have a 100% ({{dlc|r}} 50%) chance to spawn a [[Blue Fly]].'], ['{{dlc|a+nr}}{{i|Lachryphagy}}: All tears have a chance to burst into boogers. Boogers will always burst into more boogers, though some of the boogers may incorrectly appear to be normal tears. When a booger sticks to an enemy, it will burst into 8 boogers which have a high chance of sticking again to the same enemy.'], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Boogers that stick to enemies will block shots, and will not be destroyed in the process.'], ['{{i|Polyphemus}}: Booger shots lose the Polyphemus pierce effect, but stick to enemies while dealing the full damage of the Polyphemus shot. Damage does not degrade.'], ['{{i|Spirit Sword}}: Swings and projectiles have a chance to apply boogers on enemies.'], ['{{i|Strange Attractor}}: Attraction effect will remain on the booger shot stuck to an enemy. This can drag the enemy across the whole room until they reach one wall and get stuck on it, effectively disabling their normal movement.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Tech.5}}: The laser also has a chance to apply boogers on enemies.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{i|Technology}}: Hit enemies have a chance for a booger to be applied to them.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Technology 2}}: The laser can also apply boogers with the laser’s chance to apply boogers being determined rapidly every tick.'], ['{{I|Technology Zero}}: Boogers can be connected with electricity while being attached dealing large amounts of damage to the booger victim.']]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Tech X}}/{{i|Trisagion}}: Overrides Sinus Infection.'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Booger tears will not split after killing enemies.'], ["{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Sinus Infection."], ['{{i|Holy Light}}: Holy light strikes do not activate on booger shots.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Overrides Sinus Infection. Booger tears will still appear, but will act identically to other Ipecac shots.'], ["{{i|Jacob's Ladder}}: Lightning strikes do not activate on booger shots."], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{i|Tech.5}}/{{I|Technology 2}}: The laser is unaffected by Sinus Infection.'], ['{{dlc|nr}}{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The large tear has a chance to stick to enemies. The tear cannot be controlled while it is stuck to an enemy, and cannot be removed until the enemy has died.']]

name: Parasitoid
description: Adds a chance to fire an egg sack which creates [[slow]]ing [[creep]] and spawns a [[Blue Fly]] or [[Blue Spider]] upon hitting an enemy.
effects: [['Adds a chance to fire an egg sack which spawns [[slow]]ing [[creep]]. If an egg sack hits an enemy, one to two [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] or [[Blue Spider]] is spawned.'], ['Egg sack tears have {{dlc|nr}} x2 [[range]]/{{dlc|r}} x2 [[tear height]] (which also increases effective range).'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Beelzebub|item}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Spider Baby|item}}']]
notes: [["Egg sacks will also spawn blue flies or spiders if they hit {{E|Fire place}}s or invincible enemies like {{E|Death's Head}} and {{E|Stoney}}."], ['The chance to fire an egg sack is affected by [[luck]]. It is 15% at 0 luck, and maxes out at 50% at 5 luck.'], ['It is possible to create a large number of Spiders and Flies by repeatedly shooting a closed {{E|Host}}.']]
synergies: [['{{i|C Section}}: Parasitoid fetuses spawn spiders/flies and slowing creep with every hit on an enemy.'], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: When egg sacks are fired, they will split into smaller egg sacks. Split egg sacks from The Parasite will not look like egg sacks."], ["{{i|Cupid's Arrow}}: Egg sacks will apply their effect to every enemy hit."], ['{{i|Hive Mind}}: Flies and spiders are bigger and deal double damage.']]
interactions: [["{{C|Azazel}}/{{i|Brimstone}}/{{i|Dr. Fetus}}/{{i|Epic Fetus}}/{{i|Mom's Knife}}/{{i|Technology}}/{{i|Tech X}}/{{i|Trisagion}}: Overrides Parasitoid."], ['{{t|Fish Tail}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: Tears retain Haemolacria appearance and only the main tear can spawn flies or spiders when damaging enemies.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Only extra range applies on egg sack tears and they will not spawn flies or spiders.'], ["{{I|Montezuma's Revenge}}/{{i|Revelation}}: No effect."], ["{{I|Spirit Sword}}: The sword projectiles can still spawn flies and spiders, but the swings themselves won't."], ['{{i|Tech.5}}/{{i|Technology 2}}: Lasers are unaffected.']]

name: Eye of Belial
