description: Grants [[Tear Effects#Piercing|piercing tears]]. After piercing one enemy, tears start [[Tear Effects#Homing Tears|homing]] and deal double [[damage]].
effects: [['{{dlc|nr}} +1.5 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|r}} +0.375 [[range]].'], ['{{dlc|nr}} +1.0 [[tear falling speed]].'], ['Grants [[piercing tears]].'], ['After piercing one enemy, tears will gain double [[damage]], [[homing tears|homing]], and a 1.3x size multiplier.']]
notes: [["{{dlc|nr}}The piercing effect makes placed {{E|Bomb}}s, {{E|Troll Bomb}}s, and {{E|Mega troll Bomb}}s unable to be pushed around by Isaac's tears."], ['Tears will also gain homing and double damage when they pierce bombs and entities the game considers enemies, like {{E|Stone Grimace}}s and {{E|Fire place}}s.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Compound Fracture}}/{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: Tears that pass through enemies will become Belial tears and split into smaller Belial tears. Non-Belial split tears can also turn into Belial tears if they pass through enemies."], ['{{i|Godhead}}: Normal tears and Eye of Belial tears will retain damaging aura.'], ['{{i|Lachryphagy}}: Eye of Belial tears can still be fed and will burst, and burst Eye of Belial tears will still be homing. Tears from regular bursts can also turn into Eye of Belial tears'], ['{{i|Lost Contact}}: Piercing through a projectile triggers the double damage and homing effect.'], ["{{i|Remote Detonator}}: Placed Bombs won't explode automatically, so they can be placed and have tears fired through them to activate double damage and homing."], ['{{dlc|r}}{{I|Tiny Planet}}: After piercing an enemy, tears will continue orbiting rather than homing, but each tear can gain multiple damage and size multipliers. These tears can make quick work of even most bosses.'], ["{{I|Saturnus}}: When an orbiting tear hits an enemy, it will turn into an Eye of Belial tear. From that point, the tear gets out of {{I|Saturnus}}' orbit every time an enemy is nearby, becomes autonomous and chases every enemy in the room. It won't be destroyed by enemies anymore. When there's no enemy close from it, it comes back into the orbit. As all 7 tears can become Eye of Belial ones, this synergy is significantly powerful."], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: All tears will be connected with electricity. Electricity will double in damage when the tears change.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Brimstone}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.'], ['{{i|Diplopia}}: Only further increases range.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Piercing effect applies, but homing and doubled damage do not.', ["{{Dlc|r}} Bombs also deal 2.5x Isaac's damage to enemies when passing through them."]], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria}}: If the main tear pierces an enemy, it will turn into a Belial tear, and the burst tears retain the piercing effect and do double damage. If the main tear does not turn into a Belial tear, the burst tears will not be able to turn into Belial tears.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Doubled damage does not apply if hitting the same enemy multiple times in a row. The controlled tear will continue to increase in size on every hit up to roughly the width of a single room, and the effect resets on changing rooms.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Overrides Eye of Belial."], ['{{i|Ouija Board}}: Eye of Belial tears lose their homing ability and fly offscreen.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Homing tears will only damage the enemy once and then just remain fixed above the target for a brief amount of time until disappearing.'], ['{{i|Technology}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.'], ['{{i|Technology 2}}/{{i|Tech.5}}: The lasers are not affected by the Eye of Belial; however, the tears apply the effect normally.'], ['{{i|Tech X}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: May seem to override Eye of Belial but if a homing tear finds a target to seek it will stop midair as if it were fighting its momentum.'], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.'], ['{{C|The Forgotten}}: Overrides Eye of Belial.']]

name: Glyph of Balance
description: Grants 2 {{E|Soul Heart}}s and modifies drops from [[Champion]] monsters based on certain conditions. {{dlc|r}} Also modifies room clear drops.
effects: [['Grants 2 Soul Hearts.'], ['Modifies drops from Champion enemies depending on certain conditions.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Also modifies room clear drops.'], ['The priorities of the drops, in order, are as follows:', ["'''{{E|Soul Heart}}s''': When Isaac has no Red Heart containers and less than 2 Soul Hearts.", "'''Full {{E|Red Heart}}s''': While at 0.5 Red Hearts.", "'''{{E|Key}}s''': When Isaac has no keys.", "'''{{E|Bomb}}s''': When Isaac has no bombs.", "'''Full {{E|Red Heart}}s''': When Isaac has at least half a Red Heart container empty.", "'''{{E|Penny|display=Pennies}}''': While Isaac has less than 15 pennies.", "'''{{E|Key}}s''': When Isaac has less than 5 keys.", "'''{{E|Bomb}}s''': When Isaac has less than 5 bombs.", "'''Trinkets''': If Isaac has no trinkets and there are no trinkets on the ground in the room.", "'''{{E|Soul Heart}}s''': When Isaac has less than 6 total Heart containers of any kind.", 'If none of the above conditions are true, items dropped will be rolled as normal.']]]
notes: [['The Glyph has no effect in [[Greed Mode]] or Greedier Mode aside from the {{E|Soul Heart}}s granted upon pickup; champions still never drop anything.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Because of how the item works in the priorities listed above, this item is not recommended for {{c|The Lost}} (except in combination with {{i|Immaculate Conception}}) as he is always considered to be at half a Soul Heart, and all drops ''from champions'' are replaced with Soul Hearts.", ['{{dlc|r}}{{c|The Lost}} and {{c|Tainted Lost}} ignore both rules for Soul Heart generation. This prevents the item from generating mostly useless Soul Hearts.']], ["When playing as {{c|The Forgotten}}, the priority of the drops is based on the active form's health: for example, if The Forgotten has half a red heart or less, but The Soul was active right before the pickup drop and it had more than 2 soul hearts, the Glyph will skip over the full red heart drops to the next condition. Also if The Forgotten is full on pickups and health, has a trinket but has less than 6 bone hearts, the Glyph will always drop soul hearts unless The Soul is active at the moment of the drop."], ['{{dlc|r}} When playing as {{c|Jacob and Esau}} / {{c|Tainted Lazarus}}, the priority of the drops is based on the health of the character that has the Glyph.'], ['{{dlc|r}} When playing as {{c|Tainted Lazarus}}, the room drop will be modified when the character switches to the character that has the item on room clear.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Chest drops override the Glyph of Balance.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Empty room drops are replaced by Glyph of Balance drops, with the exception of heart drops in hard mode, which have a separate chance of being replaced with an empty drop.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} When playing as characters incapable of having red heart containers such as {{C|???}}, the Glyph will skip soul heart and red heart generation.', ['It is still possible to get hearts if none of the other conditions are true.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Options?}}: Only one of the options will be modified by the Glyph.'], ['{{T|Perfection}}: Chest spawns are prioritized over Glyph of Balance, meaning it will be very hard to use the Glyph effectively.']]

name: Analog Stick
description: +0.35 [[tears]] up. Allows Isaac to fire tears diagonally.
effects: [['+0.35 [[tears]] up.'], ['Allows tears to be fired diagonally.', ['With a keyboard or using buttons to fire with a controller, tears can be shot at 45-degree angles by holding two buttons. This is known as eight-directional firing.', 'With an analog controller, the analog input is accepted, allowing full analog aiming in any direction.']]]
notes: [['Enables full directional firing for keyboard and mouse users with the accessibility option EnableMouseControl enabled.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}}/{{i|The Parasite}}: When tears are fired diagonally, the split tears will also move diagonally."]]
interactions: [['{{I|Abyss}}: Locusts cannot attack diagonally, and will attack upwards or downwards instead.'], ['{{I|Book of Virtues}}: Summoned wisps are unable to shoot diagonally, and will shoot upwards or downwards instead.'], ['{{i|Compound Fracture}}: When bone tears are fired diagonally, the bone shards will not always move diagonally.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: No effect because missiles already can be fired in any direction.'], ['{{dlc|anr}}{{i|Incubus}}: Incubus cannot fire in non-cardinal directions, only tears up applies.', ['{{dlc|r}} Incubus can now fire diagonally.']], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: No effect because the tear can already move in any direction.'], ['{{i|Marked}}: Overridden by Marked.'], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: Only the tears up applies, since Mom's Knife already accepts analog input by itself."], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Overridden by Tiny Planet.'], ['{{i|Tractor Beam}}: Overridden by Tractor Beam.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tractor Beam now can be controlled.']]]

name: Jacob's Ladder
description: Tears fire sparks of electricity in random directions upon hitting an obstacle or enemy.
effects: [['{{Dlc|nr}} Tears fire 1-2 sparks of electricity in random directions upon hitting an obstacle or enemy.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} Tears fire 1 short-ranged spark of electricity in a random direction upon hitting an obstacle or enemy. When an arc strikes an enemy, it will strike another nearby enemy, chaining up to four times.'], ["Sparks deal half of the tear's damage.", ['Sparks behave like [[Spectral tears|spectral]] and [[Piercing tears|piercing]] lasers and will arc to hit enemies that are close enough, even striking multiple ones in a row.', 'An enemy can take damage multiple times from sparks of a single chain. If an enemy take damage from a tear, it does not take any damage from the chain which the tear causes.', 'Tears that hit the floor due to running out of range do not generate arcs.', '{{Dlc|r}} If the floor is wet, such as {{S|Downpour}}, {{S|Dross}}, {{S|Flooded Caves}}, some rooms in {{S|Scarred Womb}} and after using {{I|Flush!}}, the arcing distance is increased.']]]
synergies: [["{{I|Abyss}}: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Jacob's Ladder it turns into a pale blue locust. The locust can create arcs of electricity dealing 0.1 damage per tick."], ['{{I|Angelic Prism}}: All of the split tears will be electrified. {{Dlc|nr}} Also, the sparks that pass through the prism will be split.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{I|Brimstone}} / {{c|Azazel}} / {{c|Tainted Azazel}}: The beam gains a light blue tint, spawning sparks at the end of the beam and near enemies hit by the beam.'], ['{{I|C Section}}: Spawns the sparks for each tick they hit.'], ['{{I|Lost Contact}}: Tears block enemy shots as normal and will then spawn the sparks where the shot was blocked.'], ["{{I|A Lump of Coal}}: Sparks deal damage based the tear's, increasing with distance. No extra damage is applied by the distance covered by the spark."], ["{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Mom's Knife}}: The knife will occasionally generate sparks when hitting an enemy."], ['[[Spectral tears]]: The tears can spawn sparks while passing through obstacles, and a tear can spawn sparks only once in this way.'], ['[[Tear effects]]: The tear effects will be applied over the sparks as well.', ["{{I|Serpent's Kiss}}: The poison caused by the sparks will not drop black hearts.", '{{T|Nose Goblin}} / {{I|Sinus Infection}}: The boogers do not spawn sparks when directly hit on an enemy, but their sparks spawn the boogers for each enemy hit.', '{{I|Euthanasia|force=r}}: The sparks coming off of needle shots also act as needle shots themselves, allowing entire rooms to be killed instantly.']], ['{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Tech.5}} / {{I|Technology}} / {{I|Technology 2}} / {{I|Tech X}}: Lasers gain a light blue tint and generate sparks.'], ['{{I|Trisagion|force=r}}: Spawns the sparks for each tick they hit.']]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|nr}} {{I|Brimstone}} / {{C|Azazel}}: The beams do not spawn the sparks.'], ["{{I|Backstabber}}: The sparks cannot hit the enemies' backs for the extra damage and bleeding."], ["{{I|Compound Fracture}} / {{I|Cricket's Body}} / {{I|The Parasite}}: Split tears can spawn the sparks."], ['{{I|Dr. Fetus}} / {{I|Epic Fetus}}: The bombs do not spawn the sparks.'], ['{{I|Haemolacria}}:', ['{{Dlc|nr}} Only main tear can spawn the sparks.', '{{Dlc|r}} Burst tears can also spawn the sparks.']], ['{{I|Ipecac}}: The sparks spawn only when they hit a wall.'], ['{{I|The Ludovico Technique}}: The Ludovico tear spawns a large number of sparks when in contact with an enemy, but not on obstacles.'], ["{{I|Mom's Knife|force=nr}}: The knife does not spawn the sparks."], ["{{I|Proptosis}}: The sparks will decrease in damage based on how much damage the tear has lost. The spark's damage also dereases by the distance covered by the spark."], ['{{I|Rubber Cement}}: Tears will only spawn the sparks when hitting enemies.'], ['{{I|Spirit Sword}}: Both swing attacks and projectiles can spawn the sparks.'], ['{{Dlc|nr}} {{I|Tech.5}} / {{I|Technology}} / {{I|Technology 2}} / {{I|Tech X}}: The lasers do not spawn the sparks.'], ['{{I|Trisagion|force=nr}}: Only spawns the sparks when hitting obstacles.']]

name: Contagion
description: The first enemy killed in a room explodes and [[Status Effects#Poison|poisons]] nearby enemies. Poisoned enemies will also explode upon death.
effects: [['In each room, the first enemy killed will release a gas explosion and [[poison]] nearby enemies.', ['Poisoned enemies will also release gas upon death, spreading the effect.', ['Poisoned enemies do not need to die while the poison is still active to spread the effect.'], 'The effect will also activate if a {{E|shopkeeper}} is destroyed before killing any enemies.', ['Re-entering a room and destroying another {{E|shopkeeper}} inside it will trigger the effect for a second time.']]]]
notes: [["The initial gas explosion deals 5 damage, and the poison deals Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]] per tick, for 6 ticks."], ['The gas explosion and poison can damage [[friendly]] enemies.']]
synergies: [['{{t|Gigante Bean}}: Greatly increases the size of the gas explosions, making the poison spread much more effective.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Bomb damage does not apply to poison damage.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: Missile damage does not apply to poison damage.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: Ipecac only applies a 2x multiplier as opposed to +40 to poison damage.'], ['[[Poison]] tears: No effect. Gas explosions will only be triggered by poison caused by Contagion'], ['{{t|Second Hand}}: Poison duration is not affected.']]

name: Shade
description: Spawns a shadow [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's movements on a 1 second delay and deals contact damage to enemies. After dealing enough damage, it is absorbed by Isaac and spawns [[friendly]] {{E|My Shadow|display=Charger|n}}s.
effects: [["Grants a shadow [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's movements on a {{dlc|nr}} 1-second delay {{dlc|r}} 0.66-second delay and deals 2 contact damage per tick or 30 damage per second to enemies."], ['Shade is absorbed by Isaac after dealing {{dlc|nr}} over 600 damage {{dlc|r}} over 666 damage.', ['The familiar disappears and turns into friendly dark {{E|My Shadow|display=Charger}}s, similar to those spawned by {{i|My Shadow}}.', 'Isaac will now do equal contact damage at the same rate as the Shade used to.', ['{{i|BFFS!}} will continue to work on Isaac even after absorption, doubling damage dealt.', "Isaac's contact damage increases when absorbing multiple Shade familiars."]]]]
notes: [['If other familiars that move with a similar pattern such as {{i|Multidimensional Baby}} have been collected before the Shade, it will follow them instead with further delay.'], ['If Isaac gains a method of flight, Shade will gain wings.'], ['Cannot be removed with {{i|Sacrificial Altar}}.']]

name: Hushy
description: Spawns a {{E|Hush|n}} [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms|room]] and deals contact damage. While firing tears, it stops moving.
effects: [['Spawns a {{E|Hush}} [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms|room]] and deals contact damage to enemies.', ['Hushy deals 2 damage per tick or 30 damage per second.', 'While firing tears, Hushy stops moving.', 'When Hushy stops moving, it can block shots.']]]
notes: [["During Isaac's hurt animation, when holding down a fire button, Hushy will continue to move until the animation is over."]]

name: King Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and makes other familiars follow it. While firing tears, other familiars stop moving.
effects: [['Grants a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and always appears first in the familiar chain.'], ['While firing tears, King Baby stops moving and glows white.'], ['While King Baby is stationary, other familiars remain stationary as well.', ['{{dlc|nr}} [[Familiar#Shooting familiars|Shooting familiars]] will fire tears in the direction the player is firing.', '{{dlc|r}} [[Familiar#Shooting familiars|Shooting familiars]] fire at nearby enemies automatically.', ['Familiars that have charged attacks will operate on similar rules to {{I|Marked}}: they will immediately fire at full charge, and variable-charged attacks will be released earlier the closer that King Baby is to the target.']]], ['When Isaac stops firing tears, King Baby moves rapidly back towards Isaac.'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
synergies: [["{{Dlc|nr}}{{i|Isaac's Heart}}: Isaac can fire tears and leave King Baby and the heart behind, and run into a group of enemies without being damaged."]]
interactions: [["{{i|BFFS!}}: Increases King Baby's size. No other effect."], ['{{t|Duct Tape|n}}: King Baby will stay in place relative to Isaac until Isaac starts firing tears. Then King Baby will remain stationary until Isaac has stopped firing and will rapidly move back to him.'], ['{{I|Gemini}}: Suture will rest near King Baby as long as there are no enemies near Isaac. When Isaac gets near enemies, Suture will rapidly snap from King Baby toward the enemy. Functionally, King Baby has no real effect on Gemini.', ['Visually, this can result in the umbilical between Isaac and Suture getting stretched to a long length.']], ['{{T|Friendship Necklace}}: Familiars will orbit King Baby at all times instead of Isaac, even while not firing. King Baby itself is unaffected.'], ["{{T|RC Remote}}: Overrides King Baby's halting; familiars will mimic Isaac's movements even while firing. King Baby's auto-targeting remains active."]]

name: Big Chubby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and charges across the [[Rooms|room]] when Isaac fires, blocking shots and dealing 40.5 damage per second on contact.
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and charges across the [[Rooms|room]] when Isaac fires, dealing 2.7 damage per tick or 40.5 damage per second to enemies it comes in contact with.', ["The familiar's charging speed is very slow, unlike its counterpart {{i|Little Chubby}}.", 'The familiar blocks enemy shots.']]]
notes: [['Big Chubby takes 6 seconds to travel the other end of normal-sized rooms.'], ['Big Chubby will travel forward until hitting an obstacle or wall.'], ['Big Chubby will continue to travel forward between rooms.']]
interactions: [['{{t|Duct Tape}}: Big Chubby stays in place relative to Isaac until it is fired.']]

name: Acid Baby
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a random [[pill]] every 3 [[rooms]]. Upon using a pill, all enemies in the room are [[Status Effects#Effects|poisoned]].
effects: [['Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops random [[pill]]s.', ['{{dlc|nr}} Acid Baby drops a pill every 3 cleared [[rooms]]. The first drop happens after 2 rooms.', ['{{dlc|r}} Acid Baby drops a pill every 7 cleared [[rooms]]. The first drop happens after 6 rooms.']]], ['Upon using a pill, all enemies in the room will be [[Status Effects#Effects|poisoned]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} The poison lasts for 2 ticks.', ['{{dlc|r}} The poison lasts for 6 ticks. Enemies also take 10 additional damage.']]], ['{{dlc|r}}{{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|BFFS!}}: The familiar drops pills in a repeating pattern of 2, 2 then 3 rooms. No damage increase on the poison effect.', ['{{dlc|r}} Acid Baby drops a pill every 6 cleared rooms.']], ["[[Vurp!]]: If Isaac's last used pill is a Vurp! pill and Isaac finds another Vurp! pill afterward, he can infinitely generate Vurp! pills and repeatedly use them for mass poison damage."]]
interactions: [['{{T|Second Hand}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Starter Deck}}: All pills dropped by Acid Baby will turn into cards.']]

name: Euthanasia
description: Adds a chance to fire needles that instantly kill [[Monsters|basic enemies]] and deal triple [[damage]] to [[boss]]es. If a needle kills an enemy, it bursts into more tears/needles.
effects: [["Adds a chance to fire needles which deal triple Isaac's [[Damage|tear damage]].", ['Needles will instantly kill [[Monsters|regular enemies]] and cause them to burst into 10 more tears in all directions.', 'The chance to fire a needle depends on [[luck]].', ['At base luck (0), it is 3.33%', '{{dlc|nr}}It is 100% at 15 luck.', '{{dlc|r}}It maxes out at 25% with 15 luck.']]], ['{{transf|Spun|item}}']]
notes: [["The needle tears can kill enemies that are normally invincible, such as {{E|Peep}}'s eyes, {{E|Death's Head}}s, and {{E|Stoney}}s."], ['The needle tears can kill {{E|Stone Grimace}}s, allowing Isaac to permanently remove any obstacle in a room.', ['{{dlc|r}} The needle tears can kill {{E|Bomb Grimace|n}}s, dropping 10 unlit Throwable Bombs. This can make it detrimental to shoot at them, since they are usually provided as a tool rather than an obstacle.']], ['Possible needle tears in a burst from killing an enemy do not retain the instant kill and burst-causing capabilities, but still deal triple damage. This prevents chain reactions of bursts.'], ['The tears in the burst are larger than normal but do not have a damage bonus.'], ['Unless piercing is obtained, {{E|Knight}}s will still block the needles if shot from the front.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Brimstone|nr}} / {{I|dr. fetus|nr}} / {{I|mom's knife}} / {{i|Technology}} / {{i|Trisagion}}: No appearance change, tear burst, or instant kill, but triple damage still works."], ['{{i|Brimstone|r}} / {{I|dr. fetus|r}}: Enemies killed by a needle burst into normal tears.'], ['{{i|Godhead}}: The aura of a needle tear will also do triple damage, but does not cause tear burst or instant kill.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: No tear burst or instant kill, but triple damage still works.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Enemies killed by a needle burst into ipecac shots.']], ["{{I|Jacob's Ladder|r}}: The electric arcs released from a needle shot also retain the needle's instant kill and tear burst properties."], ['{{i|Little Horn}}: If a tear has both the Euthanasia and Little Horn effects and instantly kills an enemy, it does not cause a tear burst.'], ['{{i|Tech.5}}: The tears that Isaac fires work normally, and the laser has a chance to deal triple damage with no other effects.'], ['{{i|Tech X|anr}}: Completely overrides Euthanasia. No triple damage, no tear burst, or instant kill.', ['{{Dlc|r}}Laser Rings will sometimes deal triple damage/instantly kill regular enemies, and enemies killed by needles burst into normal tears.']], ['{{i|Technology 2}}: The tears that Isaac fires work normally, but the laser is completely unaffected.', ['{{dlc|r}} The laser has an extremely high chance of executing normal enemies.']]]

name: Camo Undies
description: Isaac becomes camouflaged at the beginning of each room. Until he shoots, all non-boss enemies will be [[Status Effects#Confusion|confused]]. {{dlc|r}} Isaac gains +0.5 [[Speed]] while camouflaged, and gains [[Tears]] and [[Damage]] upon breaking it.
effects: [['Upon entering a new room, Isaac will become camouflaged and all enemies become [[Status Effects#Confusion|confused]]. The effect will last until Isaac presses a fire button.', ['Bosses will not be confused when Isaac is camouflaged.', 'A co-op baby firing will also end the effect.', '{{dlc|r}} While camouflaged, Isaac gains +0.5 [[Speed]]. When the camouflage is dropped, enemies in a short radius around Isaac take 15 damage, and he gains a temporary [[Tears]] and [[Damage]] up.', ['If Isaac is firing tears while walking into a room, the camouflage and stat boost will not apply.']]]]
synergies: [['[[Items#Activated_Collectibles|Active]] items: May be used to deal damage without canceling the effect.'], ['[[Familiar|Chasing familiars]]: Familiars like these can chase and damage enemies with little risk. Best ones for the task are {{I|7 Seals}} and {{I|Daddy Longlegs}}, since they have long aggro range.'], ['[[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|Orbital]] [[familiar]]s: Enemies can be damaged with little risk, as the camo effect allows Isaac to get close enough for the orbital to deal damage with low risk of taking damage in return.'], ['{{I|120 Volt}} / {{I|Jupiter}} / {{I|Monstrance}}: Great sources of passive damage without disrupting camo.'], ['{{I|Blood Puppy}}: Like most enemies, a hostile Blood Puppy will not target Isaac while the camo effect is active, but it will still target and attack other enemies.'], ['{{i|Mars}}: Can be used to deal damage without cancelling the effect.'], ["{{I|Mom's Knife}}: As long as it's not being charged, the knife can deal damage passively."], ['{{I|Rock Bottom}}: Temporary tears and damage up do not go away, causing a permanent boost for the rest of the run.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} {{C|Tainted Judas}}: Gets a lot of use out of Camo Undies due to his in-built {{I|Dark Arts}} not disrupting camo.{{dlc-}}']]
interactions: [["{{i|Brimstone}} / {{I|Chocolate Milk}} / {{I|Cursed Eye}} / {{I|Monstro's Lung}} / {{I|Spirit Sword}} / {{I|Tech X}}: Charging ends the camo effect, and the effect doesn't happen when entering a room with a full charge."], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Camo Undies will remain active until the tear is moved by pressing a button.', ['{{Dlc|nr}} Since the tear follows Isaac, he can run around and use the tear to kill enemies.', ['{{dlc|r}} Tear no longer follows Isaac, but will still not remove Camo effect until moved.']]], ['{{I|Neptunus}}: The passive charge of Neptunus does not disrupt Camo.'], ['{{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The item does not affect {{c|Tainted Soul}}, making it useless.']]

name: Duality
description: Whenever a {{R|Devil Room}} or {{R|Angel Room}} would spawn after defeating a boss, both rooms spawn. Only one can be entered.
effects: [['Whenever a {{R|Devil Room}}/{{R|Angel Room}} spawns after defeating a boss, the other will also spawn.', ['Upon entering one, the other one will disappear.', 'Both rooms will spawn even if a devil deal was made before.', 'In rooms without enough accessible walls, only one of the two will spawn.']]]
notes: [['Even with {{i|Goat Head}} or {{i|Eucharist}} both rooms will not stay open, and entering either of the rooms will make the other disappear.'], ['If Duality was bought through a Devil deal, it is still possible to get {{R|Angel Room}}s as well as {{R|Devil Room}}s.'], ["Teleportation via a {{p|Joker}} card, a {{E|Red Chest}} or a {{R|Sacrifice Room}} ''before'' defeating the boss and choosing a door will follow the normal rules of Devil/Angel Room generation, instead of a 50/50 chance.", ['The room that was chosen this way will be the only one that opens once the boss is defeated.', 'Teleporting after choosing a door will always take you to the same room.', 'Gaining Duality during Greed/Greedier Mode will only generate one room as per normal, rendering it useless.']]]
synergies: [['{{I|Goat Head}} / {{I|Eucharist}} Guarantees an Angel & Devil room to spawn after every boss'], ['{{i|Glowing Hour Glass|r}}: Time can be reversed while inside one deal to go into another.']]
interactions: [['{{C|Tainted Lazarus}}: The Lazarus that fights the boss must be the one holding Duality in order for it to trigger.']]

name: Sack of Sacks
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{E|Grab Bag|n}} every 5-6 [[rooms]] cleared.
effects: [['Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and drops a {{e|Grab Bag}} alternatingly {{dlc|nr}} every 5 or 6 [[rooms]]. ({{dlc|r}} 7 or 8 rooms).']]
synergies: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|BFFS!}}: The drop rate is improved to every 4-5 rooms.', ['{{dlc|r}} The drop rate is improved to every 6 rooms.']]]

name: Plan C
description: Kills all enemies in the room, then kills Isaac three seconds later.
effects: [['Upon use, deals 9,999,999 damage to every enemy in the room, then kills Isaac 3 seconds later.']]
notes: [['Plan C does not kill both phases of bosses like {{E|The Lamb}}, {{E|Hush}}, {{E|Ultra Greed}},  {{E|Mega Satan}}, and {{E|Mother}}, and is most useful when used during the last phase of these multi-phase bosses.'], ['It is recommended not to use this item in Challenges, as even if the goal is within the bosses that dies before Isaac does, the player will likely die before the end of the rising trophy animation.'], ["For the game's sake, a run is not truly over until [[Isaac's Last Will]] appears. This means that some bosses that might seem to finish their death animations after Isaac dies, such as {{dlc|nr}}Ultra Greed, will still be technically killed and will still give their completion marks, even if Isaac does not enter the Final Boss Chest."], ['Some bosses have special interactions with this item:', ["Attempting to use this item to kill {{E|Delirium}} will not work. Its death animation is much longer than the time between using Plan C and Isaac's Last Will appearing, meaning Isaac will die first and it will not count as a kill. Having extra lives that revive Isaac outside the room will not help, either; Delirium must be fought again.", ["However, items that revive Isaac in the same room he died in, namely {{I|Lazarus' Rags}} (or being {{C|Lazarus}}), {{I|Inner Child}}, {{P|Soul of Lazarus}}, and {{C|Tainted Lost}}'s {{I|Birthright}}, will allow Isaac to bypass this and kill Delirium with this item. In the case of Lazarus' Rags, though, the completion mark will go toward Lazarus and not the character originally selected.", ['Similarly, if playing as {{C|Tainted Lazarus}}, using Plan C and then using {{I|Flip}} to switch to the other form pauses the death counter until the player switches back to the form that originally used the item.'], "It is possible to kill Delirium by carefully timing pauses after each screen static. Each screen static plays a cutscene that continues to play even while paused, so by pausing and unpausing at the right timings, Delirium's death animation can be shortened to just under 3 seconds allowing for his completion mark to be awarded."], '{{dlc|r}} Will not work if used against {{E|Ultra Greedier}} as {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}, {{C|The Lost}}, {{C|Tainted Lost}}, or {{C|Tainted Jacob}} in his lost form.', "{{dlc|r}} Killing {{E|Mother|n}}'s second phase with Plan C will kill Isaac just at the end of her death animation. No completion mark is awarded.", "{{Dlc|r}} If used in {{E|The Beast|n}} battle, Plan C will only kill the harbinger that Isaac is fighting on screen. It won't have any effect on the other harbingers nor The Beast itself (The Beast can still be killed if Isaac is fighting it when Plan C is used, and there is enough time to earn the completion mark)."]], ['Invulnerable enemies and closed {{E|Host}}s will not be killed by Plan C.'], ["Isaac's last will shows his last damage source as the cause of death, not Plan C. If Isaac has not taken damage or lost health from any source, Isaac's face is shown."], ['Invincibility or the {{I|Holy Mantle}} shield will not save Isaac from being killed.'], ['Some items that activate when Isaac reaches zero hearts, such as {{I|Heartbreak}} and {{I|Spirit Shackles}}, will not activate, killing Isaac.'], ['Even if Isaac enters a trapdoor immediately after using Plan C, he will still die after arriving at the next floor.', ['Isaac will also die after accepting a [[Victory Lap]] or performing a [[RERUN]].']], ['Plan C has an 80% decreased item pool weight, making it less likely to appear than other collectibles.'], ['Plan C is found in 8 item pools, the second highest count amongst all items, behind {{I|Cube of Meat}}. Its lowered weight, however, offsets its presence.']]

name: Large Zit
description: Adds a chance to fire a creep shot that deals double [[damage]] and leaves a trail of [[Status Effects#Slow|slowing]] [[Creep#White Creep|white creep]].
effects: [['While firing, Isaac has a chance to fire an additional creep shot that deals double [[damage]], [[Status Effects#Slow|slows]] enemies, and leaves a short trail of [[Creep#White Creep|white creep]] that also [[Status Effects#Slow|slows]] enemies.', ['The chance is not affected by [[luck]].', "The creep shots don't take on any tear effects.", '{{Dlc|a+nr}}The creep shots are affected by [[range]] and [[shot speed]].', ['{{Dlc|r}}The creep shots are not affected by [[range]] but affected by [[shot speed]], which determines their effective range.'], 'Their tear sizes are not affected by their damage. They always retain their small size.']], ['A creep shot will also be fired in a random direction when taking damage.']]
synergies: [["{{i|Brimstone}} / {{I|Chocolate Milk}} / {{i|Epic Fetus}} / {{i|Mom's Knife}} / {{i|Monstro's Lung}} / {{I|Tech X}}: Creep shots will still be fired occasionally while holding the fire button."], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: Creep shots will occasionally be fired along with bombs.'], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: High tear damage from Ipecac is doubled, causing very powerful creep shots.'], ['{{I|Multidimensional Baby}}: Creep shots can be duplicated.'], ['{{i|Polyphemus}}: High tear damage from Polyphemus is doubled.'], ['{{i|Technology Zero}}: Creep shots will be connected to other tears via electricity.']]
interactions: [['{{i|20/20}} / {{i|The Inner Eye}} / {{i|Mutant Spider}}: Isaac will still fire one creep shot.'], ["{{I|Bird's Eye}} / {{I|Ghost Pepper}}: Firing creep shots does not spawn the fires."], ["{{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Creep shots will not burst into split tears."], ['{{I|Dead Eye}}: Creep shots do not grant or reset the damage multiplier, although their damage still benefit from the multiplier.'], ['{{I|Eye of Belial}}: Creep shots are not affected.'], ['{{I|Eye of Greed}} / {{I|Lead Pencil}}: Creep shots are not counted for shots fired.'], ['{{I|Eye of the Occult}}: Creep shots are not controlled. Creep shots will only fire in cardinal or diagonal directions unless there is a cross-hair, in which case creep shots will fire directly toward it.'], ['{{i|Incubus}} / {{I|Twisted Pair}}: The familiars does not fire creep shots.'], ['{{I|Immaculate Heart}}: Firing creep shots does not spawn the orbiting tear.'], ['{{I|Lachryphagy}}: Creep shots are not affected from Lachryphagy, but Lachryphagy tears can feed on them.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: Movable tear behaves as normal. Isaac will occasionally fire a creep shot while moving the tear, and creep shots will only fire in cardinal or diagonal directions.'], ['{{I|A Lump of Coal}}: Creep shots are not affected.'], ['{{I|My Reflection}} / {{I|Tiny Planet}} / {{I|Tractor Beam}}: Creep shots are not affected by the trajectory altering effect. Stat changes are applied as normal.'], ['{{I|Pop!}}: Creep shots are not affected. Pop! tears do not bounce off of creep shots.'], ['{{I|Proptosis}}: Creep shots are not affected.']]

name: D1
description: Duplicates a random pickup in the room. {{dlc|r}} The new pickup may be different than the original (i.e. a different card, etc).
notes: [['{{p|Rune of Jera}} can not be duplicated.'], ['{{E|Mimic Chest}}s will not be duplicated.'], ['Opened chests will be duplicated into an unopened copy.'], ['It is possible to duplicate {{r|Shop}} pickups that have not been purchased yet.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} By dropping a card, rune, or pill in a room with no other pickups, then using D1, this item can function similarly to {{i|Blank Card}} and {{i|Placebo}}.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} A normal Chest may be duplicated into a Red Chest or a Mimic Chest.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} A duplicated trinket is mostly useless, as you cannot pick up two of the same trinket even with {{i|Mom's Purse}}, {{i|Belly Button|n}}, or {{i|Smelter}}.", ['However, with "consumable" trinkets such as {{t|Store Credit}} or {{t|Bag Lunch}}, it can be extremely powerful.']], ["{{dlc|nr}} With {{i|Car Battery}}, it is possible to infinitely generate {{E|Lil' Battery|display=Lil' Batteries}} from a single Lil' Battery.", ["{{Dlc|r}} While it's still possible to generate infinite batteries with this synergy, it is very slow to do so since mostly Micro Batteries will spawn. The occasional Lil' Battery or other battery spawn is needed to build up the battery pile."]], ['{{dlc|nr}} In combination with a [[48 Hour Energy]] pill and {{t|Paper Clip}}, the initial Locked Chests on {{s|Chest}} can be infinitely duplicated and opened.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} In [[Greed Mode]], if a Lil' Battery appears in the {{r|Shop}} and a {{p|2 of Diamonds}} is acquired, infinite money can be gained by duplicating the Two of Diamonds."], ['{{Dlc|r}} A duplicated card has a chance to turn into {{P|Cracked Key|n}}; however, a duplicated Cracked Key will always turn into another Cracked Key.'], ['{{Dlc|r}}A duplicated [[Pills|Gold Pill]] will turn into a random Pill chosen from the Pill Pool.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{dlc|r}} {{c|Tainted Lost}}: Duplicated cards have an increased chance to be Holy Cards.']]

name: Dataminer
description: Displaces enemy sprites for the current room, randomly increases one [[Attributes|stat]] and decreases another.
effects: [['For the current room, rotates every enemy and pickup 90 degrees and moves its sprite up and left.', ['Enemy hitboxes remain the same.']], ["Increases one of Isaac's [[Attributes|stats]] and decreases another. Possible stat changes include:", ['± 1 flat [[damage]]', '{{dlc|nr}} ±0.5 [[tears]]', '{{dlc|r}} ±0.5 [[fire rate]]', '±0.2 [[speed]]', ['{{dlc|nr}} Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0)'], '±0.2 [[shot speed]]', '±1 [[luck]]', '{{dlc|nr}} ±0.5 [[range]]', '{{dlc|r}} ±1.50 [[range]]']], ['Adds random tear effects for the current room.'], ['Distorts the music for the current room.']]
notes: [['{{Dlc|r}} If the tear stat reaches a negative number, there will be an integer overflow, which will max out the tear rate at the 120 cap; if the tear stat is boosted back into a positive number, it will replace the value obtained previously.'], ['If Rock Bottom is obtained while Tear Rate is overflowed, it will stay at 120 even if boosts are obtained.'], ['The minimum values for each stat are as follows:', ['Damage: 0.5', 'Speed: 0.1', 'Shot Speed: 0.6', 'Range: 1.0']], ["Further changes to Isaac's stats are still calculated normally behind the scenes, but their ''effective'' values cannot go below the minimum. For example, 0.5 Shot Speed will ''behave'' as though it were 0.6, but a 0.2 Shot Speed increase would apply to the true stat value of 0.5, meaning the new stat value would be 0.7."]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: The stats are locked to the highest number achieved, rendering the stat downs behind the scene immaterial.']]

name: Backstabber
description: Isaac's tears deal double [[damage]] and inflict [[Status Effects#Bleed|bleeding]] on enemies if they're facing away from Isaac.
effects: [['When tears land on the "back" of enemies, they deal double [[damage]] and inflict [[Status Effects#Bleed|bleeding]].', ['{{dlc|nr}} Bleeding enemies take damage equal to 10% of their maximum health every 5 seconds. Bosses cannot be inflicted with bleeding, but will still take the extra damage.', '{{dlc|r}} Enemies bleed for 5 seconds, bleeding enemies take damage based on how quickly they move; the faster the enemy, the more damage they take. While moving, a bleeding enemy leaves behind [[Creep#Red_Creep|red creep]] that can damage other enemies. Bosses can also be inflicted with bleeding.', 'The extra damage is dealt even if the enemy is already bleeding.']]]
synergies: [["{{I|Dark Arts}}: Freezing an enemy from it's back using Dark Arts will apply Backstabber's effect."], ['[[Shooting familiar]]s: Tears fired by familiars can inflict the effects of Backstabber.'], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}}: The Ludovico tear will nearly always backstab when over an enemy.']]

name: Mama Mega!
description: Damages all [[Monster|enemies]] and destroys all [[obstacle]]s. The effect occurs every time a new room is entered for the rest of the floor. Opens the doors to the floor's {{r|Secret Room}}s and {{r|Super Secret Room}}s.
effects: [['Destroys all [[obstacle]]s in the current room and deals 200 damage to every enemy (including [[Boss]]es). This effect also applies to every room for the remainder of the floor.', ['{{dlc|r}} Also destroys all [[Machine]]s, {{M|Beggar}}s, {{E|Shopkeeper}}s, and {{E|Fire Place}}s.', '{{dlc|r}} Also destroys all obstacles in rooms that have already been cleared.', '{{dlc|r}} Will destroy {{M|Donation Machine}}s as well, reducing donated coin count and removing them for the rest of the run.']], ['Opens all {{r|Secret Room}} and {{r|Super Secret Room}} doors on the current floor.']]
notes: [['Mama Mega! opens the paths to {{r|Boss Rush}} and the {{Stage|???}} even after the time limits expire.', ['The Boss does not need to be defeated before entering these doors.', "It will also open the Boss Rush / {{s|???}} entrance room door if it is activated after {{E|Mom}} or {{E|Mom's Heart}}/{{E|It Lives}} has already been defeated.", 'Leaving the {{r|Boss Room}} (via teleport or entering a {{r|Devil Room}}/{{r|Angel Room}}) will close the doors.', 'Leaving the {{r|Boss Rush}} room or {{s|???}} entrance room will also close the doors.', '{{Dlc|r}} Does not open a path to {{s|???}} if used in the room on the other side of the flesh door in {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} II.']], ['Entering a room with an angel statue while the effect is active automatically initiates a fight with an [[Angel]].'], ["Does not kill Lil' Haunts and other enemies that are immune to damage while entering the room."], ['If used before the {{E|Ultra Greed}} fight begins, it will deal no damage to Ultra Greed, as he is invulnerable for the first few seconds upon first entering his room. However, it will still break obstacles as usual.'], ['When used in [[Greed mode]], it will only activate once for the main room (as opposed to once per wave, in a similar fashion to a standard run). Therefore, its damage potential is maximized if used after all the monster waves have spawned for the current floor.'], ['Does not open the door to {{E|Mega Satan}} in {{s|Dark Room}} or {{s|Chest}}.'], ['{{Dlc|r}} If used in {{s|Downpour}} / {{s|Dross}} II, the entrance to the [[Mirrored World]] will be destroyed, making it inaccessible.', ['If used in the [[Mirrored World]], it will destroy the exit, which, on top of making it impossible to leave, will then cause Isaac to take damage and die.', 'This can be avoided by entering and immediately leaving the room before the shockwave reaches the mirror.']], ['{{Dlc|r}} Does not open the flesh door at the end of {{s|Mausoleum}} / {{s|Gehenna}} II.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{t|Broken Padlock}}: Mama Mega!'s blast will also open locks."], ["{{e|Golden Bomb}}: While holding a golden bomb, Mama Mega! can be used once on that floor without consuming it but will remove the golden bomb from Isaac's consumables (using it a second time consumes it as normal). It may be used again for free on another floor if yet another golden bomb is collected, and so on. {{dlc|r}} Mama Mega! also receives an unique golden sprite in the HUD.", ['{{I|Schoolbag}} + {{I|Everything Jar}}: Reliable source of Golden Bombs for the above use.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery|n}}: No effect.'], ["{{i|Void|nr}}: Can't be consumed by Void.", ['{{dlc|r}} If consumed by Void, the Mama Mega! effect will be activated once only, the next time Void is activated.']], ['{{p|? Card|nr}}: Mama Mega! will be activated and consumed.', ["{{dlc|r}} Mama Mega!'s effect can be activated through the card without consuming the actual item."]]]

name: Wait What?
quote: I can't believe it's not butter bean!
description: Isaac farts, sending out rock waves.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac farts, knocking back enemies and their shots. It also sends out rock waves that deal 10 damage per tick to nearby enemies and break [[obstacle]]s.']]
notes: [['This item is identical to {{i|Butter Bean}} in appearance.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Butter Bean}} has a small chance to turn into this item upon pickup.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Each run has a chance of replacing Butter Bean with Wait What? in item pools. Both items generally do not exist during the same run.'], ['This item is useful for opening {{R|Secret Room}}s, {{R|Super Secret Room}}s, [[Bedroom]]s and the path to {{S|Mines}}. In Bedrooms, it can also open up the passage under the carpet.', ['To break open a secret room, the wall must be hit with one of the rock waves, not the gas cloud, so Isaac needs to stand a few steps away from the wall.']], ['The earthquake can open {{E|Bomb Chest}}s.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The earthquake can be used to blow up the {{M|Donation Machine}} or activate/blow up a {{M|Shop Restock Machine}}.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{I|Ghost Pepper}}: Shoots a flame behind Isaac upon each use of Wait What. While {{I|Car Battery}} does not duplicate Wait What's shockwave, the flame shot is duplicated regardless."]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.']]

name: Crooked Penny
description: Spawns a penny and has a 50% chance to double all [[items]] and [[pickups]] in the room. If the effect fails, the items and pickups disappear.
notes: [['If used in a {{R|Shop}} or {{R|Devil Room}}, the duplicated items and pickups can be taken for free.'], ['If the effect fails in a shop that contains a {{M|Shop Restock Machine}}, then the Restock Machine can be used to refresh the Shop, bringing back new items and pickups.'], ['If used in the {{R|Boss Rush}} room, it can duplicate the items, and all of them can be taken without affecting the originals. Successfully duplicating the items will trigger Boss Rush, and failing to duplicate them will not.'], ['If used on {{i|The Polaroid}} and {{i|The Negative}} after defeating {{E|Mom}}, it can duplicate them, and they can both be taken without affecting the originals.'], ['The 50% chance is predetermined after each use of Crooked Penny. By force quitting or using {{i|Glowing Hour Glass}} after each failure, this can be exploited to generate large numbers of copies of useful items — if the penny is going to fail, then use it in a different room, recharge it, and try again.', ['{{Dlc|r}} The outcome of Crooked Penny is determined on a per-room basis, meaning that it will succeed in certain rooms and fail in others respecting the 50/50 chance. Using Crooked Penny will still advance an RNG step, however, and re-roll the outcome of the other rooms.']]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ["{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Void}}: Void's item-absorbing effect activates before Crooked Penny's effect, but Crooked Penny nonetheless has a chance of doubling the absorbed items, leaving behind copies of them. Missing with Crooked Penny still results in the item being absorbed, but one penny also appears.", ['{{Dlc|r}} Void does not absorb the item if Crooked Penny fails, but one penny still appears. Void absorbs only the original item if Crooked Penny succeeds, leaving behind a copy.']]]
interactions: [['{{dlc|nr}} {{i|Car Battery}}: Activates the item twice, quadrupling all items/drops in the room at a 25% chance. However, if the first activation fails, and the second activation succeeds, a copy of the item will be created as the original disappears, and the new copy will have no cost if it were in a {{R|Shop}} or {{R|Devil Room}}. This has a 25% chance as well, leaving the overall failure chance at 50% (a success followed by a fail will have the same effect as two fails).', ['{{Dlc|r}} Activates the item twice, quadrupling all items/drops in the room at a 25% chance but having a combined 75% chance to fail. A failure followed by a success generates 2 pennies.']]]

name: Dull Razor
description: Hurts Isaac without depleting health, activating any items that trigger upon taking damage.
notes: [['As using the Dull Razor will grant extra invincibility frames like normal damage, this item can be used to enter {{r|Curse Room}} for free, or, with proper timing, allow Isaac to avoid taking damage from an enemy or obstacle.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} The invincibility frames allow Isaac to use {{Machine|Blood Donation Machine}}s and {{Machine|Devil Beggar}}s for free.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Dull Razor ignores shields granted by {{i|Holy Mantle}}, and similar items.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery|r}}: Dull Razor activates twice, triggering on-damage items twice.']]

name: Metronome
description: Grants a random item effect for the current room.
notes: [['Beware using this as {{C|The Lost}} or {{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Lost}}, as it can trigger self-harm items and kill him.'], ['Using this item multiple times in the same room will replace the previous item with a new one.'], ['Metronome cannot grant the effects of itself, {{i|Glowing Hour Glass}} or {{i|Plan C}}.', ['{{Dlc|r}}It also cannot grant the effects of {{i|Breath of Life}}, {{i|Clicker}}, or {{i|R key}}.']], ["Keep in mind that you can trigger items you haven't unlocked yet, which means you could trigger the effect of items like {{I|Death Certificate}} without having to go through the trouble of unlocking them."], ['If Metronome triggers the effect of {{I|Genesis}}, it will disappear from the active slot, just as with the real item.'], ['Metronome has a reduced chance of activating {{i|Genesis}} (25% success) or {{i|Death certificate}} (15% success).']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Rock Bottom}}: Isaac keeps any stat upgrades gained by a random temporary item as long as the item brings his stats over their highest value reached on that run. This allows Isaac to potentially accrue a large number of stat upgrades.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Blanket}} / {{P|Holy Card}} / {{i|Holy Mantle}} / {{t|Wooden Cross}}: if Metronome is used while the shield is active, any stat changes or familiars/orbitals generated from Metronome will persist between rooms until Metronome is used again or replaced with another active item. Items that modify your stats and have other additional effects will keep the stats but the effect will be gone after leaving the room. For example, the tears down applied from {{i|The Inner Eye}} will persist between rooms, but Isaac will not shoot three tears at once.', ['Some tear effects from items will remain active between rooms. These include:', ["{{i|Continuum}}, {{i|Epic Fetus}}, {{i|Eve's Mascara}}, {{i|Godhead}}, {{i|Ipecac}}, {{i|Jacob's Ladder}}, {{i|The Ludovico Technique}}, {{i|A Lump of Coal}}, {{i|Monstro's Lung}}, {{i|My Reflection}}, {{i|Ouija Board}}, {{i|Pop!}}, {{i|Rubber Cement}}, {{i|Sacred Heart}}, {{i|Spoon Bender}}, {{i|Strange Attractor}}, {{i|Technology Zero}}"], 'Some items behave unusually after leaving the room while the Holy Mantle shield was active:', ["Items that grant flight: Isaac's appearance is reset back to normal, but he is still able to fly.", "{{i|1up!}}: the mushroom familiar continues to follow Isaac, but doesn't grant an extra life.", "{{i|Cupid's Arrow}}: the tear appearance is reset back to normal, but the tears still travel through enemies.", '{{i|Fire Mind}}: the tear appearance is reset back to normal, but tears can still explode when they hit an enemy.', '{{i|Mysterious Liquid}}: the tear appearance is reset back to normal, but tears will still leave green creep on the ground.', '{{i|Spear of Destiny}}: does not persist between rooms.']]], ["{{i|Car Battery}}: Metronome is activated twice at once as expected, but the item chosen for the first activation is shown raised above Isaac's head, instead of the second one that actually remains active."]]

name: D Infinity
description:
{{dlc|nr}} Grants a random die item that changes each use.
{{dlc|r}} Acts as any die item, and can by cycled by pressing the drop key.
notes: [['The icon of the D Infinity will change to resemble the corresponding die while being held. Putting it back on a pedestal will change its icon back to normal.']]
interactions: [['{{Dlc|r}} {{I|Void}}: Void will absorb the effect of the dice D Infinity was shapen into at the moment of absorption.']]

name: Eden's Soul
description: Spawns two item pedestals then is consumed. Begins with no charges.
effects: [["Upon activation, this item is consumed and will vanish from Isaac's inventory."], ['Spawns two random item pedestals using the [[item pool]] of the current room.']]
notes: [['This item starts with no charges.'], ["{{dlc|nr}} Unlike {{i|Mega Blast}}, this item can be charged with a single {{E|Lil' Battery}}.", ["{{E|Lil' Battery|r}} fills six charges."]]]
synergies: [['{{dlc|r}} {{p|? Card}}: Activates the item without consuming it, allowing for potential multiple uses.'], ['{{bov}}'], ["{{i|Diplopia}}: Spawns two Eden's Souls that will both drop 2 items when used."]]
interactions: [["{{i|The Battery}}: Eden's Soul cannot be activated twice with a double charge."], ["{{i|Car Battery}}: Does not affect Eden's Soul. Only two items will spawn upon use."], ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Void}}: If absorbed, Eden's Soul is stored, and allows for a single use in a desired location. Also effectively reduces charge time to 6 rooms", ["{{dlc|r}}{{i|Car Battery}} + {{i|Void}}: Eden's Soul immediately spawns 2 items from the current item pool. This is likely to be the Angel Room."]]]

name: Delirious
description: Spawns {{E|Delirium|n}} as a random [[friendly]] [[boss]] that fights for Isaac.
notes: [['If multiple bosses are spawned in one room with {{i|Car Battery}}, {{i|The Battery}}, or batteries, the bosses can try to kill each other.'], ["Sometimes bosses don't spawn because of grid entities getting in the way. When this happens the upper door appears to have friendly particles."], ["{{dlc|nr}} Unlike {{i|Mega Blast}}, this item can be charged with a single {{E|Lil' Battery}}.", ["{{E|Lil' Battery|r}} gives 6 charges."]], ['It is possible for {{E|Hush}} to spawn, despite Delirium not transforming into Hush during its boss battle.'], ['If a boss summons monsters, the monsters will be charmed and will follow Isaac out of the room.'], ['Delirious has a 60% decreased item pool weight, making it less likely to appear than other collectibles.'], ['Certain large bosses with high health like{{E|Hush}} can block projectiles while Isaac stays within their hitbox, with enemies often dying when they touch the boss. Very useful for bullet heavy bosses.'], ['Using Delirious in the [[Delirium]] fight is ill-advised as the player may confuse which Delirium is the right one, often causing more chaos in an already chaotic battle.']]

name: Angry Fly
description: Spawns a fly [[familiar]] that orbits around a random enemy and deals 30 damage per second to enemies it comes in contact with.
effects: [['Spawns a fly [[familiar]] that orbits around a random enemy and deals 2 damage per tick/30 damage per second to enemies it comes in contact with.', ['It will occasionally make a lunge towards the enemy it is orbiting, allowing brief contact even with smaller enemies.', 'If the enemy it is orbiting dies, it starts orbiting a different enemy.', 'If there are no enemies, it orbits Isaac.']], ['{{transf|Beelzebub|item}}']]
notes: [['Angry Fly will orbit around invincible enemies such as {{e|Stone Grimace}}s without dealing damage.'], ['Due to its movement pattern, its actual damage dealt per second is erratic against most enemies and groups of them.'], ['{{dlc|r}} As {{c|Tainted Jacob}}, Angry Fly will orbit around {{e|Dark Esau|n}}.']]

name: Black Hole
description: Throws a black hole on the ground which sucks in and damages enemies.
effects: [['Upon use, Isaac throws a black hole which sucks in and damages enemies.', ['The black hole deals 0.4 damage per tick very rapidly, for a maximum of 6 dps.', 'The black hole lasts for about 6 seconds.', 'The black hole also slightly sucks in Isaac and pickups.', 'The black hole also destroys nearby obstacles, such as rocks and pots.', 'It can also suck in projectiles shot by enemies.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery}}: No effect.'], ['{{i|Gnawed Leaf}}: The black hole does not pull Isaac in while he is a statue.'], ['{{i|Schoolbag}}: The black hole will continue to pull in enemies, pickups, etc. while allowing the player to use other active items.']]

name: Bozo
description: +0.1 flat [[damage]], grants a {{E|Soul Heart}}. Enemies can randomly become briefly [[charm]]ed or [[fear]]ed. Taking damage has a chance to spawn a {{E|rainbow poop}}.
effects: [['+0.1 flat [[damage]].'], ['Grants a {{e|Soul Heart}}.'], ['Enemies may randomly become briefly [[charm]]ed or [[fear]]ed.'], ['Taking damage has a 5% chance to spawn {{e|Rainbow Poop}}.']]
notes: [['None of the above effects are affected by [[luck]].']]
synergies: [['{{I|Blood Oath}}: Each half-heart lost has a chance of spawning a rainbow poop, allowing for full red heart regeneration.'], ['{{I|IV Bag}}: Each use has a chance of spawning a rainbow poop.'], ["With max red hearts, {{I|The Wafer}}, and careful timing to get the maximum healing from each rainbow poop, Isaac's effective health pool could be extremely high."]]

name: Broken Modem
description: Enemies, enemy shots, tears, and pickups will briefly freeze in place at random intervals.
effects: [['Enemies, enemy shots, tears and pickups will briefly freeze in place at random intervals.', ["The frequency of the effect depends on Isaac's [[luck]].", '{{dlc|r}} Frozen enemy shots will disappear.']], ['Has a 25% chance to double the room drop, similar to {{i|Contract From Below}}.', ['Unlike the Contract, the Broken Modem cannot double [[chest]]s, [[pill]]s or [[card]]s.', ["However, it ''can'' duplicate chests that are an alternate reward from {{i|Options?}}. These chests will have different contents from each other."]]]]
synergies: [['{{dlc+|r}}{{i|Magneto}} + {{i|Options?}}: If Broken Modem duplicates a chest that was spawned by Options?, using Magneto to immediately open the chest while in its glitched form will create a {{i|TMTRAINER}} item if the chest contained an item.{{dlc-}}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Poke Go}}: The charmed enemies spawned by this item will also be affected by the modem.'], ['{{i|Contract from Below}}: Contract from Below spawns two items, Broken Modem has an independent chance to duplicate each one.']]

name: Mystery Gift
description: Upon use, spawns a random item from the current room's item pool, with a chance to spawn {{I|A Lump of Coal}} or {{I|The Poop}} instead.
effects: [["Upon use, spawns a random item from the current room's [[Item Pool|item pool]], with a chance to spawn {{i|A Lump of Coal}} or {{i|The Poop}} instead."]]
notes:
[['Mystery Gift's item depends on the [[Luck]] stat.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Luck !! Item Pool !! A Lump of Coal !! The Poop
|-
| -10 || 0% || 50% || 50%
|-
| 0 || 83.3% || 8.3% || 8.3%
|-
| 10 || 90.9%|| 4.5%|| 4.5%
|}']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery|n}}: No effect, Mystery Gift will only spawn a single item.'], ['{{i|Void|n}}: Like all single-use active items, this item cannot be absorbed by Void. Instead, it will consume and use the Mystery Gift.']]

name: Sprinkler
description: Upon use, creates a stationary sprinkler that rotates and fires tears in 8 directions. The tears copy Isaac's stats and most tear effects.
effects: [["Upon use, creates a stationary sprinkler that rotates and fires tears in 8 directions. The tears copy Isaac's stats and most tear effects."]]
notes: [["Sprinkler's rate of fire and rotation speed depends on Isaac's [[tears]] stat."], ['Sprinkler does not do contact damage.'], ['It is counted as an [[obstacle]] and will block some enemies movement, e.g: {{e|Chub}}.']]
synergies: [['{{i|20/20}} / {{i|The Inner Eye}} / {{i|Mutant Spider}}: The sprinkler fires multiple tears simultaneously.'], ['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: Sprinkler tears are affected only while Isaac is firing, and are released at the same time Isaac releases the fire button.'], ['{{t|Baby-Bender}}: The sprinkler will shoot homing tears.'], ["{{i|Blood Clot}} / {{i|Chemical Peel}}: The sprinkler will fire either normal tears or tears with the items' effects depending on which tear Isaac fired last."], ['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Brimstone}}: The sprinkler fires somewhat short-ranged Brimstone lasers instead of tears.'], ['{{I|Camo Undies}}: Isaac stays camouflaged after placing the sprinkler.'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Spawns two sprinklers on top of each other.'], ["{{i|Chocolate Milk|nr}}: The size and damage of the sprinkler's tears depend on Isaac's current charge amount."], ['{{i|Dead Eye}}: Sprinklers increase the damage multiplier when hitting an enemy, and do not reduce it when they miss.'], ['{{i|Kidney Stone}}: Sprinklers will fire a barrage of tears whenever Isaac does, but will not fire the stone.'], ['{{i|Lead Pencil|nr}}: Sprinkler tears count for activation of the Lead Pencil effect. The tear burst may fire from the sprinkler or Isaac.'], ["{{i|Loki's Horns}}: The sprinkler has four eyes and simultaneously fires tears in four directions."], ["{{i|Mom's Eye}}: The sprinkler has two eyes and simultaneously fires tears forwards and backward."], ["{{i|Mom's Knife}}: The sprinkler fires knives instead of tears. The knives fire straight outwards, deal {{dlc|nr}} double / {{dlc|r}} 1.5x Isaac's tear damage and do not return.", ["{{dlc|r}} '''Mom's Knife''' + {{i|BFFS!}} The knives deal double Isaac's tear damage."]], ["{{i|Monstro's Lung}}: The sprinkler fires disorganized clusters of tears."], ['{{I|Star of Bethlehem}}: When Isaac is in the aura, the Sprinkler will rotate faster and its tears will be affected by the Star of Bethlehem. The Sprinkler does not need to be in the aura for this to work, just Isaac.'], ["{{i|Tech X}}: The sprinkler fires laser rings that are smaller than the central spark and have a correspondingly small hit area, which deal 100% of Isaac's damage."], ['{{i|Technology}}: The sprinkler fires lasers instead of tears.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Tears will travel toward and orbit Isaac, wherever he is in the room.'], ["{{i|Tractor Beam|nr}}: The sprinkler's tears will not fire from the sprinkler itself, and will simply appear within the beam."], ['{{i|Trisagion}}: Sprinklers will shoot beams.']]
interactions: [['{{i|BFFS!}}: Sprinkler increases in size but does not do extra damage.'], ['{{i|Dr. Fetus}}: The sprinkler fires bombs which can damage Isaac.'], ['{{i|Epic Fetus}}: The sprinkler fires crosshairs; missiles will strike the crosshairs after a short delay. This can damage Isaac.'], ["{{i|Eye of the Occult}}: Sprinkler's tears travel a very short distance in their original direction and can be controlled afterwards."], ['{{i|Ipecac}}: The sprinkler fires explosive shots which can damage Isaac.', ["'''Ipecac''' + '''Dr. Fetus''': The bombs fired by the sprinkler will not damage Isaac."]], ['{{i|The Ludovico Technique}} / {{i|Spirit Sword}}: The sprinkler will not fire tears at all.'], ['{{i|My Reflection}}: Tears fired from the sprinkler will boomerang towards Isaac instead of the sprinkler.']]

name: Fast Bombs
description: Grants 7 {{E|bomb}}s and allows bombs to be placed rapidly. {{dlc|r}} Bombs will no longer knock each other away.
effects: [['+7 {{e|Bomb}}s.'], ['Removes the delay between bomb placements, allowing them to be placed rapidly.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Fast Bombs inflict no knockback on Isaac's bombs."]]
notes: [['Holding the bomb button will not automatically place them. Each bomb needs to be manually placed.'], ["On {{plat|PC|no break}}, it's possible to bind two buttons to lay bombs and use both for even higher rates of bombing."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Remote Detonator}}: Since bombs can be placed rapidly, this can be used to do lots of damage at once to a boss or enemy.']]

name: Buddy in a Box
description: Spawns a [[familiar]] with a random tear effect. The familiar is randomized at the start of each [[Chapters|floor]].
effects: [['Grants a familiar with random tear effects, fire rate, and damage.', ["The familiar's damage scales from ~2-6, and tear delay scales from ~12-30.", 'The familiar takes the appearance of a random [[co-op|co-op baby]].', 'The familiar is randomized upon entering a new [[floor]].']], ['{{dlc|r}} {{transf|Conjoined|item}}']]
notes: [['The tear effects available are the same as on the {{i|Fruit Cake}} item.'], ["The familiar's tear appearance isn't linked to the normal effect such tears would have.", ['For instance, [[piercing tears|piercing]]-looking tears might not go through enemies and {{i|Sinus Infection}} tears might not stick, while tears that do not look like {{i|Compound Fracture}} tears can still split on hit.']], ['Some tear effects like {{i|Proptosis}} and {{i|Tiny Planet}} do not have their associated stat boosts and thus are very ineffective.'], ["Familiars with the {{i|Serpent's Kiss}} effect can drop {{e|Black Heart}}s when an enemy is killed."], ['Familiars will not do contact damage.'], ['{{dlc+|r}} The familiar will change upon exiting the {{i|Knife Piece 2}} area. (possibly a bug){{dlc-}}']]
synergies: [['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Spawns a new randomly generated familiar.']]

name: Lil Delirium
description: Grants a [[familiar]] that transforms into another random familiar every 10 seconds.
effects: [['Grants a [[familiar]] that transforms into another random familiar every 10 seconds.', ['The familiars it turns into are normal familiars that look white and melted like {{e|Delirium}}.', 'Familiars deal the same damage as their normal non-Delirium counterparts.', 'Familiars will not do contact damage.']]]
notes: [['Lil Delirium can transform into the following familiars:', ['[[File:Lil Delirium Acid Baby.png|20x20px|link=Acid Baby]] [[Acid Baby]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium BBF.png|20x20px|link=BBF]] [[BBF]]', "[[File:Lil Delirium Bob's Brain.png|20x20px|link=Bob's Brain]] [[Bob's Brain]]", '[[File:Lil Delirium Dry Baby.png|20x20px|link=Dry Baby]] [[Dry Baby]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Headless Baby.png|20x20px|link=Headless Baby]] [[Headless Baby]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Hushy.png|20x20px|link=Hushy]] [[Hushy]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Incubus.png|20x20px|link=Incubus]] [[Incubus]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Lil Brimstone.png|20x20px|link=Lil Brimstone]] [[Lil Brimstone]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Lil Gurdy.png|20x20px|link=Lil Gurdy]] [[Lil Gurdy]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Lil Haunt.png|20x20px|link=Lil Haunt]] [[Lil Haunt]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Lil Monstro.png|20x20px|link=Lil Monstro]] [[Lil Monstro]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Little Chubby.png|20x20px|link=Little Chubby]] [[Little Chubby]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Little Gish.png|20x20px|link=Little Gish]] [[Little Gish]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Robo-Baby 2.0.png|20x20px|link=Robo-Baby 2.0]] [[Robo-Baby 2.0]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Rotten Baby.png|20x20px|link=Rotten Baby]] [[Rotten Baby]]', '[[File:Lil Delirium Seraphim.png|20x20px|link=Seraphim]] [[Seraphim]]', "[[File:Lil Delirium Super Meat Boy.png|20px|link=Cube of Meat]] Super Meat Boy ([[Cube of Meat]]'s 4th stage)", '{{Dlc|r}}[[File:Lil Delirium Big Chubby.png|20x20px|link=Big Chubby]] [[Big Chubby]]', '{{Dlc|r}}[[File:Lil Delirium Farting Baby.png|20x20px]] [[Farting Baby]]', '{{Dlc|r}}[[File:Lil Delirium Fruity Plum.png|20x20px]] [[Fruity Plum]]', "{{Dlc|r}}[[File:Lil Delirium Isaacs Head.png|20x20px]] [[Isaac's Head]]", '{{Dlc|r}}[[File:Lil Delirium Lil Loki.png|20x20px]] [[Lil Loki]]']], ['Lil Delirium can transform into the same familiar multiple times in a row and therefore stay in the same form for more than 10 seconds.'], ['Every time Lil Delirium transforms from a free-floating familiar to a follower one, it positions itself at the end of the familiar train.'], ["Lil Delirium can damage Isaac when transformed into BBF or Bob's Brain."], ['{{i|Monster Manual|r}} can spawn Lil Delirium, which functions as normal.']]
synergies: [['{{i|Box of Friends}}: The copy of Lil Delirium will be a different random familiar.']]

name: Coupon
description: While held, guarantees one item in every {{R|Shop}} will be on sale. On use, makes a random item in the current room free.
effects: [['On use, makes a random item in the current room that costs money or hearts free.'], ['While held, guarantees a random item or pickup from the {{r|Shop}} to be half price.']]
notes: [['Using the Coupon in a {{r|Devil Room}} and taking that free item does not affect or remove the chances for {{r|Angel Room}}s.'], ['Using the Coupon in [[Greed Mode]] does not restock the taken item or consumable.'], ['Using the Coupon in a Shop while holding {{i|Restock}} will not respawn a new item after taking the free one.'], ['{{dlc|r}} Using the Coupon as {{c|The Lost}} or {{c|Tainted Lost}} allows multiple Devil deals to be taken.']]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: Makes two items free upon use.'], ['{{i|Satanic Bible|r}}: The Devil deal in the boss room can be acquired for free.']]

name: Telekinesis
description: Upon use, for the next two seconds, any enemy shots that come near Isaac are held in place. After the charge is depleted, they are fired back as tears.
effects: [['Upon use, for the next three seconds, any enemy shots that come near Isaac are held in place. After the charge is depleted, they are fired back as tears.', ['The reflected tears always do 3.5 damage.']], ["{{dlc|r}} Pushes enemies away for the duration of the item's usage."]]
notes: [["The tears can be rammed into enemies while they're held by Telekinesis. They won't disappear until the effect ends but do no further damage."], ['Catching shots from enemies that fire high into the air, like the {{e|Tube Worm}}, is very difficult and not beneficial; in the case of the Tube Worm, shots that are caught will just fall to the ground rather than be fired at enemies.']]
interactions: [['{{p|? Card}}: The cooldown applies even when used through the ? Card.'], ['{{i|9 Volt|force=nr}}: Does not benefit from 9 Volt, unlike other auto-recharge items.', ['{{Dlc|r}} 9 Volt now grants half charge on use.']], ["{{i|The Battery}}: A {{E|Lil' Battery}} (or other [[battery]]) has to be picked up for another charge. Both charges are expended at once for a longer duration effect."], ['{{i|Car Battery}}: The Car Battery has no effect.', ['{{Dlc|r}} Car Battery now grants 6 seconds of protection for 6 seconds of recharge time.']], ["{{i|Sharp Plug}}: Charge gained from Sharp Plug is expended immediately and won't stop enemy shots."]]

name: Moving Box
description: If the box is empty, picks up all items and pickups in a room and stores them. If the box is not empty, places all stored items and pickups in the current room.
effects: [['If the box is empty, it picks up items and pickups in a room and stores them.', ['{{dlc|r}} Moving Box can carry up to 10 items or pickups at once, randomly picked (i.e. items are not prioritized).']], ['If the box is not empty, places all stored items and pickups in the current room.']]
notes: [['{{dlc|nr}} There is no limit to the number of items and pickups that can be held in the box.'], ['Any stored items and pickups unpacked from Moving Box will remain identical to what was originally packed; [[pills]], [[Cards and Runes|cards, and runes]] will stay the same, {{e|Sticky Nickel}}s will remain stuck to the floor, and {{E|chest}}s will have the same contents as they would if they had been opened immediately.'], ['Active items keep their charge in the box.'], ['Stealing from {{r|Shop}}s and {{r|Devil Room}}s is not possible; only items on pedestals will be packed up.'], ['{{dlc|nr}} If used in a {{r|Challenge Room}} or {{r|Boss Challenge Room}} the objects within can be packed up without starting the challenge.', ['{{dlc|r}} Using Moving Box in these rooms starts the challenge.']], ['If used in a room with a choice of multiple item pedestals, only one of the choice objects will be packed up and the rest behave normally.', ["{{dlc|nr}} Both items presented by {{i|There's Options}} and {{i|More Options}} can be taken.", '{{dlc|nr}} Both {{i|The Polaroid}} and {{i|The Negative}} can be taken.', '{{dlc|nr}} If used in the {{r|Boss Rush}} room, one of the objects is packed up but the rush is not started. The remaining item choices start the rush as normal.', ['{{dlc|r}} Using Moving Box to pack items in {{r|Boss Rush}} starts the challenge.'], "{{dlc|r}} Moving Box works normally in {{i|Death Certificate|n}}'s area. Packing items in that special area won't activate the force-leaving mechanic."]], ['All existing Moving Boxes share their opened/closed state. Therefore, it is not possible to carry a Moving Box that is holding items within another Moving Box as the items must be unpacked first.'], ["{{dlc|r}} Disappearing pickups that are spawned by {{c|Tainted Magdalene}} / {{p|Soul of Magdalene|n}} or {{c|Tainted Keeper}} can't be packed into Moving Box."]]
synergies: [['{{bov}}'], ['{{i|Glowing Hour Glass}}: If a charged Glowing Hour Glass is stored in the Moving Box, it can be unpacked and used, refunding charges to both items while rewinding time and essentially allowing unlimited use.']]
interactions: [['{{i|Car Battery|nr}}: Activation swaps the contents of the box with the contents of the room.', ['{{dlc|r}} No effect.']], ['{{i|Flip}}: Moving items that are able to be swapped by Flip will still be able to be swapped after placing them down again. However, empty item pedestals that only contain the "ghostly" item cannot be moved unless flipped.'], ["{{i|Void}}: This item's effect cannot be absorbed by Void. It will be treated as a passive item by the Void."]]

name: Jumper Cables
description: Grants an active item charge every 15 enemies killed.
effects: [['Grants an active item charge every 15 enemies killed.']]
interactions: [["{{i|Isaac's Tears}}: No effect."], ['{{i|Jumper Cables}}: No Effect, every 15 kills still only restore 1 bar of charge.']]

name: Technology Zero
description: Connects Isaac's tears with electricity that can damage enemies.
effects: [['Connects tears with electricity that damages enemies.', ["{{dlc|nr}} The electricity's damage is equal to Isaac's [[Damage]].", "{{dlc|r}} The electricity deals 30% of Isaac's Damage, 15 times per second.", 'A tear can generate one connection. The tear does not generate another connection even after the connection is lost. However, other tears can still make connections with it.', "Each of Isaac's tears can connect to other allied tears Including those of [[shooting familiar]]s.", ["The number of connections is limited by the number of Isaac's tears."]]]]
notes: [["It will connect {{C|Jacob and Esau}}'s tears regardless of which one picked up the item."]]
synergies: [['{{i|Anti-Gravity}}: All of the tears fired are connected by electricity, creating a series of electric fences.'], ['{{I|Apple!}} / {{I|Tough Love}}: The damage of the electricity can be multiplied by the items. This occurs independently from the tears which generated the electricity.'], ["{{i|Cricket's Body}} / {{i|Compound Fracture}} / {{i|The Parasite}}: Split tears will be connected via electricity."], ["{{i|Evil Eye}}: Tears fired by eye will be connected via electricity to Isaac's tears."], ['{{i|Eye of the occult}}: Allows you to move the electrified tears, allowing you to hit more enemies and do more damage.'], ['{{i|Haemolacria|force=r}}: Main tears and bursts can be connected via electricity.'], ['{{i|Pop!}}: Tears in midair and tears that knock around each other will still be connected, effectively creating electric barriers.'], ['{{I|Proptosis}}: Triples the electricity damage. Has no penalty with range.'], ['{{i|Sinus Infection}}: Boogers will have electricity flowing between them even if attached to the same enemy, dealing massive damage to bosses.'], ['{{I|Sulfuric Acid}} / {{I|Terra}}: The lasers are capable of destroying terrain, but is unable to apply knockback, allowing to easily destroy large quantities of obstacles.'], ['{{i|Tiny Planet}}: Creates moving laser fields that orbit the character.'], ["{{i|The Wiz}}: The diagonally-spreading tear shots will be connected by electricity, effectively making up for the item's blind spot and providing an attack with a very wide range."]]
interactions: [['The following items override Technology Zero. Tears from other sources such as {{I|Lead Pencil}} can still generate electricity with each other.', ['{{i|Brimstone}}', '{{i|Dr. Fetus}}', '{{i|Epic Fetus}}', "{{I|Mom's Knife}}", '{{i|Technology}}', '{{i|Tech X}}', "{{I|Trisagion}}: Tears from other sources can be connected with the base of Trisagion's blast."]], ['{{i|Continuum}}: Tears will travel through walls; however, the electricity will not connect the tears while they are outside the room. If a tear was connected before it pass through a wall, it will not be connected after passing through, limiting the efficiency of the combination.'], ['{{i|Flat Stone}}: Tears lose their connection as they bounce. As such, tears cannot make connection to another tear once they bounce, but other tears can make connection to them.'], ['{{I|Haemolacria|force=nr}}: Only main tears can be connected.']]

name: Leprosy
description: Upon taking damage, grants a body part as an [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbital]], which blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick to enemies it comes in contact with. The orbitals will be destroyed if they take enough damage from enemies or enemy shots.
effects: [['Upon taking damage, Isaac gains a body part as an [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars|orbital]], which blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick (35 damage per second) to enemies it comes in contact with.', ['A maximum of three body parts can be active at once.', 'The body parts will be destroyed after dealing 30 ticks of damage and/or blocking 3 shots.', 'The body parts persist between floors.', 'Body parts orbit on the same layer as [[Blue Fly|Blue Flies]] and [[Locusts]] do.']]]
interactions: [['{{i|Box of Friends}}: Will not multiply orbitals.']]

name: 7 Seals
description: Spawns a random [[The Harbingers|Harbinger]] [[familiar]] that changes every 10 seconds. Harbingers have different behaviors and spawn themed [[Locust]]s.
effects: [["Spawns a random [[The Harbingers|Harbinger]] [[familiar]] that changes every 10 seconds. All harbingers deal contact damage to enemies and periodically spawn [[locust]]s if Isaac currently doesn't have any, though each harbinger behaves slightly differently:", ["{{e|Famine}} wanders around the room, leaves a trail of slowing black creep, deals 0.5 contact damage per tick or 15 damage per second, and spawns [[Locust of Famine|yellow locusts]] every 3 seconds that deal double Isaac's damage and slows enemies.", "{{e|Pestilence}} wanders around the room, leaves a trail of green creep that deals 1 damage per tick or 30 damage per second, deals 0.5 contact damage per tick or 15 damage per second, and spawns [[Locust of Pestilence|green locusts]] every 3 seconds that deal double Isaac's damage and poisons enemies, which deals double Isaac's damage over time.", '{{e|War}} chases enemies, moves faster than the other Harbingers, deals 1.5 contact damage per tick or 45 damage per second, and spawns [[Locust of War|red locusts]] every 5 seconds which detonates upon impact with enemies, dealing double tear damage for the impact of the locust and 60 damage for the explosion.
